Japana: Mampiketrona ny fiakaran'i Sina ho laharana faharoa ||| Japan: Eyebrows raised by China's rise to number two
Ny filaharana ara-toe-karena dia milaza fa nivarina ho fahatelo i Japana manerantany. ||| Financial data and figures say Japan has now fallen to number three in world ranking.
Nanaiky ny Governemanta Japoney tamin'ity volana ity fa lasan'i Sina ny amboarany ka lasa izy no hery ara-toe-karena faharoa matanjaka indrindra aorian'i Etazonia, satria dia nampiseho ny antontan'isa ofisialy fa US$1,28 miliara ny fiharian-karem-pirenen'i Japana tao anatin'ny telo volana raha US$1,33 miliara kosa ny an'i Sina. ||| China has stolen its thunder becoming the second largest economy after the US, as official figures showed that Japan's gross domestic product was US $1.28 trillion in the second quarter against China's US $1.33 trillion.
Kanefa tsy dia nahataitra loatra ny ankamaroan'ireo mponina Japoney ity fanambarana ity izay nanampo ny hitrangan'izany na ho ela na ho haingana. ||| But this announcement hasn't surprised many Japanese people who had been expecting it to happen sooner or later.
Ampontan, ohatra, mampandre fa ny fiakaran'ny toe-karen'i Sina ho laharana faharoa dia tsy inona akory fa ebon-drano izay hipoaka ihany amin'ny farany. ||| Ampontan, for instance, warns that China becoming the second largest economy in the world is nothing but a bubble that will eventually burst.
Omaly, dia gazety amin'ny teny Anglisy dia feno tantara milaza fa niangeza ny ekonomian'i Sina ka nahatonga azy ho laharana faharoa eran-tany, nihoatra ny an'i Japana. ||| Yesterday, the English-language print media was filled with stories declaring that China's economy had at last grown to become the second-largest in the world, surpassing that of Japan.
Nisy gazety iray niteny fa "naka an-keriny" ny laharana faharoa (ohatra ny dia efa hoe afaka maka an-keriny zavatra iray ny ekonomia), raha ny hafa kosa nitatitra fa nisambotra ny "satroboninahitra faharoa" izy. Angamba tokony havela ny helok'izy ireo, noho ny fankahalana fa tsy fantatr'izy ireo ny zavatra ataony. ||| One newspaper said it had "seized" second place (as if economies can seize anything), while another reported that it had captured the "second-place crown".
Tahaka ny nomarihan'i Gordon Chang ao amin'ny Forbes, lasa ebon-drano mavesatra eo ampovoan-trano ny tsenam-pandraharahana resaka trano Sinoa. ||| Forbes, the Chinese property market has become the 500-lb bubble in the middle of the room.
Rehefa mipoaka izany–ary fantatrao fa hitranga izany– dia hanovo ron-tsaramaso betsaka ny mpamatsy vola ka ho difotry ny tantara isan-karazany mandritra ny 24 ora ao anatin'ny fito andro ny gazety isan-karazany. ||| When it pops–and you know it will–investors will take a bath so large the media will be inundated with water sports stories 24/7.
Nipoitra ho manan-kery goavana eo amin'ny lafiny Ekonomika i Japana tamin'ny taona 1968, rehefa lasa laharana faharoa tamin'ny fiharian-karena matanjaka indrindra eran-tany, nihoatra an'i Alemaina Andrefana. ||| Japan emerged as economic superpower in 1968, when it became the second largest economy in the world, surpassing West Germany.
Ankehitriny i Japana, miaraka amin'ny mponiny izay ampahafolon'ny an'i Sina, dia ananana trosam-panjakana eo ho eo amin'ny 200% -n'ny Famokaram-bokatra anatiny amin'ny fitomboana ekonomika tsy mihoatra ny 0.1%. ||| public debt to GDP ratio of about 200% and a mere 0.1% economic growth rate.
Mihevitra i Takaojisan fa tsy mahagaga ny fisongonan'ny famokram-bokatra anatin'i Sina an'i Japana satria betsaka ny mponina ao aminy. ||| Takaojisan thinks it's natural that the Chinese GDP passes Japan's as the population is bigger.
Kanefa dia miombon-kevitra amin'i Ampontan ihany koa fa mety ho lasa setroka ihany izany tantara mikasika an'i Sina ho lasa hery ara-toe-karena lehibe indrindra izany rahampitso. ||| But he also shares with Ampontan the opinion that the story that China is going to be the largest economy in the near future may go up in smoke.
Raha tsorina kokoa, dia satria fotsiny impolon'ny mponina any Japana ny mponina any Sina, tsy midika izany fa folo avo heny tahaka izany koa ny heriny, satria ny sarangan'ny manan-karena ihany no afaka mividy izay tiany. Ny famokaram-bokatra anatiny dia tsy miankina amin'ny fandaniana manokana fa miankina amin'ny fampiasam-bola izay tsy afaka laniana amin'ny zavatra hafa. ||| Simply put, just because China has ten times the population of Japan, it does not necessarily follow that its purchasing power is also ten times greater, because it's only a part of the wealthy class there that can buy as much as they like.
Na dia izany aza, na ohatra aza ka mihoatra ny an'i Japana ny ekonomian'i (Sina) amin'ny laharana, dia maninona? Ho fanampin'ireo isa izay manamarina ny hatsaran'ny ekonomian'i Sina mihoatra ny an'i Japana, ireo manam-pahaizana maminaviana fa ity fitomboam-pahefana ity dia mety hihoatra an'i Etazonia amin'ny taona 2030, ka hahalasa azy ho ekonomia lehibe indrindra eran-tany. ||| In addition to the figures that prove China's economy being greater than the Japanese, experts forecast that this growing power will eventually pass also the US by 2030, becoming then the largest economy in the whole world.
Manontany tena ny mpitoraka blaogy "aen_ukon99" hoe inona ireo antony jeren'ireo manam-pahaizana rehefa mandinika ny ekonomian'ny firenena iray izy ireo. ||| Blogger "aen_ukon99" wonders what are the factors considered by the experts when examining a country's economic performance.
Manontany tena aho raha jeren'izy ireo ireo orinasa vahiny maro namindra ny toeram-pamokaran'izy ireo ho any Sina? Ary raha manome mpiasa mikarama mora i Sina dia efa mahatsapa ny fisian'ny olana isan-karazany tahaka ny famonon-tena sy ireo fitokonana izay nahatonga ireo orinasa maro nifindra nakany India na Afrika. Ho lasa adi-hevitra mamaivay ho an'i Sina izany atsy ho atsy, sa tsy izany? ||| I wonder whether they take into account the output of the numerous foreign companies that moved their production centers to China?
Ireo mpihevitra hafa amin'ny lafiny tsara, tahaka an'i Bos, dia nandray ireo vaovao ho tahaka ny anton'ny fandrosoana sy ny fanampiana ny firenen'izy ireo hampiasa ireo haja sy fanamafisana ireo mba hahatonga azy ho herin'izao tontolo izao amin'ny folo taona ho avy. ||| More positive thinkers, like Bos, have taken the news as a reason to look ahead and help their country to utilize those values and strengths that made of it a world power in just a few decades.
Efa nampoizina hitranga ny fiovan-toeran'i Sina, tsy misy zavatra azonay atao mikasika izany. ||| China's change in position is something that had to happen, there's nothing we can do about it.
Na dia izany aza, tokony hikezaka hanao izay tratry ny herinay izahay ary hampiasa ny sainay, ny fanahinay sy ny fahaizanay mba tsy hikorosfahana hatrany i Japana ||| However, we should strive to do our best and use our attitude, spirit and knowledge in order that Japan does not fall any further...
Polonina: Fanambarana Iombonan'ny Zanaky ny Web ||| Poland: The 'Web Kids' Manifesto'
Mpaka sary sady poety poloney Piotr Czerski (tsidiho ny momba momba azy ao amin'ny Wikipedia teny poloney) no nanoratra voalohany indrindra tamin'ny teny Poloney ny "Fanambarana Iombonan'ny Zanaky ny Tambajotra" izay nanomboka niparitaka tamin'ny Web amin'ny fiteny marobe samihafa, taorian'ny nivoahany tamin'ny 11 febroary 2012, tao amin'ny gazeti-paritra ao Poméranie, ao Polonina, Dziennik Bałtycki. ||| Originally written by the Polish photographer and poet Piotr Czerski Wikipedia for his biography in Polish), the ' Web Kids' Manifesto ' is now appearing on the web in many other languages since its publication on February 11, 2012, in the Polish regional newspaper, Dziennik Baltycki.
Piotr Czerski, mpanoratra ny "Manifeste des enfants du Web", ao Polonina (Sary tao amin'ny bilaoginy, nahazoana alalana CC 3) ||| The manifesto expresses the sense of community of a whole generation born alongside the arrival of the networks and Internet.
Manambara ny fihetsehampon'ny taranaka niara-teraka tamin'ny fisandratan'ny tambajotra sy ny Aterineto ity Fanambarana Iombonana ity, mitaky ny fifanantonana mora eo amin'ny samy tanora avy amin'ny vazantany efatra, sy ny fisongadinan'ny kolontsaina iraisambe tsy mbola niy hatrizay, sy ny finiavana handray anjara amin'ny fivezivezen'ny haren-kolontsaina, mihoatra ny sisintany araka ny lalàna sy ara-jeografika noforonina. ||| It also proclaims the affinity of young people around the world with the emergence of an original global culture and the desire to participate in the circulation of cultural goods, beyond the legal or geographical frontiers arbitrarily imposed. According to Czerski, the manifesto is evidence of this generation's desire to distance itself from the power relations inherited from the established authorities
Manamarika ny finiavana hisaraka amin'ny fifandanjan-kery nolovaina tamin'ny fahefana napetraka ny Fanambarana Iombonana: ||| Piotr Czerski, author of 'Web Kids" Manifesto'.
Tsy anananay intsony ny tahotra tao amin'ny ray aman-dreninay fa manana ny lanjany miankina aman'aina ny raharaham-panjakana ary masina ny raharaha iantsorohan'ny Fanjakana. ||| There is not a trace in us of that humble acceptance displayed by our parents, who were convinced that administrative issues were of utmost importance and who considered interaction with the state as something to be celebrated.
Tsy anananay intsony ny fanajana nateraky ny fifanalavirana eo amin'ny olom-pirenena manirery sy ny haavon'ny toerana onenan'ny saranga manjaka, zara raha tazana ao anaty rahona. ||| We do not feel that respect, rooted in the distance between the lonely citizen and the majestic heights where the ruling class reside, barely visible through the clouds.
Noho izany dia manohitra ny fibodoan'ireo manana tombotsoa manokana ny fananan'olo-tsotra sy ny haren-kolontsaina iombonana, mbamin'ny fifehezan-dry zareo (mpibodo) ny andrim-panjakana ity taranaka ankehitriny ity, ka maneho ny filàn'izy ireo ny mangarahara, ny fahafahana ary ny"demokrasia marina ary tena izy". ||| This generation opposes private interest groups' institutional regulations and the control these groups exert over personal information and common cultural goods. It also expresses its need for transparency, freedom, and a "true and real democracy
Marina fa mety tsy misy anarana mahalaza na mbola tsy takatry ny sainay tsara fa ny zavatra tadiavinay dia ny demokrasia marina sy tena izy. ||| Perhaps we have not yet given it a name, perhaps we are not yet fully aware of it, but I guess what we want is real, genuine democracy.
Demokrasia izay mety ho tsy nandrandrain'ny mpanao gazetinareo hatrizay. ||| Democracy that, perhaps, is more than is dreamt of in your journalism.
Fitakiana ilaina indrindra ankehitriny manoloana ny zavamisy hanoherana ny lalàna ACTA, izay hita ao anatin'ny faharanitan-tsaina ny fanahiana ny mety ho famonoana ny fahalalahana aterany, indrindra fa ao Eoropa Atsinanana. ||| It is a demand more current than ever within the context of the opposition to the ACTA agreement, where the risk of curtailing freedoms is intensely perceived, especially in Eastern Europe
Ny loharanon' "ny fanambarana iombonana", amin'ny teny poloney ||| The manifesto's original version in Polish
Izany fanambarana iombonana izany sy ny akony tany amin'ny vazantany efatra tao anatin'ny fotoana fohy monja no vavolombelon'ny hetahetam-pahafahana sy demokrasia ary mangarahara, mihaika ny fiarahamonintsika ary voambaran'ireo, dieny ankehitriny, mpirotsaka an-tsitra-pon'ny fanatontoloana, sady ho olom-pirenen'ny aterineto mahadinika ao anatin'ny taompolo manaraka. ||| This manifesto and the reactions it has sparked off everywhere in the world in such a short time, are proof of the desire for freedom, democracy, and transparency that deeply questions our societies. This desire is expressed by those who, from now on, are the willing protagonists of globalization, and who will be the critical citizens of the web over the next decades.
Fiovam-penitra mahery vaika tsy misy isalasalana. ||| The tide has turned, no doubt about it.
Libya: Ny Fanafahana an'i Tripoli ||| Libya: The Liberation of Tripoli
Tamin'ny 20 Aogositra 2011, no nanomboka ny Hetsika ara-miaramila Mermaid Dawn (zazavavindrano fiposahan'ny masoandro) hanafahana an'i Tripoli ka niantsona ny "Lehibe ny Tompo!" ||| On August 20, 2011, Operation Mermaid Dawn for the liberation of Tripoli started with calls of "God is Great!"
hatrany amin'ny moské an-jatony niely manodidina ny tanàna. ||| from the hundreds of mosques scattered around the city.
Ity no fanairana nifanarahana izay nandrasan'ireo mponina ao Tripoli mba hitsanganany toy ny olona iray manoloana ny ratsy. ||| This was the agreed signal that the residents of Tripoli were waiting for to rise as one person in the face of evil.
Tamin'izany antso izany, dia nihazakazaka be ny fandehan-draharaha ka nahavariana tanteraka. ||| From that call, the events precipitated so fast it was breathtaking.
Notantarain'ny fampahalalam-baovao manerantany ny tohin'ny korontana mampitolagaga, indrindra tamin'ny fidiran-dry zareo tao Tripoli ny ampitson'iny. ||| The ensuing epic turmoil has been well covered by international media, especially when they entered Tripoli the following day.
Mitolona ny Libyana mba hanafahana an'i Tripoli. ||| Libyans fight to free Tripoli.
Saingy ny fivadihana manafintohina indrindra tamin'ny ady tao Tripoli ho an'ny bilaogera dia ny mahita ny fizotry ny raharaha ao amin'ny Twitter-ko izay manasongadina ny tranga tamin'ny 21 Aogositra niaraka tamin'ny tweet an'i Adam. ||| But the most striking turning point in the battle for Tripoli for a blogger is seeing my Twitter timeline lighting up on the evening of August 21 with a tweet from Adam.
Zatra nampiasa bilaogy antsoina hoe Flying Birds i a. Adam, indrisy anefa fa efa nanjavona izany ankehitriny saingy mbola hita ao amin'ny aterineto hatrany ny kaontiny. ||| A.Adam used to have a blog called Flying Birds, this has now unfortunately disappeared but his user account is still online.
Mahita ny hafatra nalefany izay milaza fa efa niverina ny Aterineto ao Tripoli, ka avy hatrany dia haingana be i Al Jazeera nanambara izany ho toy ny vaovao mafana. ||| Seeing his message up meant that the Internet was back in Tripoli, and rightly so as Al Jazeera was prompt to announce it as breaking news.
Toa tsy mampino ny fahatsapana fa afaka mifandray an-tserasera amin'izao tontolo izao indray ny mponina ao Tripoli taorian'ny volana maromaro ka afaka maneho ny fihetseham-pony, ny eritreriny ary koa ny heviny. ||| This was an incredible feeling that Tripoli residents were once again connected to the world after so many months and could voice their emotions, thoughts and also their opinions.
Nieritreretra aho fa miandry izao tontolo izao, miandry hahare vaovao avy amin'ny Tripolitaniana. ||| That is what I think the world is waiting for; to hear from the Tripolitanians.
Mahagaga taty aoriana, fa nanomboka nivoaka niaraka tamin'i Highlander ireo bilaogera ka namoaka lahatsoratra voalohany taorian'ny fahanginany nandritra ny fotoana maharitra. ||| Amazingly soon after, the bloggers started to come out with Highlander publishing the first post after a long silence.
Sanganehana sy faly tanteraka fa nifarana ihany ny nofiratsy saingy malahelo kosa noho ireo aina nafoy tao Lybia sy anisan'ny fianakaviana. ||| Totally bewildered and happy that the nightmare is ending but sad at the loss of life in Libya and among family members.
Tsy ampy ny fiteny Tsy misy teny afaka mamaritra izay ao anatinay ||| No words are enough No words can describe what we feel
Enim-bolana lavabe sady sarotra tokoa izay kanefa nataoko izany. ||| It's been a long hard six months but I made it.
Nandeha ny Aterineto ary manasivana tsikelikely ireo mailaka maherin'ny 2000 aho. ||| The internet has been turned on and I'm slowly sifting through over 2000 emails.
Naverin'ny mpikomy/revolisionera Tripoli amin'ny laoniny ho anay ny aterineto ankehitriny ka afaka mamaham-bolongana indray. ||| and now finally the Tripoli rebels/revolutionaries have restored the internet for us and I can blog again.
Te hiarahaba ny tsirairay noho ny fahafahan'i Lybia aho ary hiverina haneho hevitra amin'ny lahatsoratra teo aloha ||| I would like to congratulate everyone on the liberation of Libya and move on to comment on a previous post
Tao amin'ny lahatsoratra voalohany nosoratany taorian'ny fianjeran'i Tripoli, niadihevitra ny lahatsoratra teo aloha mikasika ny andinin-tsoratramasina koranika i Pudding, izay amin'ny ankapobeny dia noheverin'ireo mpamaky ny lahatsoratra nosoratany fa navoakany mihitsy izany lahatsoratra izany satria manohitra ny firotsahan'ny vahiny ao Lybia ilay bilaogera. ||| In his/her first post after the fall of Tripoli, Pudding is discussing a previous post regarding a Quranic verse which basically his readers were assuming that it was posted because the blogger was against foreign intervention in Libya.
Mety zavatra azontsika jerena hatrany izany raha vao manomboka mihaino ny hevitry ny Libyana isika sy miankina amin'izay ho fandehan'ny tetikasan'ny OTAN ao Lybia. ||| This could be something we could see more and more of once we start hearing Libyan opinions and depending on what NATOs plans are in Libya.
Mahafinaritra tokoa ny mahita ireo Lybiana maneho hevitra an-kahalalahana. ||| It is good to see the Libyans talking freely.
Ary hamehezana izany, faranantsika amin'ny Lybiana Violet ity fitetezana vetivety ny bilaogy Libyana ity: ||| And to conclude, we wrap up this quick tour of the Libyan blogs with Libyan Violet saying:
Mbola tsy tapitra ô! ary mbola maro ny faritra miala hafahana, ary mila averina ny filaminana, ary mila alevina ny maritiora, vahana ny gadra, ratra tsaboina ary omena toky ny ankizy ato amin'ity firenentsika Lehibe ity (ary mety tsara ny mpamaritra ity)! ||| It is not all over yet, some parts of our Great country (and the adjective here is absolutely fitting still need help to be liberated, where complete safety still needs to be restored, where martyrs still need to be buried, prisoners released, injured treated and children reassured!
Kanefa matoky aho fa efa vita ny dingana sarotra indrindra amin'ity ady ity. ||| But for sure the hardest part in the fight is over I hope.
Mahavalalanina tokoa ny fihetseham-po maroloko ary manantena izahay fa ho maro ny olona hanomboka hamaham-bolongana indray rehefa niangona elaela ny vao nosokafana. ||| The kaleidoscope of emotions was fantastic and we expect more as people to start blogging after taking stock of what had just unfolded.
Brezila: Niely Nanerana Ny Firenena Ny Diaben'ny Janga ||| Brazil: SlutWalks Spread Across the Country
Ny 26 sy 27 Mey, tanàn-dehibe maro manerana an'i Brezila no nahitana ny fiodinana faharoan'ny hetsi-panoherana amin'ny fantatra ho SlutWalks (na diaben'ny janga). ||| On May 26 and 27, 2012, a number of cities around Brazil were the scene of the second round of protests known as SlutWalks.
Nidina an-dalamben'i Brasilia, São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Porto Alegre, Belo Horizonte, Florianópolis, Fortaleza ary Belém - ankoatra ny tanàna maro hafa miantso ny fahafahan'ny vehivavy sy ny zon'ny vehivavy hiakanjo araka izay tiany tsy iharan'ny herisetra na maoraly, ny vehivavy anarivony, sy ny lehilahy mpitia vehivavy, pelaka, sarimbavy eny fa na dia ny mpikambana amin'ny vondron'ny mpitondra bisikileta, mpilalao skate, skinheads, punks ary ny anarsista aza - ho fanoherana ny fankahalana ny homo sy ho fiarovana ny feminisma, na ho fiarovana ny fitoviana. ||| Calling for women's liberty and the right of women to dress as they want without being the victims of violence or moralism, thousands of women, as well as heterosexual men, gays, transvestites and even members of groups such as bikers, skaters, skinheads, punks and anarchists took to the streets in Brasilia, São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Porto Alegre, Belo Horizonte, Florianópolis, Fortaleza and Belém - amongst other cities - to protest against homophobia and in defence of feminism, or rather, in defence of equality.
Manu Baren, avy amin'ny bilaogy Jezebel, maneho hevitra amin'izay hitany nandritra ny fandrakofana ny Diabe: ||| Manu Baren, from the blog Jezebel, commented on what he saw while covering the Walk:
Fanajana ny Janga avy amin'ny mpanao sariitatra Carlos Latuff. ||| Homage to the SlutWalks by the cartoonist Carlos Latuff.
Tao amin'ny fotoana no nahitako tolo-kevitra matotra sy natao am-pisainana, manana tanjona hanaitra ny olona ho fanoherana ny herisetra atao amin'ny vehivavy. ||| at the event I found a sensible and serious proposal, with a clear aim to draw attention to and protest against violence against women.
Amin'ny lafiny rehetra: hatramin'ny vatana ka mandalo amin'ny fananahana sy ny maoraly. ||| Of all kinds: from physical to sexual and moral.
Nanohina ahy ny herimpon'ny tanora, reny ary vaviantitra milaza amin'ny vhoaka ny tantaran'ny fihoara-pahefana, izay mety mahatonga hatrany amin'ny fahafatesana amin'ny lafiny sasany. ||| I was touched by the courage of the young people, mothers and older women who exposed their stories of abuses which, in some cases,had led to death, to the crowd.
Niainga tany Canada ny Diaben'ny Janga, raha nanao fihetsiketseham-panoherana ny fanambaran'ny manamboninahitra ao amin'ny polisy Michael Sanguinetti noho ny fisiana tranga-na fanaovana an-keriny tao an-tanàna ka nilazany fa tsy tokony hiakanjo tahaka ny janga ny vehivavy raha tsy te-ho voaolana, ny vehivavy an'arivony tao Toronto tamin'ny 3 Avrily 2011. ||| The SlutWalk originated in Canada, when on April 3rd 2011 thousands of women protested in Toronto against the declarations made by police officer Michael Sanguinetti following a series of cases of sexual abuse in the city, stating that women should avoid dressing like sluts in order to avoid becoming victims of rape.
Hatramin'io fotona io, maro ny hetsi-panoherana nanerana ny tany ahitana vehivavy manao akanjo fohy na mitanjaka tapany aza ka ijoroany fa tsy midika izany ary tsy manome alalana ny hanolanana na anaovana fihoara-pahefana. ||| Since then, similar protests have taken place around the world with women dressed in short skirts or even half-naked and affirming that this does not mean that they would like to or give their permission to be raped or abused.
Ho fandraisana ohatra ny tamin'ny herintaona, nifantina andian-tsary avy amin'ny fihetsiketsehana isan-karazany tany an-tanàna Breziliana ny Global Voices. ||| Following the example of the previous year, Global Voices has selected a series of photos from protests in various Brazilian cities.
Mihoatra ny telo arivo ny isan'ny nanatrika ny fotoana tany Brasilia, renivohitr'i Brezila, mihoatra ny arivo tany São Paulo, ary an-jatony tany an-tanàna maro hafa. ||| More than three thousand protestors attended the event in Brasilia, the capital of Brazil, more than a thousand in São Paulo, and hundreds in each of the other cities.
São Paulo nandrakotra lalana 3 kilometatra ny diabe, ka nandalo ny lalana malazan'i Rua Augusta, toera-pihaonan'ny vondron'olona hafa sy toerana ahitana tranon-dopy maro sy trano fampisehoana zavakanto maro. ||| São Paulo the Walk covered 3 kilometres, passing along the famous Rua Augusta, a meeting point for alternative groups and the location of various brothels and artistic venues.
mpanao fihetsiketsehana manandratra sora-baventy miteny hoe "Fahafahana sy fitoviana". ||| Protestors hold placards saying "Freedom and Equality".
"Tsy avy any amin'ny taola-tehezanao aho, ianao no avy tao amin'ny tranon-jazako". ||| "I didn´t come from your rib, it was you who came from my womb".
"Rehefa lehibe aho, te-ho izay tiako ho izaho". ||| "When I grow up, I want to be whatever I want".
Lahatsary roa ahitana ny fihetsiketsehana tao São Paulo: ny voalohany avy amin'i Manu Barem sy Thiago Guimarães miaty sombin-kabary teo am-panombohan'ny Diabe sy ny Diabe ary ny hiaka nataon'ny mpanao fihetsiketsehana: ||| Two videos of the protest in São Paulo: the first by Manu Barem and Thiago Guimarães contains sections of the speeches made at the beginning of the Walk and scenes of the Walk itself, and the second contains scenes of the Walk and the slogans shouted by the protestors:
Rio de Janeiro, tao Copacabana no notontosaina ny hetsika ary an-jatony ny nanatrika. ||| Rio de Janeiro, the protest took place in Copacabana with hundreds of people attending.
baoritra eo ampanombohan'ny diabe. ||| Placards at the start of the Walk.
"Aza mampianatra anay hampiakanjo, ampianaro ny lehilahy tsy hanao an-keriny". ||| "Don´t teach us how to dress, teach men not to rape".
Nidina tao an-dalamben'i Belo Horizonte ihany koa ny mpanao fihetsiketsehana tamin'ny 26 Mey. ||| The streets of Belo Horizonte were also taken over by protestors on 26 May.
Andian'olona mandeha. ||| The crowd marching.
Vehivavy afaka, vatana afaka. ||| Free women, free bodies.
Tsy vitsy ny kilonga nandritra ny fihetsiketsehana. ||| There was no shortage of children at the protests.

Maneran-tany: Tsy matoan-dahatsoratry ny fampahalalam-baovao ny fiparitahan'ny solitany ||| Worldwide: The oil spills that don't make the news This post is part of our special coverage Forest Focus: Amazon.
Misarika ny fifantohan-tsain'izao tontolo izao ilay fiparitahan'ny solitany tany amin'ny Elodranon'i Meksika, vokatr'izay fanapotehana noho ny tsy fahaiza-mitantana ny fitrandrahana solitany. ||| The tragic oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico has the world's attention on the devastation that badly managed oil extraction can bring.
Na izany aza, any amin'ireo toerana sasany maneran-tany, miaina miaraka amin'ny fandrarahana poizina toy itony ny olona, ary amin'ny alalan'ny horonantsary no hiezahan'ny vahoaka hisintonana ny sain'izao tontolo izao amin'ny fijalian'izy ireo. ||| However, in some places around the world, people live with toxic spills such as these and through videos people try to bring the world's attention to their plight.
Ny mponina any Nizeria dia tsy maintsy niaina niaraka tamin'ny fandotoana avy amin'ny solitany ao amin'ny Delta-n'i Niger efa am-polo taonany maro izao, nefa ho fanampin'izay, efa niainan-dry zareo ihany koa ny fanaovana zinona ny zon'olombelona izay namoizana ny ain'ireo mafa fo manohitra ny fandotoana ateraky ny solitany. ||| The people in Nigeria have had to deal with oil pollution in the Niger Delta for decades already, but in addition, they've also dealt with human rights abuses that claimed the lives of anti-oil activists.
Nanenjika an'i Shell ny vahoaka (izay mitantana ny fitrandrahana solitany any amin'ilay faritra) ary vao haingana tamin'ity volana ity no nanaiky handoa $15,5 tapitrisa ny Shell talohan'ny fitsaràna. ||| The people sued Shell (who handles the oil extraction in the region) and earlier this month Shell settled for $15.5 Million the day before the trial.
Ho ampiasaina hanonerana ireo mafana fo mpiaro ny zon'olombelona io vola io ary hananganana tahirim-bola azo antoka. ||| This money will be used to compensate human rights activists and to establish a trust fund.
Nefa dia tsy mbola ahazoam-bokatra ny fitsaràna ny fanimbàna ara-tontolo iainana satria raha ny ambaran'ny fikambanana, ny dikan'ny hoe "fanadiovana" dia ny fanodinana ny tany mba tsy hahitàna soritra intsony ny solitany, fa dia mbola ao izy e, mandoto ny ambanin'ny tany sy mahatonga ny vahoaka harary, ary tsy mbola misy ny fepetra noraisina momba ireo jiro arehitra tsy an-kiato amin'ny solitany. ||| However, lawsuits for environmental damage have yet to be fruitful since according to the organization, what "cleanup" means is turning over the soil so that the oil is no longer visible, but it is still there, contaminating the ground and making people sick, and nothing has been done regarding the gas flares that constantly burn.
Indro ny horonantsary fijoroana vavolombelona avy amin'ireo olona any amin'ny Deltan'i Niger izay simban'ny fiparitahan'ny solitany ny anto-piveloman-dry zareo: ||| Here is the video testimony from people whose livelihoods have been destroyed by the oil spills in the Niger Delta:
Ireo moron-dranomasin'i Hurghada any amin'ny Ranomasina Mena dia rakotry ny solitany andro vitsivitsy lasa izay, ary nanomboka nitaraina ireo mpizahatany sy ireo tompona trano fivahinianana. ||| The beaches of Hurghada in the Red Sea were awash with oil a few days ago, and tourists and hotel owners raised complaints.
Ireny fitarainana ireny dia niteraka fanapahan-kevitra ary avy hatrany dia tonga ireo ekipa hamantatra ny anton'ilay fiparitahana, hampitsahatra izany ary hanadio ireo moron-dranomasina araka ny notaterin'ny Fikambanana Miaro ny Tontolo iainana any Hurghada . ||| These complaints generated actions and teams immediately went forth to discover the cause of the spill, plug it and clean up the beaches as the Hurghada environmental protection association HEPCA reported.
Iray volana lasa izay isika no nitatitra momba ilay fiparitahana solitany any Singapore, vokatry ny fifandonan'ny "tankers" roa (Avy amin'ny mpandika: ny "tanker" dia sambo natao manokana hitaterana solika) ary niteraka ny fiparitahan'ny solitany tsy voadio am-barikany maro nanapoizina ny rano. ||| A month ago we reported on the oil spill in Singapore, caused by the collision of two tankers resulting in barrels of crude oil contaminating the water.
Ity manaraka ity dia horonantsarin'ny olon-tsotra iray mampiseho ny moron-dranomasina rakotry ny solitany: ||| Following is a citizen video showing the oil encrusted coastline:
Ny reniranon'i Marañon any amin'ny Ala Mikitrok'i Amazonia no hany loharanon-drano ho ana vondrom-piarahamonina maherin'ny 28 manamorona azy, ary taorian'ny fandrarahana solitany nataon'ny Pluspetrol vao haingana tamin'ity volana ity dia tsy misy manana rano madio intsony ireo vondrom-piarahamonina ireo ho an'ny filàny rehetra no sady tsy afaka manjono koa ry zareo, satria solitany tsy voadio maherin'ny 300 barika no niraraka tao. ||| The Marañon river in the Amazon Jungle is the only source of water for more than 28 communities that line its shores, and after the Pluspetrol oil spill earlier this month all of these communities are left with no clean water for all their needs and they can't fish either, since it is contaminated with more than 300 barrels of crude oil.
Ao amin'ny blaogy Globalizado, Juan Arellano dia manoratra lahatsoratra mamelabelatra sy manakatra ny endrika samihafan'ny akon'ny fiparitahana toy izao eo amin'ny zavaboarin'i Amazona sy ireo tompontany mifandray amin'ireo sakelidrano sy renirano. ||| In Globalizado blog, Juan Arellano wrote an extensive and comprehensive post regarding the multi-faceted impact that a spill like this can have on the wildlife of the amazon and the indigenous communities in their relationship with waterways and rivers.
Ity misy horonantsarin'ny olon-tsotra iray mampiseho ny solitany mitsikafona eo ambony rano. ||| Here is a citizen video showing the oil floating over the water.
Tsy vaovao izany any Peru. ||| This isn't new in Peru.
Any Loreto, ilay orinasa PlusPetrol ihany dia manana tantara noho ny fanaparitahana ary ts mazava mihitsy ny ezaka fanadiovana ataony araka izany. ||| In Loreto, the same company PlusPetrol has a history of spills and their efforts in cleanup aren't that clean.
Araka ny lazain'ny iray amin'ireo mpiasa ato amin'ity horonantsary manaraka ity, dia asaina mamadika ny tany fotsiny ry zareo, ary rehefa tonga ireo manampahefàna dia tenenin-dry zareo fa "efa voafehy ny fiparitahana", nefa tsy afaka milaza izy ireo fa mbola ao ambany ao ny solitany izay mbola manapoizina rano, zava-maniry ary biby. ||| As one of the workers says in the following video, that they just have them turn over the soil, and when the authorities come along they tell them that "the spill has been contained", but they can't mention that the oil is still there right under the surface where it can still contaminate water, plants and animals.
Mpikambna iray ao amin'ilay vondrom-piarahamonina no mitantara ny nahafatesan'ireo namany noho ny fisotroana solitany tsy voadio sy ny fahazaran'izy ireo manana zokiolona maherin'ny 90 na 100 taona, nefa ankehitriny dia maty tanora ny vahoaka noho ny fitelemana solitany. ||| One community member speaks of how his friends have died from crude oil ingestion and how they used to have elders live up to 90 or 100 years of age, but nowadays people are dying younger due to the ingestion of oil.
Na dia eo aza ireo sary sy horonantsary mampiseho ny solitany mainty toy ny godorao eny amin'ny moron'ny farihy Maracaibo, ny Ministeran'ny Tontolo Iainana dia mitsipaka izay mety ho olana na fiparitahana solitany ary miantso ny korontana sy ny fako mandoto ireo moron-drano hatramin'ny taona 2009 ho "mahazatra", araka ny tatitra ataon'i Código Venezuela. ||| In spite of photos and videos showing black tarlike oil on the shores of the Lake of Maracaibo, the Minister of Environment denies any problem or oil spill and calls the mess and discharge, polluting the shores since 2009, "normal" as Código Venezuela reports.
Ankoatra ny fiparitahana any amin'ny Elodranon'i Meksika, eo ihany koa ny fiparitahana solitany any Utah, noho ny fahasimbàn'ny fantson'ny orinasa Chevron ary namoaka solitany 33 000 galôna any amin'ireo sakelidrano. ||| Besides the Gulf of Mexico oil spill, there's also the oil spill in Utah where a Chevron pipeline leaked and dumped 33,000 gallons of oil into the waterways.
Raha manomboka miasa ireo andian'olona mpanadio ka manala ny solitany hita eny amin'ireo kamory, farihy sy lakan-drano, ny vondrom-piarahamonina kosa hizaka izay mety ho vokatry ny fanapoizinana. ||| While cleanup crews are getting to work and removing the visible oil on ponds, lakes and creeks, the community is concerned about possible effects of the contamination.
Ity manaraka ity dia horonantsary fohy mampiseho lakan-drano miaraka amin'ny solitany mandrakotra ny sisiny. ||| Next is a short video showing a creek with oil covered sides.
Toeran-kafa, Loza hafa: ||| Other Locations, Other disasters:
Toa izao ny haino aman-jery vao mifantoka amin'ny fiparitahana solitany, ary raha hiverenana ny tamin'ny 2005 dia nahatonga ilay Taiwanais mpitoraka blaogy Munch hamporisika ireo mpamaky azy hiantso any amin'ireo biraon'ny hainoamanjery mba hijery ny fiparitahana solitany any akaikin'ny nosy Lanyu any Taiwan. ||| It seems that only now the media is getting interested in oil spills, and back in 2005 it took a Taiwanese blogger Munch to engage his readers to call media offices so that the oil spill near the island of Lanyu in Taiwan was noticed.
Ity sary manaraka ity dia mampiseho ireo moron-drano feno solitany izay nodiovina. ||| This next picture shows the oil covered shores that were being cleaned.
Nefa tsy ny solitany ihany no manapoizina ny tontolon'ny an-dranomasina. ||| But oil is not the only threat to marine environments.
Tamin'ny 2009, nisy sambo nitatitra "phosphate" nilentika tany amin'ny morotsirak'i Madagascar ary nisy fiatraikany teo amin'ny zavaboary ny fanapoizinana, anisan'izany ireo trozona mpifindra monina sy ireo mpanjono marary noho ny rano voapoizina eny amin'ny moron-drano. ||| Back in 2009, a ship carrying phosphate sunk off the coast of Madagascar and the contamination affected wildlife including migrating whales and fishermen who got sick from the contaminated water on the shores.
Toa na firy na firy taona lany amin'ny asa fitrandrahana solitany, tsy mitombo manaraka ny filàna mampiasa sy mandany solitany ny fandraisana fepetra hahazoana toky fa tsy mandoto tontolo iainana manodidina ny toerana fitrandrahana na fantsona ny solika avy amin'ny toeram-pitrandrahana. ||| It seems that no matter how many years are spent in the oil extraction business, that security measures to ensure that the oil doesn't pollute the environment around the extraction places or pipes haven't grown at the same rate than the need to use and consume oil.
Angamba tokony hamerina handinika tsara ny fampiasantsika solitany isika ary mangataka fanomezan-toky avy amin'ireo orinasa mitrandraka izany. ||| Maybe we need to rethink our use of petroleum and demand accountability of the companies that exploit it.
Afrika: Famahanam-bolongana sy fiarahana amin'Andriamanitra ||| Africa: Blogging And Walking With God
Efa elaela ihany izay, kanefa noho ny zava-misy dia tsy niandry ny fiainana hanantona azy izy – afaka tenenina hoe nanampy amin'ny fitazonana ny hadalana ny famahanam-bolongana rehefa nisedra ny kotro-baratry ny zavatra entin'ny fiainana izy. ||| It has been a while, but as with most things, blogging did not wait for life to catch up with it – it can be said that blogging helped to keep many sane as they weather the storms that life brings them.
Tao anatin'ny ady sarotra sy tahotra, hehy sy tomany, no nanohizan'ireo vehivavy Afrikana ny fitantarana ny tantaran'izy ireo, ny fifampiazarana ny dian'izy ireo miaraka amin'Andriamanitra. ||| Through struggles and fears and laughter and tears, African women have continued to tell their stories and to share their walk with God.
Taonan'ny fivoarana ho an'ny rehetra ny taona 2008. ||| 2008 was a year of growth for many.
Tohin' izany ary dia ho taonan'ny fahamatorana ny taona 2009. ||| It follows, then, that 2009 will be a year of maturity.
ny tantara marina niainany avy tamin'ny fery teo amin'ny fihodirany fotsy I Chichi, izay Surviving on Grace ||| Chichi, who is Surviving on Grace, shares a valid lesson learned from a bruise on her light skin:
Fa maninona ary isika no dia miziriziry be sy mafy loha indraindray rehefa hanantona hitady fanampiana avy amin'I Jesoa. ||| why are we so adamant, so stubborn some times to go to Jesus for help.
Maninona isika no lasa miheritreritra hoe tsy fantany ny misy antsika, na ny zavatra mianjady amintsika, eny fa na fanamelohana ataontsika midika hoe tsy mendrika ny hanantona sy hitalaho aminy isika manao hoe: "TENA VITA NY AMIKO. ||| Why do we tend to feel on other occassions that he just can't understand where we are, and what we are facing, or even allowing guilt to make us feel we do not deserve to go to him and cry out "I HAVE MESSED UP.
Rehefa mitalaho fanampiana isika, dia omen'ny Tompo ny fahatanterahana eo amin'ny olana sedraintsika, araky ny lazain'I Gomer aminao amim-pahatokisana. ||| When we cry out for help, the Lord perfects that which concerns us, as Gomer will confidently tell you.
Nianatra lesona izy teo amin'ny fandrindrana ny fotoana tamin'ireo andro tsy nahasalama azy ary tsy hitany ny fomba hamitana izany. ||| She learns a lesson in time management while she is unwell at home and cannot make it to work.
Nandamaka natory fotsiny izy kanefa nahatsapa fa diso be torimaso loatra ary tsy nanao izay mba toro-hevitry ny Pasiterany. ||| She longs for her bed but realizes that she has been doing way more sleeping than her pastor recommends:
Ratsy izany ho an'ny olona tanora toa ahy. ||| This is bad for someone as young as me.
Ny pasiterako dia milaza foana ny amin'ny hoe tokony hatory anatin'ny adiny 5 fotsiny ny Kristianina isaky ny alina – fa hitarika tsy fahatomombanana ny ankoatr'izay...... ||| My Pastor is always going on about how a Christian should only sleep roughly 5 hours every night – everything else is counterproductive....
Anontanian'I Rita antsika n y fanontaniana roa ambin'ny folo izay tokony ho fanontanina apetraky ny vehivavy rehefa mikarakara ny mpanjakany izy, ary avy eo manome azy antony ny ametrahana fanontaniana azy ireo: ||| Rita asks us twelve questions every woman should ask while preparing for her king, and then gives her reasons for asking them:
Ry havako, tsy manome anareo lisitra akory aho na fitarihana. ||| Beloved, I am not giving you a checklist or a guide.
Fa kosa milaza amim-pahatsorana zavatra 2: ||| I am simply saying 2 things:
Rehefa mikarakara ho an'ny mpanjaka lahinareo ianareo, dia tokony jerenao ny zavatra mihoatra ny ara-batana ary manome fahafaham-po ny zavatra ilaina. ||| As you prepare for your king, you need to look beyond the physical and satisfying your current wants.
Eritrereto ny fiainana miaraka aminy mandritra ny 3 taona. ||| Imagine 3 years with him.
Tena azo vinavianaina mihintsy izany fa manana lisitra izy! ||| She probably does!
Kanefa mandritra ny fotoana iandrasan-dravehivavy, dia tokony mianatra mandrindra ny fotoanany izy, koa rehefa tonga ny fahasarotana, dia tsy tokony ho menatra izy hiangavy fanampiana ||| But while she waits, she should learn how to manage her time, and when it gets too hard, she should not be ashamed to cry out for help.
Madagasikara: Ny feon'ny tanora iray mpitoraka blaogy sady mpandika teny ||| Madagascar: The voice of a young blogger and translator
Nandritra ny Vovonana Iraisam-pirenen'ny Gloval Voices 2010 tany Chile, nisy tovovavy iray avy any Madagasikara nanontany ahy raha tena avy any Japana tokoa aho, firenena izay tena ankafiziny tokoa na ny tenim-pirenena, ny kolontsaina, ary indrindra ny "sushi". ||| During the 2010 Global Voices Summit in Chile, a young girl from Madagascar asked me whether I am really from Japan, the country where she is passionate about everything including language, culture, and especially sushi.
Gaga aho raha nahita fa mbola mahay miteny Japoney tsara lavitra noho izaho izy na dia efa roa taona aza aho no nipetraka tany Japana. ||| I was impressed that she could speak better Japanese than myself despite the fact that I have been living in Japan for two years already.
Izy no Radifera Felana Candy, mpandika tenin'ny Global Voices Lingua Malagasy. ||| She is Radifera Felana Candy, translator for Global Voices Lingua Malagasy.
Vao 15 taona monja, Candy angamba no mpikambana tanora indrindra ao amin'ny ekipan'ny Global Voices. ||| Only 15 years old, Candy is probably the youngest member in the Global Voices team.
Tsy ny fahaizany tenim-pirenena ihany no nihatsara noho ny fandraisany anjara amin'ny Global Voices, fa nahafahany nanaparitaka ny tenim-pireneny koa izany, dia ny Malagasy. ||| Her participation in Global Voices has not only improved her language skills, it has also allowed her to promote her country's language, Malagasy.
Candy, izay mpianatra any amin'ny lisea amin'izao fotoana izao, dia te-hahalala bebe kokoa momba ny "infographie" any amin'ny fianarana ambony ary manantena izy ny ho afaka hampiasa ny blaoginy ho fitaovana amin'ny fifanakalozana ara-sosialy. ||| Candy, currently a high school student, wants to know more about infographics in college and she hopes to use her blog as a tool for social change.
Mendri-piderana izany fanetsiketsehana amin'ny alalan'ny fitoraham-blaogy izany. ||| This advocacy via the blogosphere is laudable.
Candy miaraka amin'ny rainy, Maminirina Radifera Ranaivoson (ankavia); Leonard Chien, Talen'ny Global Voices Lingua; ary ny "archeveque" John Baptist Odama avy any Ouganda, iray tamin'ireo nandresy tamin'ny fifaninana Breaking Borders ||| Candy together with her dad, Maminirina Radifera Ranaivoson (left); Leonard Chien, Global Voices Lingua Director; and Archbishop John Baptist Odama of Uganda, one of winners of Breaking Borders Award
Nanadihady an'i Candy tamin'ny mailaka aho ny mombamomba ny fiainany manokana sy ny fitoraham-blaogy ataony: ||| I interviewed Candy via e-mail about her personal life and her blogging activities:
Lazalazao anay ny momba anao: ||| Tell us more about yourself:
Izaho no RADIFERA Felana Candy, 15 taona, ary teraka tany Madagascar. ||| I'm RADIFERA Felana Candy, 15 years old, and I was born in Madagascar.
Taona faharoa (classe de première) any amin'ny lisea aho izao. ||| I'm a sophomore high school student.
Nianatra teny Japoney aho nandritra ny taona voalohany (classe de seconde) saingy tamin'izany fotoana izany dia naka lesona tetsy sy teroa tamin'ny aterineto fotsiny aho. ||| I learned Japanese during my first year in high school but at that time I was only taking lessons here and there on the Internet.
Herintaona taty aoriana aho vao nanapa-kevitra ny hianatra any an-dakilasy. ||| I decided to take a language course one year after.
Hafiriana izao ianao no nitoraka blaogy? ||| How long have you been blogging?
Tamin'ny alalan'ny tetikasa "Foko Madagascar" no nahalalako ny momba ny fitorahana blaogy. ||| I first heard about blogging through the "Foko Madagascar" Project.
Nandray anjara tamin'ny fampiofanana fitoraham-blaogy nokarakarain-dry zareo aho. ||| I participated in a blog training they organized.
Nanomboka tamin'ny taona 2007 aho no niblaogy, saingy tamin'izany fotoana izany aho mbola tsy dia navitrika loatra. ||| I have been blogging since 2007. But at that time I was not very active.
Tsy nanana aterineto aho tany an-trano ary tsy dia hitako loatra izay hosoratana. ||| I didn't have internet at home and I had no idea about what to write about.
Nanomboka niblaogy aho satria efa hatramin'ny mbola kely no tia nanoratsoratra tantara. ||| I started to blog because I always loved writing stories since I was very young.
Karazam-blaogy inona no nosoratanao voalohany? ||| What kind of blog did you start with?
Nanoratra momba ny fiainana andavanandro aho, momba ireo zavatra nanaitra ahy, nahaliana ahy, na nahatezitra ahy. ||| I wrote about everyday life, about the things that surprised me, interested me, or made me angry.
Misokatra amin'ny fivoarana ara-teknolojia ve ny ankohonanao? ||| Is your family open to new technologies?
Mankasitraka ny fahavitrihanao amin'ny aterineto ve izy ireo? ||| Are they supportive of your online activities?
Eny, satria ireo raiamandreniko dia samy miasa amin'ny solosaina avokoa, indrindra ny raiko izay tena mankafy ny fakàna sary. ||| Yes, since both my parents work with computers, and especially my dad because he is very passionate about photography.
Mpitoraka blaogy mavitrika ihany koa izy. ||| My dad is also a very active blogger.
Rehefa tsy miresaka momba ny politika aho dia tsy maninona, satria aty Madagasikara, indrindra mandritra ny fotoanan'ny krizy, lohahevitra saro-pady ny politika. ||| As long as I don't talk about politics, it's ok, because here in Madagascar, especially during a crisis, politics is a very sensitive topic.
Inona no tena tianao amin'ny fitorahana blaogy? ||| What do you like most about blogging?
Ny fitorahana blaogy dia ahafahako mizara ny hevitro amin'ny hafa, mampahafantatra azy ireo izay mitranga amin'ny fiainako sy ny fiaraha-moniko. ||| Blogging allows me to share my opinion to others, to let them know about what is happening in my life and my community.
Mavesa-danja amiko izany fahafahako mizara ny momba ahy amin'ny hafa izany, sy ny fifaneraserana amn'ireo mpamaky. ||| I value this opportunity to share something about myself to others, and to interact with readers.
Anisan'ny làlana ahafahana mifandray amin'ny hafa izany. ||| It's a kind of way to communicate with others.
Fa ankoatry ny fanoratana, tiako koa ny mamorona ny "bannière"-n'ny blaogiko, tiako ny mamoaka sary, na dia tsy mbola mahay loatra aza aho. ||| But apart from writing, I also love to create my own blog banner, I love to edit photos, even though I'm not very skilled yet.
Ahoana no fahitànao ny fitorahana blaogy any Madagasikara? ||| What do you think about blogging in Madagascar?
Tena voafetra ny fahafahana mitoraka blaogy any Madagasikara satria 1 na 2 isan-jaton'ny mponina ihany no manana aterineto noho ny vidiny. ||| Access to blogs is very limited in Madagascar since only 1 or 2 percent of Malagasy people can access the internet due to its price.
Fa fantatro fa maro ireo olona te-hitoraka blaogy. ||| But I know there are many individuals who really want to blog.
Raha afaka hatsaraintsika ny fahafahana miditra amin'ny aterineto, mino aho fa afaka mandray anjara amin'ny fanovàna/fanatsaràna ny fomba fiainan'ny Malagasy ny fitorahana blaogy. ||| If we can improve web access, I believe blogging can contribute to change/ameliorate the way of life of Malagasy people.
Inona no antenainao amin'ny fitorahana blaogy ho an'ny tenanao sy ny fiaraha-moninao? ||| What is your expectation from blogging for yourself and your community?
Manantena aho fa afaka ny hisarika olona maromaro kokoa hitoraka blaogy, na mety afaka hanova ny fomba fijerin'ny sasany aho amin'ny fizaràko ny fomba fijeriko, indrindra momba ny fitorahana blaogy. ||| I hope to attract more people to blog, or maybe that I will change the views of some people by sharing my views, especially about blogging.
Tadidiko indray andro raha niresaka tamin'ireo namako sasantsasany aho momba ny fitorahana blaogy, dia niteny tamiko izy ireo fa fandaniam-potoana izany. ||| I remember when I told some of my friends about blogging, they said that it's a waste of time.
Mpandika teny ho an'ny Global Voices Lingua Malagasy ianao. ||| You are translator for Global Voices Lingua Malagasy.
Manao ahoana ny fitiavanao ny andraikitrao eo anivon'ny GV amin'izao fotoana izao? ||| How do you like your role with GV now?
GV dia fiaraha-monina lehibe, vohikala goavana, ary mahàlana ny vohikala toy izany no adika amin'ny teny Malagasy. ||| GV is a big community, it's a major website, and it's rare for this kind of website to be translated into Malagasy.
tena tsy mbola malaza eran-tany ny teny Malagasy, ka voninahitra ho ahy ny mandika ireo lahatsoratry ny GV amin'ny tenim-pireneko. ||| Malagasy is not a widely known language, and it's an honor for me to translate GV articles into my language.
Fomba ahafahako manatsara ny fitenenako teny Anglisy sy Malagasy koa izany. ||| It's also a way for me to improve my English and Malagasy language skills.
Ary ankehitriny rehefa avy nanatrika ny Vovonana Iraisam-pirenena aho dia mahatsapa ho mavitrika kokoa handika teny. ||| And now that I've attended the Summit, I feel more motivated to do translations.
Tiako ny manao izany. ||| I love to do it.
Nanjary zava-dehibe eo amin'ny fiainako ny GV, ary reharehako ny maha-mpikambana ahy ao amin'ny fiaraha-monin'ny GV. ||| GV became something important to me, and I'm proud to be a part of GV Community.
Ahoana no fieritreretanao ny hoavinao? ||| How do you picture yourself in the future?
Aorian'ny lisea dia mieritreritra ny hianatra informatika aho, na infografia. ||| After high-school, I will study IT, or infographics.
Manantena koa aho fa handray anjara bebe kokoa amin'ny GV. ||| I hope I will also be more involved with GV.
Inona no hafatrao ho an'ireo tanora hafa mpampiasa aterineto? ||| What is your message to fellow young netizens?
Misokafa bebe kokoa amin'izao tontolo izao. ||| Be more open to the world.
Ny fitorahana blaogy dia fomba tsotra hizarànao ny hevitrao. ||| Blogging is an easy way to share your opinion.
Tsy fandaniam-potoana mihitsy izany, indrindra raha manoratra zava-mahaliana sy tena ilaina ianao. ||| It is never a waste of time especially if you write something interesting and useful.
Amin'ny alalan'ny fitoraham-blaogy, mety afaka hahita mpitoraka blaogy hafa isika, izay mihombon-kevitra amintsika, sy mahatakatra ary afaka manampy antsika amin'ny fiainana. ||| Through blogging, maybe we will find other bloggers in the world who also share our views, and who can understand and help us in our lives.
Raha nandray anjara tamin'ny fiofanana mitoraka blaogy voalohany nokarakarain'ny Foko aho dia nanontany azy ireo hoe inona no mety hosoratako amin'ny blaogiko. ||| When I participated in the first blog training of Foko, I asked them what I can write on a blog.
Iray tamin'ny valiny ny hoe afaka ampiasainao toy ny diary ny blaogy. ||| One of the answers was that I can use blogging as a diary.
Marina izany nefa mitandrema ihany tsy hizara zavatra saro-pady "intime" ao amin'ny blaoginao, satria afaka ahodin'ny sasany iny hanoherana anao (na "hamelezana" anao) ||| It's true, but be careful not to share something intimate on your blog, someone can use it against you (to "hit" you)
Frankofonia: Mihatsara tahaka ny divay antitra ny Twitter ||| Francophonie: Like Fine Wine, Twitter Experience Gets Better With Age
Nitamberina somary nalaza kely tanatin'ny ora tsy nampoizina ny hash tag ao anatin'ny valan-tserasera mpiteny frantsay. ||| An unexpected but deliciously nostalgic hash tag has been trending on the French speaking social media scene.
Hatramin'ny faha-26 Jolay dia somary nitodika tany amin'ny fahatsiarovana ny mpampiasa twitter, mamoaka ny tsiahiny fahatanora miampy ny hash tag "jesuisvieux" (Antitra aho ity - lehilahy) na "jesuisvieille" (Antitra aho ity - vehivavy). ||| Since July 26th, twitter users have been going down memory lane, posting tweets relating their memories from youth with the hash tag "jesuisvieux" (I am old - men) or "jesuisvieille" (I am old - women).
Ahitana fitantarana mampihomehy ny eny an-tsefatsefan'ny fanarahana ity hashtag ity, indraindray koa ahitana tranga mahafinaritra ka ahitana ny fivoaran'ny fampiasana ny haitaon'ny fifandraisana. ||| The timeline for the hashtag was filled with often humorous, sometimes sweet updates and provides a good snapshot of the evolution of information technology usage and its demographics.
Tsy dia mazava loatra aloha raha noho ny lahatsoratra iray nivoaka tao amin'ny New York Times tamin'ny 15 Jolay mitondra ny lohateny hoe: "Miha-antitra amim-pahasoavana, talenta frantsay" no nahatonga ny fironana tao amin'ny twitter ity fa mibahana ao an-tsain'ny mponina mpiteny frantsay tokoa angamba ity resaka "miha-antitra" ity ka resahiny malalaka. ||| Aging Gracefully, the French Way" has anything to do with the twitter trend but aging is certainly on a lot of people's mind in the francophone world and they seemingly embrace it openly.
Raha ny notaterin'ny Hashtags.org, dia nahasahana ny 0.03% amin'ny sioka maneratany ny hash tag "jesuisvieux" hash tamin'ny 27 Jolay. ||| According to Hashtags.org, "jesuisvieux" hash tag made up to 0.03% of tweets worldwide on July 27.

Indonezia: Fitarainana nidirana am-ponja ||| Indonesia: Jailed For Complaining
Adi-hevitra mamaivay eo amin'ny tontolom-bolongana Indoneziana amin'izao fotoana izao ny raharaha Prita Mulyasari, renim-pianakaviana mananjanaka roa. ||| The case of Prita Mulyasari, a mother of two, is currently the hot topic among Indonesian bloggers.
Nametraka taratasy fitarainana an-tserasera nitory hopitaly mamahantena any Tangerang, iray amin'ny tanàna manodidina an'i Jakarta ny anao vavy, kanjo ankehitriny dia iharan'ny fiampangana nandìka ny lalàna toko faha-27 andininy faha- 3 amin'ny Lalàna mifehy ny vaovao sy serasera (Elektrônika) ||| She wrote an online complaint letter against a private hospital in Tangerang, one of Jakarta's suburban areas, and now she is being charged for violating chapter 27 verse 3 of the Information and Electronic Transaction Law
Nitantara ny nanjò azy noho ny nataon'ny hopitaly izy tamin'ny taratasy ifandefanana anaty vondron-tserasera iray (mailing-list). ||| Prita shared her experience of being maltreated by the hospital on a mailing-list.
Nametraka fitoriana ara-panjakana taminy ny hopitaly. ||| The hospital took legal action against her.
Mety hahazoana sazy fampidirana am-ponja hatramin'ny enimbolana sy onitra hatramin'ny 1 miliara ropia (manakaiky ny US$ 98 000) io taratasy nalefa tamina vondron-tserasera io. ||| That online complaint may result into six years jail term and maximum fine of 1 billion Rupiah (nearly US$ 98,000).
Tahaka ny miverin-dalana izany isika, ho lasa rendrarendra eto amin'ny firenena izany fahalalaham-pitenenana izany. ||| It feels like going back in the past, the freedom of speech soon will become a luxury in the country.
Mety iharan'ny toko "fanalam-baraka" ao amin'ny Lalànan'ny vaovao sy ny serasera isika raha vao diso famindra kely fotsiny raha vao mialza zavatra aty an-tserasera aty.Mampalahelo ahy ity raharaha ity; araka ny hevitro manokana ny tanjon'ny toeram-piasana rehetra (tafiditra aoa ny hopitaly) dia manao izay hahazoan'ny mpanjifa ao amin'ny fahafaham-po. ||| Taking a wrong step, we could be strangled by "defamation" chapter according to the ITE law for things we talk about over the internet. This unfortunate event saddens me; I personally hope that any service (including hospitals) should aim to have customers satisfaction.
Tsy maintsy mampalahelo anay raha mampiditra am-ponja avokoa ny karazana tsikera rehetra (na dia nosoratana tao anatin'ny fahatezerana aza sy maka fironana izay mety hanelingelina ny fahalalam-pomba aza), izahay izay manoratra aty amin'ny tontolo virtoaly sy mpamaham-bolongana heverina ho olom-pirenena mpanao gazety mahalala zavatra misimisy kokoa ny amin'izany atao hoe "fahalalaham-pitenenana". ||| All criticism (whether presented subjectively or written in anger, which therefore didn't follow rules on writing's decency) that caused the writer to be put in jail surely saddens us, who often write in the virtual world and bloggers who are considered as citizen journalists who are aware so much about "freedom of speech".
Na dia heverina ho mandainga aza ve i Prita dia ho tafahoatra tahaka izao ny asetry azy (araka ny lalàna)? ||| Let say that Prita, who's said to lie, don't you think that the (legal) response is a bit too much?
Efa azontsika eritreretina avy hatrany ny fiantraikan'izao toe-draharaha izao amin'ny mpanoratra mpitsikera mba "hametraka ny resaka amin'ny toerany" sy ny fiheverana avy hatrany fa lasa "fanalam-baràka" ny fitsikerana. ||| We can all imagine the psychological effect of the case for writers who are critical in "making things right" and we can imagine how easy criticism is being labeled as "defamation".
Lahatsoratra iray ao amin'ny daily social no nanambara hoe: ||| A post on daily social network says:
Tena mampalahelo tokoa raha ny zavatra nosoratanao taty amin'ny aterineto no mety hampiditra anao any am-ponja. ||| It's unfortunate indeed when you're complaining on internet, you ended up in jail.
Mba maheno ihany isika isan'andro ny fitarainana ataon'ny olona amin'ny orinasa isan-karazany any anaty gazety any, saingy tsy mbola naheno mihitsy aho hoe nisy olona nosamborina (satria nandefa taratasy fitarainana tany amin'ny gazety). ||| While each day we see a column filled with public complaints against companies, but I've never heard someone being arrested for (having his complaint letter printed on newspaper).
Angamba tokony hitaraina anaty gazety isika fa tsy aty an-tserasera? ||| Maybe we should complain through newspapers and not complain online?
Eto indrindra aloha dia taratasy fitarainana no nidirana am-ponja, fa rehefa tena mamaky azy isika dia fitarainana nosoratana (tsy nilaza anarana) an-tserasera aloha izy ity. Tena mahaliana ity raharaha ity satria maneho miharihary fa tsy mahalaza tsikera ny Indoneziana, na dia heverina ho mpanjaka aza ny mpanjifa. ||| There was indeed a complaint letter source being jailed, but after we really read about it the complaint was first written online (anonymously). This is an interesting case that shows that Indonesians can't bare criticism, even from customers who are considered kings.
Raha hitaraina ianao, tonga dia alefasoan-gazety (mivoaka taratasy) fa aza mankaty amin'ny aterineto. ||| If you have any complaint, printed directly on newspapers, don't go around the Internet.
Mety hanaitra sy hahazo vahaolana aza manko ny fitarainana an-gazety fa mety hampiditra am-ponja kosa raha alefa aty an-tserasera. ||| Your printed complaint will be gain attention, even solution, while the online one will take you to jail.
Izany ve no fahalalaham-pitenenana? ||| Is this freedom of expression?
Niteny ny Komitin'ny zon'olombelona fa mihoampampana ny didimpitsarana nampiharana ny lalàna ITE anenjehana mpanjifa iray, efa nanambara moa ny komity fa hanampy amin'ny fiarovana ny nampangaina hahazoana ny rariny. ||| Commission for Human Rights' official said that the court is overreacting to use an ITE law to sue a consumer, the commission also said that they're ready to facilitate the victim's family for justice.
Mandrapiandry ny manaraka moa dia efa nampiasa ny fitaovantserasera ankafizin'ny any an-toerana farany ny mpampiasa aterineto Indoneziana ho psolovava ampahibemaso. ||| Meanwhile, Indonesian Internet users are taking the public advocacy to the country's latest favorite networking site Facebook.
Nihanaresaka moa ity raharaha ity rehefa nanaiky ny hamerina ny hihevitra indray mandeha ity lalàna ITE ity indray ny Fitsarana Tampony Indoneziana. ||| This case came under the spotlight after the Indonesian Supreme Court acquitted the plea for ITE's reassessment.
Hisy fakana am-bavany an'i Prita moa amin'ny herinandro. ||| Another court session for Prita is set for next week.
