Japana: Aelezo ny hafatra, adikao ||| Japan: Spread the message, translate it
Tafatafa an-tsary niarahana tamin'i Kyo Kageura, lehiben'ny tetikasa Minna no Honyaku fandikan-teny ho an'ny rehetra, Translation for all), sehatra iray ho fandikana teny hanampy ireo ONG (Fikambanana tsy miankina) sy NPO amin'ny fanapariahana ny hafatra fisaorany an'ireo mpandika teny an-tsitrapo. ||| A video interview of Kyo Kageura, head of the project Minna no Honyaku (Translation for all), a new translation platform that helps NGOs and NPOs to spread their messages thanks to volunteer translators.
Ny Global Voices any Japana dia nanontany azy momba ny fanambin'ny Minna no Honyaku, ireo olana atrehiny sy ny fetra vaovaon'ny fandikana teny an-tsitrapo. ||| Global Voices Japan asked him about the challenge of Minna no Honyaku, the difficulties and the new frontiers of volunteer translation.
Ny tetikasa Minna no Honyaku na Fandikan-teny ho an'ny rehetra, Translation for all dia vokatry ny Vondrona Fandikana Teny ao amin'ny Foibem-pirenena ho an'ny Fampahalalam-baovao sy ny Fifandraisana Teknolojia ary ny Tranomboky sy ny Toeram-pikarohana ara-tsiansan'ny fampahalalam-baovao (Language Translation Group of the National Institute of Information and Communication Technology and Library and Information Science Laboratory of the University of Tokyo) ao amin'ny Anjerimanontolon'i Tokyo, iarahany miasa amin'ny orinasa famoahamboky Sanseido. ||| The project Minna no Honyaku or Translation for all is the brainchild of Language Translation Group of the National Institute of Information and Communication Technology and Library and Information Science Laboratory of the University of Tokyo, in cooperation with publishing company Sanseido.
Nosainina ho toy ny singa iray amin'ny Tetikasa Shiitake, ny fananganana sehatra hanentanana sy hampiroboroboana ny fandikàna teny mampiasa aterineto (online) dia manana tanjona voafaritra mazava: ||| Thought as a part of the Shiitake Project, the realization of a platform to stimulate the growth of online translation has a precise purpose:
Ity fomba ity dia hahafahan'ireo mpandika teny miasa ho an'ny tenany hanangana tambazotra atsy ho atsy, tsy ilàna ezaka fanampiny be manao ahoana, ka anatin'izany ireo mpandika teny miasa amina sehatra mifanahantsahana dia ho afaka manangona antontan-kevitra sy mifampizara vaovao mikasika ny asa fandikan-tenin'izy ireo. ||| This system will ultimately enable individual translators to form a network, without any additional or conscious effort, in which translators working on similar or related domains can collectively accumulate translation data and share information relevant to their translations.
Izany, inoanay, dia hanatsara ny asan'ireo mpandika teny sy handrisika ireo mpandika teny mafonja hiditra ao. ||| This, we believe, will enhance the activity of translators and encourage potential translators to join in.
Araka izany, ny tetikasa Shiitake dia tetikasa sosialy mihitsy. ||| As such, the Shiitake project is ultimately a social project.
Farany, amin'ny fiezahana hanao ny asa fandikana teny ho dingana mora koa ho an'ireo mpandika teny tsy mbola ampy fahaiza-manao, ny tariky ny Profesora Kageura namorona ny Minna no Honyaku, dia resy lahatra fa: ||| Lastly, with the aim to make translation an easy process also to inexperienced translators, Professor Kageura's team created Minna no Honyaku, convinced that:
Ny fandikana ireo vaovao sy tatitra samihafa ataon'ireo mpiasa an-tsitrapo dia mitana toerana goavana tokoa ao anatin'ity fivezivezen'ny vaovao ity. ||| The translation of news and reports by volunteers plays a vital role in this alternative information flow.
RDC: Sariitatra politika Kôngôley ||| DRC: Cartoons satirize Congolese politics
Vao iray volanaizay ny filoha Kôngôley no nanendry ny mpikambana ny governemanta vaovao mba hampitonena ny tsikera mihatra aminy noho ny tsy fahafehazany ny herisetra ataon'ny mpioko any amin'ny ilany atsinanan'ny firenena, ka maroamin'ny mpamaham-bolongana no matro-pijery amin'ny hoavin'ny firenena. ||| It's been just one month since Congolese President Joseph Kabila named a new government in an effort to quell mounting criticism over his inability to quell rebel violence in the east, and many bloggers remain skeptical about the country's future.
Maro moa no manoratra ny tsy filaminana manjaka any Kôngô (jereo ny lahatsoratry ny mpanoratra ao amin'ny GV Elia Varela Serra, izay vao nanaraka akaiky ny fivoaran'ny toe-draharaha), saingyindraindray ny sary no mahalaza azy bebe kokoa noho ny kabary arivo. ||| A lot has been written about Congo's precarious situation (see posts by GV author Elia Varela Serra has closely followed recent developments), but sometimes a picture is worth a thousand words.
Alex Engwete ohatra namoaka ny sariitatra nataony, novokarin'ny Fikambanana miaro ny zon'olombelona (Human Rights Watch), izay manaraby ny tsy fihainoan'ny filoha Kabila ny feon'ny fiarahamonim-pirenena sy ny mpanohitra sy ny fanohanana tsy an-kitenitenin'ny vahiny mpamatsy vola. ||| Alex Engwete posts this cartoon, produced by Human Rights Watch, which satirizes Kabila's shutting out of civil society and opposition voices and the tacit support of foreign donors.
ny manao gazety Cedric Kalonji kosa indray no namoaka ireto sariitatra politika ireto tao amin'ny Flickr photostream azy: ||| Journalist Cedric Kalonji posts these political cartoons on his Flickr photostream:
Hoy ilay miteny: "Raha te-hahazo ny vaovao tadiavinao ianao mankanesa any amin'ny loharano niaviany" ||| Mustached man: "For all the information you need, go to the source"
Ilay zazavavy eo ankavia: MAMA an, tafapetraka amin'ny toerany ny governemanta, fa tsy hitako ny anaranao. ||| Girl, left: MOTHER, the government is in place, but I didn't see your name.
Fa nisy inona? ||| What happened?
(ny Adininy faha 14 dia mametraka ny fitovian'isan'ny vehivavy sy ny lehilahy tendrena eo amin'ny sehatra isan-tanàna, isakyny faritany ary manerana ny firenena.) ||| (Article 14 mandates equal gender representation at all levels, national, provincial and local).
Brezila: Hetsika Manerantany Manohitra ny Tohodrano Belo Monte an-tsary sy lahatsary ||| Brazil: Global Action Against Belo Monte Dam in Images
Nisandrahaka manerantany ny fihetsiketseham-panoherana ny fananganana ny tohodrano Belo Monte ny 19 ka hatramin'ny 22 Aogositra 2011. ||| From the 19 to the 22 of August, 2011, protests against Belo Monte dam went global.
Na dia efa nanomboka aza ny asam-pananganana ity tohodrano ity, dia manomana fihetsiketseham-panoherana an'aterineto sy eny an-dalamben'ny tanàna maro any Brezila sy manoloana ny masoivoho sy Kaonsilà Breziliana ny mponina. ||| Although the construction work on the dam has already begun, people have organized in protests on the Internet and in the streets of many Brazilian cities and throughout the world in front of Brazilian embassies and consulates.
Miaro ny mponina niorina tao hatry ny fahagola sy ny fambolena nentim-paharazana any amin'ny faritra Volta Grande do Xingu fanjakan'i Para ry zareo ireo ary miantso ho amin'ny fiarovana ihany koa ny Alan'i Amazonia sy ny tontolo iainana manodidina. ||| Advocating for the indigenous populations and traditional settlers of Volta Grande do Xingu region in the state of Para, they are also calling for the protection of the Amazon rainforest and environment.
Amin'ity lahatsoratra ity no anangonanay ny lahatsary sy sarin'ireo fihetsiketsehana manerantany. ||| In this post, we compile a selection of photos and videos featuring the worldwide demonstrations.
Sao Paulo, tanàna lehibe indrindra any Brezila no nanomana ny fihetsiketsehana lehibe indrindra; nizotra tao amin'ny Avenue Paulista izany ary mandray anjara ao ihany koa ireo indizeny izay misy fiantraikany amin'ny fiainany ny fananganana ity tohodrano hakana angovo ity. ||| Sao Paulo, the largest city in Brazil, staged the biggest protest; it took place in Paulista Avenue and included members of the indigenous groups that will be affected by the hydroelectric power plant dam.
Raphael Tsavkko, izay mpanoratra ato amin'ny Global Voices no nisiokantsera izay fahatsapany sy saripika maromaro avy amin'ny Diabe tao Sao Paulo nandritra ny folakandron'ny 20 Aogositra: ||| Raphael Tsavkko, who is a Global Voices author, tweeted his impressions and photos from the march of Sao Paulo during the afternoon of August 20:
Sora-baventy: "Velona i Xingu - Fa tsy i Belo Monte!". ||| Banner reads: "Xingu Alive - Not Belo Monte" !.
Diabe sy fandoroana sary ho fanoherana ny tetikasa hananganana ny tohodrano Belo Monte. ||| Demonstrators march and burn an effigy in protest over the Belo Monte power plant construction.
Namoaka fanombatombanana moa ny Polisy-Miaramila fa eo ho eo amin'ny 800 ny olona nanatrika ny fanoherana tao Sao Paulo. ||| The Military Police released an estimate that at least 800 people attended the protest in Sao Paulo.
Jereo ny lahatsarin'ny fanoherana tao an-tanàna, mivoaka ao amin'ny YouTube napetrak'i Dhirak: ||| Check out a video of the protest in the city, posted on YouTube by Dhirak:
Ny vohikalan'ny Rede Brasil Atual no mitatitra ny fanoherana tany Belém, renivohitr'i Para, fanjakana hananganana ny tohodranon'i Belo Monte. Danilo Ramos no namoaka sary vitsivitsy ny diabe izay nizotra tamin'ilay tsena malaza Ver-o-Peso sy ny toerana manan-tantara hafa ao afovoan'ny tanàna. ||| The website Rede Brasil Atual covered the protest in Belém, the capital city of posted some photos of the march that went along the famous Ver-o-Peso market and other areas of the historical city center.
Altamira, ny fivondronana hananganana ny tohodrano, dia ny andro mialoha no nanaovana ny fihetsiketsehana, ny zoma19 Aogositra. ||| In Altamira, the municipality where the dam is to be located, the protest came on the day before, on Friday, August 19.
Karen Hoffman no namoaka tao amin'ny Flickr-ny sary 15 tamin'ity hetsi-panoherana ity. ||| Karen Hoffman posted photos of this protest on her Flickr page 15.
Ny diaben'i Fortaleza, tao amin'ny fanjakan'i Ceará, dia nizotra tao amin'ny fari-pivarotana tao afovoan-tanàna. ||| The march in Fortaleza, in the state of Ceará, took place in a commercial area of the city center.
Amin'ny alalan'ny posters sy ny teny filamatra no hihetsehan'ny mpikatroka manohitra ny tetikasa Belo Monte, sy ny fanoherana ihany koa ny lalàna vaovao momba ny ala: ||| Through posters and slogans, the demonstrators protested against the Belo Monte project, and also against the new Forestry Code:
Diabe fanoherana ny tohodrano Belo Monte tany Fortaleza, Brezila, tamin'ny 20 Aogositra 2011. ||| March against the Belo Monte dam in Fortaleza, Brazil, on August 20, 2011.
Tany Brasília, renivohi-pirenena ao Brezila, mandihy sy mihira fanandratana ny ala, ao amin'ny toerana voajanahary manakaiky ny tranoben'ny minisiteran'ny fitondrana federaly. ||| In Brasília, the national capital of Brazil, demonstrators danced and sang songs of praise of the forest, in a natural area close to the buildings of the ministries of the federal government.
Jereo ity lahatsary nivoaka tao amin'ny YouTube avy amin'ny mpisera FSPompeo2 ity: ||| Check out this short video posted on YouTube by the user FSPompeo2:
Tamin'ny 22 Aogositra, dia fihetsiketsehana - izay nambara tao amin'ny vohikalan'ny fikambanana Xingu Vivo - no nizotra tao Rio de Janeiro, teo anoloan'ny foiben'ny Bankim-pirenena misahana ny Fampandrosoana, miantso ny fitondrana tsy hampiasa ny volam-bahoaka amin'ny fananganana ny tohodrano. ||| On August 22, another protest - which had been announced on the website of the organization Xingu Vivo - took place in Rio de Janeiro, in front of the headquarters of the National Development Bank, calling on the government not to use public money for the construction of the power plant dam.
Mieritreritra an-toerana ihany, mihetsika manerana ny tany ||| Thinking locally, protesting globally
Nandritra ny Andro Iraisam-pirenena ho fiarovana an'i Amazon, 22 Aogositra, no niofo nahatratra ny manerantany ny hetsi-panoherana ny fananganana an'i Belo Monte. ||| On the International Day for the Defence of the Amazon, August 22, the protests against the construction of Belo Monte gained global proportions.
Ny fikambanana iraisampirenena Survival izay natokana hiaro ny vahoaka indizeny, namoaka lahatsoratra miaraka amin'ny sary avy any amin'ny tanàndehibe manerana izao tontolo izao, tahaka ity iray avy ao Londres: ||| The international organization Survival, which is dedicated to the protection of indigenous peoples, published an article with photos from several cities of the world, such as this one from London:
"Olona ampolony manohitra ny fananganana ny tohodrano Belo Monte, ivelan'ny masoivoho Breziliana ao Londres." ||| "Dozens of people demonstrated against the Belo Monte dam, outside the Brazilian Embassy in London today".
Ao amin'ny Twitter, Xingu Vivo no mizara lahatsary ahitana ny fanoherana ny fananganana an'i Belo Monte tao Paris, Frantsa: ||| On Twitter, Xingu Vivo shared a video of the protest against Belo Monte that took place in Paris, France:
Any Etazonia, mpikatroka avy ao San Francisco no manao izay handrenesana ihany koa ny feony: ||| In the United States, activists from San Francisco also made their voices heard:
"Brezila: Tsy mila ny tohodrano Belo Monte! ||| "Brazil: No Belo Monte Dam!
Arovy ny ala" Eo ivelan'ny masoivoho Breziliana ao San Francisco, Etazonia. ||| Save the rainforest" outside the Brazilian consulate in San Francisco, USA.
Mpanao fihetsiketsehana manandratra marika ampitan'ny masoivoho freziliana ao San Francisco, Etazonia. ||| Demonstrators holding signs outside the Brazilian consulate in San Francisco, USA.
Any Meksika misy mpikatroka mivezivezy miaro ny "rano sy fandriampahalemana" nanao fihetsiketsehana manoloana ny Kaosilàn'i Brezila ao Guadalajara "ho fiaraha-mientana anoherana an'i Belo Monte". ||| Also in Mexico, an itinerant movement of activists for "water and peace" demonstrated in front of the Consulate of Brazil in Guadalajara "in solidarity with the journey of fight against Belo Monte".
Ny tanjon-dry zareo moa dia ny hanolotra taratasy amin'ny Kaonsily "hitaky ny hanajana ny zon'ireo olombelona iharan'ny fanjavonana": ||| They aimed to hand out a letter to the Consul "demanding for the respect of human rights of the threatened people":
Manana fanangonan-tsonia mandrisika ny filoha Dilma Rousseff hampitsahatra ny fanitarana ny tohodranon'i Belo Monte i Avaaz ary"hampiasa vola amin'ny angovo mahomby sy loharanonkery madio, hiaro ny zo fototry ny olona taloha (indizeny) sy ny fokonolona ao an-toerana ary hanohana ny fampandrosoana miaro ny fiainana sy ny tontolo iainana". ||| Avaaz has an ongoing petition urging president Dilma Rousseff to stop development of the Belo Monte Dam Complex and "invest in energy efficiency and clean power sources, protect the basic human rights of indigenous people and local communities, and support sustainable development that protects lives and ecosystems".
Efa novakian'i Lou Gold (notsaraina) ity lahatsoratra ity. ||| This post was proofread by Lou Gold.
Sarimihetsika: Andro Iray Hiainana Ny Fiainan'ny Olona Iray Jamba ||| Video: A Day in the Life of a Blind Person
Jamba hatrany an-kibon-dreny i Tommy Edison, ary amin'ny alàlan'ny lahatsary YouTube no anehoany amintsika ny fiatrehany ireo asa aman-draharaha sasantsasany izay mitaky fanamby avy aminy toy ny fampiasàna vola taratasy ohatra, ATM, famakiana DVD sy fiampitàna arabe. ||| Tommy Edison has been blind since birth, and through YouTube videos he shows us how he deals with certain activities that present challenges to him such as using paper money, ATMs, DVD players and crossing streets.
Izy koa dia mpanao kiana amin'ny sarimihetsika ary ny fomba fijeriny miharo vazivazy no manome antsika topimaso amin'ny fomba ankafizan'ireo manana olana ara-pahitàna ny fiainana. ||| He is also a movie critic and his humorous reviews provide us with a glimpse in how the visually impaired enjoy life.
Soratra Braille avy amin'i Ralph Aichinger CCBy ||| Braille by Ralph Aichinger CCBy
Ao amin'ny lahatsariny farany indrindra, asehony antsika ny fomba hiampitàny ireo arabe be mpivezivezy: anatinà tranga iray, misy feo fanairana mampahafantatra azy rehefa azo antoka ny hiampitàna, ary amin'ny tranga iray hafa, mila mamantatra ny fandehan'ny fifamoivoizana amin'ny alalan'ny feo manodidina izy, ary aorian'izay vao manandrana manapa-dàlana, izay soritany hoe zavatra tena faran'izay mahatahotra: ||| In his latest video, he shows us how he crosses busy streets: in one case, there's an audible signal that lets him know when it is safe to cross, and in the other case, he has to figure out traffic patterns through sound, and then attempt to cross in what he describes as a scary experience:
Mr. Edison koa dia mpanao kiana aminà sarimihetsika. ||| Mr. Edison is also a film critic.
Izy dia mibanjina manokana ireo mpilalao, ny resaka, ny mozika ary ny fomba fitantaràna, ary araka ny filàzany, manome antsika vina vaovao izy momba ny fomba ahafahan'ireo jamba mahatsapa ny elanelam-panahy ara-pahitàna. ||| He focuses on the characters, dialogues, music and storytelling, and through his telling, he gives us a new perspective on how a blind person perceives such a visual medium.
Ao anatin'ity fitetezana an-dahatsary ity, misy ampahany izay navela ho mainty ny fàfana nefa ny feo kosa mitohy re hatrany ka manampy ny mahiratra hahatakatra ny fomba hanarahan'ny jamba ny tantara. ||| In this video review, there are parts where the screen goes black while the audio continues which really helps the viewer understand how movies play out for the blind.
Ity lahatsary manaraka ity dia ny fijeriny malalaka ny X-Men: First Class. ||| This next video is his spoiler free review of X-Men: First Class.
Raha ny mahazatra dia mandeha any amin'ny trano fandefasana sarimihetsika i Tommy Edison ho an'ireo sarimihetsika alalininy, saingy mijery DVD any an-tranony ihany koa izy. ||| Tommy Edison usually goes to the movie theater for the films he reviews, but he also watches DVDs at home.
Na izany aza, ny fanomanana ny rehetra momba ilay famakiana DVD nambara fa tsotra izay namidy taminy dia voaporofo fa mbola sarotra tsy araka izay nosaininy. ||| However, setting up a DVD player that was sold to him as accessible proves to be a bit more complicated than he thought.
Na dia natolotra amin'ny fiteny maro samihafa aza ny pitsopitsony amin'ny fampiasàna ilay famakiana DVD, tsy ahitàna ny Braille hianarana mampiasa ilay fitaovana vaovao azony izy ireny, fanamby sarotrarotra kokoa. ||| Although the DVD player instructions come in a multiplicity of languages, they don't include Braille so learning to use his new equipment is more than a bit challenging.
Ity lahatsary manaraka ity, na eo aza ny teknolojia nampifanarahana amin'ny toetoetr'ireo tratry ny fahasembanana, dia maneho ny tsy fahombiazan'ireo 'marques' tahaka ny ao anatin'ny ohatra manaraka etoana amin'ny fampiasàna ny ATM. ||| This next video shows how, even though technology gets adapted for people with disabilities, efforts fall short of the mark as in the next example of ATM use.
Raha toa ka tsy dia henjana loatra ny lafin'ny teknolojia, mbola mila miatrika ny fomba fijerin'ny olona ihany koa i Tommy, satria tsy mahatsindry izy ireny noho izy mandany fotoana kokoa rehefa maka ny volany eny amin'ireo milina mibaiko tena mampiasa feo natao ho an'ireo olona afaka mahita: ||| If just the technology aspect weren't hard enough, Tommy also has to deal with people's perceptions, as they lose patience because he takes longer to get his money from an automated teller machine designed for people who can see:
Ary vantany vao mahazo ny volany ho eny an-tànany i Tommy? ||| And once Tommy has the money in his hand?
Tsy mora velively ny zava-drehetra satria ny fampiasàna vola taratasy dia ilàna manontolo ny fahaiza-mandamina sy fitokisana ny hoe hanome azy ny famerim-bola marina ho azy ve ny olona, satria ao Etazonia, tsy misy fomba natao ho fanomezana faktiora manokana ho an'ny olona jamba: ||| Things don't get any easier since using paper money requires a whole lot of organization and trust so that people actually give him the right amount of change since in the US, there is no way for the blind to tell bills apart:
Tsy mandeha irery amin'ny zavatra ataony ing. Edison: Ben Churchill no mamokatra sy mitantana ireo lahatsariny, ary ilay tarika dia mameno ireo tambajotra sosialy, mifanerasera amin'ireo mpanjohy azy: ohatra, mandroso soso-kevitra ny olona ny amin'ny tokony hisian'ny sarimihetsika ho an'ny Kianan'ny Sarimihetsika Jamba mba hojerena fa tsy ho fametrahana fanehoan-kevitra fotsiny eo amin'ny pejiny. ||| Mr. Edison isn't alone on his endeavor: Ben Churchill produces and directs his videos, and the team is on several social networks interacting with followers: for example, people have suggested movies for the Blind Film Critic to watch by leaving a comment on his page.
Hita any anaty tambajotra sosialy samihafa ihany koa izy. ||| He is also on different social networks.
Qatar: Manontany izay tetikasa amin'ny hoavy ireo miasa ivelan'ny tanindrazana ||| Qatar: Expats Question Future Plans
Ny Filan-kevi-piaraha-miasa any amin'ny Golf, ahitàna an-dry Bahrain, Kaoety, Arabia Saodita, Qatar, Oman ary ny Emira Arabo Mitambatra, dia manana mpiasa vahiny voavinavina ho eo amin'ny 13 tapitrisa eo, izay 40 isan-jaton'ny mponina ao aminy. ||| The Gulf Cooperation Council, which comprises Bahrain, Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Oman and the United Arab Emirates, has an estimated 13 million foreign workers, who make up about 40 per cent of its population.
Amin'ny mponin'i Qatar 1,69 tapitrisa, 200 000 no inoana fa tena teratany. ||| Out of Qatar's population of 1.69m people, 200,000 are believed to be locals.
Saika ireo mpiasa rehetra no miverina any amin'ny tanindrazany rehefa mifarana ny fifanarahan'asany. ||| Almost all workers return to their countries after their work contracts end.
Ao amin'ny Qatar Living, miezaka mamaly ny fanontaniana tsy azo idifiana ireo niala ny tanindrazany: Inona no hataony rehetra miverina an-tanindrazana izy ireo? ||| At Qatar Living, expatriates attempt to answer the inevitable question: What will they do when they return home?
Manafàna ny resaka ilay Filipiana Obed Castro Jr manao hoe: ||| Filipino Obed Castro Jr kicks off the discussion saying:
Izaho dia teratany Filipiana izay nipetraka taty Qatar efa ho 9 taona izao ary an-kafaliana no hilazako fa nahitako voka-tsoa ny nipetrahako taty, afaka manana ny tranoko manokana aho ary mahavita mitahiry kely, izao aho nanapa-kevitra ny hiverina any amin'ny tanindrazako, nefa inona no hataoko rehefa tafaverina aho... toy izany koa ny an'ireo teratany hafa rehetra "inona no hataonao amin'ny fiainanao rehefa afaka an'i Qatar" ||| I am a Filipino who have stayed here in Qatar for almost 9 years happy to say that my stay here has been fruitful, I manage to have my own house and maybe save a little, now I am deciding to go back to my native country, but what will I do when I am back... same to all other nationalities "what will you do with your life after Qatar"
Hiova ny toeram-ponenana fa mitohy tahaka ny tany Qatar ihany ny fiainana..... ||| Place of living would change but life would go on normally as in Qatar.....
Azo antoka fa halahelo ny fiainanao be ierehana ianao... Fantatrao fa tsy azo antoka ny zava-drehetra... nefa tsy ratsy mihitsy ny miomana ho amin'ny zavatra iray... ka mino aho fa tokony hiomana ianao raha tena hody marina... ||| for sure your gonna miss the busy life.. You know all things are uncertain.. but its never bad to prepare for something.. so I guess better plan up if your goin home for good...
Ochiha dia miteny rehefa nonina 5 taona sy tapany tany Qatar fa tsy malahelo ny fiainany tany an-tanindrazany mihitsy izy: ||| Ochiha says after five and half years in Qatar, she doesn't miss living in her country:
miteny ny olona fa mahafinaritra ny miverina any an-tanindrazana dia maka aina, nefa tsoriko fa tsy mitovy hevitra amin'izany aho. ||| people say that it is amazing to return to your home country and relax, but honestly, I do not feel like that.
marina fa malahelo ny fianakaviako aho, fa tsy dia malahelo loatra ny fiainana any an-tanindrazako. ||| sure I miss my family, but I really do not miss living in my home country.
ratsy ve izany sa maro ireo olona mahatsapa toy izany koa? ||| is that weird or many people feel the same way
raha tsara kokoa ny toe-piainanao sy ny mety hahitanao asa, inona no tsy hijanonanao mandra-pahitanao fa nivoatra ny toe-javatra any an-tanindrazanao? ||| If your standard of living and chance for employment is better here, why wouldn't you want to stay until you see the situation in your homeland improve?
Ary i Foolish dia manolo-kevitra ny hanandramana manao afera: ||| And Foolish suggests venturing into business:
Maninona raha manangana fihariana kely ianao; mba ho tale indray mandeha amin'ny fiainanao tpt. ||| Why don't you start a small business; be a boss once in your life lol.
Izaho izao manandrana ny famokarana atody ary mandeha tsara izany. ||| I'm venturing now on egg production and it's going good.
Mieritreritra ny hody aho mety ho amin'ny heritaona raha mandeha tsara ny asa. ||| Am planning to go home maybe next year, if my business will go better.
Arymoceana dia manohana ilay hevitra sy ireo antony: ||| Arymoceana supports the idea and reasons:
Indraindray dia ny fiverenana no mampatahotra antsika indrindra satria maro ireo zavatra tsy ara-tsika tany an-tanindrazantsika. Mieritreritra isika fa maro loatra ireo zavatra niova ka mety tsy ho zatra vetivety, nefa ny marina dia isika izay niaina taty amin'ny kolotsaina hafa no tena niova be. ||| Sometimes going back scares us the most because we have missed a lot things in our country. We think that so many things changed already there and we may not adjust easily, when the truth is it's us being here in a different culture that has changed a lot.
Makà aina tsara aloha, hifalio ny vola valin-kasasaranao. ||| Try to relax first, enjoy your hard earned money.
Nefa hamarino fa tena manana tetika hamelomanao ny tenanao sy ny fianakavianao ianao. ||| But make sure you do have a plan to sustain yourself and your family.
Fantatrao tsara ny toe-draharaha any Filipina, mikoriana toy ny rano ny vola, ary noho ianao mpiasa tany ivelany dia mieritreritra ny rehetra fa nitondra kitapo feno QR ianao. ||| You know how it is in the Philippines, money flows like water, and you being an OFW everybody thinks you brought a sack full of QR.
Tsoriko fa moramora kokoa dieny mbola aty ny manao bizina any an-tanindrazana dia avy eo raha mandeha tsara izay vao manapa-kevitra hody. ||| Honestly, its more practical that while here, we do start a business in our countries then if its doing okay then that is the time to make a decision to come home.
Eny e, hevitro ihany izany. ||| Oh well, that is just my opinion.
Nefa i Mr. Balut mampatsiahy ireto teboka ireto alohan'ny hiverenana any an-tanindrazana: ||| But Mr. Balut cautions those planning to return to their home countries:
Hamarino ny toekarena any an-tanindrazana! ||| Check the economy back home!
Hamarino ny tahan'ny fanaovana asa ratsy any an-tanindrazana! ||| Check the crime rate back home!
Hamarino ny toetr'andro any an-tanindrazana! ||| Check the weather back home!
Hamarino raha ampy ny vola entinao mamelon-tena! ||| Check if you have enough money to survive!
Hamarino raha mbola amin'ny taona tokony hahita asa tsara ianao raha sendra lany vola! ||| Check if once your out of money, your age is right enough to get a good job!
Raha tsy mety aminao ireo TOKONY ATAO ireo, tsaratsara ho anao ny manafoana ny fodianao! ||| If the TO DO's don't fit you, better cancel your flight!
Ndeha miverina miasa! ||| Go back to work!
Raha mponina efa ela tany amin'ny iray amin'ireo firenen'ny GCC ianao, inona ireo tetikasa maharitra anananao? ||| If you are a long term resident in one of the GCC countries, what are your long-term plans?
Inona no hataonao rehefa tafaverina an-tanindrazana? ||| What will you do when you return home?
Meksika: Raharaha fakàna an-keriny niantraika tamin'ny fifandraisana ara-diplaomatika amin'i Frantsa. ||| Mexico: Kidnapping Case Affects Diplomatic Relations with France
Meksika sy Frantsa dia manana olana lehibe ara-pifandraisana diplaomatika noho ny fanamelohana ny fakana an-keriny natao-na teratany Frantsay tao Meksika. ||| Mexico and France have had growing problems in their diplomatic relations due to the kidnapping conviction of a French national in Mexico City.
Florence Cassez no anarany, ary voasambotra tamin'ny taona 2006 izy, nampangaina ho nanao fakana ankeriny ary voasazy 60 taona an-trano-maizina. ||| Her name is Florence Cassez, and she was arrested in 2006, accused of kidnapping charges and sentenced to 60 years in prison.
Ny sakaizan'i Cassez dia mpitarika andian-jiolahy antsoina hoe "Los Zodiacos" (midika hoe ry zaravintana), ary ny fijoroana vavolombelona nataon'ireo nalaina an-keriny no nanamarina fa anisan'ireo andian-jiolahy tokoa izy. ||| Cassez's boyfriend was a leader of a gang called "Los Zodiacos" (meaning the zodiacs), and in several testimonies the kidnapped recognized her as part of the gang.
Tamin'ny taona 2009, namangy an'i Meksika ny Filoha Frantsay Nicolas Sarkozy ary nangataka ny fahafahan'i Cassez nandritra ny fivahiniany tany. ||| In 2009, French President Nicolas Sarkozy visited Mexico and asked for Cassez's release during his time in the country.
Tokony naverina any Frantsa i Cassez saingy tsy nanaiky ny governemanta Meksikana, izay noteren'ny fikambanana nasionaly "manohitra ny fakana an-keriny". ||| Cassez could have been sent to France but Mexican authorities refused to let her go, pressured by "anti-kidnapping" national organizations.
Ny filazan'izy ireo dia mifototra amin'ny tsy fahatokisana fa mety hahenan'ny manam-pahefana Frantsay ny didim-pitsarana rehefa tonga any amin'ny taniny i Cassez. ||| Their argument was based on their distrust that French authorities would alter her sentence in her home country.
Nanazava ny fanerena nataon'ny fikambanana tamin"ny governemanta Meksikana" ny bilaogera AguaChile: ||| The blog AguaChile describes the pressure the Mexican government faced from these organizations:
Tao Meksika, indrindra, ONG mpanohitra ny fakàna an-keriny malaza tahaka an'i Isabel Miranda de Wallace''s Alto al Secuestro, Alejandro Martí's México SOS sy María Elena Morera's Causa en Común, dia resy lahatra amin'ny fiampangana an'i Cassez' ary niantso ny Filoha Frantsay Nicolas Sarkozy mba tsy hitsabaka amin'ny raharaha. ||| In Mexico, notably, prominent anti-kidnapping NGOs such as Isabel Miranda de Wallace''s Alto al Secuestro, Alejandro Martí's México SOS and María Elena Morera's Causa en Común, are convinced of Cassez' culpability and call on the French President, the mercurial Nicolas Sarkozy, to stay out of the case.
Amin'ity taona ity, ny "Taonan'i Meksika ao France" dia tokony hankalazaina misesisesy amin'ny fampisehoana ara-kolontsaina sy ara-barotra mihoatra ny 350 nomanina amin'ity taona 2011 ity. ||| This year, "The Year of Mexico in France" is to be celebrated with a sequence of more than 350 cultural and trade events programmed throughout 2011.
Nanambara i Frantsa tamin'ny voalohany fa handroso izy ireo amin'ny fampisehoana ary hampiasa izany, ary etsy andaniny, mba hanintona ny saina momba ny raharaha Cassez. ||| France initially said it would move forward with the events and use them, in part, to draw attention to Cassez's plight.
Nanambara ny manam-pahefana Meksikana fa tsy hanohana ny fandehan'ny "Taonan'ny Meksika" sy tsy hamindra an'i Cassez izy ireo. ||| Mexican authorities have announced they will not support the "Year of Mexico" proceedings and will not transfer Cassez.
Ao amin'ny Twitter, ireo olom-pirenena avy amin'izao tontolo izao dia nampiaka-peo. ||| On Twitter, citizens from all over the world have raised their voices.

Ny polisy federaly sy ny polisim-paritra tsara ofana kokoa sady voaofana kokoa, dia mahomby lavitra mihoatra ny valim-pitsarana sy ny krizy ara-diplomatika ary ny fanafahana mpaka an-keriny. ||| A federal and state police that are better trained, and are more professional, can make a big difference between a successful prosecution and, well, a diplomatic crisis or a released kidnapper.

Etazonia: Naverina nodinihana indray ny fanambarana mikasika ny zon'ny vazimba ||| USA: Indigenous Rights Declaration under Reexamination
Telo taona latsaka kely taty aorian'ny nandavana ny Fanambaran'ny Firenena Mikambana mikasika ny zon'ireo vahoaka vazimba tamin'ny Septambra 2007, mangataka ny fandraisan'anjaran'ireo mpitarika Amerikana Teratany (Indiana Amerikana) amin'izao fotoana izao ny governemantan'i Etazonia, manavao indray ny fanantenan-dry zareo fa mety hanampy amin'ny fanokafana làlana ho amin'ny fanaovan-tsonia ny lalàna, ny fifidianana ny Filoha Barack Obama. ||| Almost three years after rejecting the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples in September 2007, the United States government is now asking for input from Native American leaders, renewing their hopes that the election of President Barack Obama may help open a path to ratification.
Mangataka "fanonerana ara-drariny" ireo tanim-bazimba nangalarina ilay fanambarana, saingy tsy manohintohina ny maha iray tsy mivaky ny faritra eo amin'ny tanin'ny fanjakana akory. ||| The declaration calls for "reasonable reparations" for stolen indigenous lands, but not at the expense of violating a nation-state's territorial integrity.
Firenena telo fotsiny ihany no nandà ilay fanambarana tany am-boalohany, izay tsy mbola manana endrika tsy maintsy tanterahana, nefa mametraka fepetra mafy hanajana sy hampandrosoana ny zon'ny foko vazimba. ||| Only three other countries initially opposed the declaration, which is legally non-binding yet provides solid framework for respecting and advancing collective indigenous rights.
Ny roa tamin'izy ireo, Nouvelle Zélande sy Aostralia, dia efa niova hevitra ka namela an' i Etazonia sy i Kanada ho ny hany sisa tavela ho mpisafidy ny "tsia." ||| Two of these, New Zealand and Australia, have since changed their mind, leaving the U.S. and Canada as the only "no" voters.
Tendrombohitra mitohy manana endrika Crazy Horse any Black Hills any Dakota Atsimo, kilometatra vitsivitsy miala ny tendron'i Rushmore. ||| An ongoing mountain carving of Crazy Horse in the Black Hills of South Dakota, a few miles away from Mount Rushmore.
Milaza ny Lakota fa tany masina nalaina tamin'izy ireo izy ity ||| The Lakota say this is sacred land that was stolen from them.
Tamin'ny 4 Jona 2010, nilaza ny Departemantam-panjakan'i Etazonia fa tokony alefa ao amin'ny mailaka declarationalohan'ny 15 Jolay ny fandraisan'anjaran'ny vahoaka. ||| On June 4, 2010, the U.S. State Department announced that public input should be be sent to the email address declarationby July 15.
Taoriana kelin'izay, nampanantena fa hamerina handinika ny fepetra ny lahatsoratra iray tanaty bilaogy ofisialin'ny Departemantam-panjakana: ||| Earlier, an official State Department blog post promised a review process:
Tamin'ny Talata 21 Aprily, nilaza ny fanapahan-kevitr'i Etazonia, ny masoivohony ao amin'ny Firenena Mikambana, i Susan Rice, ny amin'ny hiverenan'izy ireo handinika indray ny heviny manoloana ny fanambaran'ny Firenena Mikambana mikasika ny zon'ireo vahoaka vazimba, ao amin'ny Seha-piseraseran'ny Firenena Mikambana mikasika ireo olan'ny vazimba. ||| On Tuesday, April 21, U.S. Ambassador to the UN Susan Rice announced the U.S. decision to review our position regarding the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples at the UN Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues.
Nampanantena fiaraha-miasa bebe kokoa miaraka amin'ireo governemanta ara-poko neken'ny tany sy fanjakana, ny Filoha Obama, ary lohahevitra lehibe ao amin'ny Lafim-pitantanana ny fampivoarana ny fifandraisana miaraka amin'ireo fokon'ny Teratany Amerikana. ||| President Obama has promised greater engagement with federally recognized tribal governments, and improved communication with Native American tribes is a prominent theme in the Administration.
Tamin'ny volana Aprily ihany koa no nanjary firenena faharoa taorian'i Aostralia i Nouvelle Zélande raha nandray ny Fanambarana taorian'ny nifidianany ny "tsia" tany am-boalohany. ||| It was also in April that New Zealand became the second country, after Australia, to endorse the Declaration after an initial vote of "no".
Fa tsy ny olon-drehetra no mihevitra fa fanapahan-kevitra tsara no noraisin'i Nouvelle Zélande. ||| But not everyone thinks New Zealand made the right decision.
Mitaraina ny mpanao politika mpanohitra avy amin'ny vazimba Maori, i Nanaia Mahuta, izay ny Antokon'ny Asa misy azy dia nanohitra ilay antontan-taratasy tamin'ny taona 2008, sady manindry fa ny toetra" sarintsariny" amin'ny Fanambarana no ampiasain'ny governemanta. ||| Indigenous Maori opposition politician Nanaia Mahuta, whose Labour party voted against the document in 2008, claims the government is stressing the "symbolic" nature of the Declaration.
Manoratra eo amin'ny bilaoginy izy manao hoe: ||| She writes on her blog:
Tao ambadiky ny voalin'ny tsiambaratelo no nanasoniavan'ny Ministry ny Raharaha Maori ka nampidirany ny governemanta tamin'ny UNDRIP. ||| Under the veil of secrecy the Minister of Maori Affairs signed the Government up to the UNDRIP.
Kinga ery ireo Ministry ny Nasionaly (Avy amin'ny mpandika; Antoko Nasionaly) ny hanamaivana ny hetsika ho "manana tanjona" sy" tsy mamatopatotra!" ||| National Ministers were quick to downplay the move as "aspirational" and "non-binding"!
In-telo farafahakeliny no nanindrian'ny PM izany nandritra ny fotoana fametraham-panontaniana. ||| The PM must have stressed that point at least three times during question time.
Ny sedra ho an'ny Antoko Nasionaly dia hoe ry zareo ve hitazona ity antontan-taratasy ity ho hetaheta tsy misy fiantraikany any Nouvelle Zélande, sa ry zareo hanome ny valinteny izay efa nambaran'ny MParty?? ||| The test for National is whether they intend to leave this document as a symbol of aspiration that has no currency in New Zealand or whether they intend to deliver any of the expected outcomes which the MParty allude to??
Mahazo vahana ny fanehoana fampanantenana poak'aty sy foana - raha mitohy miakatra hatrany kosa ny tsy fananana asa ho an'ny Maori... ||| A whole heap of window dressing of empty promises and hollow gains – meanwhile Maori unemployment continues to rise...
Raha toa an' i Nouvelle Zelande sy i Aostralia, manao sonia manaiky ilay fanambarana i Etazonia, izay toa mety ho izay ny tantara hiseho, dia i Kanada irery sisa no tavela amin'ny nanao sonia ny "tsia". ||| If like New Zealand and Australia, the U.S. ratifies the declaration, which seems to be the likely scenario, Canada will remain the only "no" signatory.
Ao amin'ny bilaogin'ny Center for World Indigenous Studies, Fourth World Eye, mamaritra ny fomba fandinihan'i Kanada i Rudolph Ryser mikasika ny fanoheran'izy ireo ny fanambarana, ary mamarana izy fa ny fiovana hisy dia avy amin'ireo mponina vazimba ireo ihany fa tsy avy amin'ny governemanta akory. ||| On the blog of the Center for World Indigenous Studies, Fourth World Eye, Rudolph Ryser describes Canada's reasoning for being against the declaration, and concludes that change will come from indigenous peoples themselves, not from governments.
Matanjaka ny famantarana ireo vahoaka vazimba nipetraka teo amin'ny Lalantsaran'ny Fihaonam-ben'ny Firenena Mikambana, nefa kosa tsy mahasolo ny asa tanterahan'ny fahefana ara-politika. ||| The symbolism of indigenous peoples sitting in the UN General Assembly Hall is powerful, but there is no substitute for the exercise of political authority.
Hanohy hanome zava-poana sy oha-pitenena mahazatra feno fampanantenana ho amin'ny fampivoarana ho avy atao ho an'ireo vahoaka teratany ny firenena toa an'i Kanada sy i Etazonina, nefa hetsika tena henjana avy amin'ireo vahoaka vazimba ihany no hanery azy ireo amin'ny fanekena feno ny haja sy ny lalàna momba ireo vahoaka vazimba mipetraka eo an-databatra fanapahan-kevitra izay mendrika azy ireo tokoa. ||| States like Canada and the United States will continue to offer platitudes and tired expressions of confidence for the future development of native peoples, but only vigorous political action by indigenous peoples will force the respect and lawful acceptance of indigenous peoples sitting at the table of decision-making they so richly deserve.
Eo amin'ny bilaogy mavitrika progresista Docudharma, manolotra tohan-kevitra maro ny mpanoratra mitondra ny anarana hoe "winter rabbit" mikasika ny antony mety hanasoniavan'ny Filoha Obama (fantatra ihany koa amin'ny hoe Awe Kooda Bilaxpak Kuuxshish – ny anaran'ny foko Crow nanangana azy) ilay fanambarana. ||| On progressive activism blog Docudharma a writer by the name "winter rabbit" offers several arguments for why President Obama (alternately known as Awe Kooda Bilaxpak Kuuxshish – his adopted Crow tribe name) should ratify the declaration.
Iray amin'ireo rohy maro ao amin'ny lahatsorany no mankany amin'ny tantaram-baovaon'ny taona 2009 izay mitatitra fa tsy mbola namaky ny Fifanarahana Ft. Laramie tena izy tamin'ny taona 1868 ny lehiben'ny mpampanoa lalàna ao Dakota Atsimo amin'ny ankapobeny, izay miantoka fa tompon'ny Black Hills ny Lakota, talohan'ny tena nitazonana izany nony nahitàna volamena tao. ||| One of several links in his post goes to a news story from 2009 that quotes the South Dakota attorney general for saying he has never read the original Ft. Laramie Treaty from 1868 that guaranteed ownership of the Black Hills to the Lakota, before it was eventually seized when gold was discovered there.
Tsy mazava tsara raha hanery ireo Dakotana Tatsimo, handinika tsara indray ny zon'ny vazimba amin'ny taniny, miohatra amin'ireo Amerikana hafa, ny fanekena ny UNDRIP. ||| It is unclear whether the adoption of UNDRIP would compel South Dakotans, among other Americans, to rethink indigenous rights in their country.
Fa ny fangatahan'i Etazonia hevitra avy amin'ireo Teratany Amerikana ho fiverenana mandinika ny fepetra aloha dia efa manome risi-po. ||| But the fact that the U.S. is asking input from Native Americans in the reexamination process is encouraging.
Arabia Saodita: Tenifototra Manokana Ho An'ny Mpanjaka Ao Amin'ny Twitter! ||| Saudi Arabia: A Special Twitter Hashtag for the King!
Tenifototra iray amin'ny teny Saodiana manao hoe "tal3mrak" izay raha adika ara-bakiteny dia manao hoe "Andriamanitra anie hanome tombon'andro anao" na "ny andriamanjaka" raha atao amin'ny teny Tandrefana no nandrakotra ny Twitter androany (28 Aogositra 2011). ||| A Saudi hashtag entitled "tal3mrak" which literary translates into "May god prolong your life" or "your majesty" if translated into a Western context took Twitter by storm today (August 28, 2011).
Zava-tsy nampoizina ho an'ny maro ilay tenifototra, izay tsy nihevitra velively fa ny Saodiana mpiondana aterineto dia hanana faharisihana hiresaka amin'ny feo avo amin'ny fomba tahaka izany rehefa mitodika amin'ireo manampahefanan-dry zareo. ||| The hashtag came as a surprise to many people who never thought Saudi netizens would have the courage to speak up in this manner in the way they address their authorities.
Tany am-piandohana, ilay tenifototra dia nahafaoka ireo olona ambony rehetra mifehy ny tsena ao Arabia Saodita, malalaka amin'ny fanaovan-javatra izay voaràra kosa ho an'ny sarambabem-bahoaka, ary miaina toy ny saranga niangaran'ny vintana rehetra araka izay tiany. ||| At the beginning, the hashtag might have been directed to all the high ranking names in Saudi Arabia who control the market, have the freedom to do things that regular citizens are prohibited from, and live as a privileged class as they wish.
Na izany aza, tsy ela dia nanjary nazava fa nampiasaina hitafàna amin'ny Mpanjaka Saodiana Abdullah, indrindra indrindra rehefa nanomboka nampiasa azy io ireo tsy Saodiana mba hitsikeràna ny politika ivelan'ny Saodiana izay manenjika ny Lohataona Arabo sy manohana ireo mpanao didy jadona mamely ny vahoakany ihany. ||| However, it soon became clear that it was being used to address King Abdullah of Saudi, especially when non-Saudis started using it to criticize Saudi foreign policy that fights the Arab Spring and supports dictators against their people.
Ilay vehivavy Saodiana mafàna fo, Eman AlNafjan dia im-betsaka nandefa bitsika mikasika ny tenifototra "tal3mrak": ||| Saudi women's activist Eman AlNafjan tweeted several times about the "tal3mrak" hashtag:
Ity nifototra "tal3mrak" ity dia mahatonga ahy hihevi-tena ho antitra. ||| This hashtag "tal3mrak" is making me feel old.
Tsy nihevitra velively hoe nisy Saodiana maro tsy mataho-masomena toy izany. ||| Never thought there were this many Saudis not afraid.
AlNafjan dia niezaka koa nanazava ilay tenifototra tanaty bitsika roa ka nanaoratra hoe: ||| AlNafjan has also tried to explain the hashtag in two tweets writing:
Ny tenifototra "tal3mrak" dia manondro ny fianakavian'ny mpanjaka nefa koa nampiasaina ho an'ireo PDG, manamboninahitra ambony amin'ny tafika, minisitra sns. ||| The hashtag "tal3mrak" refers to royal family but is also used for CEOs, high ranking military officers, ministers, etc.
ny dika ara-bakitenin'ny "tal3mrak" "Andriamanitra anie hanome tombon'andro anao", ara-kolotsaina dia nampiasaina ho toy ny fiankohofana&ao amin'ny twitter dia toy ny fananihaniana ny mpitondra&mpanankarena Saodiana ||| literal meaning of "tal3mrak" "may God give you long life",culturally its used as address and on twitter to make fun of powerful and rich Saudis
Ilay bilaogera Saodiana, Ahmed Al-Omran, dia nandefa bitsika momba ny hasin'ny tenifototra toy izany: ||| Saudi blogger Ahmed Al-Omran tweeted about the value of such a hashtag:
Raha Saodiana ianao, ny tenifototra "tal3mrak" dia... tsy dia zava-poana akory. ||| If you are Saudi, the "tal3mrak" hashtag is... quite something.
Al-Omrankoa dia nana ny fanontaniany manokana amin'ity tenifototra ity miresaka ny tahotry ny Saodiana an'ireo polisy ara-pinoana: ||| Al-Omran has also had his own question in this hashtag referring to the Saudi fear of religious police:
Raha mivoaka mba mampiaraka amin'olona ianao, dia matahotra sao ho voasambotry ny polisy ara-pinoana ve? ||| When go out on a date, are you worried that the religious police could arrest you?
Mohamed Effat, mafàna fo Ejiptiana, dia iray tamin'ireo Ejiptiana voalohany nampiasa ilay tenifototra, nilaza fa izy io dia fomba fiteny iray ny amin'ireo zavatra atrehan'ny Saodiana ao amin'ny firenen'izy ireo ihany noho ny ataon'ny mpitondra. ||| Egyptian activist Mohamed Effat was one of the first Egyptians to use the hashtag, saying it is an expression of what Saudis face in their own country from the regime.
Ny sasany amin'ireo Saodiana mpampiasa Twitter dia nikiaka ny tsy fitovoan-keviny amin'i Effa, izay niziriziry tamin'ny fomba fijeriny sady nanazava ilay tenifototra tamin'ny filazana hoe: ||| Some Saudi Twitter users voiced their disagreement with Effa, who insisted on his opinion and explained the hashtag saying:
saodiana miteny eny am-bovonana mikasika ny olan-dry zareo sy manakiana ny mpanjakany ||| Saudis speaking up about their problems criticizing their king
Eman Hussein from Dubai showed admiration for Saudis using this hashtag saying: ||| Eman Hussein from Dubai showed admiration for Saudis using this hashtag saying:
Ilay Ejiptiana, Evronia Azer, dia nanasongadina fa ny mpanjaka dia tokony hanohana ny zon'ireo vehivavy: ||| Egyptian Evronia Azer pointed out that the King should support women's rights:
"tal3mrak" tsy maintsy manomboka amin'ny fanohanana ny zon'ny vehivavy ianao! ||| "tal3mrak" you have to start by supporting women's rights!
Nawwarah, vehivavy Saodiana mpandefa bitsika, dia manome sary tsotra izao ny fomba tsy nitànan'ny mpanjaka ny teny nomeny momba ny fanovàna: ||| Saudi female tweep Nawwarah simply depicted how the King did not keep his promises for reforms:
Nampanantena fandrosoana ho anay ianao, ary dia nahita fahataràna izahay. ||| You promised us progress, and we found ourselves late.
Nampanantena fiainana mendrika ho anay ianao, ary dia niatrika vidim-piainana lafobe izahay. ||| You promised us a decent life, and we faced high living expenses.
Nampanantena anay ny politikan'ny 'varavarana misokatra' ianao ary dia nanome fanomezana anay ianao, ny lalàna iadiana amin'ny fampihorohoroana! ||| You promised us the policy of "the open door" and gifted us the new anti-terror law!
Manal Al-Sharif, ilay ramatoa izay nosamborina noho ny familiana fiara volana maro lasa izay, dia nibitsika im-betsaka nampiasa ny tenifototra "tal3mrak". ||| Manal Al-Sharif, the woman who was arrested for driving her car months ago, tweeted many times under the "tal3mrak" hashtag.
Iray amin'ireo bitsika maneso avy aminy ny hoe: ||| One of her sarcastic tweets reads:
Satria 20 tapitrisa ny zanaka lahy sy zanaka vavinao ary manondrana solika 9 tapitrisa barika isanandro isika, anaty barika toy inona re heverinao mba hitahirizanay ny faharetanay e? ||| Since your sons and daughters are 20 million and we export 9 million barrels of oil per day, in which barrel do you think we should keep our patience?
Sami Almalki, bilaogera Saodiana, dia niezaka koa ny hanazava ny natioran'ilay tenifototra amin'ny fomba fijeriny manokana: ||| Saudi blogger Sami Almalki has also attempted to explain the nature of the hashtag from his own perspective:
Fanamarihana: ny tenifototra "tal3mrak" dia tsy natokana ho an'ny karazanà printsy na mpanjaka na mpanao raharaham-barotra tahaka izay tadiavin'ny sasany hamiliana azy; io dia natodika amin'ireo rehetra manana fahefana ao anatin'ny tontolo arabo. ||| Note: the hashtag "tal3mrak" is not specified for a certain prince or king or merchant as some people tried to divert it; it is addressed to everyone in charge of power in the Arab World.
Haiti: Fomba fahitan'ireo tanora momba ilay horohorontany ||| Haiti: Teens' perspectives on the earthquake
Na dia betsaka aza ny tatitra natao taorian'ilay horohorontany mirefy 7,3 nanimba ampahany betsaka tamin'ny renivohitr'i Haiti, nisy vondrona mpitoraka blaogy haitiana iray adinodino - ireo tanora. ||| Although the coverage of the aftermath of the 7.3 earthquake which has left Haiti's capital partly devastated, has been massive, one group of Haitian bloggers has been overlooked - teenagers.
Ity misy topimaso kely amin'izay lazain'ireo tanora momba ity loza ity, izay nanokatra vanim-potoana iray vaovao teo amin'ny fiainan'izy ireo. ||| Here is a look at what young people have to say about this catastrophe, which foreshadows a new era in their lives.
Mety tsy tianao ho fantatra ny nanjo ahy. ||| You might not wanna know what happened to me.
Mety izay nanjo ny nenitoanao na ny raibenao any Haiti ka tsy azonao tamin'ny finday ihany no mahaliana anao. ||| You might only be interested to what happened to your aunt or your grandpa that are in Haiti and that you can't reach by phone.
Tsy afaka manome tsiny anao amin'izany aho, toy tsy ahafahanao manameloka ahy maniry ny hanoratra izao rehetra izao, satria tsy hisy afa-tsy ny blaogiko ihany no afaka mipetraka sy mihaino izany. ||| I can't blame you for that, though you can't blame me for wanting to write all this, since there's no one else but my blog that can sit and listen to it.
Ireto no teny voalohany avy amina vehivavy mpitoraka blaogy iray Krizkadiak tao amin'ny lahatsorany ny faha-15 Janoary mitondra ny lohateny hoe "Avy amin'ny masona tanora 16 taona" izay mamboraka ny faniriany hiteny, ho heno sy hampahafantatra ny fijaliany. ||| These are the first words of female blogger Krizkadiak in her January 15th post entitled "From 16 year old eyes" and they reveal her need to speak, to be heard and to have her pain acknowledged.
Izany dia manamafy ny lahatsoratra iray nosoratan'i Frantz Duval ary navoakan'i Espas Ayisien, mitondra ny lohateny hoe "Adinontsika fa mijaly koa ireo ankizy", izay fitambarana fijoroana vavolombelona avy amina zatovo Haitiana. ||| This echoes a post by Frantz Duval published by Espas Ayisien, entitled "We are oblivious that children suffer too", in which testimonies of Haitian teenagers are compiled.
Ireo lahatsoratra roa ireo dia samy mampahafantatra antsika momba ireo famantarana voalohany an'ilay horohorontany mahery vaika. ||| Both posts inform us about the first signs of the massive earthquake.
Araka ireo tenin'i Krizkadiak: ||| In the words of Krizkadiak:
Tsaroanay nihovitrovitra ny tany, nefa tsy nahataitra anay izany, satria samy mbola tsy nandalo izany mihitsy izahay tany aloha tany, ka notohizanay ny dianay. ||| We felt the ground shaking, but we didn't pay attention, because none of us had experienced that before, so we continued walking.
Nefa nihamafimafy kokoa izany ary renay ilay mpampianatra PE nikiakiaka taminay mba hitsilanesanay amin'ny tany. ||| but then it started shaking a lot more and we could hear the PE teacher screaming for us to lay on the ground.
Izany zava-niainana izany dia namafisin'i Nathalie, 15 taona, tanisaina ao amin'ny lahatsoratr'i Espas Ayisien's: ||| This experience is echoed by 15 year-old Nathalie quoted in Espas Ayisien's post:
Tany am-pianarana dihy tany amin'i Joëlle Donatien Belot izahay, ao amin'ny efitra ambany rihana, raha nahare hovitrovitra mafy be. ||| We were at a dance class at Joëlle Donatien Belot's in the room downstairs, when we felt a strong vibration.
Nefa tsy nisy natahotra izahay. ||| But no one got worried.
Ny nivoahanay tao no ela dia nihovitrovitra indray. ||| We had hardly had enough time to rush out, when there was another shake.
Samy manasongadina ny tsy fahampian'ny fiomanana hiatrehana horohorontany mafy toy izao ireo fijoroana vavolombelona nataon'ireo ankizivavy roa ireo, nefa koa mizara lohahevitra iraisana, dia ny faniriana hifandray amin'ny fianakaviana - indrindra amin'ny rainy avy izy ireo. ||| Both girls' testimonies highlight the lack of preparedness for an earthquake of this magnitude, but they also share a common theme, which is the need to connect with family - especially their fathers.
Avy eo dia nitsangana daholo ny rehetra niolomay handray ny findainy avy ary niezaka ny niantso ireo havany akaiky... Niezaka ny niantso ny dadako aho; nefa ny zavatra hany henoko dia ny « bip bip » faheno rehefa mbola sahirana ny tambajotra. ||| Then everyone got up and ran to go get their phones and try to call their parents... I tried to call my dad; the only thing i could hear was the « beep beep » it does when it's busy.
Tapaka avy eo...Nanahy mafy ny momba azy aho. ||| and disconnected.. I got extremely worried about him.
Nitsahatra ny tahotro raha vao tonga naka ahy ny dadako. ||| I stopped being afraid when my father came to pick me up.
Teny feno fahendrena no zarain'ireto zatovo izay miaiky fa tsara vintana ry zareo. ||| Words of wisdom are shared by these teenagers who acknowledge that they have been lucky.
Ity ny nambaran'i Nathalie: ||| Here is Nathalie's statement:
Amin'izao rehefa mieritreritra momba ireny rehetra ireny aho, momba ny sekoliko, Institution du Sacré-Coeur izay nirodana, dia miaiky fa mbola tsara vintana izahay. ||| Now when I think about all this, about my school, Institution du Sacré-Coeur which collapsed, I think to myself that we have been lucky.
Tao amin'iny lahatsoratra iny ihany, taorian'ireo zava-nisy nolalovany teny an-dàlany mody, manohy izy: ||| In the same post, after witnessing scenes of horror on her way back home, she continues:
Nahita ny fianarako nirodana teo anoloako aho. ||| I saw my school fall in front of me.
Nahita ireo olona nihazakazaka tao anatin'ny vovoka aho, naheno fa nirodana ny tranon'izy ireo... ary indraindray dia mbola nisy olona tao anatiny. ||| I saw people running covered in dust, hearing that their houses fell... sometimes with people in them.
Nahita tobi-na mpitsoa-ponenana aho, tahaka ireny fahita amin'ny fahitalavitra ireny... olona mivavaka, olona velona nefa toa tsy ao tsara... ||| I saw a refugee camp, as they are on tv... people praying, people alive but not really...
Nahita zazakely maty tapaka aho, mifono anatina "bande"... ||| I saw a baby half dead, covered in bandaids...
Nahita olona efa ho 150 tao anatina trano lay kely telo aho... ary an'arivony maro amin'ny tany eny ivelany. ||| I saw almost 150 people in three little tents... and thousands on the ground outside.
Nahita ny namako iray tany amin'ny fàsana aho nandevina ny "cousin" keliny. ||| I saw a friend at the cemetery burying his little cousin.
Nahita ny tranon'i Jacmel vakoky ny ela sy tsara indrindra lasa toy ny tsinontsinona aho. ||| I saw the oldest and prettiest houses of Jacmel reduced to nothing.
Nahita ireny fiara fitaterana entana ireny (pickup) feno faty marobe aho... ||| I saw pickup truck filled with corpses...
Nahita ny mpampianatra ahy nizotra ho any am-pàsana taorianan'ny fiara nitondra ny vatana mangatsiakan'ny vadiny aho... ||| I saw my teacher walking to the cemetery behind the car where his wife's dead body was...
Nahita ankizy mpianatra ao amin'ny sekoliko, olona FANTATRO, tao amin'ilay tobi-na mpitsoa-ponenana aho.... ||| I saw kids from my school, people I KNOW, at the refugee camp....
Nony tafaverina tany amoron-dranomasina izahay, nisy tritra be ny hotelin'ilay mpiray vodirindrina amiko, mbola tsy tamin'ny toerany ny ranomasina, tsy dia nisy fahasimbana loatra ny tranoko, nisy tavoahangy sy fitaratra vaky tamin'ny tany, fa tsy dia nisy tena goavana be... ||| When we got back to the beach, my neighbor's hotel had huge crack all over it, the sea was still not at it's place, my house didnt have much damage, there were broken bottles and glasses on the floor, but nothing very important...
Na izany aza, ireny fijoroana vavolombelona ireny dia tsy afaka manafina fa nisy tanora hafa koa voadonan'iny horohorontany iny. ||| However, these testimonies cannot hide the fact that other teenagers have also been affected by the earthquake.
Tao amin'ny lahatsoratr'i Espas Ayisien, nahazo vaovao momba an'i Fanorah 16 taona izahay, izay tsy niaina nivantana ilay horohorontany, nefa nahita ny fiainany nivadika ho nofy ratsy ny ampitson'iny: ||| In Espas Ayisien 's post, we learn about 16 year-old Fanorah who did not experience the tremors herself, but saw her life turning into a nightmare on the following day:
Tsy nisy zavatra takatro mihitsy tamin'iny resaka horohorontany iny satria Pétion-Ville sy Delmas ambony dia tsy dia voadona be loatra. ||| I couldn't understand anything about this earthquake since Pétion-Ville and the top of Delmas had not been significantly hit.
Farafahabetsany, hoy izy, dia ny fitohanan'ny fifamoivoizana sy harivako voasembantsembana. ||| It was at the most, the cause for huge traffic jam and a spoilt evening, she said.
Ny ampitson'iny vao fantany ny tena nahatsiravina, rehefa nanomboka ny fanisàna ireo maty. ||| She only discovered the horror of the situation, the next day, when the casualty toll begins.
Ny reny mpiantoka azy, telo tamin'ireo namany ary olom-pantany maro no maty. ||| Her godmother, three of her friends and many people she knew, died.
"Tsy azoko izany, mbola tsy azoko foana ny zava-nitranga", izany no avaliny isaky ny anontaniana momba io horohorontany tamin'ny 12 Janoary io izy. ||| "I don't understand it, I still don't understand what happened" is her answer every time she is asked a question concerning January 12th earthquake.
Tao amin'ny lahatsorany manaraka mitondra ny lohateny hoe "tsy nofy izao... atreho: zava-misy marina io Krizkadiak dia manazava ny nahatonga iny tranga mahatsiravina iny ho nanova ny fomba fijerin'izy ireo momba ny olan'ny zatovo amin'ny andavan'andro, izay toa endrika ivelany fotsiny ihany sisa: ||| In her following post entitled "it's not a dream... face it: it's real Krizkadiak explains how this horrible event has altered their perspective about everyday teenaged concerns, which now seem so superficial:
Tsy nisy dikany mihitsy izany fety izany, akanjo tsara, ny fanaovana tantara be momba ny volonao, fiara "blindé" goavana sy lafo vidy, fialan-tsasatra any amoron-dranomasin'i Miami, ny fananana bika tsara, volo tsara... tsapanao fa "BULLSHIT" ireny; tsy mitondra na aiza na aiza, adalàna sy fandaniam-potoana misavovona be TSY MISY ILANA AZY ! ||| partying never mattered, fancy clothes, making a big deal about how your hair is done, huge and expensive armored cars, summers at the beach in Miami, having a beautiful body, nice hair... you realize all this was BULLSHIT; that all this was going nowhere, a big nasty pile of POINTLESS time-wasting crap!
Ankehitriny tsy maintsy mihiratra ny masonao ka miatrika ny zava-misy miaraka amin'ny antsipiriany rehetra ary mitady fomba hamintinana ireo taona rehetra nitomboana ao anatin'ireo 35 segondra ireo, izay nanova ny zava-drehetra ||| Now you have to open up your eyes and face reality with all it's details and find a way to compress years of growing up into these 35 seconds, that changed everything
Miresaka momba ny fitiavana ny fianakaviana sy ny fanomezana azony amin'ny maha-velon'aina azy izy: ||| She also talks about cherishing family and the gift of being alive:
Tsy afaka mieritreritra tahaka ny taloha intsony ianao, tsy ireo maha-maika anao taloha intsony no maha-maika anao amin'izao... Izao dia fantatrao ireo tena zava-dehibe amin'ny fiainana... ny fitiavana ny rahalahinao mihoatra noho ny zava-drehetra, ny fananana ireo olona tianao eo akaikinao... na ny fahafahana mivelona fotsiny, ny fahafahana mihinan-kanina, matory,... ary izay ihany. ||| You can't think the same way you used to, you're not allowed to have the same priorities as you did before... Now you know what really counts in life... loving your brother more than anything, having the people you care about close to you... or simply being alive, being able to eat, sleep,... nothing else.
Ireny fahatsiarovan-tena sy fahatsapàna ireny dia namorona tahotra vaovao sy fanahiana mavesatra kokoa ho ana 16 taona iray: ||| These awareness and sensiblity make new fears and doubts even more tangible for a 16 year-old:
Ny fanahiana ny amin'izay mety ho ampitso, ny fahatsapàna ny tany mihovitrovitra amin'ny fotoana tsy voafaritra (hamoha anao mihitsy izany hovitrovitra izany indraindray), ny fahenoana momba ireo olona maty isan'andro,... ireo banky mihidy, ireo sekoly koa... Mahalasa adala, sa tsy izany?! ||| to have doubts on how tomorrow's going be, to feel the ground shaking at anytime (the shaking even woke you up once), to hear about dead people everyday,... banks that are closed, schools also... This is driving you crazy right?!
Lasa saro-tahotra ianao, tsy mahavita mandeha irery anaty haizina, mitomany amin'ny tsy antony. ||| You're becoming paranoid, you can't go in the dark alone, you cry for no reasons.
Ireo fanehoan-kevitra ao amin'ireo lahatsoratr'i Krizkadiak dia maneho ny vaikan'ny fiantraikan'ireo fijoroana vavolombelona nataony tamin'ireo mpamaky any ivelan'i Haiti, any amin'ireo firenena toa an'i Italy, Ghana ary Caraibes, raha tsy hitanisa afa-tsy ireo. ||| Comments on Krizkadiak's posts show the great impact her testimonies have had on readers outside of Haiti, in countries like Italy, Ghana and the Caribbean, to name a few.
Ireto ireo izay tena misongadina: ||| Here are some of the most telling:
Hotahiana anie ianao sy ny fianakavianao, Yael. ||| Bless you and your family, Yael.
Mankany aminao sy Haiti ireo vavaka ataoko. ||| My prayers are with you and with Haiti.
Raha te-hahazo fanampim-baovao momba ny andavanandron'ireo vahoaka Haitiana avy amin'ny mason'olona 16 taona ianao dia afaka manaraka ilay mpitoraka blaogy Krizkadiak koa ao amin'ny Twitter. ||| If you want to know more about the Haitian people's day-to-day reality through 16 year-old eyes, you can also follow blogger Krizkadiak on Twitter.
Ato ny Pejy Fitateram-baovaon'ny Global Voices momba ilay horohorontany tany Haiti. ||| Global Voices' Special Coverage Page on the earthquake in Haiti is here.
Sénégal: Herinandro Mety Hampidi-doza Indrindra ||| Senegal: A Week of Living Dangerously
Fanamarihana: Nampitainà mpamaham-bolongana taty aminay nialoha ny toe-draharaha mampahonena tamin'ny 31 janoary, izay hanaovana hafatra hafa ihany koa, ity hafatra ity. ||| Note: This post was written by our author in Senegal before the dramatic events of January 31, 2012, which will be adressed in a follow-up article.
Hidina an-dalambe ho fanoherana ny firotsahan'ny filoha Wade hofidiana fanintelony ny mpanohitra ao Senegaly amin'ny 31 janoary. ||| On January 31, 2012, in Senegal, the opposition will take to the streets to protest a third term for incumbent President Wade.
Namoaka didy ny lisitry ny kandidà filoham-pirenena hotontosaina amin'ny 26 febroary ho avy izao ny Fitsaran-Dalampanorenana tamin'ny 27 janoary lasa teo. ||| On January 27, the Constitutional Council of Senegal decided on the final list of candidates for the presidential elections on 26 February.
Nanaiky ny firotsahan'i Abdoulaye Wade, izay hirotsaka fanintelony heverin'ny Senegaley maro ho mifanohitra amin'ny Lalampanorenana ny "Loholona" dimy ary nandà ny firotsahan'ilay mpihira Youssou N'Dour, nolazaina fa tsy ampy ny sonia hahafahany mirotsaka hofidiana. ||| The five elders on the council have accepted the nomination of Abdoulaye Wade, who is seeking a third term, an action considered unconstitutional by many Senegalese voters. Furthermore, the council denied the candidacy of the singer Youssou N'Dour, on the pretext that he would not have collected enough signatures to support his candidacy.
Vao nivoaka ny didy, tamin'ny 27 janoary lasa teo, dia nidina an-dalambe ary matetika nahery fihetsika ho fanehoany ny fahatezerany. ||| Since the announcement of these decisions on January 27, protesters have taken to the streets and sometimes violently expressed their anger.
Nanaovan'ny olona angaredona ny polisy iray tamin'ny Asabotsy hariva. ||| One policeman was lynched by the crowd on Saturday night.
Lasa nalaza ny lahatsary tamin'ny aterineto. ||| A video of the incident has gone viral on the Internet:
Avy eo ny 30 janoary, olona roa no maty voatifitra nandritra ny fihetsiketsehana tany an-tanànan'i Podor. ||| On January 30, two citizens were shot dead during protests in the northern city of Podor.
Henjana ny toe-draharaha manerana ny firenena sy ato amin'ny aterineto. ||| The situation is tense across the country and also online.
Tena ho fambara ratsy amin'ny famoriam-bahoaka hotontosaina amin'ny 31 janoary. ||| None of this bodes well for the big rally on January 31.
Na dia miantso hanao fihetsiketsehana milamina sy tsy hampiasa herisetra aza ny mpikambana maro ao amin'ny antoko mpanohitra sy ny hetsika Mouvement du 23 juin (M23), dia ahoana tokoa ny fihoaram-pefy rehefa jerena izay mitranga amin'ny aterineto. ||| Although several members of the opposition movement, the Movement June 23 (M23), have called for peaceful and non-violent demonstrations, the excesses clearly give cause for grave concern, according to the conversation online.
Ao amin'ny vohikalan'ny M23, dia misy ny fandrisihana hatramin'ny fikendrena ny havana sy olona akaiky an'i Wade, indrindra i Farba Senghor, mpanolo-tsaina fanta-dazan'i Wade. ||| The web site of the M23 went so far as to target people close to Wade, notably Farba Senghor, a consultant well known to Wade.
Ao amin'ny pejy Facebook-n'ny Hetsika,aza dia tadiavina izay misy ny tranony hamaizana azy araka ny fijery. ||| On the Movement's Facebook page, they even posted an appeal for Senghor's address to be revealed, it seems, in order to carry out reprisals.
Raha fantatrao ny fonenan'ireto olona manaraka ireto, ampitao azafady... hapetratsika amin'ny google map ny adiresin'izy ireo amin'ny Andro iray, ho fantatra tsara ny kinendry. ||| If you know the addresses of the residences of the following, please contact us... we are going to spread their address widely on google map for the D-Day, the targets will be identified with precision.
Misy aza moa ny mampiasa googlemap mba hahitana ara-jeografika ny fonenany. ||| Some even used to Google maps to locate his residence:
Fa ny mpanohana kosa, ahitana fankahalana ny hafatra ||| But Wade's supporters themselves employ a tone tinged with hatred
Senegaley, ho fiarovana an'i Selegaly tsy ho tratry ny korontana araka ny fambaran'ny M23 sy ny mpanodikodin-doha miafin'ny pelaka amerikana sy frantsay, mivonòna hiaro ny Repoblika amin'ny vondron'ny ratsy, amin'ny fomba manara-dalàna rehetra. ||| Senegalese people, to protect Senegal from the chaos suggested by the M23 and its manipulators lurking in the shadows of Americans and French homosexuals, be ready to defend the Republic against the axis of evil, using all legal means.
Ho henjana ny raharaha amin'ny 31 janoary 2012. Efa mikorataba ny aterineto. ||| January 31 will be a highly tense day; the net is already in uproar
Raha tokony handefa ny tafika manokana hamaha ny olana any Casamance i Wade, dia ny hivonona hidaroka ny mponina no nampanaoviny azy... Ary mpamono olona matihanina ireo, nozarin'ny kômandô Isiraeliana. ||| Instead of sending Special Forces to address the problem in Casamance, Wade puts them on alert to quell the population... these people are professional killers, led by Israeli commandos.
Raha vao mahita izahay fa mamono Seengaley iray monja izy dia ny any amin'ny fiarovana ny fianakaviany avy hatrany no tafihanay...teboka midina andalana... atao ny fomba rehetra handoroana ny tranony sy hanapoizinana cyanure ny zanany... ho an'izay mandre. ||| If we identify even one who kills a single Senegalese, there will be direct reprisals on his family... period... by all means necessary, from setting his house on fire or poisoning his children with cyanide... don't say that you were not warned.
Bolgaria: Adihevitra momba ny Islamo ||| Bulgaria: A Debate on Islam
Nisy olona 40 nanatrika adihevitra mitondra ny lohateny hoe "Islamo heverina ho mampatahotra - lamaody indray ve?" izay notontosaina tao amin'ny "Trano mena" Ivo ho an'ny kolontsaina sy ny adihevitra tao an-drenivohitr'i Bolgaria, Sofia tamin'ny 26 febroary teo. ||| On Feb. 26, some 40 people attended a debate titled "Islam as a threat - again in fashion"?, held at the Center for Culture and Debate "Red House" in the capital of Bulgaria, Sofia.
Anisan'ny mpandray anajra fitenenana tamin'izany i Saleh Breh, mpahay haisaina (psychologue) ao amin'ny anjerimanontolon'i Damasy, Vladimir Chukov, manampahaizana manokana momba ny Islam, ary i Nidal Hlayf, mpianatra amin'ny fitantanana lahatsary. ||| Speakers included Saleh Breh, a psychologist at the University of Damascus, Vladimir Chukov, a specialist in Islam, and Nidal Hlayf, a student in film directing.
Manodidina ny 1 tapitrisa ny Miozolomana monina any Bolgaria (izay manana mponina 8 tapitrisa). ||| Approximately 1 million Muslims live in Bulgaria (whose total population is about 8 million people).
Maro amin'ny mponina no manana hevitra momba ny Islam, satria efa an-taonjatony no nisy miozolomana tany amin'ity firenena ity. ||| Many people have an idea about Islam, because there has been a Muslim population in the country for centuries.
Saingy misy ny antoko politika izay miteraka olana eo amin'ny Kristiana sy ny Miozolomana: Mihamatanjaka sy mihasahisahy manko ny nasionalisma tao anatin'ny taona vitsivitsy izay, ary maro amin'ny mponina no mihevitra fa mampididoza ity Islamo ity. ||| But there are political parties that create problems between Christians and Muslims: in recent years nationalism has become stronger and more aggressive, and some people believe that Islam is dangerous.
Izay no mahazava-dehibe ho an'ny fiaraha-monina ny adihevitra tahaka izay notontosaina tany Sofia itony. ||| This is why a debate like the one that took place in Sofia is important for the society.
Itony manko no fanararaotra raha mety hampidi-doza ho an'i Eoropa tokoa ny Islam. ||| Its purpose was to discuss whether Islam presents a danger for Europe.
Anisan'ny nanatrika tamin'ity adihevitra ity ihany koa ny mpikambana ao amin'ny Antoko Hetsika Nasionaly Boligara ; Nilaza moa ny BNM, fa mampidi-doza ny Islam sady fitaovana entina miaro ny tombotsoa Tiorka. ||| Among others, members of the nationalist Bulgarian National Movement party attended the debate; according to BNM, Islam is dangerous and is an instrument of Turkish interests.
Ato misy rohy avy amin'ny lahatsoratr'i Vladimir Chukov momba ny "Maodelim-poko Boligara." ||| Here is a link to Vladimir Chukov's article on the "Bulgarian Ethnic Model".
Ao amin'ny adihevitra hita ao amin'ny Muslims and American Cinema, no hamahanam-bolongana amin'ny fiteny Boligara ny endrika ametrahana izany hoe Miozolomana izany amin'ny sarimihetsika, notarihin'i Hlayf Nidal, izay nanoratra these ahazoana mari-pahaizana dokotôrà amin'ny fitantanana sarimihetsika ao Sofia io. ||| A post on the debate appeared on Muslims and American Cinema, a Bulgarian-language blog on stereotypical portrayal of Muslims in the movies, administered by Hlayf Nidal, who has written a doctoral thesis in film directing in Sofia.

Saiky Boligara avokoa ny ankamaroan'ny mpanatrika, misy ny antitra fa maro ihany koa ny tanora ||| The audience consisted mainly of Bulgarian citizens, some elderly, but there were also many young people
Nasongadin'ny Profesora Chukov fa misy karazany roa ny lalam-pifindra-monina - ny Anglo-Saxon somary malaladalaka kokoa amin'ny fomba fijeriny, sy ny Frantsay - izay somary mihenjakenjana kokoa manoloana ireo sokajin'olona vitsy an'isa na minorités. ||| Professor Chukov outlined the two main types of immigration patterns - Anglo-Saxon, which is more liberal in its view, and French - more restrictive towards minorities.
Ny tena nahatalanjona anay dia ny nahitana fa mamela ny hananganana antoko miozolomana ny any Danimarka (jereo izany lahatsoratra momba izany ao amin'ny bolongana Islam in Europe). ||| To our general surprise, it appeared that Denmark has already allowed the creation of a Muslim party (see this post at Islam in Europe blog).
Nadikan'i Ruslan namelabelatra tetikasa misy ny ny lisitry ny bolongana any amin'ny tontolo Arabo sy Islamika manerantany, izay miaty ny vaovaon'ny fandrarana mila resahina tahaka ny fitsarana ireo mpanohitra politika any Ejipta (jereo ny lahatsoratry ny GV raha te-hahalala bebe kokoa), mpamaham-bolongana ampidirina amponja (ohatra ny fanentanana ny fitakiana nanafahana an'i Kareem (Free Kareem) sy Bashir El Hazem (Free Bashir El Hazem), bolongan'ny vehivavy avy amin'ny faritra "proche orient" izay mitolona mba hahazoana zo bebe kokoa. ||| Ruslan Trad presented a slide project with a list of blogs in the Arab and Islamic world, which contained information on the ban to cover events such as prosecution of political opponents in Egypt (see this GV post for more), imprisoned bloggers (e.g., Free Kareem and Free Bashir El Hazem campaigns), blogs of women from the Middle East who are fighting for more rights.
Ny tanjona ao anatin'izany dia ny entina hampisehoana amin'ny olona fa tsy tontolo tsy miova (na tsy mivoatra) tsy akory ny tontolo arabo, fa liana ihany koa amin'izay mitranga ao aminy sy mitranga manerana izao tontolo izao, indrindra moa fa avy amin'ireo taranaka vaovao. ||| The aim was to show the public that the Islamic world is not some inert mass, but is concerned about what happens to it and to the world, especially with regard to the younger generation.
Miresaka momba ny fahazaran-dratsy (stereotypes) hita amin'ny sarimihetsika indray i Nidal Hlayf. ||| Nidal Hlayf talked about stereotypes in movies.
Efa lalimpaka loatra ny (fampanazarana) ny fifanoherana ny tontolo arabo amin'ny tontolo tandrefana ka sarotra ny manala ireo fahazaran-dratsy ireo. ||| (The practice) of juxtaposing the Islamic world against the West is so rooted that it is difficult to go beyond stereotypes.
Momba ny adihevitra hoe nahoana moa no tsy miova mihitsy ny fijerin'ny olona ny miozolomana sy ny Arabo. ||| A debate on why the image of Arabs and Muslims is so stable.
Voalohany, mbola maharary dia maharary ny ratra nampifanditra ny tandrefana sy ny Islam, na ara-kolontsaina na ara-miaramila; faharoa, mbola taranaky ny Eoropeana voanjo (mpanjanaka) ihany no fijerin'ny tatsinanana an'i Etazonia; fahatelo, hatramin'ny faran'ny taonjato faha-19 dia nitombo dia nitombo ny asa misionera tany amin'ny tontolo arabo. ||| First, because of the still painful memories of the past clashes with Islam in the West, military or cultural; second, because the United States inherited the Orientalist imagination of the European settlers; third, since the end of the 19th century, American missionary activity in the Islamic world has increased.
Dr. Saleh Brik avy amin'ny Anjerimanontolon'i Damasy no miresaka ny fahasarotana hanaiky fivavahana "Hafa" noho ny tsy fahalalana azy io. ||| Dr. Saleh Brik from the University of Damascus talked about the difficulty accepting the "Other" religion due to ignorance of it.
(Ohatra iray amin'izany ny fandraran'i Soisa ny fananganana minarets): tsy ny minarets no tena zava-dehibe indrindra amin'ny fivavahana ho an'ny Miozolomana ary tsy io no olana fototra amin'ny fiaraha-monina Miozolomana. ||| (An example of the Swiss ban on construction of minarets): the minarets are not the most important part of religion to a Muslim and they are not the main problem with Muslim communities.
Maya Tsenova, mpahay resaka Arabo ao amin'ny Ivotoerana ho an'ny teny sy kolontsaina tatsinanana, nanampy fa "matahotra ny zavatra tsy fantany ny olona" sy ny hoe "Efa tafahoana imbetsaka tamin'ny Miozolomana ny tandrefana mialoha ny nihaonany tamin'ny Islamo." ||| Maya Tsenova, an Arabist from Center for Eastern Languages and Cultures, added that "one is afraid of what one does not know" and that "the West had had encounters with Muslims before it met with Islam".
Ny lehilahy tsy mahalala an inoa na inona no fahavalontsika sy ny hafa, hoy ny lazain'ny ohabolana Arabo. ||| A man who is ignorant is the enemy of ourselves and others, as one Arab proverb says.
