Miezaka Ny Hiditra Indray Ao Shina Ve Ny Facebook? ||| Is Facebook Trying to Re-enter China?
Niverina avy any Shina ny Tale Jeneralin'ny Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg. ||| Facebook's CEO Mark Zuckerberg has come back to China.
Maro ireo mpanao gazety tany an-toerana sy ireo mpiondana aterineto no nahatsikaritra azy sy ny sipany, Priscilla Chan, tao Shanghai tamin'ny Talata lasa teo, 27 Martsa, ary indray mandeha indray, niparitaka toy ny afo ny honohono tany anaty aterineto: Mikarakara ny hiverenany indray ao Shina ve ilay mpanjakan'ny tambajotra sosialy? ||| Several local journalists and netizens spotted him and his girlfriend, Priscilla Chan, in Shanghai last Tuesday, March 27, and once more, rumors spread like fire through the Internet: Is the king of social media working on its reappearance in China?
Na dia nolazain'i Zuckerberg fa fitsangantsanganana fialantsasatra fotsiny aza iny, dia tsy matoky loatra an'izany ireo mpiondana aterineto ao Shina sy erak'izao tontolo izao. ||| Although Zuckerberg alleged it was just a vacation trip, netizens in China and worldwide have their doubts.
Tamin'ity tolakandro ity, tsikaritry ny sasany tamin'ireo paparazzi Shinoa ny Tale Jeneralin'ny Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg sy ilay Shinoa vavy fofombadiny, tao Shanghai, araka izany dia niverina indray taty Shina i Mark Zuckerberg! ||| This afternoon, some Chinese paparazzi spotted Facebook's CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his Chinese fiancée in Shanghai, so Mark Zuckerberg has came back to China again!
Fitsangantsanganana miala sasatra sa fitsidihana noho ny fandraharahana? ||| Holiday tour or business trip?
Raha ny honohono ao an-toerana, Mark Zuckerberg sy ny tale jeneralin'ny Apple,Tim Cook (ieee! aty Shina koa i Cook!) dia niara-dàlana tanaty sidina manokana tamin'ny dian-dry zareo ho aty Shina. ||| According to inside rumor, Mark Zuckerberg and Apple CEO Tim Cook (yeah! Cook is also in China!) have flown together with a private jet on their trip to China.
Ny fidirana amin'ny Facebook dia voarara ao Shina hatramin'ny tapaky ny taona 2009, rehefa nanao ny tsoa-keviny ireo manampahefan'ity firenena ity fa hoe ireo olona nandray anjara tamin'ny korontana niseho tany amin'ny faritany andrefan'i Xinjiang dia nanmpiasa ny tambajotra sosialy handrindràna ny hetsi-panoherany. ||| Access to Facebook has been banned in China since mid-2009, when the country's authorities concluded that people participating in the riots that took place in the western province of Xinjiang had used the social network to organize the protests.
Tamin'ny Febroary anefa, Facebook dia nampahafantatra fa mijery ny fomba hahafahany misokatra indray any Shina izy, ilay tsena midadasika indrindra eran-tany ho an'ny Aterineto, ary ankehitriny i Zuckerberg dia nitsidika ny firenena tamin'ny "fialantsasatra" ofisialy. ||| In February, however, Facebook revealed it was studying the possibility of re-opening in China, the world's largest Internet market, and now Zuckerberg has visited the country officially "on vacation".
Ny bilaogy hafa, toy ny Shangaiist, Ministry of Tofu sy TechNode, dia niresaka ihany koa ny fitsidihan'i Zuckerberg. ||| Other blogs, like Shangaiist, Ministry of Tofu and TechNode, have also discussed Zuckerberg's visit.
Tena mahaliana tokoa izany. ||| This is really interesting.
Ny goavana roalahy, misol tena ireo orinasa matanjaky ny teknolojia eto an-tany. ||| Two great guys, representing two hottest tech companies of the world.
Izy mitsamy samy mitsidika an'i Shina amin'ny fotoana iray mitovy. ||| Both visit China at the same time.
Ny iray ao Beijing, ny iray ao Shanghai; Ny iray ho amin'ny fandraharahàna, ny iray hiala sasatra; Ny iray vao sambany no teto Shina, ny iray hafa efa fivahinianany fanindroany ary mba mahatakatra kely ny teny Shinoa ihany; Ny iray nampiroborobo ny fandraharahàny teto Shina tamin'ny hafainganam-pandeha tsy hay faritana, ny iray hafa efa nahazo ny fon'ireo mpampiasa ny habaka aterineto eran-tany saingy tsy mbola azo idirana foana aty Shina. ||| One in Beijing, the other in Shanghai; One for business, the other is for vacation; One is the first time in China, the other is at his second trip and even understands a bit of Chinese; One is growing its business amazingly fast in China, the other has almost conquered the entire cyber world but is still not available in China.
Nefa ilokàko fa teny fanalahidy iray no mameno ny lohan'ireo amin'izao fotoana, dia ny hoe: Shina, Shina! ||| But I bet there is only one keyword in their mind right now, which is: China, China!
Ny Alarobia, Liu Kun, mpitantana ny PopCap Games ao Shina, dia nitny tao amin'ny tambajotra sosialy Shinoa, Sina Weibo, fa hoe nahita an'i Zuckerberg tao Beijing sy ny asa nataony izy izay tsy misy ieritreretana mihitsy hoe resaka fialan-tsasatra ||| On Wednesday, Liu Kun, PopCap Games manager in China, said on Chinese social network Sina Weibo that he had spotted Zuckerberg in Beijing and his activities there did not make think of vacations:
Ny fitsidihana farany nataon'i Zuckerberg tao Shina dia efa tany amin'ny Desambra 2010 ary mbola nolazaina ihany koa fa nanao fialantsasatra, na dia nanao fihaonana maro tamin'ireo orinasa Shinoa misahana Aterineto aza izy, toy ny Baidu, sy Alibaba. ||| Zuckerberg's last visit to China took place in December 2010 and was also billed as a vacation trip, despite that he paid several visits to top Chinese Internet companies such as Baidu, Sina and Alibaba.
Ny mety ho fahafahana mahita indray ny famahàna ny fidirana amin'ny Facebook dia nampitsiry ny fanantenana ho an'ireo izay maniry ny hahita fiovàna ara-tsosialy sy ara-politika eto amin'ity goavana aty Azia ity. ||| The possibility of seeing Facebook unblocked has boosted the hopes of those who want to see social and political change in the Asian giant.
Misy hevitra miparitaka be fa hoe ny media sosialy -na izany ao an-toerana, na manerana izao tontolo izao- dia afaka manome hery ny vahoaka Shinoa, fahefana izay nolavin'ny Antoko Kaominista Shinoa tsy homena azy ireo. ||| There is a widely held idea that social media–both local and global–can give the Chinese people the power that the Chinese Communist Party denies them.
Ny media sosialy ao an-toerana dia efa manao fanamby sahady amin'ny fanarahamaso ny vaovao ampiharin'ny governemanta ary maro ireo Shinoa mpiondana aterineto no maika hiditra amin'ireo tambajotra sosialy maneran-tany. ||| Local social media are already challenging the government's controls on information, and many Chinese netizens are eager to access global social networks.
i Zuckerberg izy tenany no nilaza fa Facebook dia afaka ny ho singa mitondra fiovàna ao Shina, tahaka izay nisy tany Ejipta sy Tonizia. ||| Zuckerberg himself has stated that Facebook can be an agent of change in China, like it has been in Egypt or Tunisia.
Alec Ross, Sekreteram-panjakana Amerikana Lehiben'ny mpanolotsaina momba ny Fanovàna, dianiteny mikasika an'i Shina tao amin'ny Anjerimanontolon'i Hong Kong tamin'ny 19 Martsa. ||| Alec Ross, US Secretary of State Senior Advisor for Innovation, spoke about China at a speech at the University of Hong Kong on March 19.
Rehefa nanontanian'ny mpianatra iray mikasika ny fangatahan'ireo Shinoa mpiondana aterineto ny mba hanosehan'ny governemanta Amerikana ny manampahefana Shinoa hampiato ny sivana sy ny teritery, namaly i Ross tamin'ny fomba tena diplaomatika fa ny tantara dia mampiseho fa ny fiovana ao Shina dia avy amin'ireo olom-pirenena ihany no miainga ary afaka manampy betsaka amin'izany ny tambajotra sosialy. ||| When asked by a student about Chinese netizens' demands for the US government to push Chinese authorities away from censorship and repression, Ross replied with the perfectly diplomatic answer that history shows that change in China can only come from its own citizens and social networks can be of great help.
Ny fifanakalozan-dresaka nateraky ny fitsidihan'i Zuckerberg tao Shina dia tsy nifantoka fotsiny tamin'ny Indostrian'ny Aterineto fa koa tamin'ny resaka sivana, fahalalahana maneho hevitra sy ny fanantenana-na tsia- hahita ny Facebook ho afa-patorana. ||| Online discussions sparked by Zuckerberg's visit to China focus not only on the Internet industry but also on censorship, freedom of expression and the hope–or not–of seeing Facebook unblocked.
William Moss, avy amin'ilay bilaogy iray ifanotronana, Rectified.name, dia naka sary an-tsaina ny mety ho endri-dalao sy izay mpandray anjara manodidina ny ho fiverenan'i Facebook indray ao Shina, ary namorona tabilao iray izay anehoany fa ny firesahana ny Facebook sy Shina dia midika ho firesahana politika sy fahalalahana maneho hevitra: ||| William Moss, of the new collective blog Rectified.name, imagines possible scenarios and players around Facebook re-entering China, and designed a table where he demonstrates that talking about Facebook and China means talking about politics and freedom of expression:
Ny lalan-jotran-kevitra tokony ho izy dia hoe mba hananana vintana hisokatra eto indray, Facebook dia tokony hampihatra ny politikan'ny sivana efa napetraka ho an'ireo tena mpanjifa ny tolotra fototra omeny ao Shina fotsiny na ho an'ireo tolotra fanampiny ankoatra ilay tolotra fototra. ||| The basic math is that to even have a chance of operating here Facebook would have to apply the mandated censorship policies either just to users of its core service in China or to a spinoff service that is kept separate from the core service.
Tokony koa izy ho efa vonona hanome n y mombamomba ireo Shinoa mpampiasa azy raha takian'ny manampahefana ny amin'izany. ||| It would also have to be prepared to surrender Chinese user information to the authorities if requested.
Ary tolorana fisaorana ireo Shinoa rehetra mpampiasa ny bilaogy kiritika avy ao amin'ny Sina Weibo izay naka ireo sary rehetra! ||| And thanks to all the Chinese micro-blog users from Sina Weibo who have captured all the snaps!
Tsy maintsy marihana ihany koa fa tsy afaka ny hampanaraka ny toetrandro ny mombamomba azy ao amin'ny Facebook i Zuckerberg mandritra ny fijanonany ao Shanghai, noho ny fisian'ny Great Firewall of China na ilay Rindrim-be ao Shina – raha tsy ohatra ka hoe mampiasa VPN izy. ||| It should be noted that Zuckerberg won't be able to update his Facebook account during his stay in Shanghai, thanks to the Great Firewall of China – unless he's using a VPN.
Na dia hoe voasakana azo ny Facebook, manodidina ny 450.000 ireo mpampiasa Aterineto ao Shina–araka ny filazan'ny socialbakers–no tafiditra amin'ilay tambajotra sosialy amin'ny fihoarana ilay rindrim-be amin'ny fampiasàna proxies, tonelina na rindrambaiko VPN, fomba iray izay tsy ato ho ato no ho foana, raha ho izany ||| Despite Facebook being blocked, almost 450,000 Internet users in China–according to socialbakers–access the social network by scaling the firewall with proxies, tunnels or VPN software, a practice not likely to change soon, if at all.

Mampiasa sarintany an-tserasera ny mpiaro ny zon'olombelona any Kambôdza hanangonana antontan-kevitra, hanaraha-maso ary hampisehoana ny fanitsakitsahana ny zon'olombelona manerana ny firenena. ||| Human rights advocates in Cambodia have been using online maps to document, monitor, and expose human rights violations across the country.

Azonao atao ny mikaroka amin'ny alalan'ny sokajy zon'olombelona, niharam-boina, heverina ho mpanitsakitsaka, tranga, toerana ary daty ||| You can search the violation section by human right, victim, alleged perpetrator, case status, location and date
Niakatra tokoa tao anatin'ny taona vitsivitsy izao ny adin-tany ary ny maro amin'izy ireo dia mifandraika amin'ny tetikasam-pampandrosoana mamindra toerana mponina an'hetsiny ||| Land conflicts have been rising in the past years and many of them are related to development projects which have displaced hundreds of thousands of residents
Araka ny fikarohana nataonay, 223 ny adin-tany voatatitra eny amin'ny seha-pajakana nandritra ny efa-taona hatramin'ny 2007...Ny faritany ahitana adintany be indrindra, araka ny hitanay, dia i Phnom Penh ahitana ny 10%-n'ny adintany ao amin'ny faritany ahitana ny renivohitra sy tanàna lehibe indrindra. ||| According to our research, 223 land disputes have been reported on in the public domain in the last 4 years since 2007...The province with the highest number of land conflicts, according to our findings, is Phnom Penh with 10% of total land conflicts occurring in the province containing the country's capital and largest city.
Efa namoaka lahatsoratra momba ny fampanofàna tany be velarana mampanontany tena any Kambodza ny gazety mivoaka isan'andro Weekend ||| The Cambodian Daily Weekend has published an article about the questionable land concessions in Cambodia
3.936.481 hekitara no nampindramina hanaovana fitrandrahana sy fambolena, izay mandrakotra ny 22 isan-jaton'ny velarantany Kambojiana ||| 3,936,481 hectares have been granted as mining and economic land concessions, covering 22 percent of Cambodia's surface area
1.900.311 hekitara nampindramina hotrandrahin'ny orinasa mpitrandraka harena ankibon'ny tany tahaka ny volamena, akoramby, varahina ary baoksita ||| 1,900,311 hectares have been granted as mining concessions to companies exploring for precious minerals such as gold, iron ore, copper and bauxite
2.036.170 hekitara nampindramina hanaovana fambolena ara-indostrialy tahaka ny fingotra, siramamy sy mangahazo, velarantany mahatratra ny 53 isan-jaton'ny tany azo ambolena any Kambodza ||| 2,036,170 hectares have been granted as land concessions for agro-industrial plantations for crops such as rubber, sugar and cassava, an area equivalent to 53 percent of Cambodia's arable land
346.000 hekitara amin'ny tany nampindramina dia ao anatin'ny faritra arovana tantanin'ny minisiteran'ny tontolo iainana. ||| 346,000 hectares of land concessions are located inside conservation areas administered by the Ministry of Environment.
Io velarantany io dia eo ho eo amin'ny 10%n'ny tany arovana ambany fitantanan'ny minisitera ||| This area represents about 10% of protected areas under the ministry's control

Bangladesh: Miverina ny Hartal ||| Bangladesh: Hartal Is Back
Fihetsiketsehana any Dhaka. ||| Protests in Dhaka.
Taorian'ny fitsaharana nandritry ny telo taona, niverina indray ny Hartal any Bangladesh, endrika iray fanao any µAzia Atsino rehefa manao fitokonana. ||| After three years of respite Hartal, a South Asian form of strike action is back in Bangladesh.
Ny fiombonamben'ny mpanohitra any Bangladesh dia niantso fanaovana hartal iray tamin'ny Alahady (27 Jona 2010) ho fanindriana ny fangatahan-dry zareo ahitana teboka 11 ka isan'izany ny famahana ny olan'ny filan'ny vahoaka, ny fanodikodinam-bola, ny fanaovana antsojay amin'ireo mpitarika nhy mpanohitra sy ny mpiasa sns. ||| Bangladesh's opposition alliance has called for a hartal on Sunday (27th of June, 2010) to press for its 11-point demand including solution of the utility crisis, tender manipulation, persecution of opposition leaders and workers etc.
Nafampana ny teo-draharaha raha ny fijerena ny harivan'ny andro nanaovana ny Hartal izay nisy tati-baovao milaza fandoroana fiaramadinika sy fitateram-bahoaka tany amin'ny faritra samihafa tao Dhaka renivohitra ka mpandefa maro no tratry ny fahamaizana lalina tamin'izany. ||| Things have heated up as on the eve of the Hartal day there are news reports of cars and buses being torched in different areas of the capital Dhaka with passengers suffering serious burns.
Nazmul Hasan Babu avy amin'ny blaogy Prothom Alo dia manolotra fanazavana vitsivitsy mikasika ny kolontsaina Hartal ao an-toerana: ||| Nazmul Hasan Babu at Prothom Alo blog provides some background of the Hartal culture in the country:
Ireo antoko politika ao Bangladesh dia mampiasa ny famaritana ny Hartal amin'ny fiteny Gujrati izay tsy mbola hita hatrizay na taiza na taiza manerana izao tontolo izay. ||| The political parties of Bangladesh are using the Gujrati term Hartal in a way which was never achieved by any other country of the world.
Adinoy hoe ahoana ny famaritana itambarambe ny Hartal, amin'ny fijery ao Bangladesh, ny dikany dia hoe fananana nolovanay manokana ny firenena ka azonay akatona ny zavatra rehetra araka izay tianay. ||| Forget how Hartal is defined universally, in Bangladesh perspective it means the country is our inherited property and we can close everything on our will.
Efa raiki-tampisaka ao an-tsain'ireo mponina ao Bangladesh ny Hartal. ||| Hartal has been engraved in the spirit of Bangladeshis.
Singa iray amin'ny kolontsainay. ||| It has been part of our culture.
Ny filazana ny datin'andro hanaovana Hartal dia midika fan a hakatona ny toeram-pivarotako, na horobaina. ||| The declaration of a Hartal date means that my shop will either be closed or be looted.
Amin'io andro ion y fiara tsy foiko dia hopotehin'ireo mpanao fihetsiketsehana. ||| On that day my beloved car will be broken by picketers.
Ny Hartal dia midika fa tsy ho afaka mandeha mamonjy toeram-piasana aho ary ho voabetrobetrokin'ny mpampiasa ahy. ||| Hartal means that I will not be able to go to work and will be scolded by my supervisor.
Ny ho vokany dia tsy handray karama ary handry fotsy miaraka amin'ireo zanako. ||| The consequence will be that I will not get my pay and will starve with my children.
Zavatra efa fantatra daholo izany rehetra izany. ||| These all are known facts.
Taorian'ny fitsaharana naharitra efa ho telo taona dia niverina indray ny Hartal eto Bangladesh. ||| After a long break of almost three years Hartal has come back in Bangladesh.
Maro ny olona ao Bangladesh no efa nanadino io nofy ratsy io. ||| Many Bangladeshis may have forgotten about this nightmare.
Noho izany mety tsy ho ankasitrahan'izy ireo mihitsy ny hiverenan'io indray. ||| So they probably don't want it to come back.
Saingy tsy olana izay hetahetan-dry zareo any, satria izay no tian'ireo mpitarika. ||| But it does not matter what they want, because the leaders want it.
Ry mpitarika hajaina avy amin'ny mpanohitra, mba efa noeritreretinareo ve hoe hoatrinona no ho fatiantoky ny firenena anatin'ny andro iray noho ny fitokonana? ||| Respected leader of opposition, have you thought how much the country will lose in one day because of the strike?
Aina firy no hafoy? ||| How many lives will be disrupted?
MAzava loatra fa tsy mila miasa saina amin'izany ianareo, satria ny politikanareo dia entim-bahoaka fa tsy ho an'ny vahoaka. ||| Of course you don't have to think about it, because your politics is driven by people, not for people.
Noho izany dia tsy manana fotoana ianareo hisainana ireo olana sy ireo fatiantoky ny vahoaka. ||| So you don't have time to think about the problems and losses of the citizens.
Ny zavatra voalohany tonga ao an-tsaina avy hatrany rehefa miresaka momba ny Hartal dia ny fahavoazana goavana entiny ho an'ny firenena. ||| The first thing comes into mind when talking about Hartal is that it brings huge loss for the country.
Rehefa any amin'ny ilany misy ny mpanohitra ny antoko politika iray, tena zavatra ilaina ny Hartal hoy ry zareo, rehefa any amin'ny ilany mitondra indray dia mahazendana fa manohitra ny Hartal ry zareo. ||| If a political party is in the opposition, Hartal is absolutely ok for them, if they are the ruling party then obviously they are against Hartal.
Satria ny Hartal amin'ny famoronana tontolo baranahiny dia làlana iray hanosehana ny governemanta ho amin'ny toerana saropady. ||| Because Hartal is the way to put the government in an awkward position by creating anarchy.
Aminul Haque Bachchu at Pothom Alo blog dia manazava an-tononkalo ny Hartal: ||| Aminul Haque Bachchu at Pothom Alo blog explains Hartal with a poem:
Eny ankianja miaraka amin'ny fampiasana langilangy ||| On the field with sticks in action
Fitaovana vaovao handripahana ny ory ||| A new device to kill the poor
Fitaovana iray handranitana ny vahoaka io ||| Its a tool to instigate citizens
Jiro no an-tànana, poleta an-tsikinana ||| Torch in hand, Guns in Pocket
Hartal Hartal Na izany aza, misy mponin'ny aterineto vitsivitsy manohana ihany koa ny Hartal. ||| However some netizens are also supporting the Hartal.
Ilay mpitoraka blaogy Dhibor ao amin'ny Somewhereinblog.net dia manome rariny ny fitokonana: ||| Blogger Dhibor at Somewhereinblog.net gives logic for the strike:
Tsy misy làlana hafa azo ijoroana afa-tsy ny Hartal mba hanoherana ny tsindrihazolena ataon'ny Ligin'ny Awami (antoko mitondra) Awam. ||| There is no alternative to taking a tough stand by a Hartal declared to protest (ruling party) Awami League's repressions.
Satria ny Ligin'ny Awami tsy mahafantatra resaka ampilaminana izany. ||| Because Awami League does not understand peaceful language.
Satria ry zareo no mibahan-toerana amin'ny asany sy n y politikany, raha tsy matanjakan tsar any fanoherana, dia handefa ny mpitandro filaminana hidaroka antsika avy ao an-damosina ry zareo. ||| As they are dominant in their work and policies, if the resistance is not strong enough, they will put the police on our back to beat us.
Efa misy soritsoritra sasantsasany mivoaka sahady. ||| Some symptoms have already been divulged.
Tsy ilaina ny fandosirana rehefa voadaroka. ||| There is no achievement in running away after being beaten.
Efa ela tany alohga tany no tokony nanao izany ny mpanohitra (efa nisy ny olana) ary farany dia nanapa-kevitra ihany ry zareo hanao azy ity – mendrika fisaorana avy aty amiko ry zareo. ||| The opposition should have done this a long time ago (the issues were present) and they have finally decided for it - they should get thanks from me.
Io filazana etsy ambony io dia maneho ny fifandroritan'ny tontolo politika ao. ||| The above statement shows the confrontational state of Bangladesh politics.
Ireo mpampiasa twitter koa dia isan'ny naneho hevitra toy izao: ||| Twitter users also reacted this way:
Tokony hampiasa fomba hafa hanaovana fihetsiketsehana ankoatra ny Hartal ny mpanohatra. ||| The opposition could declare other means of protests except Hartal.
Azony atao ny manao diabe, fihetsiketsehana mipetraka, fitokonana tsy hihinan-kanina, sns. ||| They could use long march, sitting protests, hunger strike etc.
Ka maninona no ity Hartal mpandrava ity no nambaran-dry zareo? ||| So why did they declare this destructive Hartal?
Tena ho an'ny firenentsika tokoa ve no hanohanantsika ity Hartal ity? ||| Do we really support this Hartal for our country's sake?
Efa andro vitsy lasa izao no tsy nahazoam-baovao ilay Bahraini mafana fo mpiaro ny zon'olombelona sady mpitarika ny mpanohitra Abdulhadi Alkhawaja, izay nanao fitokonana tsy hihinan-kanina hatramin'ny 8 Febroary. ||| For some days there has been no news of imprisoned Bahraini human rights activist and opposition leader Abdulhadi Alkhawaja, who has been on hunger strike since February 8.
Atahorana fa mety fahanana sakafo an-katerena na anaty tsy fahasalamana lalin i Alkhawaja, izay notsaraina tamin'ny taona lasa higadra mandra-pahafatiny, ary araka ireo tatitra dia iharan'ny fampijaliana ara-batana sy ara-nofo. ||| It is feared that Alkhawaja, who was sentenced last year to life imprisonment and has reportedly been subjected to physical and sexual torture in detention, is now either being force-fed or is in a critical state.
Fitokonana tsy hihinan-kanina vaovao mikasika azy ny fianakavian'i Alkhawaja, ary nolavin'ireo manam-pahefana ny fangatahana fitsidihana. ||| Hunger Strike no news about him, and requests for visits have been denied by the authorities.
Mitombo ny ahiahy, ary aman'arivony ireo mitoraka bitsika amin'ny tenifototra "WhereIsAlKhawaja," mangataka valinteny tsy misy hatak'andro avy amin'ny governemanta. ||| Concern is growing, and thousands have been tweeting on the hashtag "WhereIsAlKhawaja," demanding an immediate answer from the government.
Nirotsaka an-tsehatra amin'ny antso hahazoam-baovao mikasika an'i Alkhawaja ireo fikambanana miaro ny zon'olombelona eran-tany, isan'izany ny Front Line Defenders. ||| Human rights organizations around the world, including Front Line Defenders, have joined the calls for information about Alkhawaja.
Nampiasa ny kaontiny Twitter i Khadija Almousawi, vadin'i Alkhawaja, handefasany hafatra ho an'ny vadiny. ||| Khadija Almousawi, Alkhawaja's wife, has been using her Twitter account to send messages addressed to her husband.
Anatin'ny iray amin'izy ireo, nanonona ny zananivavy Zainab, izay mitoraka bitsika amin'ny ary vao haingana no voatàna am-ponja taoriana fihetsiketseham-behivavy tokana ho an-drainy: ||| In one tweet she mentioned her daughter Zainab, who tweets as and is currently in detention after a one-woman demonstration for her father:

Nihena ny fianakaviana. ||| the family has shrunk.
Any am-ponja i Zainab. ||| Zainab is in jail.
Anatina bitsika hafa dia niteny izy: ||| In other tweets she said:
Ry Hadi, reko avy amin'ireo mpiandraikitra fa salama tsara ianao. ||| Dear Hadi, I hear officials telling me that you are ok.
Nefa tiako heno avy aminao izany. Tsy mandainga mihitsy ianao. ||| But I need to hear it from you. You never lie.
Tsy tahaka azy ireo. ||| They always do.
Maninona ianao no tsy afaka miantso ahy? ||| Why can't you call me?
Ry vady malalako: Manohy ny tolona ho an'ny fahalalahana ianao eo ambony fandrianao, na aiza na aiza toerana misy anao. Raha mbola eto ianao. ||| Dear Husband: You continue your fight for freedom from your bed in where ever you are. If you're still here.
Ry Hadi, mijoro ho anao 100% aho ary hanohy hanohana anao 100%, malahelo anao aho. ||| Dear Hadi, I stand by you 100% and I will keep supporting you 100%, I just miss you.
Malahelo ny tsikinao, ny hatsaram-panahinao ||| Miss your smile, Miss your kindness
Firahalahian'ny Bahraini niady hevitra tamin'i Zainab Alkhawaja aza: ||| Bahraini solidarity debated Zainab Alkhawaja:

Rosia: "Tranonkalan'ny fahamarinana "||| Russia: "Web of Justice"
Tamin'ny herinandro lasa, nandefa vaovao mikasika ireo mpitoraka bilaogy Rosiana sy ny fomban'izy ireo, izay tena mivatravatra, sahy maneho ireo heloka bevava sy ny kolikoly eo amin'ny rafi-pitantanana, ny mpanentana ny fandaharana vahiny any Rosia ao amin'ny - Fahitalavitra Russia Today TV. ||| Last week, Russia's foreign broadcaster - Russia Today TV - ran a report about Russian bloggers and how they, heroically, expose crimes and corruption in the system.
Ireto misy santionany avy amin'ny lahatsoratra naseho tamin'ny aterineto mifandraika amin'izay: ||| Here are some excerpts from the related article posted online:
Nanjary mora idirana ny aterineto any Rosia noho ny solosaina, ny solosaina finday, ny finday ary ny PDA.... ||| Desktops, laptops, phones and PDAs....
ary ampiasaina mihoatra kokoa noho ny maha-fialamboly fotsiny. ||| Internet in Russia is rapidly becoming much more available, and much more than just entertainment.
Ho an'ny maro, nanjary niova ho toerana niomerika hifaneraserana izany, izay tsy hoe andrenesana fotsiny ny feon-dry zareo fa miantoka ihany koa ny fipariahany manerana ny taniny ao anatina ora maro. ||| For many, it has turned into a virtual speaker's corner, where their voice will not only be heard, but is guaranteed to echo across the country within hours.
Misy ireo ohatra am-bava mikasika ny fomba azon'ireo mpampiasa aterineto anampiana amin'ny famahàna olana sarotra. ||| There are vocal examples of how Internet users can help solve complicated problems.
Amin'ny lafiny iray, nahavoaroaka ny lehilahy iray ny horonantsary nisy azy naseho teo amin'ny aterineto. ||| In one instance, a video of a man posted online led to his dismissal.
Ity lehilahy ity, izay lehiben'ny governemanta eo an-toerana, dia tena mpampijaly ankizy tokoa any am-pianarana nefa dia tsy mbola voasazy mihitsy raha tsy lasa toy ny aretina miparitaka ilay horonantsary. ||| The man, who was the head of the local government, was bullying children at school but remained unpunished until the video went viral.
"Tsy midika akory izany fa tsy mahay ny mpanao gazety, ary lafatra kokoa ny mpitoraka bilaogy," hoy i Sergey Dorenko, tonian'ny fanoratana ao amin'ny Sampam-baovao Rosiana, manamafy."Na hoe ity no endrika tokan'ny fahalalahana maneho hevitra misy ao amin'ny aterineto. ||| "This doesn't mean that journalists are bad, and bloggers are better," stressed Sergey Dorenko, editor in chief of Russian News Service. "Or that the only notion of free speech exists online.
Resaka safidy tsotra fotsiny ihany izy ity. ||| It's simply a matter of choice.
Tsy te hahita olona hanao tatitra izahay, fa te hanao – ary afaka – manao izay vitanay. ||| We no longer want to watch someone else's rundown, we want to – and can – make our own.
Mamela antsika hisafidy izay tiantsika ho fantatra ny aterineto, raha ny hafaingan'ny fandehan'izany, na ny gazety na ny haino aman-jerin'ny fahitalavitra aloha dia tsy afaka ny hifaninana aminy amin'izao fotsiny. ||| The Internet allows us to choose what we want to know about, at a speed print or TV media simply cannot compete with.
Nefa kosa misy an'ity: ||| But then, there was this:
Amin'ny lafiny hafa, niezaka hifandray tamin'ny filoha Rosiana Dmitry Medvedev ny mpitoraka bilaogy iray mba hanampiana kamboty iray, Pasha Berezin. ||| In another instance, one blogger managed to reach Russian president Dmitry Medvedev in order to help an orphan, Pasha Berezin.
Mpilalao echec matihanina, manam-pahaizana amin'ny matematika ary nahazo fanohanana avy amin'ny fanjakana, tsy nahatratra ny fanombohan'ny taom-pianarana i Pasha noho ny fangatahan'ny orinasa mpanao trano izay manampy ara-bola ilay sekoly. ||| A master chess player, a math genius and guaranteed state benefits, Pasha is missing the start of the academic year due to the demands of a construction company that helps fund the school.
"Te-ho manam-pahaizana manokana amin'ny IT aho", hoy ity ankizilahy tamin'ny RT. ||| "I want to be an IT specialist," the boy told RT.
"Nefa milaza ny sekoly fa raha te-hianatra ao aminy aho ary hipetraka ao amin'ny trano fonenan'ny mpianatra, dia tsy maintsy mianatra mba ho lasa mpanao trano." ||| "But the school said that if I want to study here and live in the residence halls, I have to study to be a builder".
Noraisin'ny fikambanana manao asa soa, Murzik, ny trangan'i Pasha. ||| Pasha's case was taken on by a charity organization, Murzik.
Nilaza ny mpamorona azy ity, i German Pyatov, fa ny nahasamihafa ny trangany dia noho izy nandefa hafatra ho an'ny Filoha tamin'ny aterineto." ||| Its founder, German Pyatov, says what made a difference to his case was a message he posted online to the president.
Taorian'ny nandefasako ny taratasiko, nisy olona avy ao amin'ny biraon'ny Filoha niantso ahy ary nanontany ahy ny antsipiriany mikasika ity tranga ity" hoy i Pyatov. ||| "After I posted my letter, someone from the president's office called and asked for details about this case," Pyatov said.
"Fantatro fa nifampiresaka tamin'ny fianarana nisy an'i Pasha izy ireo, satria saika taorian'izay avy hatrany, niantso ilay toeram-pianarana ary nilaza tamin'i Pasha haka ny antontan-taratasiny ary mazava ho azy ny hialany tao. ||| "I know they got in touch with Pasha's college, because almost immediately afterward, the college called and told Pasha to withdraw his application and basically get the hell out.
Natahotra izy ireo fa niditra an-tsehatra ny manam-pahefana. ||| They were scared that the authorities got involved.
Avy eo nalain'ny haino aman-jery ny tantara, ary voatery nanajanona ny asa ratsiny ilay toeram-pianarana. ||| Then the media picked up the story, and the college was forced to stop its unlawful actions.
Navelan'izy ireo hanatrika ny fampianarana i Pasha amin'izao fotoana izao, fa tsy mbola ekeny kosa ny hanome trano azy. ||| They now allow Pasha to attend lectures, but still refuse to give him a room.
Vaovao nandeha tamin'ny 20 Septambra ity tantara ity. ||| This story was broadcast on September 20.
Ny ampitson'io andro io, vaovao hafa mikasika ny anjara toerana mavitrika raisin'ny tontolon'ny bilaogy Rosiana no niseho tao amin'ny I Rosia ao ambadik'ireo Lohateny lehibe (Amin'ny aterineto sy an-tsoratra, fiaraha-miasa amin'ny gazety maro manan-danja avy any ivelany): ||| The following day, another report about the great potential of the Russian blogosphere appeared on Russia Beyond the Headlines (online and print, in cooperation with several prominent foreign newspapers):
Nihanihena ny firesahana antontan'isa na antoko ao amin'ny fanoherana ara-politika any Rosia, fa niha nivelatra kokoa ho amin'ny olana fototry ny vahoaka: Araho maso ny fanoheran'ny mpamily fiara na ny fampielezan-kevitry ny olona any ifotony manohitra ny kolikoly ataon'ny polisy. ||| Opposition politics in Russia have become less about political figures or parties, and more about grassroots issues: Witness the car protests or the grassroots campaign against police corruption.
Tena hita mihitsy ny fiantraikan'ny fanomezam-baovao mitsitaitaika (avy amin'ny tontolon'ny bilaogy mankany amin'ny haino aman-jery fototra), noho izy maneho ny hetsiky ny mpitoraka bilaogy miala amin'ny maha-mpitahiry fotsiny ny maha-tandrenivohitra, sangany tena maharaka tsara ny zava-misy. ||| The trickle-up effect (from blogosphere to mainstream media) is especially significant, as it shows how bloggers move further away from being the preserve of an urban, well-connected elite.
Eo ampahitàna tatitra toy izany, tsy vitan'ny tsirairay ny tsy hijery izay loharano: ny roa amin'ireo famoaham-baovao ireo dia an'ny fanjakana ary vokarina, voalohany indrindra, amin'ny teny Angliy, miaraka amin'ny tanjona mba" hanampiana ireo vahiny hahalala kokoa mikasika an'i Rosia". ||| Seeing such reports, one cannot help but consider the source: both of these outlets are state-owned and are produced, primarily, in English, with the objective of "helping foreigners better understand Russia".
Miaraka amin'izany ao an-doha, sahala amin'ny hoe hanampy ny fifandraharahana amin'ny vahoaka any Rosia kokoa izany tantara izany, indrindra rha ny ezana nataon'ny Filoha Medvedev hanandrana hampiseho amin'izao tontolo izao fa i Rosia dia afaka milahatra (en par) tsara amin'ny Tandrefana raha resaka fivoarana ara-teknolojia, ary koa ny fiovana ara-tsosialy sy ara-toekarena izay miaraka aminy. ||| With this in mind, it seems such stories would serve Russia's public diplomacy well, especially given President Medvedev's attempts to demonstrate to the world that Russia can be en par with the West in terms of technological progress, as well as the social and economic transformations that accompany it.
Kanefa, toa mifanohitra ihany amin'izay tokony ho izy raha ny fahalalahana mampiasa ny aterineto Rosiana izay nahasarika ny sain'ny maro tato ho ato. ||| Yet, Russian Internet freedom also seems to be a paradox that has caught the attention of many, lately.
Tamin'ny voalohandohan'ity volana ity, niezaka ny naneho ny "demokrasia niomerika" i Tangled Web, izay milaza mikasika ireo vaovao farany avy amin'ny U.S. Institute of Peace - Blogs and Bullets - momba ny tanjaky ny media vaovao: ||| Earlier this month, Tangled Web tried addressing Russia's "virtual democracy", referring to a recent report by the U.S. Institute of Peace - Blogs and Bullets - on the power of the new media:
Tao anatin'ny fampidirana, nanamarika ny vaovao fa mbola tsy mazava mihitsy ny fiantraikan'ireo haino aman-jery vaovao amin'ny demokrasia, satria hita mibaribary loatra fa mbola miparitaka sy tsy matotra izany. ||| From the outset, the report makes the point that the impact of new media on democracy is still unclear, as much of the evidence is still fragmentary and anecdotal.
Fa fehezanteny iray, eo amin'ny lafiny mikasika ny fiantraikan'ny haino aman-jery vaovao any amin'ny tsirairay, miaraha amiko: "mahatonga ny mponina ho malai-mihetsika ny haino aman-jery vaovao, amin'ny fitarihana azy ireo hanafangaro ny fanasana vangy aty amin'ny aterineto sy ny hetsika ara-politika lehibe, mamily ny fifantohan-tsain-dry zareo tsy hizotra ho any amin'ny hetsika mamokatra maro." ||| But one sentence, in the section on how new media can affect individuals, stuck with me: "new media could make citizens more passive, by leading them to confuse online rhetoric with substantial political action, diverting their attention away from productive activities".
Tena miasa malalaka tsy misy hoatr'izany ny toerana fanaovana aterineto any Rosia, indrindra raha oharina amin'ny fampielezam-baovao sy ny gazety an-tsoratra an'ny fanjakana. ||| Cyberspace is remarkably free in Russia, especially compared with state-dominated broadcast and print media.
Ary maro ireo hetsiky tsara avy amin'ny olona ifotony ao amin'ny tranonkala any Rosia. ||| And there is a lot of good grass-roots activism on the web in Russia.
Fa ankoatry ny maha fanoitry ny demokrasia kokoa ny aterineto, dia mety ho iray amin'ireo toerana fitsoahana lehibe ihany koa izy, izay ahafahana manao resadresaka sy fomba fanao maro amina fotoana iray, izay tena velona sy maro karazana, nefa ny sarintsariny aloha no tena betsaka. ||| But rather than the Internet being democracy's enabler, it could also be one of its biggest loopholes, allowing a parallel discourse and parallel process, one that's lively and diverse, but ultimately a sham.
Eto, tsy misy afa-tsy ny filazana ny tatitra 2010 avy amin'ny OpenNet Initiative, izay vakian'ny Country Profile on Russia toy izao: ||| Here, one cannot but mention the 2010 report by OpenNet Initiative, whose Country Profile on Russia reads:
Ny tsy fisian'ny fanivanana ny aterineto ataon'ny fanjakana ao Rosia dia nahatonga ny mpandinika sasany hanao tsoak'hevitra toy izao fa toy ny habaka iray midadasika tsy voarara ny aterineto Rosiana. ||| The absence of overt state-mandated Internet filtering in Russia has led some observers to conclude that the Russian Internet represents an open and uncontested space.
Raha ny zava-misy, ny mifanohitra amin'izany no marina. ||| In fact, the opposite is true.
Mifofotra mafy mifaninana mafy amin'ireo trano fidirana amin'ny aterineto ny governemanta Rosiana izay mampiasa ny tetikadiny andiany faharoa sy fahatelo ho fitaovana hanefena ny tontolon'ny famoaham-baovaom-pirenena sy mba hanapariahana ny hafatra ara-politika sy ny tetikadin'ny mpanohana ny governemanta. ||| The Russian government actively competes in Russian cyberspace employing second- and third-generation strategies as a means to shape the national information space and promote pro-government political messages and strategies.
Ity fomba ity dia mifamatotra amin'ny fomba fijery stratejikan'ny governemanta manoloana ireo trano fidirana amin'ny aterineto ary narafitra ho tetikady hanjary ho ny lalàna fototra mifehy ny tsiambaratelon'ny vaovao. ||| This approach is consistent with the government's strategic view of cyberspace that is articulated in strategies such as the doctrine of information security.
Afaka mamaky bebe kokoa mikasika ny "fomba azo isafidianana" amin'ny "fitantanana" ny aterineto ianao ao amina toko iray hafa ao anatin'ilay tatitra, izay natokana ho an'ny trano fidirana amin'ny aterineto Rosiana. ||| You can read more about these "alternative approaches" to Internet "management" in a separate chapter of the report, dedicated to the Russian cyberspace.
Raha ny heviny, na izany aza, maneho ny tsy hita maso izy ireo, ary angamba aza, mandray fanapahan-kevitra, izay tsy voatery ho voasakan'ny fetran'ny fahalalahana - amin'ny fanomezana hevitra ankapobeny mikasika ny filaminana (izany hoe tsy misy "firewalls (Avy amin'ny mpandika: rindrambaiko fanivanana ny hoe iza avy no afaka manao inona ao anaty tambajotrana solosaina)" na fandrarana amin'ny tranonkala sasany) - rehefa miato kely mandinika raha toa ka mety hisy fiantraikany goavana tokoa ny fahalalahana tafahoatra... ||| In essence, however, they represent inconspicuous and, perhaps even, covert measures, that do not necessarily limit broader freedoms - to give a general sense of calm (i.e. there are no "firewalls" or certain website bans) - while taking over in instances where allowing too much freedom can have serious repercussions.
Maro ireo karazana "vaovao" izay niresaka mikasika izay olana izay, izay tena mendrika horaketina an-tsoratra: ||| There were several other "news" pieces dealing with the issue, which are worthy of note:
Nanana lahatsoratra tsara mikasika ny "revolusiona amin'ny fitorahana bilaogy any Rosia The Guardian raha, raha naneho ireo ohatra milaza ny fomba mety hahafahan'ireo izay eo amin'ny fahefana mitrandraka izany ho amin'ny tombontsoany manokana. ||| The Guardian had an optimistic article about "Russia's blogging revolution," while pointing out examples of how it can, as well, be exploited by those in power for their own interests.
Nanana ampahana horonantsary manokana mikasika ny tombontsoa azo amin'ny fahavitrihan'ny aterineto, ary ny sasany amin'ireo vokatra mety ho azo avy amin'izany any Rosia ny New York Times. ||| The New York Times had a special video segment on the potential of Internet activism, and some of its possible consequences in Russia.
Ny fahitalavitra Russia Today TV ihany koa no mba nahita tantara mikasika ny andrana tsy nahomby nataon'ny fitsarana any amin'ny tanàna farany atsinanana lavitra any Komsomolsk-on-Amur hanakana ny YouTube. ||| The very same Russia Today TV ran a story about a failed attempt by a court in Far Eastern city of Komsomolsk-on-Amur to block YouTube.
Izay no manohy ny "andrana vaovao "tena resahana be nataon'ny Kremlin: manokatra ny tolo-dalàna fanovana ny rafitry ny polisy izay natolony vao haingana mikasika ny gazety bokim-bahoaka, amin'ny aterineto. ||| That follows the much-discussed "new experiment" by the Kremlin: opening up the newly proposed Police reform bill for public review, online.
Mety hoe hanehoana ny mariky ny fandrosoana angamba ireo, izay mety tsy dia nandrasan'ny maro loatra hoe ho avy rahampitso. ||| These, perhaps, do demonstrate signs of progress, which, most certainly, cannot be expected to arrive overnight.
Na izany aza, mety ho ohatra fotsiny ihany koa ireo amin'ny antsoin'i Tangled Web izay hanamarinany ny atao hoe "fomba fisainana taloha tany Rosia, toerana izay ny "tsar" no tena nanjaka tao ka ny mpiasam-panjakana antonontonony teo no tena notondroina ho mpanao kolikoly sy tokony ho saziana mafy amin'ny zavatra rehetra." ||| Nevertheless, they might as well be examples of what the Tangled Web referred to as "an old strand of thought in Russia, where the tsar was fundamentally decent and it was the corrupt mid-level officials who were to blame for everything".
Tokony ho lazaina na izany aza, fa izany demokrasia izany, - ny tena izy sy ny niomerika - dia hita ho azy foana eny ihany fa tena zara raha izy. ||| It should be mentioned, however, that democracy - real or virtual - proves itself, time and again, as being very relative.
Eny fa na dia ny demokrasia malaza Tandrefana maro aza dia manana olana lehibe amin'ny fidirana amin'ny aterineto ary koa ny fanaraha-maso, ka angamba i Rosia tsy tokony hotsaraina hentitra loatra? ||| When even some of the more prominent Western democracies have major issues with Internet access and surveillance, perhaps Russia should not be judged as strictly?
Nefa moa, fa maninona kosa ny firenena raha nametraka izany tanjona izany ho azy irery? ||| But then, why not, if the country has set that objective for itself?
Ejipta: Androm-pifidianana ||| Egypt: The Country Votes
Handeha hifidy izay ho solombavambahoakany ny Ejypsiana ny 28 sy 29 Novambra 2011, na dia eo aza ny fiantsoana tsy hifidy, dia hita fa nanapa-kevitra handray anjara avokoa ny ankamaroan'ny olona. ||| Egyptians are voting in parliamentary elections on November 28 and 29, 2011, and despite calls for a boycott, it seems that most people have chosen to participate.
Tsy ny Ejypta rehetra no handeha hifidy amin'io daty io; satria nozaraina dingana telo ny fifidianana, izay samy ahitana governorà sivy. ||| Not all of Egypt votes on these dates; the elections are staggered across three stages, each covering nine governorates.
Ny tanàna ao Kairo sy Alexandria no dingana voalohany handray ny fifidianana. ||| The first stage includes the cities of Cairo and Alexandria.
Tsy hifidy ny sasany noho ny antony manokana, tahaka ilay mpamaha bolongana sady mpanao gazety Sarah Carr, izay nanoratra hoe: ||| Some people are not voting on principle, such as blogger and journalist Sarah Carr, who writes:
Raha mety manontany ianao, tsy handeha hifidy aho. ||| In case you're asking I won't be voting.
Ary tsy handeha hifidy toy izany koa ireo olom-pantatro. ||| Neither will several of my acquaintances.
Misy ny antony mazava hanoherana ny fifidianana (angamba mety hanampy amin'ny fanakanana ny herin'ny mpitana ny mahazatra izany) tsy hanova ny hevitro anefa izany fa ny fandraisana anjara amin'ny fifidianana dia hampanao izay haha-ara-dalàna ny fitondrana izay tsy mendrika izany akory, noho ny fandraisany ireo Ejypsiana ho toy ny ankizy tsy misaina sy ny fanehoan-kevitra nandritra ity tetezamita tsy mety tapitra ity izay fomba nentiny hamonoana olona sy hananganana rindrina. ||| While there is a strong argument against a boycott (it might help keep out religiously conservative forces) it doesn't sway my conviction that taking part in the election gives legitimacy to a regime that doesn't deserve it, that has treated Egyptians like foolish children and whose only display of creativity during this never-ending transitional process has been in methods of killing people and building walls.
Nisafidy tsy handeha hifidy ihany koa i Ismail Naguib: ||| Ismail Naguib has also chosen not to vote:
Ho ahy, ny tsy fandehanana hifidy dia misy fahalemena ihany. ||| For me, not voting has little to do with apathy.
Inoako fa tokony takian'ny vahoaka fa ny olom-pirenena tsy azo hozongozonina (angamba amin'ny endrika Praiminisitra matanjaka) na filankevitrin'ny olom-pirenena (angamba amin'ny endrika Filan-kevitry ny Filoha) no tokony manam-pahefana manaramaso ny minisitra izay misahana ny fikarakarana ny fifidianana solombavambahoaka. ||| I believe that people should demand that an untainted civilian (perhaps in the form of a strong PM) or civilian council (perhaps in the form of Presidential Council) should be the authority to oversee the ministries who will manage parliamentary elections.
Raha izay tokoa no hiseho, amin'ny fisainana milamina, tsy handray anjara amin'ny fifidianana solombavambahoaka aho izay hanome fankatoavana ny fahefana didy jadona, izay ny tombotsoany manokana no ambony fa tsy ny tombotsoam-pirenena. ||| Until that is the case I cannot, with a clear conscience, participate in parliamentary elections that grant legitimacy to a dictatorial force whose self interests are above those of the country.
Tamin'ny fiafaran'ny androm-pifidianana voalohany, tsy resy lahatra i Mostafa Hussein: ||| Towards the end of the first day's voting, Mostafa Hussein was not convinced:
Malalaka tanteraka ny fifidianana ho an'ny parlemanta izay tsy toy izany akory. ||| The voting was mostly free for a parliament that isn't.
Tsy maninona izay hofidianao, fa ho voafidy ny fitondrana. ||| No matter who you vote for, the regime gets elected.
Na dia izany aza, betsaka tamin'ireo Ejypsiana no nandeha nifidy, nahitana filaharam-be manerana ny firenena. ||| Nevertheless, a great number of Egyptians have been voting, and there were long queues all over the country.
Miandry ny fizarana taratasim-pifidianana. ||| Waiting for voting papers to be delivered.
Tsy kivy tamin'ny fiandrasana ela be i Pakinam Amer: ||| Pakinam Amer was not put off by the queues:
roa ora sahady izay no lasa, mbola mitsangana milahatra eto foana. ||| Two hours on, still standing in line.
Fantatrao tokoa fa sarobidy ny demokrasia ||| You know, democracy is hard
Tsy kivy toy izany ihany koa ilay mpisera Twitter CokiCoussa: ||| Nor was Twitter user CokiCoussa discouraged:
Raha mahita ny filaharam-be eto ianao, dia mety hihevitra fa tsy misy fiafarany mihitsy izany, kanefa tsy mahakivy anao izany na hoe zavatra mahasosotra, fa manome hery anao indray aza ||| When you see the queue, you think it has no end, but it's not that boring neither is it that bad, it's actually motivating
Nahoana no tsy afaka mifidy amin'ny alalan'ny aterineto isika toy izay milahatra be mandany fotoana fotsiny ||| Why we can't vote online instead of standing in long queue that consumes hours and hours
Filaharam-be tao amin'ny birao fandatsaham-bato Aleksandria. ||| Queuing to vote in Alexandria.
Mohamed El Dahshan nahatsiaro izay vita tamin'ity fotoana ity: ||| Mohamed El Dahshan remembered how this moment had been reached:
Afaka hifidy ankehitriny, ho fahatsiarovana ireo maritioranay, ny mpanao fihetsiketsehana, sy ny gadra tsy manan-tsiny. ||| Off to vote now, with our martyrs, protesters, and innocent prisoners in mind.
Tao ambanivohitra Zamalek, Fatenn Mostafa nihaona tamin'ireo mpifidy hafa izay mahatsiaro ireo voavono: ||| In the Cairo suburb of Zamalek, Fatenn Mostafa met other voters remembering those who were killed:
Marobe ireo vehivavy miakanjo mainty nandritra ny filaharana tao zamalek! ||| A lot of women are wearing black in the zamalek queue!
Na dia teo aza ny filaharam-be, sy ny tsy fahatomombanan' ny fizotry ny fifidianana, ary ny fiampangana ny hosoka, dia nisy hatrany ny fientanentanana. ||| Despite the long waits, the complicated voting process, and accusations of violations, there has been a sense of excitement.
Mpanao gazety kanadiana Firas Al-Atraqchi niresaka tamin'ny mpifidy tao Kairo: ||| Canadian journalist Firas Al-Atraqchi spoke to voters in Cairo:
Tamin'ny resaka nataoko tamin'ireo sasany nilahatra hifidy, toa tsapako fa nahafoy fotoana be tamin'ity fifidianana ity izy ireo. ||| From talking to some of those in the queue I get an impression they are invested in the election process.
Te haneho hevitra mafy izy ireo ||| They want to be heard
Be fanantenana i Mosa'ab Elshamy: ||| Mosa'ab Elshamy was upbeat:
Nitety birao fadatsaham-bato 5 samihafa aho androany. ||| Went to 5 different polling stations today.
Faly ny olona teo am-pilaharana ary nifidy tamim-pifaliana. ||| People are enjoying the queues and voting with a smile.
Na dia teo aza ny tsy fetezana, nahafinaritra ny tontolo andro. ||| Despite the violations, glorious day.
Be fanantenana ihany koa i Mohamed Soliman: ||| Mohamed Soliman was also optimistic:
Mirehareha noho ireo Ejypsiana nitsangana ela be sy mbola miandry eo am-pilaharana, miraikitra eo an-tananao misy ranomainty ny ampitso. ||| Proud of every Egyptian who stood or continues to stand in line to vote, the future is in your ink stained hands.
Iran: Bilaogera momba ny Tontolo Iainana Torian'ny Manampahefana Eny Amin'ny Fitsaràna ||| Iran: Environmental Blogger Sued by Authorities
Houman Khakpour, bilaogera iray miresaka momba ny tontolo iainana ao Iran dia nenjehin'ny Biraom-panjakana Miaro ny Tontolo Iainana ao amin'ny faritanin'i Chahrmahal Bakhtyari, noho ny fampitandremany mikasika ny loza aterak'ilay tetikasa fametrahana fantsona fitaterana solika eo amin'ny tontolo iainana eo amin'ilay faritra. ||| Houman Khakpour, an environmental blogger in Iran has been sued by the state run Bureau for Environmental Protection in the Chahrmahal Bakhtyari province, for warning about the the dangers of a gas pipeline project for the region's environment.
Khakpour dia nanazava tao amin'ny bilaoginy, "mpandinika ny natioran'I Bakhtyari" fa notoriana izy ho "manohintohina ny filaminam-bahoaka" sy "manely vaovao tsy marina." ||| Khakpour explained in his blog, "Bakhtyari nature watcher" that he stands accused of "disturbing public opinion" and "spreading false news".
Taorian'ny nanoratako lahatsoratra iray momba ny fanaovan-dàlana iray, izay ny tena tanjona dia ny hampandalovana fantsona iray hitaterana solika hamakivaky ny faritra voajanahary arovana ao 'Tang-e- Sayad', Ny Biraom-panjakana Miaro ny Tontolo Iainana ao Chahrmahale Bakhtyari dia manenjika ahy ary tsy maintsy miatrika fitsarana eo anatrehan'ny mpitsara ao amin'ny tanànan'i Shahre Kurd aho. ||| After I wrote a post about the construction of a road in order to pass a gas pipeline through the protected natural area of 'Tang-e- Sayad', The Bureau of Environmental Protection in Chahrmahale Bakhtyari sued me and I must go to trial before a judge in Shahre Kurd city.
Ny lahatsoratro mikasika ity lohahevitra ity dia naverin'ireo vohikala maro navoaka indray. ||| My post on this topic was republished by several websites.
Tanatin'ilay lahatsoratra naha-be resaka iray volana lasa izay, nilaza i Houman Khakpour fa ny Biraom-panjakana Miaro ny Tontolo Iainana dia tsy nanisy olana velively tamin'ny fanomezana alàlana ny hamakivakian'ilay fantsona fitaterana solika sy ny lalambe 10 km eo afovoan'ny valan-javaboahary arovana iray. ||| In the controversial post from about a month ago, Houman Khakpour argued that the Bureau for Environmental Protection had not offered any resistance to allowing a gas pipeline and a 10 kilometer road pass right through a protected natural area.
Mojgan Jamshidi, mpanao gazety iray malaza amin'ny resaka tontolo iainana sady bilaogera koa, dia zendana tamin'ny vaovao sady niteny fa tsy sendra hetsika toy izany izy tato anatin'ny 40 taona farany. ||| Mojgan Jamshidi, a leading environmental journalist and blogger, was surprised by the news and says she has not experienced such action in the last 40 years.
Tsy mampino mihitsy hoe ny lehiben'ny Biraom-panjakana Miaro ny Tontolo Iainana izay milaza ho efa manana traikefa 11 taona niarahana tamin'ny media, no mitory bilaogera eny amin'ny fitsarana sy miampanga azy ho manakorontana ny filaminam-bahoaka sy manely vaovao tsy marina. ||| It is unbelievable that the head of Bureau for Environmental Protection who claims to have 11 years of experience with the media, complains about a blogger and accuses him of disturbing public opinion and publishing false news.
Mahagaga fa ny manampahefana dia feno fandeferana amin'ireo mamotika ny voary, nefa manenjika mafàna fo iray sy mpandàla ny tontolo iainana. ||| It is amazing that the authorities are very tolerant towards the ones who destroy nature, while they sue the nature lover and environmental activist.
Animal Persian milaza fa i Houman dia mandalina ny olan'ny tontolo iainana amin'ny maso tsy miangatra ao amin'ny bilaoginy. ||| Animal Persian says Houman analyses environmental issues with a critical eye in his blog.
Traikefa 19 taona no ananany amin'io sehatra io. ||| He has 19 years of experience in this field.
Miteny ilay bilaogera fa toa tsy mionona fotsiny amin'ny fanatantavànana (fanivànana) bilaogy momba ny tontolo iainana, fa koa mikendry mihitsy ny bilaogera amin'ny maha-bilaogera. ||| The blogger says that it seems that the authorities now not only filter (censor) environmental blogs, but also target the bloggers themselves.
Tonga indray ny vanim-potoanan'ny tafio-drivotra. ||| It's that time again: Hurricane season.
Ka ireo mpitoraka blaogy any amin'ny faritra, efa tratran'ny rivodoza mahery dia mahery taloha, dia manara-maso akaiky ny zotran'i tafio-drivotra Earl, izay nosokajiana ho tafio-drivotra sokajy faha-3. ||| And regional bloggers, having been affected by brutal storms in the past, are keeping a watchful eye on Hurricane Earl, which has now been classified as a Category 3 storm.
Mandritra ireo 36 hatramin'ny 48 ora ho avy dia eritreretina handalo any amin'ireo nosy Virijiny Amerikana sy Porto Rico izy, ankoatr'ireo nosy hafa. ||| Within the next 36 to 48 hours, it is expected to affect both the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, among other islands.
Na dia miforona aza ny famantarana toetr'andro vaovao any amorontsirak'i Barbados, afa-tahotra ny Barbados Free Press fa nandingana azy fotsiny i Earl: ||| Even as a new weather system forms off the Barbadian coast, Barbados Free Press is relieved that Earl has passed them by:
Ho avy ny orana mandritra ny andro maromaro any Bajan noho ny tafio-drivotra Earl, fa voadona mafy kosa ireo mpifanila amintsika any Avaratra. ||| Hurricane Earl will make for wet Bajan weather for the next couple of days, but our neighbours to the North are taking quite a hit.
Ny vaovao tsara ho an'i Barbados dia tsy naharava trano indray ny tafio-drivotra. ||| The good news for Barbados is that once again a hurricane missed our home.
Ny vaovao ratsy dia ny fiforonan'ny tafio-drivotra hafa indray any atsinanana ary 80% ny mety hiakarany ho ho tafio-drivotra manana anarana ao anatin'ny 48 ora. ||| The bad news is that another storm is forming to the east and there is an 80% chance it will grow into a named storm within 48 hours.
Mora ho an'ireo Barbadiana ny mampitony saina satria tsara vintana isika na notahiana nandritra ny fotoana ela isaky ny misy tafio-drivotra mahery mandalo. ||| It's easy for Barbadians to become lulled into a false sense of security because we've been lucky or blessed for a long time as far as major hurricanes go.
Toa avotra ihany koa i Kiobà; manoratra ny Havana Times: ||| Cuba, too, seems to have been spared; Havana Times writes:
Niha-nahery ny tafio-drivotra Earl tamin'ny Alatsinainy raha izy nandao ireo nosy Leeward avaratra ka nandeha ho any amin'ireo nosy Virijiny. ||| Hurracane Earl has picked up steam on Monday morning as it crosses the northern Leeward Islands and heads for the Virgin Islands.
Tsy misy tokony hampatahotra ny faritra Kiobàna noho izany. ||| It is not expected to threaten any part of Cuban territory.
Mitatitra ny Repeating Islands fa ny Foibem-pirenena Amerikana misahana ny Tafio-drivotra dia niteny fa "toa hihamahery hatrany" i Earl: ||| Repeating Islands reports that the U.S. National Hurricane Center said Earl "was likely to keep growing":
Maminavina ireo mpamantatra toetr'andro ao amin'ny Foibem-pirenena misahana ny Tafio-drivotra fa hijanona eny amorontsirak'i Etazonia ilay tafio-drivotra, hizotra manodidina an'i Etazonia sy Bermuda manomboka ny Alarobia hatramin'ny Zoma... ||| National Hurricane Center forecasters project the hurricane to remain offshore of the United States, passing through the open water between the U.S. and Bermuda from Wednesday through Friday...
Hatreto kosa aloha ireo mpitoraka blaogy avy any amin'ireo nosy Virijiny no tena mavitrika, mety hoe noho ry zareo akaikin'ny làlan'i Earl. ||| So far, however, bloggers from the U.S. Virgin Islands have been the most active, perhaps because they are next in Earl's path.
Ampiomanana ny tompon-trano, mpiandraikitra "villa", ary mpandraharaha tamin'ny Alakamisy lasa teo, namoaka ireo entana tao anatiny ary namatotra ireo sisa tavela. ||| Home owners, villa managers, and business folk began preparations last Thursday, moving outdoor furniture inside and tying down what was left.
Henonao tamin'ny zoma teo ny fipaipaikan'ny maritoa sy ny basy famantsihana. ||| By Friday evening, the sounds of hammering and nail guns could be heard, boarding up.
Mitatitra ny StormCarib fa nofoanana avokoa ireo sidina mivoaka ny St.Thomas tamin'ny Alatsinainy. ||| StormCarib reports Monday flights out of St. Thomas have been canceled.
Ao amin'ny lahatsoratra iray hafa izy dia mampiakatra horonatsary ary mitatitra: ||| In another post, he uploads a video still and reports:
Nihaniadana ny fandehan'i Earl tamin'ny alina, ka nampihemotra tokony ho 12ora eo ho eo ny fahatongavany. ||| Earl slowed its forward motion overnight, delaying the arrival of its fury about 12 hours.
Milaza ny foibem-pirenena misahana ny rivodoza fa handalo any avaratra-atsinanan'i St.John ny ivon'ny rivodoza amin'ny 6ora hariva any ho any. ||| Now the National Hurricane Center says the center of the storm will pass northeast of St. John at about 6 p.m.
Nitsahatra tsy nitati-baovao ny St. John Spicecam tamin'ny 7ora maraina tany ho any. ||| The St. John Spicecam quit transmitting at about 7 a.m.

Manambara ny fanampim-baovao taorian'io fa "tsy misy raisina ny "quai" ao amin'ny helodranon'i Cruz." ||| A further update reveals that the "dingy dock in Cruz Bay's a goner".
Mandritra izany, ny mpitoraka blaogy namana Live De Life dia mikarakara fitaovana ary miomana araka izay azo atao amin'ny fahatongavan'i Earl, ka mitatitra: ||| Meanwhile, fellow blogger Live De Life is battening down the hatches and preparing as best as possible for Earl's arrival, reporting:

Rivotra mahery sy orana mivatravatra. ||| Gusts of wind and hard rain.
Tapatapaka ny herinaratra. ||| Power keeps going on and off.

Hanome fanampim-baovao ny Global Voices rehefa mivoaka izany. ||| Global Voices will post more storm updates as they become available.
Hisy e-varotra ve eto Afrika? ||| Is there a future for e-commerce in Africa?
Nahaliana ny adi-hevitra momba ny ho avin'ny e-varotra eto Afrika tamin'iny herinandro lasa iny. ||| The past week turned out to one that came with an interesting debate online about the prospects of e-commerce in Africa.
Natomboky Oluniyi David Ajao tamin'ny lazan'ny e-gold (vola an-tsoratra manana sandam-bolamena) ao Nigéria ny resaka. ||| Oluniyi David Ajao started with throwing an insight into the popularity of e-gold (a digital gold currency) in Nigeria.
Mety hanjohy io fahombiazana io koa ny fandoavam-bola amin'ny alalan'ny karatra hafa eto Afrika: Nahoana no tena tiam-bahoaka ny e-gold ao Nigéria? ||| Other online payment systems might indeed follow the same growth pattern, in Africa: Why is e-gold popular in Nigeria?
Mihamisongadina ny isan'ny Nizeriana miditra amin'ny ty sy nday ifanaovan'izao tontolo izao amin'ny alalan'ny World Wide Web. ||| Not a few Nigerians take part in global commerce via the World Wide Web.
Araka an'Internet World Stats dia mahatratra 5.000.000 ny isan'ny mpanovo ny siniben-tserasera ao Nizeria. ||| According to Internet World Stats, there are about 5 million Internet users in Nigeria.
Ny 03.57% monja amin'ny mponina mahatratra 140.000.000 izany (fanisana ofisialy taona 2007). ||| This is only 3.57% of Nigeria's 140 million people (2007 official census).
ny fandoavam-bola an-tserasera ireo mpanovo siniben-tserasera ireo hahamora ny e-varotra ifanaovana amin'ny hafa. ||| These people need to make payment online to facilitate their participation in e-commerce.
Ankoatra ny mividy sy mivarotra an-tserasera, dia maro koa ny mpametra-bola any amin'ny fifanakalozana sy ny tsenam-bola any ivelany, forex ohatra, any amin'ny fametrahana sy fampindramam-bola ahazoana zanabola midangana ary amin'ny fikirakirana ny haivarotra amin'ny ambaratongan-dingana samihafa. ||| Aside buying and selling online, others invest in foreign stock markets, foreign currency market, High Yield Investment Programs, Multi-Level Marketing schemes etc.
Avoitran'i Erik Hersman mibilaogy ao amin'ny thought leader kosa ny heveriny ho olana manakana ny fandrosoan'ny e-varotra eto Afrika – Afrika atsimo indrindra indrindra: ny olana amin'ny fandoavam-bola an-tserasera sy ny e-varotra eto Afrika: ||| Erik Hersman blogging for Thought Leader, highlighted what he saw to be t he problems with participating in e-commerce, from Africa - especially South Africa: The problem with e-commerce and online payments in Africa.
Ny fahabangan'ny fomba fandoavam-bola an-tserasera matotra eto Afrika no mampifintina ny e-varotra Afrikana, ary tsy tafala amin'izany i Afrika Atsimo. ||| A lack of true online payment options is crippling African e-commerce, and South Africa is no exception.
Ny tsy fahazoana manaraka ny fomba fandoavam-bola ifanaovan'izao tontolo izao rehefa mividy zavatra na manao fifanarahan'asa no midika fa betsaka ny fandraharahana azo atao tsy vonona ho an'ny mpivarotra eto Afrika. ||| The inability to accept payments for products and services on equal footing with the rest of the world means that many viable business options are not available for merchants in Africa.
Ny ambiny kely isafidianana ho amin'ny e-varotra eto Afrika kosa dia mbola mila fahazaram-pandraharahana, fandanian-karena ary famolahana kely. ||| The few options there are for African e-commerce take a certain amount of business history, wealth or contortions to attain.
Nanome tolo-kevitra vitsivitsy i Erik Hersman any amin'ny faran'ny lahatsorany: ||| Erik Hersman makes some suggestion towards the end of his blog post:
Itovizana ny hevitra fa ny famahana olana ho an'i Afrika dia mahaleo tena manoloana ny banky sy ny mpanera hafa. ||| I would submit that the solution for Africa needs to be bank and carrier agnostic.
Noho izany, efa manomboka mipoitra ireo vahaolana azo heverina, saingy mbola tsy nisy nahita kosa ny valiny tena mahafa-po hahamatotra ny e-varotra ho an'i Afrika. ||| So, the beginnings of possible solutions are being seen, but no one has created the ultimate e-commerce option for Africa.
Mazava loatra fa raha ahafahana manaporofo ny fisiantsika sy ny orinasantsika eto Afrika ny fampiasana ny PayPal dia mety handraoka nyankamaroan'ny fifanaraham-barotra an-tserasera anatin'ny fotoana fohy monja. ||| Of course, if PayPal were to just allow us all to go through a little more stringent verification to ensure that we are real people with real businesses in Africa, then it would scoop up most of the online business overnight.
Fa nahazo setriny avy amin'i Oluniyi David Ajao avy hatrany izy izay milaza fa azo heverina ihany eto Afrika ny mifampiraharaha amin'ny alalan'ny e-varotra amin'izao fotoana izao: Azo atao ve ny manangana tambazotra iraisan'ny Afrikana amin'ny e-varotra? ||| However, he got a direct response from Oluniyi David Ajao who is suggesting that it is indeed possible to participate to some extent in e-commerce from Africa, today: Is a common African e-commerce platform possible?
Ny ambiny kely isafidianana ho amin'ny e-varotra eto Afrika kosa dia mbola mila fahazaram-pandraharahana, fandanian-karena ary famolahana kely. ||| The few options there are for African e-commerce take a certain amount of business history, wealth or contortions to attain.
Marina ihany izany fa amin'ny lafiny sasany. ||| These are also true, but only to some extent.
Ny ao an-tsain'i Erik Hersman amin'izany resaka izany dia ny fomba fandoavam-bola mahazatra amin'ny alalan'ny karatra famantarana ny vola ampelantanana na ny trosa. ||| Erik Hersman obviously had the mainstream payment systems that evolve around the major credit/debit card brands in mind.
Fa na dia amin'ny alalan'ny mastercard sy Visa fotsiny ihany anie dia efa ahafahan'ny mpanao ty sy nday Afrikana miditra an-tsehatra tanteraka amin'ny sehatry ny e-varotra e. ||| But even with only MasterCard and Visa in mind, it is still possible for an African merchant to participate fully in the global e-commerce arena.
Notanisainy amin'izay ary hazavainy ireo fomba fandoavam-bola an-tserasera ahafahana mandray anjara amin'ny e-varotra na aiza na aiza eto Afrika. ||| He goes on to list and explain some online payment methods that can enable full e-commerce participation from virtually any African country.
Mino aho noho ireo nosoratako ireo fa afaka miantsena tsara amin'ny alalan'ny e-varotra ny mponina eto Afrika na dia izao ankehitriny izao aza! ||| I believe I have proved beyond reasonable doubt that residents of Africa can indeed participate in global e-commerce, even today!
Azoko tsara ny eritreritrao Atoa Erik Hersman saingy sarotra tanterahina ny fananana tambazotrana e-varotra iraisan'ny Afrikana raha tsy efa nanana fivondronana ekonomika matotra ny firenena afrikana. ||| I fully understand the angle you are pushing - Erik Hersman - but I believe your model of an African e-commerce platform would only be feasible, if African countries had a tight economic union.
Fivondronana manana fitsipi-pitantanam-bola iraisana sy politika ekonomika iraisana. ||| A union with common financial regulations and common economic policies.
Ny Vondrona Eoropeana no ohatra mahazatra amin'izany saingy tsy izany aloha no misy izao. ||| The European Union is a classic example. As of today, this is not the case.
Na ny vondrom-paritra toy ny COMESA aza dia tsy manana izay firaisana ekonomika izay na dia misy aza ny fiezahana ho amin'izany. ||| Not even the regional blocks (at least I am very sure about ECOWAS) are united economically though efforts are being made in this direction.
Mahafantatra ohatra roa azo alain-tahaka amin'ilay e-varotra lazainao aho izay misy any Eoropa no mety tsara ho an'ny Eoropeana: Moneybookers sy ChronoPay. ||| I know of two examples of your e-commerce model that already exist in Europe and work well for Europeans: Moneybookers and ChronoPay.
Azo tanterahina ve ny tambazotrana e-varotra afrikana? ||| Is African e-commerce platform possible?
Saingy tsy maintsy mikambana aloha ny firenena afrikana hahatontosa izany.Izay no ihavian'ny zavatra hafa. ||| However, Africa countries need to unite for this to be possible. Every other thing shall follow.
Niditra tanaty resaka iGrandiose Parlor nanontany hoe: Azo tanterahina eto Afrika ve ny e-varotra ankinina amin'ny fampiasana finday? ||| Grandiose Parlor joined the conversation by asking: Could Airtime Driven e-Commerce Work in Africa?
Maro ny adi-hevitra panafrikana mitovitovy amin'izay ifanaovan'i Erik sy David any amin'ny haino aman-jery sy any amin'ny blaogy, saingy hitako fa raha jerena ny lafiny sosialy sy ekonomika ary politika misy eto amin'ny kontinanta –ankoatra ny fananany manam-pahaizana, dia maro amin'ireny reska ireny no maty an-karanany: maro dia maro ny singa mibahana ka manasarotra loatra ny fanatontosana hevitra panafrikana, raha tsy hoe tsy azo atao mihitsy aza izany. ||| There are similar Pan-African driven discussions as Erik-David's debate on the blogosphere and mainstream media, but I feel given the socio-economic and political state of the continent - beyond their intellectual appeal, many of those conversations are dead on arrival: There are just too many limiting factors that make the realization of the vast majority of Pan-African concepts too difficult - if not impossible.
Aoka isika tsy hamita-tena, hevitra lehibe sy manintona ny panafrikanisma (fitambaran'ny firenena afrikana hiray volo)- fa iza moa tsy te-hifandraharaha amin'ny kaontinanta lehibe faharoa sy faharoa be mponina indrindra eto an-tany? ||| Don't get me wrong, Pan-Africanism is a great and sweet concept - who wouldn't want to have access to the second-largest and second most-populous continent in the world?
Na dia eto Nizeria firenena mahazatra ahy indrindra, sy ny manodidina azy akaiky aza, zana-paritry Afrika andrefana dia mbola sarotra ny manangana fomba fandoavam-bola « mahaleo tena miohatra amin'ny banky sy mpanera hafa » saingy mety ho avy izany sady hahomby. ||| Even in Nigeria - a country I'm most familiar with, and it's immediate extension, the West African subregion - the creation of an online payment system that is "bank and carrier agnostic" is still difficult but carries a better chance of happening and succeeding.
Nanontany avy eo i Grandiose Parlor: ||| Grandiose Parlor has this to ask:
Ny mahazatra ny ankamaroan'ny Nizeriana hitako – eny fa na dia ireo tsy mpandoa hetra aza – dia ny fividianana fahana ho amin'ny finday. ||| One "common denominator" characteristic of most Nigerians - including those in the informal economy - that I've discovered is that they all purchase airtime minutes.
Ara-dalàna amin'ny takalo ara-barotra an-tserasera sy ny e-varotra ve ny halavan'ora azo iantsoana amin'ireny fahana finday ireny? ||| Could those minutes be used somehow as legal tender for online transactions and e-commerce?
Anatin'ny tsenam-barotry Afrika an-tserasera ve ianao? ||| Are you based in an online merchant based in Africa?

andeha ary hidinika amin'ny fametrahanao ny hevitrao. ||| Join the conversation by posting your comments.
Japan: Hadisoana ve ny mihanika ny havoanan'i Fuji amin'ny tànam-polo? ||| Japan: Is it wrong to climb Mount Fuji empty-handed?
Raha misy hazo midaraboka any an'àla nefa tsy misy olona afaka handre izany eo amin'ny manodidina eo, dia ho olana ve raha mitalakotrokotroka na tsia izany arakarak'izay nanaovan'ilay hazo azy teo? ||| If a tree falls in a forest and no one is around to hear it, does it matter if it made a sound or not when the tree was doing its own thing?
