2 Jolay, 21:45 - Lehilahy iray niantso ny polisy avy ao amin'ny Fiantsonanan Fahavalo ao amin'ny Havoanan'i Fuji (haavo: 3,250 metatra), nilaza hoe "Eo ampihanihana ny havoanan'i Fuji aho nefa tsy nitondra jiro ho fitsilovana. ||| July 2nd, 21:45 - A man called the police from the Eight Station on Mount Fuji (altitude: 3,250 meters), saying "I'm climbing Mount Fuji but didn't come with a flashlight.
Maizina be tsy ahitàna ny làlana aty ka matahotra aho. ||| It's too dark to see the road and I'm scared.
Mpamonjy voina enina avy ao amin'ny Prefektioran'ny polisy ao an-tanànan'i Fujinomiya Shizuoka no nanainga tokony ho tamin'ny 11:30 alina ka namonjy ilay lehilahy efa tafanika tany amin'ny Fiantsonana Fahaenina (Sixth Station) (haavo: 2,490 metatra) tany samirery. ||| Six mountain rescue workers from the Fujinomiya Precinct of Shizuoka Prefecture Police headed out around 23:30 and rescued the man who had climbed down to the Sixth Station (altitude: 2,490 meters) by himself.
Tsy naninona ralehilahy. ||| The man had no injuries.
Araka ny filàzan'ny tao an-tanàna, pachinko 22 taona izy ary mpiasa amina toeram-pikolokoloana vatana avy any Nakano Ward ao Tokyo. ||| According to the Precinct, he is a 22 year old pachinko parlor worker from Nakano Ward in Tokyo.
Teo amin'ny Fiantsonana Fahadimy, tokony ho tamin'ny 5:00 hariva teo ranamana no nanomboka nihanika ny Havoanan'i Fuji nanàraka ny Soritra Fujinomiya. ||| He had started climbing Mount Fuji from the Fifth Station on the Fujinomiya Course around 17:00.
Nony tonga teo amin'ny Fiantsonana Fahasivy (haavo: 3,460 meters), tapa-kevitra ny hiato ranamana ary nanomboka nidina talohan'ny niantsoany vonjy tamin'ny alàlan'ny findainy rehefa nanomboka tonga ny haizina. ||| Upon reaching the Ninth Station (altitude: 3,460 meters), he gave up and began to descend before calling for help with his cell phone when it became dark.
Lobaka lava tànana, jeans ary kiraro sneakers (karazana tennis) no nanaovan-dranamana. ||| The man was wearing a long sleeved shirt, jeans, and sneakers.
Tsy nisy na inona na inona teny an-tànany; tsy nitondra sakafo na fitaovana koa izy. ||| He was empty-handed; he wasn't carrying any food or equipment.
Nanomboka tamin'ny 1 Jolay ny fotoam-pianihana ny Havoanan'i Fuji nefa ny maripàna eny akaikin'ny Fiantsonana Fahaenina dia manodidina ny 2°C. ||| The climbing season for Mount Fuji started on July 1st but the temperature around the Sixth Station is 2 degrees Celcius.
Tsy mbola nanana traikefa amin'izay fihanihana havoana akory ranamana ary dia tena feno fialan-tsiny tokoa, hoy izy "Monkon-doha fotsiny no nanombohako nihanika". ||| The man had no climbing experience and was apologetic, saying "I started climbing on a whim".
Hoy ny tao amin'ny Tànana hoe, "Fihetsika iray tsy voahevitra monja dia mety resaka ho velona sa ho faty no tohiny. ||| The Precinct stated, "One wrong step and it would have been a matter of life and death.
Iangavianay ny tsirairay mba ho ampy fiomanana tsara eo am-pahatongavana, eny fa na dia amin'ny fihanihana tendrombohitra rehefa lohataona aza. ||| We'd like everyone to come fully prepared, even for summer mountains.
Jereo ity sary ity hahitàna ny haavon'ny Fiantsonana tsirairay ao anatin'ilay lahatsoratra" Tari-dàlana iray ho fihanihana ny Havoanan'i Fuji sy hankafizana ilay Reny Natiora" avy amin'ny Sampan-draharaha Japoney misahana ny Fizahantany. ||| View this graph for a visualization of the altitude of each Station in the article "A guide for climbing Mount Fuji and enjoying Mother Nature" from the Japan National Tourism Organization.
Manohy manazàva ny fomba fijeriny i Zope taorian'ilay ampahan-dahatsoratra. ||| Mojix goes on to explain his viewpoint after the excerpt.
Amina mpihanika efa voky fahalalàna, ny fanandràmana hianika ny Havoanan'i Fuji nefa tsy mivatsy fitaovana dia tena hadalàna. ||| To an experienced climber, attempting Mount Fuji without any gear is ridiculous.
Mety hilaza izy ireo hoe, "Aza hamaivanina ny fihanihana tendrombohitra!". ||| They might say, "Don't underestimate mountain climbing!"
Na Havoanan'i Fuji io na ny Tendrontany Atsimo aza, heveriko fa zava-dehibe mipetraka amin'ny tsirairay ny fanapahan-kevitra tokony horaisiny. ||| Be it Mount Fuji or the South Pole however, I think that the decision is fundamentally one that should be left to the individual.
Tena ilokàko fa be ny olona mihanika tanam-polo ny Havoanan'i Fuji. ||| I bet there are lots of folks that climb Mount Fuji empty-handed.
Lasa resa-be anaty fampahalalam-baovao toy izao ilay izy rehefa misy tsy fetezan-javatra mitranga saingy mety ho betsaka ny olona no tafaverina tsy misy maratra. ||| It becomes newsworthy like this when an incident occurs but many people probably return unharmed.
Angamba aza izy ireny mbola miverina mihevitra hoe, "Oh, tena mora be ilay izy teo satria tsy nitondra na inona na inona aho". ||| Perhaps they even come back thinking, "Oh, that was much easier because I wasn't carrying anything".
Amin'izao fotoana, ny olana dia rehefa very na maty ny olona iray. ||| Now, the problem is when a person gets lost or almost dies.
Mila famonjena izy ireo amin'izay fotoana, izay miteraka fandaniana ho an'ny fiarahamonina amin'ny ankapobeny. ||| They then require rescue, which incurs a cost to society in general.
Na dia tsy nisy ezaka famonjena natao aza ka maty any ry zareo, tsy azo avela any an-tampon-tendrombohitra any mihitsy ny faty. ||| Even if a rescue attempt isn't made and they perish, a dead body can't just be left up in the mountains.
Enta-mavesatra iray izany ary tsy maintsy aloan'ny fiarahamonina ny lany aminy. ||| It's a burden either way and society foots the bill.
Tsy ny mikasika ny fihanihana ny Havoanan'ny Fuji tsy miaraka amina fitaovana loatra no resaka. ||| The issue isn't about climbing Mount Fuji without equipment.
Ny resaka dia mikasika ny "tsy fahafahana mandray andraikitra feno amin'izay ataon'ny tsirairay" sy ny "fanomezana olana ho an'ny fiarahamonina" isak'izay misy zava-mitranga. ||| It's about "not being able to take full responsibility of one's actions" and "causing problems to society" when something happens.
Amin'ny lafiny iray, raha afaka mandray andraikitra feno ny olona iray ka tsy miteraka olana ho an'ny fiarahamonina, tsy misy zavatra tokony horaràna mihitsy, eny fa na dia izay fikasana faran'izay adala indrindra aza. ||| On the other hand, if a person can take full responsibility and not cause problems, nothing should be prohibited, not even the most foolish undertaking.
Ilay lehilahy navotana dia nofaritana ho pachinko 22 taona ary mpiasa amina toeram-pikolokoloana vatana avy any Nakano Ward". ||| The rescued man was purposely described as being "a 22 year old pachinko parlor worker from Nakano Ward".
Ny teny nisoratra teo amin'ny fitafiany miaraka amin'ny fanamarihana hoe "tsy mitondra na sakafo na fitaovana" dia mahatonga ny mpamaky hanana eritreritra fa olona tsy mivaky loha, ary angamba aza tsy mitandrina, ilay akama. ||| The description of his outfit with the comment "not carrying neither food nor equipment" leaves the reader with the impression that he is a carefree, perhaps even reckless, fellow.
Mba saino kely ange e, marina mafy! ||| Think about it, though!
Very ny olona rehefa ho very ary maty rehefa ho faty... na dia ireo manampahefana matanjaka sy ireo mpitàna birao ambony aza, ary na dia nitondra fitaovana feno aza. ||| People will get lost when they get lost and die when they die... even powerful executives and high level bureaucrats, and even in full gear.
Raha ny marina, ireo manana traikefa no azo lazaina ho mananton-doza kokoa noho ny fitokisan-tena diso toerana (Avy amin'ny mpandika: toy ilay ohapitenenana Malagasy hoe 'Izay mahay milomano ihany no maty an-drano'). ||| In fact, it could be said that an experienced person might be more at risk because of false confidence.
Izay tena tiana havoitra amin'izy ity dia hoe ny karazan-dahatsoratra toy itony dia iray amin'ireo endrika "filazàna ho tombontsoam-bahoaka". ||| What it boils down to is that this type of article is one form of "public service announcement".
Raha marobe ny olona mety hanomboka hihanika ny Havoanan'i Fuji nefa tsy hivatsy fitaovana sahaza akory, be ny mety ho fitomboan'ny fisavoritahana ary ny vidin'ny asa famonjena koa hidangana. ||| If more people start climbing Mount Fuji without the proper equipment, the chance of trouble increases and the cost of rescue missions starts to pile up.
Noho izany, milaza amintsika ry zareo mba ho ampy fitaovana tsara rehefa hihanika ny Havoanan'i Fuji. ||| So, they tell us to be properly equipped when climbing Mount Fuji.
Sahala amin'ireny Kilasy fampianarana Fitondrantena/Môraly any amin'ny Ambaratonga Fototra ireny ilay izy, saingy mandritry ny taona sy ampiasàna ny fampahalalam-baovao ho an'ny daholobe. ||| It's like those Moral Education classes in elementary school, but all throughout the year and utilizing the mass media.
Tsy dia hanohina loatra ny fahalalahantsika izay fandraràna iray atao mikasika ny fihanihana ny Havoanan'i Fuji tsy mitondra fitaovana. ||| A prohibition to climb Mount Fuji without equipment doesn't really affect our freedom.
Na izany aza, goavana kosa ny fiantraikany rehefa ny famerana ny famokarana menaka fanosotra Konjac no lohahevitra, na fivarotana fanafody amin'ny alalan'ny aterineto, fampiasàna mpiasa an-tselika, na fanapahana fifanarahana arak'asa. ||| However, the influence is more widespread when the topic is restriction on Konjac jelly manufacturing, selling medicine online, hiring temp workers, or terminating employment contracts.
Ny toerana rasin'ny governemanta matetika dia ny fanomezana vahana ny karazana fameperana henjana amin'ny lohahevitra toy ireny. ||| The government's position is usually to promote stricter restrictions for these kinds of topics.
Vokatr'izany, izay mety ho vaovao mifangaro tsirona "Filazàna ho an'ny tombontsoam-bahoaka" dia lasa maka endrika "loza mitatao satria tsy misy mihitsy fameperana atao eo an-toerana." ||| Therefore, any news with a "public service announcement" flavor takes the angle of "Disasters occur because there are no restrictions in place."
Raha manao lalàna isika, azontsika atao ny misoroka ireny loza ireny. ||| If we make rules, we can prevent these disasters.
Ny lafy ratsiny, ny sandany, na ny tsy ara-drariny mety haterak'ireny didy fanapahana ireny dia tsy mahazo fankasitrahana mihitsy. ||| The disadvantages, cost, or unfairness that would arise from such rules do not receive any mention.
Raha tsy azo lavina fa nanao zavatra kidaladala ilay rangahy, ny fitanisana teboka iray ilazàna fa izy dia "pachinko 22 taona miasa amina toeram-pikolokoloana vatana iray" dia manome endrika filazàna tolo-barotra iray tsara ketrika. ||| While there's no denying that the man took a foolhardy action, making a point of mentioning that he was "a 22 year old pachinko parlor worker" gives off the air of a carefully designed public service announcement.
Raha olona nanana ny toerany na mpiasa birao ambony izy, tena misalasala aho raha hoe hahataitra ireo mpanely vaovao izany. ||| Had the man been an executive or high ranking bureaucrat, I very much doubt that this would have hit the news at all.
Isaorana i Ziggy Okugawa tamin'ny fanampiany tamin'ny fandikàna. ||| Thanks to Ziggy Okugawa for helping with the translation.
Chili: Tahotra Tsunami tany amin'ny nosin'i Paska ||| Chile: Tsunami Scare on Easter Island
Fanta-daza noho ireo sary sokitra Polyneziana izay manintona mpizahantany manerantany ny Nosin'ny Paska. ||| Easter Island is well-known for its Polynesian monumental statues that draw tourists from around the globe.
Fantatra amin'ny anarana napetraky ny mponina ao ho Rapa Nui moa ity anatin'ny zaratanin'i Chili ity, izay any amin'ny 3500 km andrefan'ny kaontinantan'i Amerika atsimo ary manana mponina maharitra manakaiky ny 5000. ||| This Chilean territory, also known by its native name of Rapa Nui, lies 3500 km west of the South American continent and has a permanent population of close to 5,000.
Taorian'ny horohorontanin'ny 27 febroary moa dia niahiahy be ihany noho ny fanairana ny amin'izay mety hisian'ny tsunami ny mponina sy ny mpizahantany. ||| During the aftermath of the February 27 earthquake, there was also great concern for local residents and visiting tourists because of the tsunami warning.
Teo ampitsidihana ny Nosin'ny Paska ilay Meksikana José Alberto Castro raha nitranga ny horohorontany ary navoaka ny loza fanairana momba ny tsunami. ||| Mexican José Alberto Castro was visiting Easter Island when the earthquake struck and when the tsunami warning was issued.
Nampiasa ny Twitter ny tenany hahalalana vaovao tamin'izay nitranga tany amin'ny tanibe sy hampahalala ny namany ny zaa-misy eo am-pitendreny (sa atao hoe eo am-panoratany ihany?) ||| He used Twitter to access information on what has happening back on the mainland and to inform friends about the current situation.
Toa hoe hosintonin'izy ireo izahay, mety hisy ny onja vaventy, hampahafantariko ihany ianareo. ||| It looks like they will evacuate us, they are expecting large waves, I'll let you know.
Nomena baiko hiala ny morondranomasina avokoa na ny mponina na ny mpizahantany ka hamonjy ny faritra avo. ||| Residents and tourists were ordered to evacuate coastal areas and were moved to higher ground.
Rehefa lany moa ny fotoana mety ho nisian'ny tsunami ka tsy nisy loatra ny tena fahasimbana, dia nanapika tity sarin'ny volana feno niteronterona tambonin'ny nosy ity izy ka nanoratra hoe, "androany, taorian'ny fihazohazoana, dia nanome volana feno ho anay i Rapa Nui." ||| When the tsunami warning had expired without any serious damage, he took this photograph of the full moon over the island and writes, "today, after so much uncertainty, Rapa Nui gives us this moon".
Tao amin'ny Nosin'ny Paska ny rahalahin'i José Luis Tapia raha nitranga ilay horohontany. ||| The brother of José Luis Tapia was on Easter Island when the earthquake hit.
Nosokafan'i Tapia ny kaonty Twitter-ny taorian'ny horohorontany hifanakalozany vaovao hamantarany izay fizotry ny toe-draharaha any amin'ny Nosin'i Paska. ||| Tapia opened his Twitter account during the earthquake repercussions to exchange information regarding the situation on Easter Island.
Taorian'ny niantsoany ny rahalahiny, dia nozarainy ny vaovao izay nangoniny: ||| After phoning his brother, he shared the information that he gathered:
vao avy niantso ny rahalahiko any amin'ny Nosin'i Paska ka mbola milamina tsara avokoa ny zava-drehetra, araka ny nolazain'izy ireo dia tsy hisy zotram-piaramanidina mandritra ny 5 andro. ||| just finished talking with my brother on Easter Island and everything is normal, according to them there won't be any flights for the next 5 days.
Maivana ihany ilay tsunami tao amin'ny faritr'i Tongariki tokony ho tamin'ny 9 maraina tany amin'ny Nosin'i Paska fa tsy dia nisy loatra ny fahavoazana na faharatrana goavana. ||| on Easter Island, there was a mild tsunami in the area of Tongariki around 9 a.m., but there was no damage or injuries.
Nanokatra kaonty Twitter taorin'ny hovitry ny tany ihany koa i Alejandro Tucki. ||| Alejandro Tucki also opened a Twitter account post-earthquake.
Noraisiny ity sary tao atsinanan'ny nosy izay nampiseho faharavana rindrim-bato izay ravan'ny onja tany amin'ny faritra tsy misy mponina: ||| He took the following photo on Easter Island that shows a stone wall that was damaged by the waves in an unpopulated area:
Saripikan'ny ridrim-bato rava tany atsinanan'ny nosy nopihan'i Alejandro Tucki ||| Photo of damaged stone wall on Easter Island by Alejandro Tucki
Chiliana hafa, Daniel Sovino, izay tany amin'ny nosy ihany koa rehefa nolazaina ny fanairana mety hisian'ny tsunami no nanoratra fa milamina tsara ny zava-drehetra, saingy tsy nisy tsy fahataitairana izany: ||| Another Chilean who was on the island when the tsunami warning was announced, Daniel Sovino also writes that everything is fine, but not without alarm:
Milamina tsara avokoa ny manodidina eto, ankoatra ilay fifohazana niaraka tamin'ny fialana tsunami, maivamaivana noho ny tany amin'ny tanibe ihany ny nanjo anay.... ||| everything fine around here, other than the scare of waking up with the tsunami evacuation, we got off lighter than the continent....
Miharatsy ny fanabeazana any Kazakhstan ||| Grimaces of education in Kazakhstan
Ny 01 hatramin'ny 10 jona no niatrika ny fanadinana famaranana ireo mpianatry ny ambaratonga faharoa any Kazakhstan-fanadinana atrehan'ny mpianatra voalohany kanefa manan-danja eo amin'ny fiainany. ||| From June 01 to June 10 school graduates in Kazakhstan were undergoing Unified National Test - the first and one of the most important tests in their lives.
Ny salanisa ankapoben'ny mpanala fanadinana, araka ny nosoratan'i Zara, mpitoraka bilaogy iray, dia 74.9, izany hoe nitombo isa 7 raha oharina amin'ny teo aloha. ||| As Zara, one of our bloggers, writes, the average test result has been 74.9 points, which is 7 points higher than the one for the last year.
Niakatra ho 54.5% ny salan'isa ankapoben'ny mpianatra raha 36% izany tamin'ny taon-dasa. ||| The number of graduates with excellent marks, who confirmed their knowledge, has increased from 36% in the last year to 54.5%.
Amin'ny ankapobeny dia nihatsara ny vokatra raha oharina tamin'ny taona lasa rehetra, araka ny fanamarinany. ||| "On the whole, the situation with UNT results over the country is more optimistic comparing to the previous years", she notes.
Milaza ny tarehimarika azony i Sadenova, araka ny antontan'isa eo am-pelantanany, ary nanamarika: ||| Sadenova gives her own calculations, based on the officially stated figures, and her conclusions are far less optimistic:
"Raha jerena ny vokatra tamin'ity taona 2009 ity dia mpiadina 1 amin'ny 7 no tsy nahazo isa 45, 1 amin'ny 9 no nahazo isa mihoatra ny 100 ary 1 amin'ny 13 500 no nahatratra ny isa ambony indrindra 125. ||| Analisys of UNT-2009 results shows that every 7th school graduate hasn't scored the threshold of 45 points, every 9th school graduate scored over 100 points, and only 1 school graduate out of 13,500 scored the maximum of 125 points.
Milaza kosa i Lord-Fame fa nisy ny hosoka nandritra ny fanadinana. ||| And lord-fame tells about rumored violations during the test.
Tsy misy dikany ny fandraràna ny fitondrana finday raha ampitahana amin'izao manaraka izao: ||| Crib notes and mobile telephones used by the graduates are nothing, comparing to what is described below:
300 dôlara-izay no vola aloa amin'ireo mpiasan'ny fampianarana tsy hahatratrarana finday any am-pelantanan'ny mpianatra iray manala fanadinana. ||| $300 - is the price fixed by local level some education officials and their cronies for not noticing a mobile telephone in the hands of a graduate passing the test.
Toy izany ihany koa ny vola aloa any amin'ny faritany raha somary lafolafo kosa any Almaty sy Astana... Raha mandoa 1000 dôlara mantsy ianao dia mahazo matoky fa atoron'ny mpampianatra raha toa ka misy fanontaniana sarotra. ||| This price is valid for the provinces, and it's more expensive in Almaty and Astana. By paying $1000 you can be sure that your child will get teacher's help in case of a difficult question.
Syria: Fanoherana ny Kabarin'ny Filoha Assad ||| Syria: Reactions to President Assad's Speech
Ity lahatsoratra ity dia fitantarana manokana ataonay momba ny Fihetsiketsehana tao Syria taona 2011. ||| This post is part of our special coverage Syria Protests 2011.
Nanao kabary tamin'ireo solombavambahoaka Syriana ihany ny Filoha Bashar Al Assad tamin'ny Alarobia 30 Martsa rehefa niandry ela sy nangataka andro maromaro. ||| President Bashar Al Assad finally made a speech on Wednesday 30 March, 2011, at the Syrian Parliament after days of postponement and anticipation.
Niarahaba azy tamin'ny alalan'ny tehaka mirefodrefotra sy horakoraka ireo solombavahoaka tamin'ny fahatongavany tao, ary matetika ny kabary nataony no notapahan'ny solombavambahoaka iray manao tononkalo fiderana. ||| The president's arrival at the Parliament was met with thundering applause and chanting by the Members of Parliament, and his speech was often interrupted by an MP reciting poems of praise.
Tabilao mampiseho ny Filoha Syriana Bashar Al Assad, Jolay 2010. ||| Billboard showing Syrian President President Bashar Al Assad, July 2010.
Tsy tsara ny nandraisan'ireo mpampiasa Twitter izany. ||| Twitter users did not receive this well.
Tian'ny vahoaka ho ravàna ny antenimieram-pirenena ||| The people want to bring down the Parliament
Tian'ny vahoaka ho ravàna ny fihatsarahambelatsihy ||| The People want to bring down hypocrisy
Wael Alwani, Syriana mpianatra ao Arabia Saodita dia nilaza hoe: ||| Wael Alwani, a Syrian student in Saudi chimes in:
Indrisy, mahamenatra ahy ireto solombavambahoaka ireto... Syriana aho ary tsy mahasolo tena ahy ireo solombavambahoaka ireo...Solombavambahoaka mpihatsaravelatsihy ||| Unfortunately I feel disgraced by this Parliament... I'm Syrian and this Parliament doesn't represent me... Hypocrisy Parliament
Ayman, Syriana mpila ravinahitra, dia nanambara ny fanantenany voalohany momba ny fanovàna nandrasana: ||| Ayman, a Syrian expat, announced his first hope for the anticipated reforms:
Manantena aho ny fanovàna dia hanomboka amin'ny fandroahana ireo solombavambahoaka manorisory ireo ||| I hope reforms start with sacking such an embarrassing Parliament
Sasa, Sirana mpitoraka bilaogy sady mpampiasa twtter dia nanolotra ny sosokeviny ho fanatsarana ny toe-draharaha: ||| Syrian blogger and twitter user Sasa offered suggestions to improve the situation:
zavatra 4 no tokonyh atao: ajanony ny antsoantso, AJANONY, ajanony ny fiampangana ny Al Jazeera, Ajanony ny fiampangàna ireo vahiny. ||| 4 things: Stop chanting, STOP, stop blaming Al Jazeera, stop blaming foreigners.
Shadi Hamid ni- tweet ampahany fohifohy tamin'ny kabarin'i Assad ho an'ireo izay tsy naheno izany: Famerenana fohifohy ny kabarin'i Bachar: fanovàna angamba. ||| Shadi Hamid tweets a short version of Assad's speech for those who missed it:
Fitondrana iray manohitra ny fanovàna, andraikitsika no manapa-kevitra amin'izany, amin'ny Zoma, fa tsy anatin'ny 10 taona araka ny nolazainy! ||| A regime of resistance against reform, it's our responsibility to fix it, on Friday, not within 10 years like he's said!
Satria nifarana tsy dia nisy filazana fanovana azo tsapani-tanana ny kabary, dia nanomboka naneho ny hatezerany sy ny hadisoam-panantenana ireo mpampiasa Twitter. ||| And as the speech ended without offering any tangible reforms, Twitter users proceeded to express their frustrations and disappointment.
Marina ry Bashar tsy tena nihoatra noho izay nandrasana no nataona. ||| Really Bashar you exceeded all expectations.
Manantena izahay fa hanipy ati-mofo sy fanovàna tsy misy dikany aty aminay ianao, hay ny hany mba nanananao dia kabary tsy misy votoatiny akory!!! ||| We expected that you would throw us scraps and meaningless reforms, but all you had was a hollow speech!!!
Nizara ny fihetsehampo ankapoben'ireo vahoaka izay nanaraka ny kabary i Dina Jaffary, nilaza izy fa: ||| Dina Jaffary agrees with the general sentiment of people who watched the speech, she said:
mahagaga tokoa, ny kabary iray izay tokony ho lafatra indrindra amin'ireo kabariny tsara indrindra no tena ratsy indrindra... ||| surprisingly the one speech that should have been perfect among all his great speeches is the only bad one...
Rehareha ho ahy lalandava ny fireneko, raha tsy toy izany kosa ireo mpitondra azy. ||| My Country always makes me proud, especially when their leaders don't.
Leo i RevolutionistSY, ni-tweet izy hoe: ||| RevolutionistSY was fed up, he tweeted:
O Ry zalahy, andeha hihaino an'i Samih Shqeir aho.. O Mahamenatra, O Mahamenatra.. Leo io olona tsy misy ilàna azy io aho.. afaka hifoha ho an'ny tanindrazana ve ianao? ||| Guys I'm going to listen to Samih Shqeir.. O Shame, O shame.. I have had enough of this farce.. may you wake up to a homeland
Ny hira mitondra ny lohateny hoe O Shame no tiany lazaina amin'izany, natolotra ho an'ireo martioran'i Daraa. ||| He was referring to a song called O shame, dedicated for the martyrs of Daraa.
An'i Samih Shqeir ny hira, Syriana mpihira fanta-daza amin'ireo hiram-pitiavan-tanindrazana. ||| The song is by Samih Shqeir, a Syrian singer renowned for his patriotic songs.
Asehon'ity horonantsary ity ny hira ahitàna soratra mandady amin'ny teny anglisy (tsindrio ny CC mba hijerena izany). ||| The song is in the video below available with English subtitles (click on CC icon to display them).
Afrika Atsimo: Ny tontolon'ny media sosialin'ny vuvuzelas ||| South Africa: The social media world of vuvuzelas
Tsy afa-mahazo vuvuzelas bebe kokoa ve? ||| Can't get enough of vuvuzelas?
Na koa ny mifanohitra amin'izay. ||| Or perhaps the opposite is the case.
Eto dia misy rohina media sosialy voatokana ho an'ny resaka vuvuzela. ||| Here are a series of social media links devoted to everything vuvuzela.

Ny maha-olombelona mihitsy no voavoatra ho mpamokatra amin'ny alalan'ny lojikan'ny asa voalamina ka any ivelan'ny toeram-pamokarana dia mitazona iny "hoditra", iny fomba fisaina iny ihany. ||| Humanity itself is conditioned to be a productive entity through the logic of organizational labor so outside of the chain of production, a man holds on to the same apparent "skin", the same frame of mind.

Ny sary dia nahafahako foana nampaharitra mandrakizay ny fotoana iray amin'ny fiainana, sary iray mitoetra miaraka amiko mandrakizay. ||| Photography has always allowed me to immortalize life's passing moment, a snapshot that stays with me forever.

Ny sary tsara indrindra dia izay mitahiry ny halalin'ny tantara iray izay tsy misy mahafantatra ankoatra ilay mpaka sary. ||| The perfect photo is one that encapsulate the depth of a story that only the photograph can truly know.

Ejypta: Mpitoraka Bilaogy Alaa Abd El Fattah Notazomina 15 Andro ||| Egypt: Blogger Alaa Abd El Fattah Detained for 15 Days
Notazomina nandritra ny 15 andro ilay mpitoraka bilaogy mafana fo, Alaa Abd El Fattah, taorian'ny fandavany ny fanadihadiana tokony ataon'ny mpampanoa lalàna miaramila taminy, nolaviny izany fanadihadiana noho ny tsy maha ara-dalàna azy. ||| Activist and blogger Alaa Abd El Fattah has been detained for 15 days, after refusing to be interrogated by the Military Prosecutor, in protest against its legitimacy.
Tonga tao amin'ny mpampanoa lalàna miaramila izy, niaraka tamina mpiserasera iray Bahaa Saber, nitangorona tao ivelany avokoa ireo mpanohana azy, miampanga ny fitsarana ady miaramila. ||| He appeared at the Military Prosecutor, along with fellow activist Bahaa Saber, today as supporters gathered outside, denouncing military trials.
Nanomboka tamin'ny 28 Janoary, olo-tsotra maherin'ny 12,000 no notsaraina tao amin'ny fitsarana ady miaramila ao Ejypta. ||| Since January 28, more than 12,000 civilians have been tried by military courts in Egypt.
Nafindra fonja i Abd El Fattah, raha toa ka noahafahana kosa i Saber. ||| Abd El Fattah has since been transferred to prison, while Saber will soon be released.
EFa nogadraina ireo mpiserasera anankiroa ireo tamin'ny taona 2006 nandritra ny fitondran'i Hosni Mubarak. ||| Both activists were imprisoned in 2006 under Hosni Mubarak's regime.
Alaa sy Bahaa nahazo sazy an-tranomaizina 15 andro, tezitra avokoa ireo mpanohana tao ivelany. ||| Alaa and Bahaa get 15 days detention sparking outrage from supporters outside
Bahaa Saber, eo ankavia, ary i Alaa Abd El Fattah miatrika fitsarana androany maraina. ||| Bahaa Saber, left, and Alaa Abd El Fattah outside the court earlier today.
Ni-tweet mikasika ireo fanenjehana an'i Alaa, Bahaa ary i Mina Daniel ny mpisolo vava Gamal Eid, Mina Daniel izay nisy namono tamin'ny vono olona 9 Oktobra tao "Maspero." ||| Lawyer Gamal Eid tweets the allegations against Alaa, Bahaa and Mina Daniel, who was killed in the October 9 Maspero massacre.
Ireo mpiserasera dia voampanga ho: nitarika nanao fihetsiketsehana, naka ny fitaovam-piadian'ny tafika ary nanimba ny fitaovan'ny miaramila ||| The activists are accused of: instigating gatherings, overtaking the armed forces weapons and damaging military equipment
Alaa Seif nandà tsy hohadihadian'ny Mpampanoa lalàna miaramila satria anisan'ny tafika ity farany ity ary anisan'ny voampanga amin'ny raharaha koa ihany koa ny tafika. ||| Alaa Seif refused to be interrogated by the Military Prosecutor because it is part of the army and the army itself is accused in the crime.
Tsy ara-dalàna ho an'ny voampanga ny manao fanadihadiana amin'ny voampanga iray ||| It is illegal for an accused to interrogate another accused party
Henjana ny hevitra nijoroan'i Alaa sy i Bahaa satria nandà tsy hankatò ny mpampanoa lalàna miaramila izy ireo. ||| Alaa and Bahaa's stance was strong because they refused to acknowledge the legitimacy of the military prosecutor.
Fiarahabana noho ny herim-po nasehoan'i tamin'ny fandavany tsy hohadihadian'ny manam-pahefana miaramila izay voampanga ihany koa. ||| Salutations to the courage of as he refuses to be interrogated by the military authority he is actually accusing.
Karazana esoeso ny mahita fa hiatrika fanadihadiana miaramila amin'ny fararano 2011 i kanefa ny anabaviny nitolona manohitra ny fitsarana miaramila nanomboka tamin'ny lohataona 2011. ||| It's kind of ironic to see facing military prosecution fall 2011 when his sister has been fighting mililtary trials since spring 2011.
Aiza ho aiza ny mikasika ny fampanantenana tsy hitsara olo-tsotra manoloana ny fitsarana miaramila intsony, Tantawi? ||| What about the promise not to try civilians in front of military court anymore, Tantawi?
Tahaka ny maro hafa, tohina tanteraka i Gigi Ibrahim fa anisan'ireo voampanga ihany koa i Daniel izay efa namoy ny ainy. ||| Along with many others, Gigi Ibrahim is livid Daniel is among those accused.
Novonoin'izy ireo i Mina Daniel ary maty izy, nampangain'izy ireo ho "nitarika herisetra" izy?!!! ||| They killed Mina Daniel and he is dead and they are charging him of "inciting violence"?!!!

Azia Atsimo atsinanana: Mitoraka bilaogy momba ny baolina kitra ||| Southeast Asia: Blogging about Football
Betsaka ireo bilaogy mikasika ny baolina kitra any Azia Atsimo atsinanana izay manome vaovao lehibe farany sy ara-potoana mikasika ireo lalao baolina kitra sy ny fandaharam-potoana any amin'ny faritra. ||| There are many football blogs in Southeast Asia that provide relevant news stories and updates about football matches and programs in the region.
Tamin'ny alalan'ny mailaka, niresadresaka tamin'i Erick Bui avy amin'ny baolina kitra any Vietnam ny tenako sy i Chamroeun ao amin'ny Football Roubroum any Kambodza mikasika ny fitorahana bilaogy mikasika ny baolina kitra any Azia Atsimo atsinanana. ||| Through email, I interviewed Erick Bui of Vietnam Football and Chamroeun of Cambodia Football Roubroum about football blogging in Southeast Asia.
Nilaza fohifohy mikasika ny tantaran'ny baolina kitra any Vietnam i Erick. ||| Erick gives a brief history of football in Vietnam
Tsy azo iadian-kevitra fa ny baolina kitra no fanatanjahan-tena matanjaka sy be mpanohana indrindra any Vietnam. ||| Football is unarguably the main and most supported sport in Vietnam.
Nanomboka tamin'ny taona 1980 ny fifaninana V-League isan-taona. ||| Its annual V-League competition has taken place since 1980.
Tamin"i Vietnam nizara roa ho lasa Vietnam Avaratra sy Vietnam Atsimo, dia nanjary nisy ekipa roa ihany koa...Taorian'ny nikambanan' i Vietnam tamin'ny taona 1975, nijaly ela tsy nivoatra mihitsy ny baolina kitra Vietnamiana. ||| When Vietnam was split into North Vietnam and South Vietnam, two national teams existed...After Vietnam was united in 1975, Vietnamese football suffered a long time of stagnation.
Tamin'ny taona 1991 no niatrika lalao iraisam-pirenena voalohany indrindra ny ekipam-pirenena Vietnamiana. ||| In 1991, Vietnam national football team played its first international match.
Nanao ezaka lehibe mihitsy ny baolina kitra Vietnamiana nanomboka tamin'izay. ||| Vietnamese football has made a lot of improvement since then.
Amin'izao fotoana izao dia iray amin'ireo tsara indrindra eo amin'ny faritr'i ASEAN ny ekipam-pirenena Vietnamiana sy ny V-League. ||| Both Vietnam national team and V-League are now one of the best in ASEAN region.
Milaza ny antony itazonany ny bilaogy amin'ny teny Anglisy mikasika ny baolina kitra any Vietnam i Erick. ||| Erick names his motivation in maintaining an English blog about football in Vietnam
Mifanohitra amin'ny hamaron'ny isan'ny tranonkala mikasika ny baolina kitra amin'ny teny Vietnamiana, vitsy ihany ireo tranonkala amin'ny teny Anglisy mikasika ny baolina kitra eo an-toerana ao amin'ny aterineto. ||| Contrary to the big number of football sites in Vietnamese, there are few English sites about local football on the net.
Izany no antony nahatonga ahy nanomboka ny bilaogy mikasika ny baolina kitra any Vietnam mba hanampy ny olona hahalala kokoa mikasika ny baolina kitra eo amin'ny fireneko. ||| That's the reason why I started Vietnam Football blog in order to help people know more about football in my country.
Manana namana maro any am-pitan-dranomasina aho izay mpankafy baolina kitra ihany koa. ||| I have a lot of friends overseas who are also football fans.
Matetika izy ireo no manontany ahy mikasika ny baolina kitra Vietnamiana satria hitan'izy ireo fa sarotra ny mahita vaovao amin'izany. ||| They often question me about Vietnamese football because they find it quite hard to find the info.
Eo am-pijerena izany zavatra izany dia nihevitra aho fa ho rohy lehibe hampifandray an'i Vietnam amin'izao tontolo izao ny bilaogy mikasika ny baolina kitra amin'ny teny Anglisy. ||| Looking at this matter, I think an English football blog can be an essential link between Vietnam and the world.
Sady tena tia aho no manana ny fahaizana ilaina mikasika ny baolina kitra ka dia mahafinaritra ahy ny mitoraka bilaogy momba ny baolina kitra Vietnamiana. ||| I have the passion and decent football knowledge so I really enjoy blogging about Vietnamese football
i Chamroeun no Kambodjiana voalohany mpitoraka bilaogy mikasika ny baolina kitra. ||| Chamroeun is the first Cambodian football blogger.
Ao anatin'ny bilaoginy, Cambodia Football Roubroum, mizara ny vaovao mikasika ny lalao baolina kitra any Kambodza izy ||| Through his blog, Cambodia Football Roubroum, he shares information about football games in Cambodia
Tamin'ny volana Jolay 2008 no nanaovako ny bilaogiko manokana. ||| I launched my personal blog on July 2008.
Ny hanaparitaka ny vaovao mikasika ny baolina kitra Kambodjiana no tena tanjoko. ||| My main goal is to spread the news on Cambodian football.
Hitako ihany koa fa manana tetikasa tsaratsara kokoa mikasika ny baolina kitra ireo firenena roa mpiray vodirindrina amintsika, Thailand sy Vietnam. ||| I noticed that our two neighboring countries, Thailand and Vietnam, have better football programs.
Tsara karama ireo mpilalao. ||| The players are well-paid.
Nefa any Kambodja, tsy feno tsara ny fepetra ho an'ireo mpilalao baolina kitra. ||| But in Cambodia, the footballers are not really in good condition.
Milalao maina na kely karama ny ankamaroan'izy ireo. ||| Most of them play for free or with low salaries.
Na izany aza, niova be ny baolina kitrantsika tao anatin'ny dimy taona. ||| However, our football has changed a lot in the last five years.
Amin'izao isika efa manana ligy matihanina izay tohanan'ny orinasa Vietnamiana iray. ||| Now we have a professional league which is sponsored by a Vietnamese company.
Mifandray amin'ny bilaogy hafa miresaka baolina kitra ao amin'ny faritra ihany koa i Erick sy i Chamroeun. ||| Erick and Chamroeun are also linking to other football blogs in the region.
Mifandray amin'ireo tranonkala mikasika ny baolina kitra eo an-toerana ihany koa ireo bilaogy ireo. ||| These blogs also link to local football websites.
Miresaka mikasika ny filokana eo amin'ny fanatanjahan-tena izay tena olana goavana any Malezia nandritra ny volana vitsivitsy izao i Haresh Deol, ilay mpitoraka bilaogy mamahana ny bilaogy Foul from Malaysia. ||| Haresh Deol, the blogger who maintains Foul from Malaysia, discusses sports betting which was a big issue in Malaysia a few months ago.
Sakanan'ny antoko maro ny resaka fampanarahan-dalàna ny filokana eo amin'ny fanatanjahan-tena. ||| Talk about legalizing sports betting is objected by many parties.
Tsy mahasoa ny rehetra ny filokàna volabe – na ho an'ny maro an-isa na vitsy an'isa. ||| Gambling is not healthy for all – majority or minority.
Ampiasain'ireo mpanao politika ho fitaovana ity olana ity mba hilazany fa tena mpandàla ny rariny sy masina izy ireo. ||| Politicians are using this issue as a perfect avenue to claim how righteous and religious they are.
Tokony HAZAVAIN'ny governemanta tsara ny fandehan-javatra. ||| The government should EXPLAIN the situation properly
Tsy manohana ny filokàna aho toy ny tsy anohanako ny fidorohana. ||| I'm not for gambling, as I'm not for smoking.
Rehefa tsy mahasoa dia tsy mahasoa. ||| If it's unhealthy, it's unhealthy.
Fa rehefa fomba tsara kosa ny fanaraha-maso ny fandehan'ny Ringgit-ntsika (tenin'ny mpanoratra: sandam-bola Maleziana) sy ny loharanon'ny fidiram-bola ho an'ny governemanta, dia tsy maninona? ||| But if it's a good method to monitor the outflow of our Ringgit (author's note: Malaysian currency) and a source of income for the government, why not?
Madagasikara: Nitono-tena ho filoham-pirenena ny Ben'ny tanàna ||| Madagascar: The mayor proclaims himself president
Nivadika ho adim-pahefana hiandraikitra ho filoham-pirenena indray ny fifanandrinana misy eo amin'i filoham-pirenena Marc Ravalomanana sy ny Ben'ny tanàna Andry Rajoelina izay efa nampisaritaka ny Malagasy tao anatin'ny herisetram-pandrobana tamin'iny herinandro iny. ||| A dispute between the president of Madagascar, Marc Ravalomanan, and the mayor of the capital, Andry Rajoelina, thrust Malagasy citizens into violent rioting and looting last week, and has now escalated into a power struggle for the presidency itself.
Nanetsika ny mpanohana azy i Rajoelina, DJ sy mpampiala voly lasa Ben'ny tanànan'Antananarivo rehefa nakaton'ny fitondrana ny televizionany VIVA. ||| In December, Rajoelina, a DJ and advertising tycoon turned Antananarivo's mayor, mobilized his supporters when the government shut down his television station, VIVA.
Ankehitriny moa dia tsy mitady ny hamerenana amin'ny laoniny ny demaokrasia sy ny fahalalaham-pitenenana ihany no takian'ny mpanaraka azy mahatratra an'aliny fa ny fitantanana ny fitondrana mihitsy. ||| Now, it seems his tens of thousands of followers will demand not only restoration of democracy and freedom of speech, but also control of government.
Samy nandamoka (foana) avokoa moa ny fampihaonana indroa miantoana saiky natao ho an'ny roa tonta (Ravalomanana sy Rajoelina). ||| Two scheduled negotiation talks between Ravalomanana and Rajoelina have been canceled.
Hain'ny Ben'ny tanàna moa ny namadika ny tsy fahafalian'ny olona sy ny tsy fanekeny intsony ity fitondrana ity hanaraka azy amin'ny fitolomana. ||| The mayor has been able to tap into Malagasy growing discontent and disapproval of the current regime to gather a following.
Tamin'ity Sabotsy ity, teo amin'ny Place du Treize Mai, teo anatrehan'ny olona an'aliny no nilazan'i Andry Rajoelina fa izy no mpitondra vaovaon'i Madagasikara. ||| This Saturday, on the Place du Treize Mai, in front of tens of thousands of supporters, Andry Rajoelina has proclaimed himself the new leader of Madagascar.
Rehefa tsy nandray ny andraikiny ny filoha sy ny fitondrana notarihiny... dia ho raisiko an-tanana ny fitantanana ny firenena, hoy ny nolazainy. ||| "Since the president and the government have not taken their responsibilities... I will run all national affairs as of today," he said.
Mikasa ny hanongana an-dRavalomanana, filoha ankehitriny, ihany koa izy noho ny Fanitsakitsahana ny Lalampanorenana Malagasy araka ny nolazainy. ||| He has also announced plans to impeach Ravalomanana, the current elected president, who has according to him, disrespected the Malagasy constitution.
"Notanisaina teny an-kianja daholo androany ireo teboka efa ho folo lazain'ireo mpomba an'i Andry fa fanitsakitsahana lalampanorenana nataon'Atoa Ravalomanana Marc, ka tafiditra ho isan'ny tena antony azo analana azy amin'ny toerany, ka isan'izany ny resaha 'haute trahison' momba ny fanafarana mpikarama an'ady hamono ny taranaka Malagasy, ny fanaovana fanavakavahana ara-pinoana sns.... ||| "Andry's supporters counted ten instances of Marc Ravalomanana holding the constitution in contempt, they included some that validate his impeachment, one of them being "high treason" for importing mercenaries to kill Malagasies (author's note: this is an unsubstantiated claim, officially refuted by one of the army's leaders. The presence of foreign mercenaries was a recurring rumor during unrests)., another instance was Ravalomanana's alleged religious discrimination, etc...
Teny ampamaranana ny fotoana, rehefa ela no niandrasan'ny vahoaka azy, dia nivoaka ihany ilay fanambarana lehibe nataon'i Andry Rajoelina, ka nanabaràny fa izy ny mitondra vonjimaika ny tetezamita, ary manome baiko sy mitantana ny raharaha rehetra. ||| At the end of the rally, after his supporters had long waited for it, Andry Rajoelina finally showed his ace card, when he said that he would lead the transitional government, and he would be the one giving orders and in charge of all affairs.
Nisy ny fanaingany ny tafika sy ireo ministera isan-tokony mba hanaraka ny baikony. ||| He urged the army and ministers to follow his commands.
News2Dago indray manontany raha izao no atao hoe demaokrasia: ||| News2Dago wonders if this is democracy:
Toy izao ilay atao oe vahoaka maro an'isa izany oe 80.000/20.000.000 na koa oe 0,004 % no hadidy sy hanapaka ny tany sy ny fanjakana. ||| Here are the numerous people, 80,000 out of 20 millions inhabitants, meaning 0.004% of the population that will order about the nation and the government.
Dia atao ahoana izany ireo vahoaka tsy milahatra tsy tia korontana kanefa tsy sahy maneho hevitra fa ampitahorina bemiranga sy olona milanja basy handromba sy hanampim-bava. ||| What about the population that does not demonstrate, does not want chaos, but cannot express their views because of intimidation from armed looters.
Demokrasia ny bandy bokona sy beloha no tiana hanjaka eto tanana. ||| Democracy of muscles and stubbornness is what they want to impose.
Madagascan manotany izay hitranga: ||| Madagascan wonders what will happen next:
"...Ny mahalasa fanontaniana ahy dia ny tanjaky ny mpaohana azy any anivon'ny tafika sy ny mpitandro ny filaminana?" ||| "...one question begs an answer: how solid is the mayor's support among the army and the police?"
Hatramin'izao loha di atsy misy ahafantarana mihitsy ny fifandanjan-kery misy eo amin'ny andaniny sy ny ankilany. ||| Until now, no event has demonstrated one side or another's superior handle on the army.
Fitsapana lehibe ho an'i Andry Rajoelina noho izany ny fanambarana nataony. ||| This announcement will be a big test for Andry Rajoelina.
Tsy isalasalana kosa ny fanohanana azony avy amin'ny antoko politika fa raha izy irery manko tsy hahatontosa izao fifanandrinana izao. ||| It removes any doubt that the Antananarivo mayor has solid support among the opposition parties, which have been preparing for this fight.
Mbola mety hafana ny raharaha amin'ity faran'ny hernandro ity. ||| Rajoelina would not have managed this alone.
Raha ny lôjika dia tokony handefa taratasy fampisamborana an'i Andry Rajoelina i Marc Ravalomanana, ary tokony ho gadra anio ihany ilay zalahy io. ||| The weekend will be eventful again. Marc Ravalomanana will logically want to issue an arrest warrant against Andry Rajoelina and arrest him today.
Fitsapana lehibe ny androany: hanoa azy ve ny tafika? ||| The first big test: will the army obey him?
Nandritra izany fotoana izany dia nitety ny tanàna any amorontsiraka ny filoha Ravalomanana ary ny nandehanany farany dia tany Nosy Be, ary araka ny nolazain'ny sampan-tseraseran'ny Prezidansa, dia nanao izao kabary manaraka izao izy tany: ||| Meanwhile, Ravalomanana was seen in various coastal cities, the latest being Nosy Be, where according to the Presidential communication team, he gave the following speech:
"Tonga eto aho handiso ny tsaho lazaina any Antananarivo fa may avokoa i Madagasikara manontolo." ||| "I am here to refute rumors, because in Antananarivo they say that all Madagascar is burning."
HItako fa mitohy tahaka ny andavanandro ihany ny fiainana. ||| I see now that everyday life continues.
Hiasa hatrany isika hampandrosoana ny firenena. ||| We have to focus on the work to develop the country.
Tonga eto aho hijery ny fahasimbana vokatry ny fandrobana sy ny fandoroan-trano. ||| I am here also to look at the devastation caused by fire and riots.
Efa arahinay maso akaiky ireny mpanakorontana ireny hahatsapanareo fa misy fanjakana mijoro eto Madagasikara. ||| We are closely following the trouble makers so you can realize there is law and order in Madagascar.
Ny tsikaritra ankapobeny dia tahaka izao: mipoitra tampoka avy any ry zalahy hanakorontana. ||| The overall assessment is that the troubles are caused by groups coming out of nowhere to generate panic.
Hajaintsika ny Lalampanorenana sy ny ara-dalàna ka tsy olona nandroba sy namaky trano no hanakorontana ny firenena. ||| We respect the Malagasy Constitution and legality, it is not rioters and looters who are going to shake our nation.
Malahelo dia malahelo tokoa izahay tamin'ny zava-nitranga, fa hiasa miaraka indray isika amin'ny fanarenana ny toe-karem-pirenena. ||| We are deeply sorry for what happened, and we will work together to get the economy back on its feet.
Yahoo Forum indray no hahitana ny fihetsika isan-karazany miainga amin'ny fahagagana (fahatezerana) ka hatramin'ny hatramin'ny horakora-kafaliana tamin'izay nitononan'i Andry Rajoelina ny tenany ho filoha. ||| Yahoo Forum reactions to Andry Rajoelina's self-proclamation range from bewilderment, consternation to elation.
Misy ny mahita ny fihetsiky Rajoelina ho fitadiavam-pahefana hiarovanany tombotsoany sy ny harenany. ||| Some see in Rajoelina's power grab a move to protect his personal interests and fortune.
Faly kosa ny hafa. ||| Others are just glad.
ny hafa indray mbola mieritreritra fa sao voafitaky ny mpanao politika indray ny vahoaka. ||| Still others wonder if the people are not again the dupe of politicians.
"Inona no hatao mba tsy ho lasa sorona noho ny tombotsoa manokana ny ahoaka malagasy." ||| "What can we do for the Malagasy people not to be sacrificed in the name of personal interests."
Saino anie izao: hahazoany fahefana dia niantsoantso demaokrasia ny sasany ary dia nahasahy nanao asa fampihorohoroana ary dia mandray an-keriny ny fahefana! ||| Let us realize: to accede power, those people dare to speak of democracy and are ready to commit terrorist acts and take power by force!
"Manana "Filoha vaovao" aloha izao ny tenanay ka soava tsarà ingahy "ANDRY TGV"" ||| "We now have a "new president" and good luck to "ANDRY TGV""
Manontany momba ny fifidianana eto Madagasikara kosa ny hafa ao amin'ny Sobika forum: ||| Others on the Sobika forum wonder about elections in Madagascar:
"Ahoana kosa hoy ny vahoaka Malagasy?" ||| "Will the Malagasy people have their say?"
Tsy afaka hitsara aho fa tokony hitaky fifidianana ny TGV? ||| I am not allowing myself to judge but it seems TGV should demand elections?
Ny (fifidianana demaokratika) ihany no manome antoka ny ampitson'ny mpanao politika. ||| The only democratic legitimacy that gives a politician a future.
Efa tamin'ny andro taloha izany misora-tena ho izao na izatsy izany... ||| These self proclamations are of another age...
Global Voices Podcast 1: Iza no inoantsika an-tserasera? ||| Global Voices Podcast 1: Who do we believe online?
Tsy mora ny mamehy ny vaovaon'ny mpanoratra sy ny fiarahamonina misandrahaka manerantany ato amin'ny Global Voices ao anatin'ny fandraisana sy fandefasam-peo antsasakadiny, saingy hiezaka izahay ny hitondra an-tanana amin'ny endrika feo ny zoro rehetra ato amin'ny tontolon'ny Global Voices. ||| It's not easy to summarise what is happening with Global Voices writers and communities worldwide in a half-hour podcast, but we're going to try and bring you a handy audio version reflecting the flavour of our writers, editors and themes.
Amin'ity fizarana voalohany ity no handrenesantsika momba ny... ||| In this first episode, we hear about...
Inona no azo inoana ato amin'ny aterineto ||| What to believe on the internet
Na ny bilaogera na ny gazety dia samy voafitak'ilay mpanao hoax Tom MacMaster izay nilaza tena ho "Amina" ilay vehivavy bilaogera monina any Syria mpitia vehivavy tamin'ny Jona 2011. ||| Both bloggers and the media were fooled in June 2011 by hoaxer Tom MacMaster who pretended to be "Amina" a lesbian blogger in Syria.
Nampieritreritra anay amin'izay bilaogy hovakiana sy hohamarinina ny Raharaha Gay Girl in Damascus. ||| The Gay Girl in Damascus incident made us all think about how we read and verify blogs.
I Jillian York, mpanolotena sady solontena ao amin'ny Filankevim-pitantanana sady mpanoratra any amin'ny faritra Afovoany Atsinanana sy Afrika Avaratra sy i Aparna Ray, mpanoratra momba an'i Azia Atsimo ary i Tarek Amr mpitati-baovao avy ao Ejipta no niresadresaka tamiko. ||| Jillian York, volunteer representative to the Board and author on the Middle East and North Africa team, Aparna Ray, a South Asia author and Tarek Amr covering Egypt joined me in a lively discussion.
Feo avy any Ginea Bisao ||| Sounds of Guinea Bissau
Eddie Avila, talen'ny Rising Voices ninday fandraisam-peo tamin'ny diany vao haingana avy tany Ginea Bisao ao Afrika Andrefana. ||| Eddie Avila, director of Rising Voices brought home audio from his recent visit to Guinea Bissau in West Africa.
Mihainoa ary ny mozika fialamboly vitsivitsy avy any Bandim sy Enterramento, faritra malaza amin'ny dihy isan-tarika miaraka amin'ny manodidina azy ireo, ary mihainoa ihany koa ny eritreritr'i Eddie momba ny fikambanana vaovaon'ny tanora mibilaogy izay miorina any ka tohanan'ny Rising Voices. ||| Tune in for some musical entertainment from Bandim and Enterramento, neighborhoods that are famous for their dance troupes, and to hear Eddie's thoughts on a new youth blogging community there established with support from Rising Voices.
Ahoana izany hoe tonian'ny Global Voices editor? ||| What's it like to be a Global Voices editor?
Hamaranana ny andiany voalohany, Nifampitafa tamin'ny tonian'ny teny espaniola aho, Ramatoa Firuzeh Shokooh Valle izay mampifandrindra ny asa tapakandro ao amin'ny Global Voices sy ny mahareny azy, mampianatra sy mianatra hahazoana ny Phd. ||| To finish up our first edition, I took a moment to chat with our Spanish Language Editor, Firuzeh Shokooh Valle who juggles her part time Global Voices work alongside motherhood, teaching and studying for a Phd.
Ahoana izany mitatitra avy amin'ny toerana toa an'i Porto Riko, Kioba, Repoblika Dominikana, ary Espaina ho an'ny Global Voices? ||| What is it like to cover places like Puerto Rico, Cuba, Dominican Republic, and Spain for Global Voices?
Nilaza tamiko moa i Firuzeh fa tiany ny asany. ||| Firuzeh told me what she enjoys about her work.
Lazao anay izay ho henoinay amin'ny manaraka ||| Tell us what you'd like to hear next time
Izay ary no azonay natolotra tamin'ity andiany voalohany fiaingana vaovao indray ity. ||| That's all we could fit into the first edition of the reboot.
Saingy natao hivoatra y hivelatra moa ity fandraisana sy fandefasam-peo an-tserasera ity ary eo am-pikatrohana momba azy ity indrindra izahay. ||| But the podcast is bound to grow and evolve as we keep working on it.
Te-haheno izay avy aminao kosa izahay ary inona no tianao hohenoina - amin'izay fotoana izay dia miteny amin'ny tonia sy ny mpanoratra aho hifampizarana amintsika misimisy kokoa izay tiana hohenoina isaky ny fizarana. ||| I'd like to hear more from you about what you think and what you would like to hear - that way I can start chasing down our editors and writers to share more with us to listen to in each episode.
Hehy matetika sy asa vita tsara ny fandraisana sy ny fandefasam-peo an-tserasera. ||| Making the podcast is a lot of fun and a fair amount of work.
Ny mahafinaritra - ny fiasako miaraka amin'olona mahafinaritra avy amin'ny vazantany efatra mahafoy ny androny, mivoaka maka feo ny zava-mahafinaritra ary manao izay hamaliana hatrany izay zavatra takiako horaketina sy avoaka hohenoina. ||| The cool thing is - I get to work with so many amazing people worldwide who are willing to give their time, go out and record wonderful things and put up with my constant demands for more audio.
Isaky ny misy clip iray vasobasoka avy amin'olona samihafa manerana ny glaoby - dia tsy dia (fitsangatsanganana) ratsy iray ao anatin'ny telopolo minitra izany. ||| Each tiny clip was recorded by different people around the globe - that's not a bad journey for just under thirty minutes.
Etazonia: Mpifankatia tsy mitovy fihodirana tsy nahazo nisora-panambadiana ||| USA: Interracial couple denied marriage license
Tamin'ny herinandro, tany Hammond, any Louisiana, Beth Humphrey (fotsy hoditra) sy Terence McKay (mainty hoditra) dia nangataka fisoratam-panambadiana ary nolavina noho ny tsy fitovian'ny fihodiran'izy ireo. ||| Last week, in Hammond, Louisiana, Beth Humphrey (who is white) and Terence McKay (who is black) applied for a marriage license and were refused on the basis of their races.
Ny Mpitsara misahana ny fandriampahalemana, Keith Bardwell, dia nanambàra fa araka ny efa hitany dia "tsy maharitra ny fanambadiana eo amin'ny olon-droa tsy mitovy fihodirana" ary nolazainy fa "ho an'ireo taranaka no nanaovany izany." ||| The justice of the peace, Keith Bardwell, claimed that in his experience, "interracial marriages do not last long" and stated that he was "doing it for the children".
"Ny lalànan'i Jim Crow" izay nitaky ny fisarahan-toeran'ny Amerikana fotsy sy mainty dia foana tamin'ny 1965, ary ireo lalàna manohitra ny fifangaroan-karazana fihodirana izay nandrara ny fifanambadiana olona tsy mitovy fihodirana na ny firaisana ara-nofo dia foana nanerana ny firenen-drehetra nanomboka ny 1967. ||| "Jim Crow laws" which required separate facilities for black and white Americans ended in 1965, and anti-miscegenation laws that forbade interracial marriage or sex ended in all states by 1967.
Nefa mbola misy hatrany ny fanavakavaham-bolon-koditra. ||| But racism still exists.
Na dia hoe tsy hita mitsikafona aza izy ireny matetika, misy kosa fotoana anandratany ny lohany mahatsiravina amin'ny fomba tsy takona hafenina; nahatonga lohateny lehibe maro manerana an'i Etazonia ity tantara ity, niteraka lahatsoratra blaogy maro avy amin'ny fiaraha-monina ao an-toerana sy ivelany. ||| Although much of the time it lies beneath the surface, occasionally racism rears its ugly head in a way that is impossible to miss; this story made headlines across the United States, prompting blog posts from the local community and beyond.
Ho valin'ny "fiarovan-tena" nataon'i Bardwell hoe mampivady olon-droa mainty foana izy, nampiseho ny hatezerany ilay blaogy manohitra ny fanavakavahan-bolon-koditra, Stuff White People Do, amin'ny fitenenana fa: ||| In response to Bardwell's "defense" that he marries black couples all the time, the anti-racist blog Stuff White People Do expressed outrage, saying:
Hay, toa tsara fanahy tokoa ianao, Atoa mpitsara Bardwell. ||| Well, how thoroughly magnanimous of you, Justice Bardwell.
Ny fiarovanao tsy lazaina intsony. ||| Not to mention, intrusively paternalistic.
Raha ny tranon'i Bardwell no resahina, izay mino aho fa feno vahoaka keli-na zazakely fotsy sy mainty miara-milalao dia tokony hiteny an'izao koa izy: ||| Speaking of Bardwell's house, which I'm sure is just overrun with joyous hordes of black and white children carousing together, he also had this to say:
Manana namana mainty hoditra maro dia maro tokoa aho. ||| I have piles and piles of black friends.
Mankanyany an-tranoko ry zareo, Mampivady azy ireny aho, ampiasain'izy ireo ny trano fidiovako. ||| They come to my home, I marry them, they use my bathroom.
Raisiko tahaka ny olon-drehetra ry zareo. ||| I treat them just like everyone else.
Hay moa, namana mainty hoditra koa, maro be. ||| Ah yes, black friends too, piles of them.
Hatrany amin'ny trano fidiovany! ||| Right there, in his bathroom!
Mpametraka hevitra iray ao amin'ilay blaogy Siditty (izay nanoratra ny lahatsorany manokana koa ato), dia nikitika ny momba ny eson-tenin'ny hatezeran'i Bardwell: ||| A commenter on the blog, Siditty (who also wrote her own post here), touched on the irony of Bardwell's anger:
Manontany tena foana aho hoe fa naninona ny lehilahy avy any Louisiana, izay manan-tantara goavana momba ny fifangaroana fihodirana (volon-koditra), na amin'ny alalan'ny rafitra fametrahana na amin'ny kolontsaina kiriolona (créole), no toa niditra tamin'ny fiahiana ny ankizy tampoka teo? ||| I always wonder about a man who comes from Louisiana, who has a strong history of race mixing, through the system of placage as well as creole culture, is now all the sudden concerned about the children.
Tsy niasa saina momba izany ry zareo tany amin'ny taona 1700 tany, tsy tokony koa izy ankehitriny. ||| They weren't concerned in the 1700s, he shouldn't be now.
Ny blaogy Racism Review dia nanohitra ny "fiasàn'i Bardwell saina momba ny taranaka" tamina porofo momba ireo zaza teraka avy amin'ny fiarahan'olona tsy mitovy fihodirana: ||| The blog Racism Review countered Bardwell's "concern for the children" with evidence on children of interracial relationships:
Ary, mba handalinana kokoa ilay porofo, tsy mijaly ireo zaza teraka tamina fifanambadiana tsy mitovy fihodirana raha ampitahaina amin'ireo zaza hafa raha miaina anaty tontolo manaiky ny fahasamihafana sy ny zaza teraka tamina fifanambadian'ny tsy mitovy fihodirana izy ireo. ||| And, to further review the evidence, children of interracial marriages do not suffer in when compared to other children provided that they grow up in an environment that's accepting of diversity and children of interracial marriages.
Raha sendra fanavakavahana ireny zaza teraka tamina fifanambadiana tsy mitovy fihodirana ireny (sy tsy fitoviana ara-drafitra hafa), dia mety hisedra adin-tsaina izy ireo, ary koa aretina mifandraika amin'izany adin-tsaina mitombo izany, toy ny fidorohana sy ny fibobohana. ||| If children of interracial marriages encounter racism (and other structural disadvantages), then they're more likely to experience stress, and health-related risks due to that increased stress, such as smoking and drinking.
Izany no vokatry ny fanavakavahana, ary antony iray hafa tokony hanaovana izay hahafoana ny fanavakavahana. ||| That's a result of racism, and yet another reason to work to end racism.
Fa tsy tokony ho antony – raha atsimbadika ny lojika – hanamafisana ny fanavakavahana izany. ||| It should not be used – turning logic on its head – as a reason to perpetuate racism.
Ary Black Girl in Maine koa dia niresaka tsara momba ilay fanontaniana "ahoana ny momba ireo zaza?", ka nilaza ny zava-niainan' ny zanakalahiny izay metisy: ||| And Black Girl in Maine touched on the "what about the kids"? question as well, noting the experiences of her own biracial son:
Ary ho an'ireo ankizy, ahoana ny momba azy ireo? ||| As for the kids, what about the kids?
Eny, indraindray ireo ankizy metisy dia ampijalian'ny hafa nefa tsy matetika izany, ary izaho aza mieritreritra fa amin'ny tanora ankehitriny dia efa saika mahafinaritra izany hoe metisy izany. ||| Yes, biracial kids sometimes catch flack from others but not always and I think among the youth today its almost considered cool to be biracial.
Araka ny nolazain'ny namako ahy dia tsy mijaly noho ny tsy fananany namana lahy na vavy, ny zanako lahy. ||| As a buddy mentioned to me my son most certainly doesn't suffer from a lack of friends male or female.
Amiko, ny fotoana mety hananan'ireo zaza metisy olana goavana dia rehefa tsy misy na iza na mba hiresahany momba izay razambeny. ||| I think the only time biracial kids have real issues is when they have no one to talk to them about their roots.
Amiko rehefa mifandray amin'ny razambeny sy ny foko ara-tantara ireo ankizy dia mamorona toeram-piadanana ho azy ireo izany. ||| I think when kids are connected to their historical roots as well as community, it creates a safe space for them.
Any Etazonia, misy lalàna maro manohitra ny maha-metisy any amin'ireo firenena maro, mandràra ny fanambadiana eo amina Amerikana fotsy hoditra sy Amerikana mainty hoditra (ary Amerikana avy amina fihodirana hafa). ||| In the United States, anti-miscegenation laws in many states banned the marriage of white Americans to black Americans (and Americans of some other ethnicities) in a number of states.
Raha tany amin'ireo firenen-kafa kosa, nofoanana nanomboka tamin'ny taona 1780 ireny lalàna ireny, tany amina firenena enina ambin'ny folo tsy nofoanana ireo lalàna ireo raha tsy taorian'ilay tranga Loving vs. Virginia tamin'ny 1967, izay nisamborana tany am-pandriana mpivady tsy mitovy fihodirana, nivady tany Washington, D.C.. Tonga hatrany amin'ny Fitsaràna Avon'ny Etazonia ny ady ara-dalànan'izy ireo, ary nofoanana tamin'izay ireo lalàna. ||| While in some states, these laws were repealed as early as 1780, in sixteen states the laws were not repealed until a 1967 case, Loving vs. Virginia, in which an interracial couple who had married in Washington, D.C. were arrested in their own bedroom. Their legal battle made it all the way to the U.S. Supreme Court, at which point the laws were overturned.
Mpitoraka blaogy maromaro no niresaka momba ny endrika araka ny lalànan'ity raharaha ity. ||| A number of bloggers touched on the legal aspects of the case.
Amin'ny maha-Mpitsara misahana ny fandriampahalemana azy, tokony hahafantatra izy fa tsy voarara intsony ny fanambadiana tsy mitovy fihodirana – nambara ho tsy araka ny lalampanorenana, 40 taona lasa izay. ||| As a Justice of the Peace, he should be aware that interracial marriage is not illegal anymore – having been deemed unconstitutional 40 years ago.
Ity ohatra miavaka ity dia nipoitra taorian'ny Diabem-pirenena ho an'ny Fitovian-jo tamin'ity herinandro ity, ka nanadihadiako fohy mpifankatia tsotra tsy mitovy fihodirana, ry Newmans (horonantsary) ny momba ny antony anaovan'izy ireo izany diabe izany. ||| This particular instance hits home after this weekend's National Equality March wherein I briefly interviewed a straight, interracial couple, the Newmans (pictured) about why they are marching.
Ny fanavakavahana volon-koditra, sokajy, lahy na vavy, fankahalana vahiny, tsy fandeferana ara-pinoana sy ny sisa dia afaka ary misy eo amin'ny fiaraha-monintsika, nefa tsy tokony hisy izy ireny ho arovan' ny lalàna. ||| Racism, classism, sexism, homophobia, religious intolerance and other biases can and do exist in our society, but they must not exist under the law.
Mahasosotra ny famelàna mpiasan'ny governemanta mikarama amin'ny hetran'ny "olona afak'i" Etazonia (na amin'ity tranga iray ity, firenena iray any Etazonia) hampiasa ny faharesendahatra azy manokana mba hanapahana ny momba ireo olana izay tantanin'ny lalàna sivily. ||| To allow an employee of the government who is paid by the taxes of the "free" people of the United States (or in this case, a state in the United States) to use his/her own personal beliefs to decide matters governed by civil law is abhorrent.
Raha tsy manaiky ny fifanambadian'ny tsy mitovy fihodirana izy dia tokony hitady asa vaovao – mety hoe Lehiben'ny Ku Klux Klan ohatra? ||| If he doesn't agree with interracial marriage, he needs to find a new job – perhaps Grand Master of the Ku Klux Klan?
Farany, nisy mpitoraka blaogy iray nanaraotra ka namadika ity trangan-javatra iray ity ho fotoana hakàna lesona. ||| Finally, one blogger has taken the opportunity to turn this incident into a moment of learning.
Ilay mpitoraka blaogy, manoratra ilay blaogy "Inona no mba haiko?" dia nangataka ireo mpamaky mba hieritreritra ny fihetseham-pony tsirairay avy momba ity resaka ity: ||| The blogger, whose blog is called "What Do I Know?" begs readers to think about their own feelings on the subject:
Raha manahy ianao fa mbola velona anatintsika rehetra ny fanavakavaham-bolon-koditra, eritrereto ny tenanao mivady amin'ny olona iray tsy mitovy fihodirana aminao, indrindra raha fotsy hoditra ianao dia mainty hoditra ilay olona. ||| If you doubt that racism still lives inside us all, consider your reaction to the idea of marrying outside your race, particularly if you are white and the other race is black.
Eny e, tsy haninona izany ho an'ny olon-kafa, nefa tsy hahita antony tsara sy mitombina ve ianao hoe mety hanasarotra lavitra ny fiainany ny zanakao vavy rehefa hitondra ny fofombadiny mainty hoditra ho any an-trano izy? ||| Yeah, it's ok for other people, but wouldn't you find some good, rational reasons why your daughter would be making her life far more difficult when she brings home her black fiance?
Aza mihatsara velatsihy e. Na dia miteny aza ianao hoe "Ts'isy olana" tsy ho nisalasala na dia kely fotsiny aza ve ianao? ||| Be honest. Even if you said, "No problem" didn't you hesitate just a little?
Raha tsia dia olona tsy dia fahita loatra ianao. ||| If you didn't you're unusual.
Amin'izao Bardwell miteny izao fa tsy hiova hevitra izy ny momba an'io, zavatra iray no tena azo antoka: tsy maintsy ho maro ny vaovao ho avy. ||| With Bardwell now saying that he won't resign over the matter, one thing is certain: there is surely more news to come.
Ireo olona teratany sy ireo toeram-pitrandrahana any Kanada ||| Indigenous People and Mines in Canada
Tahitahiana ihany ny tsy hampiasa teny mahery hilazàna fa ny vondrom-piarahamonin'ireo teratany any Amerika Avaratra dia tsy nahazo tombon-tsoa sahaza azy avy amin'ny fandrosoana ara-indostrialin'ny kontinanta Amerikana Tavaratra. ||| It would be an understatement to state that Indigenous community in North America have not benefited equally from the industrial development of the North American continent.
Ny Foibem-pikarohana momba ny fanatontoloana dia nanao izao fanambaràna izao: ||| The Research Center on Globalization made the following grim statement:
Fohy andro iainana, mihamiparitaka ireo aretina, mihabetsaka ihany koa ireo olan'ny olombelona, manomboka hatreo dia mitombo koa ny herisetra an-tokatrano hatramin'ny fisotroan-toaka. ||| Life expectancy is lower, diseases are more widespread, the human challenges ranging from domestic violence to alcoholism are also more widespread.
Mihavitsy ireo tanora no mahavita fianarana eny amin'ny lisea ary vitsy ireo mianatra eny amin'ny kolejy sy ny anjerimanontolo. ||| Less young people are finishing high school and only a few attend universities.
Dia nanohana ny hevitro aho tao amin'ny lahatsoratra blaogy iray fa tokony ho andraikitr'i Amerika Avaratra ny fampandrosoana iraisam-pirenena rehefa mikasika ny olan'ireo olona vazimba teratany izany. ||| In fact, I made the argument in a blogpost that international development should be a North America's preoccupation when it concerns indigenous people affairs.
Ireo fifandraisana misy eo amin'ireo governemanta sasany (Canada sy Quebec ohatra) sy ireo olona vazimba teratany ao amin-dry zareo, dia manam-pitoviana betsaka amin'ny governemantan'ireo tany mandroso sy ireo mponina malemy indrindra maneran-tany. ||| The relations between some governments (Canada and Quebec for instance) and indigenous people of their territories, have many similarities with relations between governments of the developed world and the most vulnerable populations of the world.
Asa mora lavitra ny manao lamin'asa arahan-tanjona tsara ary ny manasonia fifanekena iraisam-pirenena rehefa tsy misy fiantraikany mivantana amintsika izany. ||| It is a much easier task to elaborate programs filled with good intentions and sign international treaties when they don't impact us directly.
Na izany aza, rehefa momba ireo vazimba teratany sy ny fahantràna (ireo tompon-tany any Kanada dia mitàna ny laharana faha-63 ao amin'ny Lisitry ny Fandrosoan'ny Olombelona, raha faha-4 kosa i Kanada iray manontolo), lasa olàna mafàna ny raharaha, noho isika mifampizara tany an-teoria, ary koa harena izay mety hanampy ireo vazimba teratany hiakatra zana-tohatra vitsivitsy eo amin'ny Lisitry ny Fandrosoan'ny Olombelona. ||| However, when it comes to indigenous people and poverty (indigenous people in Canada are ranked 63rd on the Human Development Index, while Canada as a whole is ranked 4th), the question become a hot issue, since we are in theory sharing a territory, as well as resources which could help indigenous people climb some echelons on the Human Development Index.
Noho izany ny vondrom-piarahamonina Innu, vazimba teratany mponina ao Labrador any Canada dia nanakana ny fidirana any amin'ireo toerana fitrandrahana vy any Labrador nanomboka tamin'ny 11 Jona. ||| Therefore, the Innu community, indigenous inhabitants of Labrador, Canada, have blocked access to a Labrador Iron Mines site since June 11.
Araka ny Mining Watch, ny vondrom-piarahamonina Innu dia: ||| According to Mining Watch, the Innu community is:
miantso ny Governemantan'i Québec hanambara ny fampiatoana avy hatrany ny fitiliana "uranium" sy ny fitrandrahana manerana an'i Québec (...) Ny Lehiben'ny Innu any Uashat mak Mani-Utenam dia nanamarika fa maro ireo tetikasa fitiliana "uranium" no hita eny amin'ireo tanindrazan-dry zareo ary ireo tetikasa rehetra ireo, tahaka ireo fanomezan-dàlana hafa rehetra nataon'ny Governemantan'i Québec, dia mila ny fanekena malalaka, mialoha ary fanazavàna avy amin'ny Innu. ||| calling on the Government of Québec to declare an immediate moratorium on uranium exploration and mining throughout Québec (...) The Chief of the Innu of Uashat mak Mani-Utenam noted that several uranium exploration projects are found within their traditional territory and that all of these projects, as with all other authorizations by the Québec Government, require the free prior and informed consent of the Innu.
Ireo mpisolo tena ny governemanta federaly, ny governemantan'i Quebec, ny governemantan'i Terre-Neuve sy Labrador ary ireo mpitarika tera-tany avy ao Schefferville sy Sept-Îles Maliotenam dia nihaona mba hiadihevitra momba ireo tombon-tsoa ara-toekarena mety ho azo avy amin'ny tetikasa. ||| Representatives of the federal government, the Quebec government, the Newfoundland and Labrador government and indigenous leaders from Schefferville and Sept-Îles Maliotenam met to discuss economic opportunities that could come out of the project.
Nefa mbola misy fifanarahana iray tsy maintsy atao: ny governemantan'i Dany Williams any Terre-Neuve dia te-hahazo 80 isan-jaton'ireo tombon-tsoa mifandraika amin'ireo asa fitiliana ao amin'ireo toeram-pitrandrahana vao nisokatra tsy ela, raha nanolotra vola 700 000$ ho an'ireo Innu any Schefferville kosa ireo Toeram-pitrandrahana vy any Labrador sy ny Renivohitry New Millenium mba handresen-dahatra azy ireo hanala ireo sakana. ||| But a consensus is still to be reached: the Dany Williams government of Newfoundland would like to get 80 percent of the benefits associated with the exploration activities of the newly opened mines, while Labrador Iron Mines and New Millenium Capital offered 700 000$ of compensation to Schefferville Innus to convince them to take off the barricades.
Fanambaràna ireo zon'ireo olona vazimba teratany tohanan'ny governemantan'i Quebec. ||| Declaration on the rights of indigenous peoples that the government of Quebec supports, are not always respected in reality.
Ohatra mazava amin'ity tsy fifanarahana ity no asongadin'ny mpitoraka blaogy Armand McKenzie izay mitanisa ny andininy faha-32 ao amin'ilay Fanambaràna, izay milaza fa: ||| A clear example of this dissonance is highlighted by blogger Armand McKenzie who cites the article 32 of the Declaration, which states that:
Ny Fitondràna dia tokony hanomana fitaovana mahomby ho an'ny fanarenana marina sy rariny ho an'ireo asa rehetra, sy fepetra mifandraika amin'izany noho ny voka-dratsiny ara-tontolo iainana, toekarena, sosialy, kolotsaina na ara-panahy. ||| States shall provide effective mechanisms for just and fair redress for any such activities, and appropriate measures shall be taken to mitigate adverse environmental, economic, social, cultural or spiritual impact.
Sady fanampin'izany, araka ny voalazan'i Melissa Filion, miblaogy ao amin'ny Greenpeace: ||| What's more, according to Melissa Filion, who blogs for Greenpeace:

Hatramin'izao, mazava fa liana amin'ireo karazana tetikasa fitiliana sy fitrandrahana ny governemanta, na tohodrano famokarana herin'aratra, asa fitrandrahana ala maromaro na fitrandrahana solika vaovao, entona na vato... Ireo asa ara-indostrialy goavana ihany, izay ihany! ||| Up to now, the government is clearly interested by any kind of exploration and exploitation projects, whether it is new hydro electric dams, more forestry opérations or new oil, gaz or mines exploitation... Only big industrial activities, all in all!

Bolgaria: Manohitra ny "Fanelingelenana" ny Internet ||| Bulgaria: Against Internet "Bugging"

fanangonan-tsonia tamin'ny internet hanoherana ilay didy, olona efa maherin'ny 1150 sahady no nanasonia, ary ny mpitoraka blaogy Bolgara dia samy nanome toerana ho fanohanana izany hetsika izany daholo. ||| The civil initiative Electronic Frontier published on the internet a petition against the decree, signed by over 1150 people already, and a number of Bulgarian bloggers put banners to support the campaign on their blogs.

"Ireo manakalo ny fahalalahana amin'ny filaminana, dia ho votso-droa." ||| On February 7, Electronic Frontier organized a protest in front of the State Agency for Information Technologies and Communications in Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.

On February 23, a meeting of bloggers, online journalists, free-thinking people with an opinion of their own, and enthusiasts united by the idea of blogging, was held in Sofia.

Natao ny adihevitra, tsy hoe ho fitsikerana fotsiny ny nataon'ny SAITC sy ny Ministeran'ny atitany, fa niadiana hevitra indrindra koa momba ny hoe hatraiza ny fetran'ny fahalalahana sy ny azon'ny resa-pilaminana idirana. ||| The discussion was aimed not only at discussing the particular act of SAITC and the Ministry of Interior, but also at a debate on where the thin border between freedom and security passes.
