Mozambika: Fanairana fa misy rotaka ao Maputo ||| Mozambique: Maputo on alert with unrest
Niely ny resaka an-toho-tsofina, SMS eny fa amin'ny alalan'ny Twitter aza omaly fa hisy ny fitokonana faobe. ||| Yesterday rumors spread in Mozambique about a general strike via word of mouth, SMS, and even Twitter.
Ny antony: Ny vidim-piainana "tsy ara-drariny" - miakatra ny vidin'ny mofo, ny rano ary ny jiro. ||| The motive: the "unjust" cost of living - rises in the price of bread, water and electricity.
Mety hahatsiaro ny mpamaky fa niteraka rotaka sy fanoherana, tamin'ny volana Febroary 2008 ny nampakarana ny saran-dalan'ny minibus. ||| Readers may recall that an increase the price of minibuses sparked riots and protest in February 2008.
Noho izany handry tsirangaranga ny tanàna. ||| So the city went to sleep on edge.
Raha vao miandoha amin'ny fitaterana ity vaovao ity ny haino amanjery be mpanaraka, efa lasa nialoha tamin'ny maraina kosa ny nitateran'ny mpamaham-bolongana sy ny mpi-twit azy. ||| While the mainstream media is just starting to report this, this morning bloggers and twitters have already been reporting on events.
Nanoratra i Eduardo Castro avy ao amin'ny Elefante News ||| Eduardo Castro of Elefante News writes
Henoko tamin'ny radiom-pirenena sy novakiako tamin'ny O País (miankina amin'ny fanjakana ilay voalohany ary tsy miankina kosa ny faharoa) fa "tsy naharay fangatahana hanaovana fihetsiketseham-bahoaka" anio izany ny polisy eto Maputo. ||| I heard on the National Radio and read in O País (the former public and the latter private) that the police did "not receive any request for a popular demonstration" for today in Maputo.
Saingy hita ho heniky ny polisy mihitsy ny tanàna. ||| But the city is visibly more policed.
Misy barazy avokoa na eo Benfica na eo Xiquelene ary eo Chopal. ||| There was a roadblock in Benfica, Xiquelene and Chopal.
Vitsy ny chapas (minibus) mivezivezy ao Mahotas. ||| There are few chapas (minibuses) circulating around Mahotas.
Naharay antso avy amin'olona nody aho rehefa tsy nisy ny fiara fitaterana hitatitra tamin'ny maraina. ||| I received a call from people who returned home after waiting for transport since early in the morning, with no success.
Ny mampanahy dia hiverina indray ny tamin'ny 2008: Nitokona ny chapas ka nampitsikasina tanteraka ny tanàna. ||| The worry is that 2008 happens again: the chapas made a protest that threw the city into convulsions.
Hita ho lohateny lehibe eo amin'ny gazety O País ny anton'ity fahatezerana ity: Ampiharina manomboka anio manerana ny firenena ny sara vaovaon'ny jiro sy ny rano". ||| The front page headline of O País, the motive for the nerves: Water and electricity with new prices from today in all of the country".
Manoratra ny Sosiology Carlos Serra izay loharanom-baovao lehibe tamin'ny 2008 ||| Sociologist Carlos Serra, who was an important source of information in 2008, writes
Tamin'ny alalan'ny feo tony no niezahan'ny mpitondra tenin'ny Governemanta nandresena lahatra nandritra ny fandaharana "Sosoa Maraina" tao amin'ny Radio Mozambique (7:30/8:00) fa efa nanao ny fomba rehetra hisorohana ny vidin'ny mofo (niakatra ampahaenina ny vidiny, tsy niova hatramin'ny 2008) ho lasa enta-mavesatra kokoa... Nandefa hafa-pitarainana amin'ity fahalafosan'ny vidim-piainana ity ny mpihaino ny fandaharana sady nimenomenona tamin'ny vidin'ny mofo "sakafom-bahoaka mahantra", hoy ny iray amin'izy ireo. ||| With a calm voice, a representative of the Government made an effort on the program "Breakfast" on Radio Mozambique (7:30/8:00) to show that the government had done everything to prevent the price of bread (more expensive as of the 6th, stable since 2008) from becoming more of a burden... Listeners of the program sent messages complaining of the high cost of living and lamenting the rise in the price of bread, "poor people's food", wrote one of them.
Niantso ny olona hanolo ny mofo amin'ny vokatra hafa, toy ny vomanga mamy ohatra, ny mpitondra tenin'ny governemanta. ||| The representative appealed to listeners to look to substitute bread with other products, for example sweet potato.
Rehefa nandanjalanja ny tati-baovao rehetra azoko avy amin'ny faritra maro manerana ny tanàna aho (Lalambe Mozambique ohatra), dia mieritreritra Ifa mila fahamalinana tokoa izao toe-java-misy izao. ||| Judging by the reports that are arriving to me from various parts of the city (Mozambique Avenue for example), I think this is a situation that will require much good sense and a great prudence in managing.
Nitatitra ny mpampiasa Twitter BarataJorge ||| Twitter user BarataJorge reported
Nitohana tanteraka ny fifandraisana amin'ny finday ato an-tanànan'i Maputo. ||| The mobile network is congested, in the city of Maputo.
Niteny koa ny iray hafa antsoina hoe TeknikNineMilli ||| Another called TeknikNineMilli said
Fitokonana eto maputo. ||| Strike in maputo.
Izany no mitranga rehefa tsy miraharaha vahoaka ianao. ||| That was happens when you abuse people.
Ny manahirana, hisy indray ny hanararaotra handroba, sns. ||| The bad part, there are people who will loot, vandalize, etc.
Nanmpita ny fisian'ny fipoaham-basy sy ny tora-bato ary ny fanapotehana fananana misy any amin'ny faritra mahantra manodidina ny tanàna ilay mazoto dia mazoto ao amin'ny twitter Katembe, tahaka ity iray ity ||| Prolific twitter user Katembe is relaying reports of shooting, rock throwing and vandalism in the poor outlying neighborhoods of the city, like this one
"Any amin'ny EN4, misy mitora-bato ny fiara mandalo" / "ratsy koa ity, misy ny tsy afaka mivoaka ny tranony akory (Chamanculo)" ||| "On the EN4, cars and buses are being attacked with rocks" / "this is bad, one can't even take a step out of the house (Chamanculo)"
Mi- tweet ilay mpanao gazety tsy miankina Nastasya Tay ||| Freelance reporter Nastasya Tay tweeted
Rotaka any amin'ny faritra manodidina. ||| Rioting in township areas.
Nipoaka ny basy, bala fingotra. ||| Rubber bullets fired.
Fandoroana kodiarana manerana ny lalana ary manenika sy manempotra ny tanànan'i Maputo ny setroka avy amin'ny afo. ||| Burning tyres on the roads, and a smoke haze rising up over Maputo from the fires.
Vaovao farany - 12:15 pm ora Maputo: ||| Update - 12:15 pm Maputo time:
Misy ny sehatra tambajotram-pampahalalàna Ushahidi natsangan'ny Jornal A Verdade . ||| A citizen media Ushahidi platform has been launched by Jornal A Verdade .
Ary amin'izao fotoana izao, efa mihoatra ny 50 ny tranga voatatitra ao ary misy ny filazana fa nisy ny maty ka anisan'izany ny zaza roa voatifitra tany amin'ny lalamben'i Acordos de Lusaka. ||| As of now, there are over 50 incidents among which reports of deaths, including of two children shot at Av. Acordos de Lusaka.

Palestina:Ny filàzan'ireo mpitoraka blaogy ny tahotra ||| Palestine: Bloggers in Gaza describe the fear
Tsy arak'izay noeritreretina, fa dia blaogu mivoaka foana avy ao Gaza mivoatra manaraka ny zava-misy, ary ireo mpitoraka blaogy dia mampita hatrany ny famaritan'izy ireo ny tahotra iainany noho ny fanafihan'ny israeliana. ||| Against all odds, there are still blog posts coming out of Gaza, and bloggers are vividly describing the fear they are filled with in the face of ongoing Israeli attacks.
Exiled dia milaza fa tsy isan'ireo maherifo izy: ||| Exiled says he is no hero:
Mbola mitsangana isan'ny velona aho izao, nefa mandry tsy lavo loha. Saingy amin'ny fotoana rehetra dia mety hifanehatra amin-drafahafatesana aho, amin'izay aho vao tena "Ao tsara!" ||| I am still alive, but not OK.
Nefa niezaka ihany aho ny hifehy izay fangovitako izay nandritry ny fisavoritahana; Tsy maherifo aho e. Laila El-Haddad, mpitoraka blaogy ao amin'ny Raising Yousuf and Noor, dia mifandray amin'ireo raiamandreniny ao Gaza: ||| Laila El-Haddad, who blogs at Raising Yousuf and Noor, is in touch with her parents in Gaza:
Niantso ahy ny raiko mba hilaza fotsiny fa tsy maninona izy – taorian'izay dia nanjera baomba tao amin'ny Anjerimanontolo Silamo tany an-toerana ireo fiaramanidina mpiady, izay azo raisina ho toy ny sangany indrindra amin'ireo toeram-pianarana ambony. ||| My father just called to inform me he was ok – after warplanes bombed the Islamic University there, considered to be the Strip's premiere academic institution.
Taoriana kelin'izay dia niantso ny reniko indray aho, dia nihaino azy nitomany tao anaty telefaonina fotsiny e!. ||| A little later I called my mother, only to hear her crying on the phone.
"Ao ambony ao ny fiaramanidina" hoy izy mikiakiaka "Ao ambony ao ny fiaramanidina". ||| "The planes are overhead" she cried "the planes are overhead".
Niezaka ny nampitony azy ihany aho – raha fiaramanidina eo ambony loha izany dia midika izany fa any lavitra any no "lasibatra". ||| I tried to calm her down – planes overhead mean the "target" is further away.
Saingy amin'ny fotoana maha fara-tampony ny tahotra toy izao, tsy misy intsony toerana ho an'ny lojika sy ny fahafaha-mandanjalanja. ||| But in such moments of intense fear, there is no room for rationality and logic.
Mpitoraka blaogy iray hafa avy ao Gaza, Dr. Mona El-Farra izay any UK (Grande Bretagne) amin'izao fotoana izao, ary very hevitra eo ampanarahana ny zava-mitranga: ||| Another Gazan blogger, Dr. Mona El-Farra is currently in the UK, and is watching what is happening in despair:
Amin'ny fo feno dia feno no anaovako tazan-davitra an'i Gaza. ||| With an aching heart I continue to watch Gaza from a distance.
Tsy pihako mihitsy ny fahitalavitra, tsy haiko ny tsy hanaraka izay fandehan'ny any. ||| I cannot turn the TV off, cannot detach myself from what is going on there.
Indrindra fa hoe misy ireo namako amin'ny sehatry ny fitsaboana miasa anatin'izao tranga tsy roa aman-tany izao. ||| Not while my medical colleagues work hard under such extraordinarily circumstances.
Indrindra fa hoe misy ireo namako, fianakaviako, ary ny vahoaka manontolo mihitsy ao Gaza no miatrika habibiana tafahoatra sy horohoro toy izany foana. ||| Not while my friends, my family, and the whole population of Gaza face such horrible atrocities and constant fear.
Tsy mbola mifarana ity nofy ratsy ity. ||| The nightmare isn't over.
I Eva Bartlett, vehivavy Kanadiana mpandàla ny zon'olombelona, izay mitoraka blaogy ao amin'ny In Gaza, dia mamariparitra ny ezaka ataony mba hiatrehana izany: ||| Canadian human rights activist Eva Bartlett, who blogs at In Gaza, describes how she is trying to cope:
Atao ahoana no fambara izay tsapa ankehitriny? ||| How to explain this feeling?
Tena mbola volivolin'ny fipoahana ny tenako manontolo, tsy hoe tsy manam-pahasahiana aho, fa tena miantraika amin'ny tena ilay izy. ||| I am physically numb to the explosions, not that I am in any way brave, but just physically unaffected.
Ilaina mihitsy izany, manome hery ahy hanohy ny fanoratana izany, haka sary, hiteny. ||| This is useful, it allows me to continue to write, to photograph, to speak.
Fa izay ilay ilany mpandanjalanja ato anatiko izay manohy foana ireny zavatra ireny. ||| But it is my rational side which is continuing these things.
Alberto, mpanao gazety espaniola iray mipetraka eto akaikiko eto, manampy ahy hahatsiahy fa omaly alina aho dia nilaza taminy hoe: "Mifantoka loatra amin'ny fijoroana vavolombelona aho ka tsy nahavita namadibadika ny loza." ||| Alberto, a Spanish journalist sitting next to me, helps me to recall that last night I told him: "I'm so focused on conveying the eyewitness account that I'm not thinking about danger".
Toa sahala amin'ny tsy azo takarina ny hoe hamàrana ity resaka ity...fipoahana maro no re isa-minitra: fiara iray tao amin'ny toby ao Al Bureijj, afovoan'i Gaza, daroka iray hafa tany amin'ny fari-ponenana ao Zaytoun ao an-tanànan'i Gaza, iray hafa tany avaratra... Tamin'ity indray mitoraka ity, tsy ny fahatapahan'ny herinaratra no hanakana ahy tsy hanoratra na tsy fahampian'ny teny na vaovao azo. ||| It's nearly impossible to finish this entry...still more explosions are erupting every few minutes: a car in Al Bureijj camp, central Gaza, another hit in the Zaytoun residential area of Gaza City, another in the north... This time, it is not the electricity that prevents me from writing, nor certainly not want of words or information.
Fa ity zera baomba mihazo kiry biby ataon'ny Israel aminay rehetra ao Gaza ity, nanomboka tamin'ny 11 ora ny faha 27 Desambra ary mitohy mihazakazaka, mahery vaika, na eo aza ny fisian'ny 300 efa maty sy ny 800 maratra, raha ny vinavina tsotsotra (1000 ho an'ny vinavina sasany), tsy mbola amin'ireo ny maty sy ny naratra tamin'ny daroka faramparany. ||| It is that the appalling bombing at close range that Israel is unleashing on us here in Gaza, since just after 11 am on December 27th continues at full speed, full strength, despite over 300 dead and over 800 injured, by conservative estimates (1000 by other estimates), not including the victims and casualties from the latest and ongoing attacks.
Te-hahafantatra izay tena zava-misy marina ao Gaza izao tontolo izao, ary mba te-hahalala koa aho, na dia hoe aty aza aho. ||| The outside world rightfully wants to know what is going on in Gaza, and I too want to know, even though I am here.
Lasa faritra natoka-monina i Gaza, misitrir-belona any an-tranony ny olona noho ny tahotra hivoaka eny an-dàlam-be. ||| Gaza has become isolated areas, where people are trapped in their homes for fear of being out on the streets.
Ary, raha ny fivoarany hatreto, na ny trano fonenana aza tsy azo antoka intsony. ||| And, as it turns out, even homes are not safe.
Tsy misy hoe aiza no azo antoka intsony eto Gaza. ||| There is no where safe in Gaza.
Ny toerana rehetra dia mety ho lasibatra avokoa. ||| Any place can be a target.
Ary ny lasibatra dia azo ambara ho efa lasibatra nomanina na toerana nanakaiky ilay lasibatra. ||| Any target can be justified as being a planned target or being closed to a planned target.
Tanaty hafatra iray tsy ela akory, dia hoy fotsiny izy milaza: ||| In a later post, she simply says:
Amin'izao fotoana...efa miomana aho ny tsy hahazo herinaratra, aterineto, sy ny ratsy kokoa noho izany ||| For now...i prepare for no electricity, no internet, and the worst
Chili: Horohorontany tany Chili hitan'ny mason'ny olona ||| Video: Chile Earthquake through Citizen's Eyes
Santiago taorian'ny horohorontany nopihan'i pviojo CC-By ||| Santiago After the Earthquake by pviojo CC-By
Koa satria moa efa hadiva hilentika ny masoandro dia nitombo isa ireo lahatsary mitantara ny horohoroontany nahatratra 8,8 izay nihatra tamin'i Chili tamin'ny 3:30 maraina. ||| As the day comes to a close, more videos crop up of the devastating 8.8 magnitude earthquake that hit Chile at 3:30 am.
Koa satria moa tsy ny tanibe ihany no nisian'izany hetsiky ny tany izany dia niteraka onjan-dranomasina vaventy (tsunami) izay nanaovana fanairana manerana ireo firenena hafa manerana an'i Pasifika ny onja vaventy hidona amin'ny torapasik'izy ireo ilay horohorontany. ||| The earthquake, which not only affected the mainland through the ground movements, also generated tsunami waves that set out an alarm throughout the Pacific as different nations prepared for the waves to hit their shores.
Nisy ny lahatsary noraisina nandritra ny nihetsehan'ny tany indrindra, tahaka ity sarina tsy mandray vola hita ao amin'ny YouTube ity. ||| Some videos were made during the earthquake itself, as this amateur video found on YouTube.
nanomboka tamin'ny fipoahana solosaina iray tao an'efitra izany, koa satria moa nihovotrovotra ny tany dia re ny firohondrohony, maty ny jiro avy eo ary dia feona vehivavy iray sy lehilahy iray sisa no heno ka heverina fa ilay lehilahy no nitana ny fakantsary sary nampitony an-dravehivavy. ||| It starts with a shot of a computer in a room, and as the earth moves the rumble of the earth can be heard, then the lights go out and we are left in the dark, hearing only the voices of a woman and a man we assume to be the one holding the camera trying to calm her down.
Ity manaraka ity kosa dia noraisin'ilay mpampiasa YouTube taorian'ny iray amin'ny hovitrovitra: ||| This next one was recorded by YouTube user ikonsento during one of the aftershocks:
Mbola nandrakitra ihany i Ikonsento minitra maromaro taorian'ny hovitrovitra voalohany, ka namoahany ny fikorontanana nisy tao an-tranony: mianjerazera ny fanaka sy izay rehetra ao ana-trano hahitana ny herin'ilay hovitrovitra: ||| Ikonsento has been reporting since minutes after the first earthquake, when he uploaded this video showing how his house fared: the way furniture slid on the floor and toppled over bearing witness to the earthquake's strength:
Ity lahatsary ity indray dia noraisina minitra maromaro taorian'ny horohorontany voalohany, ary ity manaraka ity dia ahitana lehilahy roa vao tonga tao Chili ka niaina ilay hovitra, dia nanapa-kevitra ny handao ny tranony hijoro any ivelany mihitsy aloha. ||| This video was made minutes after the quake, as this next one where two men who had just arrived in Chile experience the quake and then decide to leave their building and stand outside for a bit.
Rehefa niverina moa ny jiro dia niditra tany an-trano izy ireo ka nahita ny fahasimbana: fantson-drano vaky sy rindrina mitriatra. ||| As lights come back on their building, they walk back and the building's inhabitants are all milling in the lobby, and as they return to the building, the assess the damage: broken water pipes and cracked concrete.
Rehefa niposaka ny masoandro dia nivoaka ho eny an'arabe ny olona ka nandrakitra ny fahasimbana hitany: Netprox namily fiara ho eny amin'ny lalambe, ary tsy maintsy nisisika tambanina tetezana nianjera. ||| As daylight came, more people went out to the streets and recorded the damage they observed: drove through the highway, and had to squeeze under a fallen bridge to get through.
Nivoaka ho eny an'arabe ihany koa i Rafael Vial ka nandrakitra ny tetezana nianjera tany Llaillay, Chili, izay nopihany avy tamin'ny fiantso findainy narakitra tao amin'ny Qik. ||| Rafael Vial also went out to the streets and recorded a collapsed bridge in Llaillay, Chile, which he streamed through his mobile phone on Qik.
Tapaka moa ny fifandraisana tany amin'ny faritramaro nanerana an'i Chili ka sarotra ny nahazoana vaovao tany amin'ireo olom-pantatra ho manao ahoana izay izy ireo. ||| Communications in many areas of Chile are down and it gets harder to get in touch with loved ones to make sure they are all right.
Ireto ampela roa ireto dia nanararaotra ny tombony azony tamin'ny YouTube ka nandrakitra ny lahatsariny, izay ilazany amin'ny olom-pantatra sy ny namana fa tsy maninona izy ireo, ary mitantara ihany koa izay hita sy ren'izy ireo tamin'ilay hovitrovitry ny tany: ||| This couple of girls took advantage of YouTube and recorded their video, where they tell friends and family they are OK, and narrate a bit of what they've seen and heard regarding the earthquake:
Ary ny hafa kosa tao anatin'ny hetaheta te-hanampy no namoaka vaovao manan-danja milaza izay tokony hatao mba ahafahana miaina ela araka izay azo atao raha toa voatery ao ambanina trano nirodana. ||| And others, in their need to help are spreading valuable information regarding what to do to maximize the possibility of staying alive in a collapsed building.
Tahaka ny amin'ity lahatsary ity izay noraisina taorian'ny horohorontany. ||| Such is the case with this video which is being passed after the quake.
ny Petra-kevitry ny telozoron'ny fiainana dia mametraka fa ny toerana tsara aro indrindra amin'ny horohorontany dia tsy ny miafina ao ambanin'ny fanaka fa ny eo akaikina fanaka matanjaka: amin'izay fotoana izay rah amisymianjera amin'ilay fanaka dia tsy hianjera io ary tsy hitontona amin'izay olona miafina aminy.Amin'izay fotoana izay dia avotra amin'ny alalan'ireo paosin-dalana naterak'ireo zavatra ireo ilay olona. ||| The Life Triangle theory basically states that the safest place to hide in an earthquake is not under furniture, but besides a strong piece of furniture: that way, if the piece of furniture is crushed by falling materials, it will not collapse on the person hiding under it. Instead, the person will be safe in the pocket created on the object's side.
Ity lahatsarim-panentanana izay nadika sy namboarina ho amin'ny teny espaniola ity no manazava fa tsy mahavonjy anao izany miafina ambanin'ny latabatra na eny an-tolàna izany. Juliana Rincón Parra ||| This promotional video which was adapted and translated into Spanish, explains why hiding under desks or under doorways is just not going to allow you to survive.
Iran: Horaka "Ho lavenona i Rosia" nandritra ny vavaka zoma ||| Iran: "Death to Russia" at Friday Prayer Photo from Mehr news site in Iran
Nandritra ny vavaka zoma ny 17 jolay lasa teo izay natao tao amin'ny anjerimanontolon'i Téhéran dia nangataka ny hamotsorana ireo mpanao fihetsiketsehana marobe nosamborina tany Iran taorian'ny fifidianana filoham-pirenena ny 12 jona lasa teo ny filoha teo aloha Ali Akbar Hashemi. Fifidianana nahalany an'i Mahmoud Ahmadinejad. ||| At a Friday prayer service today at Tehran University, former president Ayatollah Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani called for the release of the many protesters arrested since the disputed June 12 presidential election where Mahmoud Ahmadinejad was declared the winner.
Manohana tsy misy fepetra an'ilay mpanohitra Mir Hossein Moussavi i Rafsanjani. ||| Rafsanjani is a firm supporter of Ahmadinejad's main contender Mir Hossein Mousavi.
Sambany hatramin'ny fifidianana no nitarihany vavaka isan-joma. ||| He led the Friday prayer for the first time since the election.
Mpanohitra maro any an-toerana no nandray anjara tamin'io vavaka zoma io, ary ny sasany miakanjo maitso, loko lasa hamantarana ny hetsika Moussavi. ||| Members of the Iranian opposition movement took part in the prayer, some wearing green, the colour that has come to symbolize Mousavi's movement.
"Ho lavenona i Rosia" Hatramin'izay rehefa mivavaka zoma dia ny antsoantso hoe "Ho lavenona i Amerika" sy ny hoe "Ho lavenona i Isiraely" no nahoraka. Ankehitriny indray dia novana hoe "Ho lavenona i Rosia", satria ampangain'ireto mpanohitra ireto ho nandray anjara tamin'ny fanazaran-tena nataon'ny miaramila mpanao famoretana iraniana i Rosia. ||| Traditionally at Friday Prayer, people are encouraged to chant "Death to America" and "Death to Israel" but today, they defiantly shouted "Death to Russia", in referring to opposition accusations that Russia has been involved in training repression forces of the regime.
Amin'ity lahatsary manaraka ity, nalaina tsy lavitra ny toeram-pivoriana, dia henonao ny feon'ny lehilahy iray miantsoantso mafy hoe "Ho lavenona i Amerika", "Matesa ny mpihatsaravelatsihy", "Ho lavenona i Angletera", ho valin'izany kosa dia mihorakoraka ny rehetra hoe "Ho lavenona i Rosia!". ||| In the following video, recorded from a short distance of the outdoor gathering, you can hear a male voice over the loudspeaker screaming "Death to America", "Death to the hypocrites" and "Death to England", while the crowd roars "Death to Russia" ! in response EVERY time.
Saminejad miresaka ny zava-nitranga, no nilaza fa nisy resa-pady vaovao nofohazina androany. ||| Saminejad refers to this incident, and says that new taboos were broken today.
Iraneema kosa no nilaza tao amin'ny twitter fa nodoran'ireto olona ireto ny sainam-pirenena rosiana. ||| Iraneema tweeted that protesters burned a Russian flag.
Nanaparitaka ireto mpanao fihetsiketsehana miakanjo maitso ireto ny mpitandro ny filaminana tamin'ny alalan'ny fanipazana entona mandatsa-dranomaso. ||| Security forces repressed green-clad protesters at the prayer by launching tear gas at them.
Taorian'ny fivavahana dia nihorakoraka indray ry zareo hoe "Allaho Akbar" (lehibe andriamanitra) sy ny hoe "miongana ny mpanao didy jadona"". ||| After the prayer, protesters chanted "Allaho Akbar" (God is great) and "Down with the dictator".
Indro sarimihetsika fito noraketina nandritra ny fihetsiketsehana androany: ||| Here is a compilation of seven films from today's protest in Tehran:
Fandresena mamy marikivy ||| Bittersweet victory

Hadi Nili nilaza tao amin'ny twitter" (namaly an'i onlymehdi) "Nanafika mpivavaka ny polisy! ||| Hadi Nili tweeted" (in response to onlymehdi) "Police attacked the prayers!
Nataoko fa anisan'ny governemanta tsy hanao izany velively i Iran!". ||| I think Iran is among very few governments who ever attacked to Prayers".
Mpiasan'ny BBC News, Jim Sciutto no nilaza tao amin'ny twitter fa tsy nalefa tamin'ny fahitalavim-panjakana iraniana ny kabarin'i Rafsanjani. ||| ABC News correspondent Jim Sciutto tweeted that Rafsanjani's speech was not aired on Iranian state television.
Jomhour no milaza fa nihoatra ny nantenaina ny kabarin'i Rafsanjani satria dia nanakiana tanteraka ny famoretana natao tamin'ireo mpanohitra miakanjo maitso izy ary nilaza koa izy fa "fandresena vaovao indray androany no azon'ny hetsika maitso iraniana". ||| Jomhour says Rafsanjani's speech was beyond expectations and criticized the way protesters were repressed... "Tsy nanaja an'i Ali Khamenei, mpitarika lehibe izy, ary tsy nilaza zavatra ratsy mihitsy mikasika ny hetsika maitso" Hamid Tehrani ||| "He did not praise Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, the Supreme Leader, and did not say anything negative about the green movement".

Indonezia: Tokony Hampidina Ny Haavon'ny Feon'ny Vavaka Ve Ireo Moske? ||| Indonesia: Should Mosques Lower Prayer Volume?

Tao anatin'ny lahateny natao nandritra ny kaongresim-pirenen'ny Filankevitra Indonezian'ireo Moske tamin'ny faran'ny herinandro, niteraka resabe ny nambaran'ny Filoha lefitra Boediono rehefa nanolo-kevitra izy hoe tokony hampidina ny haavon'ny feon'ireo fanamafisam-peony ny moske mandritra fiantsoany vavaka fanaony isan'andro. ||| In a speech delivered during the national congress of the Indonesian Board of Mosques last week, Vice President Boediono sparked a debate when he suggested that mosques should lower the volume of loudspeakers during the daily prayer call.
Ireo moske ao Indonezia dia mampiasa fanamafisam-peo avokoa mba hanapariahana ny "adzan" in-dimy isan'andro hampahatsiahivna ny olona hivavaka. ||| Mosques in Indonesia use loudspeakers to broadcast the "adzan" five times a day reminding people to pray.
Nampitandrina i Boediono fa ny feo mafy loatra dia mety hanelingelina ny olona hafa, tafiditra anatin'izay ireo Silamo hafa. ||| Boediono warned that the loud volume might disturb other people, including fellow Muslims.
Nanampy izy fa miohatra amin'ny feo mikiakiaka, ny antso malefaka mba hivavaka dia manohina kokoa ny fon'ny olona. ||| He added that a less noisy call to prayer is more likely to enter a person's heart rather than loud sounds.
Moske Goavana ao Al-Mashun. ||| Blogger happydsf, voices his concern:
Sary avy amin'ny pejy flickr an'i hophoptuing ||| Grand Mosque Al-Mashun.
Saingy maro ireo Indoneziana no manoro hevitra an'i Boediono mba hijery ireo olana hafa manana ny lanjany kokoa. ||| Photo from Flickr page of hophoptuing (CC BY-NC-ND 2.0).
Ilay bilaogera happydsf, dia milaza ny ahiahiny: Mampalahelo fa dia ity firenena izay be mponina sy silamo indrindra ity mihitsy no miezaka manindry ny fahalalahana ara-pinoana. ||| Too bad that this country even tries to intimidate freedom of religion in the most populated Muslim nation.
Mbola betsaka ihany ny olana izay tokony hovahan'ireo mpanao lalàna fa tsy izay haavon'ny antso hivavaka akory. ||| There are still a lot of problems that should be solved by the lawmakers rather than taking care of the prayer's call volume.
Bilaogera iray hafa, Tototapalnise, no miezaka hahatakatra ny hafatra nampitain'ny Filoha Lefitra: ||| Another blogger, Tototapalnise, tries to understand the Vice President's message:
Raha miezaka ny misaina tsara azy io isika, dia fampitandremana malefadefaka ho an'ny vahoaka Silamo ilay fanambaràna mba hitahirizana ny hatsaran'ny adzan sy koa ny hatsaran'ny fitaovana fampielezam-peon'ireo moske... ||| If we try to think about it carefully, the statement is a soft warning for Muslim people to maintain the adzan's quality and also the mosques' sound system quality...
...Noho izany, inona no tokony hahatezitra antsika amin'izany sy anariantsika ny fahatoniantsika? |||...So why we have to be angry with that and losing our temper?
Amin'ny maha-finoana mibahan-toerana eto amin'ny firenena, nahoana isika no ho tezitra rehefa mba maharay fanakianana? ||| As the majority religion in the country, why are we so angry when we receive criticism?
Haris El Salman niteny fa ny haavon'ny feon'ilay fanamafisam-peo dia tsy olana velively mihitsy ho an'ny tontolo ety ivelany: ||| Haris El Salman said that the loudspeaker's volume has never been an issue in the real world:
Mbola mba manana fandeferana be ihany isika amin'ireo finoana samihafa. ||| We still have great tolerance among different religions.
Any amin'ny toerana onenako, misy moske sy trano fiangonana izay rindrina manify monja no manasaraka azy, nefa tsy mbola nahita fifandirana mihitsy aho teo amin'ny roa tonta. ||| In where I live, there's a mosque and a church only separated by a thin wall, but I never see a conflict between people.
Samy manao ny azy fotsiny ry zareo rehefa manao ny vavaka ataony. ||| They get along together when practising their religions...
...Tsy manao afa-tsy ny hiteraka adihevitra poakaty izany. ||| ...It will only provoke non-essential arguments.
Mety mba tsara ihany ny hevitra niaingany, fa tsy tamin'ny toerana nilàna azy fotsiny. ||| His intention might be right, but not in the right place.
Hevitra goavana diso toerana ve? ||| Great idea in the wrong place?
Betsaka ihany koa ny fanehoan-kevitra mifamahofaho tao amin'ny Twitter: ||| There were also mixed reactions on Twitter:
Raha ny resaka haavon'ny feon'ireo fanaparioaham-peo, fandinihan-tena iray tsara ho an'ny Silamo Indoneziana ny fanambaràn'i Boediono. ||| In case of the speaker's volume, Boediono's statement is a good self-criticism for Indonesian Muslims.
Nahoana moa no tokony haha-olana an'izany? ||| Why it should be a problem?
Nandritra izay ela izay tsy nanakorontana mihitsy ny "adzan". ||| All this time adzan has never been disturbing.
Nahafaly ahy ny niresahan'i Filoha Lefitra Boediono mikasika ny haavon'ny feon'ny fanapariaham-peo ho an'ny adzan. ||| I'm happy VP Boediono talked about speaker's volume for adzan.
Farafaharatsiny aloha mba nisy olona sahy nanomboka fifanakalozan-dresaka manohitra ny fomba fijerin'ny maro an'isa...... ||| At least someone bravely started a discussion against the majority opinion.
Tonizia: hetsika naoty fotsy hanoherana ny sivana ||| Tunisia: The White Note Campaign Against Cyber Censorship
Sary famantaran'ny Hetsika Naoty Fotsy ||| The White Note campaign logo
Tamin'ny zoma 25 desambra no namoahan'ny mpamaham-bolongana Toniziana ny fanentanana Naoty Fotsy hanoherana ny sivana izay miitatra dia miitatra tokoa any Tonizia amin'izao fotoana izao. ||| On Friday, December the 25, Tunisian bloggers waged the White Note Campaign to protest against censorship, which is growing to a tremendous extent in Tunisia.
Tsy mifidy karazam-bohikala asiana intsony ny Sampan-draharahan'ny Aterineto Toniziana . ||| The Tunisian Internet Agency is not sparing any kind of websites from censorship.
Saiky nandray anjara tamin'ity fanentanana naoty fotsy ity avokoa ny ankamaroan'ny mpamaham-bolongana Toniziana tahaka an'i Ounormal, Metallistication izay tsy namoaka afa-tsy ny sary famantaran'ny hetsika Naoty fotsy misy soratra manao hoe Ho amin'ny fahalalaham-pitenenana sy ny famahanam-bolongana, tahaka izay nataon'i Chiheb. ||| The majority of bloggers took part in the White note campaign like Ounormal, Metallistication who just posted the White Note Action logo with the caption For freedom of expression and blogging, as Chiheb did.
Fa ny mpamaham-bolongana Patriote Tunisien kosa nisafidy hanome Naoty mainty ho an'ny bolongana Toniziana. ||| But blogger Patriote Tunisien chose to give Tunisian blogs a Black Note.
Sudan: Safidy stratejika ve ny maha-iray tsy mivaky? ||| Sudan: Is Unity Still a Strategic Choice?
Amin'ny teny Arabo, ilay Sodane mpitoraka blaogy Ayman Hajj dia mifanakalo hevitra momba ny politikan'ny fireneny sy ny hoe nahoana ny maro amin'ny vahoaka Sodane no tsy mino intsony ny maha-iray tsy mivaky. ||| Writing in Arabic, Sudanese blogger Ayman Hajj discusses his country's politics and why many Sudanese people are losing faith in unity.
Ny asan'ny governemanta Sodane sy ny Hetsi-bahoaka (Popular Movment) tany atsimon'i Sodana, hoy ilay mpitoraka blaogy, dia toa sangy ratsy no fijery azy: ||| The actions of the Sudanese government and the southern Sudan Popular Movement, says the blogger, are being seen as a farce:
Nahoana no mitombo ny fahatsapàna fa hoe ny governemanta Sodane sy ny Hetsi-bahoaka, mpiara-miombona antoka aminy amin'ny fitantànana, dia tsy manao zavatra hafa afa-tsy ny milalao sarimaizina, eo imason'ny vahoaka Sodane? ||| Why is the feeling increase that the Sudanese government and its partner in governance, the Popular Movement, are not doing anything other than performing a play which is dull, in front of the eyes of the Sudanese people?
Ny fihetsiketsehana toy izany, hoy i Hajj manoratra, dia manohintohina ny maha-iray tsy mivaky an'i Sodana: ||| Such a charade, writes Hajj, puts the unity of Sudan on the line:
Ny tsy asiako fisalasalàna dia ny fiombonan-tsain'ireo roa ireo hamaky an'i Sodana ao anatin'izao efa toerana misy azy izao ho firenena roa. ||| What I have no doubt about is that the two are almost in agreement to the splitting up of Sudan under its current boundaries into two countries.
Zava-poana ny firesahana ny maha-iray tsy mivaky ho tahaka ny zava-manintona. ||| Talk about unity as an attractive option is empty.
Nandritra ireo taona nifandimby teo aloha, tsy nisy mihitsy nandray andraikitra hahatongavana amin'izany - maha-iray tsy mivaky. ||| Throughout the previous years, neither have committed to any action that could lead to that - unity.
Niady izy ireo ary namorona. ||| They have been fighting and making up.
Ny ankilany manozona sy manompa ny andaniny ary ny andaniny miezaka mandamindamina ny toe-draharaha ka manohy manao ny fombafombam-panambadiana ihany. ||| One of them would curse and swear at the other and the other party would try to pacify the situation and continue with the courtship rituals.
Ny vokatra farany dia tsy misy ahafahan'izy ireo manome toky antsika fa hoe niezaka nanao zavatra mba hampanjary ny maha-iray tsy mivaky ho zava-mahasarika ry zareo ireo. ||| The end result is that nothing they do makes us believe that they are trying to create something that would make unity an attractive option.
Am-pitanisàna zava-bita vao haingana, manamarika ny mpitoraka blaogy fa: ||| Citing a recent development, the blogger notes:
Fehiny, ny Hetsi-bahoaka (Popular Movement) dia nikarakara, tamin'ny faran'ny herinandro lasa teo, famoriam-bahoaka izay nosakanan'ny governemanta. ||| Finally, the Popular Movement last week organised a rally that was suppressed by the government.
Mpitarika maro no voasambotra. ||| A number of leaders were arrested.
Izy ireo dia isan'ireo nanao fanehoan-kevitra tamin'ny fahitalavitra nilaza fa ny governemanta dia mpanao didy jadona, raha adinon'izy ireo kosa fa ry zareo ireo koa dia tsy hafa fa mpiara-miombona antoka ao amin'io governemanta io. ||| They were among those who have been giving statements on television saying that the government was an oppressive dictatorship, while forgetting that they themselves are original partners in this government.
Nihodinan'ny governemanta ny resaka ka nolazainy fa niarahany sy ireo mpiara-miombona antoka aminy nanaiky ny lalàna maromaro manohana ny fifanarahana ho amin'ny fandriam-pahalemana sy ny fanohizana ny làlana demaokratika. ||| The government then turns around and announces that it has agreed with its partner on a number of laws which support the peace agreement and pursuing a democratic option.
Dia nifandray tànana ry zareo ary ny Hetsika dia nanoroka ny takolaky ny governemanta toy ireny hoe tsy nisy na inona na inona nitranga ireny akory. ||| They then shake hands and the Movement imprints a kiss on the cheeks of the government as if nothing has happened.
Ho famarànana, hoy izy: ||| In conclusion, he says:
Fehiny, ny fanao toy izany no mahatery ny vahoaka tsy hino intsony ny maha-iray tsy mivaky, izay raha araka ny tena iainana azy dia tena safidy stratejika mihitsy. ||| Finally, it is those actions that force citizens to lose faith in unity, which is in reality a strategic option.
Tsy mino azy io intsony ry zareo satria efa nomena sary ho toy ny zavatra tsy azo ampiarahana amin'ny fahasamihafàna ara-poko, ara-pivavahana sy ara-toekarena izy io. ||| They no longer believe in it because it is being portrayed as an impossibility to coexist with ethnic, religious and economic differences.
Global Voices any Haiti: Ny Ekipanay any an-Toerana ||| Global Voices in Haiti: Our Team on the Ground
Taorian'ny horohorontany ny 12 Janoary izay nanapotika ny faritra atsimon'i Haiti, namory andiana mpandikateny sy mpanoratra vitsivitsy ny Global Voices mba hanao fitateram-baovao amin'ny atsipiriany momba ny vonjy, fanampiana, ary ireo ezaka fanarenana isan-karazany. ||| In the wake of the 12 January earthquake that devastated southern Haiti, Global Voices assembled a small team of editors and authors to provide detailed coverage of rescue, relief, and recovery efforts.
Iray amin'ireo olana lalovanay anefa dia ny fahavitsian'ny olom-pirenena Haitiana manome vaovao. ||| One of our challenges is the relatively small scale of Haitian citizen media.
Vitsy dia vitsy ireo Haitiana no mampiasa fitaovana amin'ny aterineto hizarana vaovao na hevitra amin'ny vahoaka. ||| Very few Haitians currently use online tools to publicly share news or opinions.
Nandritra ireo roa herinandro farany teo, ny Global Voices dia niankina indrindra tamin'ny haino aman-jery sosialy (valam-piarahamonina) mivantana sahanin'ireo mahavatra mi-tweet sy mitoraka blaogy manana herin'aratra sy aterineto. ||| In the past two weeks, Global Voices has leaned heavily on the social media streams of a handful of regular tweeters and bloggers with access to electricity and Internet connections.
Novatsianay koa izany fitateram-baovao izany tamin'ny alalan'ny vaovaon'ireo blaogy sy hafatra amin'ny Twitter avy amin'ireo mpanome fanampiana avy any ivelany sy ireo Fikambanana Tsy Miankina eny an-toerana. ||| We've supplemented this coverage with information from the blogs and Twitter streams of foreign aid workers and NGOs on the ground.
Izahay ato amin'ny Global Voices dia mino fa ilaina maika ny fanamafisana ny fomba fijerin'ireo Haitiana momba ny vonjy sy ny ezaka fanarenana. ||| We at Global Voices believe there is an urgent need to amplify Haitian perspectives on relief and reconstruction efforts.
Làlana iray manan-danja amin'izany ny fampandrosoana ny fihetsiketsehan'ny haino aman-jery avy amin'ny olom-pirenena any Haiti, mba hahazoana alalana amina vaovao sy hevitra bebe kokoa izay mety hisy vokatra tsara eo amin'ny fahatsiarovan-tena, fahalinana, resaka ary fanapahan-kevitra ho an'ireo volana mbola ho avy. ||| One crucial way is to increase citizen media activity locally in Haiti, thereby making available more news and commentary that may positively affect awareness, interest, conversations, and decisions in the coming months.
Ho an'izany no nandefasan'i Global Voices ekipan'olon-droa any Port-au-Prince, mba hanampiana ny fanohanana ny fitateram-baovao amin'ny haino aman-jerin'ny olom-pirenena. ||| To this end, Global Voices has sent a two-person team to Port-au-Prince, to help support citizen media coverage.
Ny talen'ny Global Voices Georgia Popplewell sy ilay tompon'andraikitra taloha tao amin'ny teny Frantsay Alice Backer dia niatrika ny zava-nitranga tany an-toerana nandritra ireo enina andro farany teo, mifandray amin'ireo Haitiana amin'ny alalan'ny fitaovana amin'ny haino aman-jerin'ny olom-pirenena, ary mitady ireo hafa manana fahafahana handray anjara sy hanafana ny dindinika amin'ny aterineto, raha mahazo ireo loharano marina izy ireo. ||| GV's managing director Georgia Popplewell and former Francophonia editor Alice Backer have spent the past six days assessing the situation on the ground, making contact with Haitians using citizen media tools, and identifying others with the potential to participate in and enrich the online conversation, given the right resources.
Izy ireo dia samy mandefa fanampim-baovao matetika amin'ny alalan'ny blaogin'izy ireo manokana sy ny Twitter-ny: Georgia ao amin'ny Caribbean Free Radio sy Alice ao amin'ny Kiskeácity sy ||| Both have been issuing regular reports via their personal blogs and Twitter accounts: Georgia at Caribbean Free Radio and Alice at Kiskeácity and @kiskeacity.
Mamoaka sary ao amin'ny Flickr-ny koa i Georgia. ||| Georgia is also posting photos at her Flickr account.
Ary hampiasa ny tatitra ataon'izy ireo izahay hamenoana ny fitateram-baovao ataon'ny Global Voices ao min'ny dinidinika mandeha amin'ny aterineto. ||| And we will be using their firsthand reporting to complement Global Voices' coverage of the ongoing online conversation.
Manazava i Georgia raha manoratra ao amin'ny blaoginy andro vitsivitsy alohan'ny hiaingana ho any Haiti: ||| Writing at her blog a few days before leaving for Haiti, Georgia explained:
Raha jerena ny haben'ny fahasimbàna—sy ny haben'ny fandraisana anjaran'ireo Amerikana amin'ny vonjy sy ny ezaka fanarenana— dia manahy aho fa tsy hanjavona eny amin'ireo pejin'ireo haino aman-jery lehibe tahaka ireo tantara hafa iny horohorontany tany Haiti iny. ||| I suspect that given the magnitude of the damage—and the magnitude of US involvement in the relief and reconstruction efforts—the Haiti earthquake isn't going to disappear from the pages of the major media in the way that other stories have.
Nefa ho karazana fitateram-baovao hafa ity, ary iray izay tsy dia mila loatra manasongadina ireo tantara any an-toerana. ||| But it's going to be a different kind of coverage, and one that won't necessarily highlight local stories.
Iray amin'ireo tanjona kendrenay indrindra noho izany ny fanasongadinana ny filàna fanandratam-peo any an-toerana sy ny fanondrotana ny fotoana anana'ireo fiaraha-monina voadonan'ny horohorontany mba hohenoina sy ho takatr'ireo miasa sy mitatitra momba ny ezaka fanarenana— vondrona izay ahitàna sampan-draharaha sy haino aman-jery haitiana ary koa mpandraharaha iraisam-pirenena. ||| Another of our key goals, therefore, is to highlight the need for local voices in the mix and increase the opportunities for communities affected by the earthquake to be heard and understood by those working and reporting on the recovery—a group that includes Haitian institutions and media as well as international agencies.
Tsy mieritreritra izahay fa ho mora izany: Saro-pantarina i Haiti ary tena goavana ny fahasimbàna any amin 'ilay firenena. ||| We don't expect it will be easy: Haiti is a complex place and the damage to the country has been severe.
Ny asan'ny Global Voices any Haiti dia tohanan'ireo mpanome fanampiana mahazatra anay sy vatsy ho an'ny vaovao momba ny fanampiana avy amin'ireo fanadihadiana. ||| Global Voices' work in Haiti is supported by our general support donors and by a humanitarian information grant from Internews.
Mba tsidiho ny pejin'ny Global Voices momba ny horohorontany tany Haiti raha mila fanampim-baovao. ||| Please visit the Global Voices Haiti Earthquake page for more coverage.
Maraoka: tsy nampoizina nandravarava ||| Morocco: In Meknès, a Devastating Accident
Minaret Bab Berdieyinne, Meknes Maraoka (saripikan'i Eli J. T.) ||| Bab Berdieyinne Minaret, Meknes Morocco (photo by Eli J. T).
Vaovaom-paharavana nitranga tany Maraoka tamin'ny 19 Febroary lasa teo: Nihotsaka nandritra ny fotoam-bavaka isan-joma ny minaret an'ny môske Bab Berdieyinne (fantatra ihany koa amin'ny hoe moske Lalla Khenata bint Bekkar) izy miorina ao amin'ny tanàna Lovan'ny UNESCO ao Meknès, Maraoka (izay nipetrahako ny 2005-2007). ||| On February 19, devastating news from Morocco: the minaret of the Bab Berdieyinne Mosque (also known as the Lalla Khenata bint Bekkar Mosque) in the UNESCO heritage city of Meknès, Morocco (where I lived from 2005-2007) had collapsed during Friday prayers.
Nolazaina ho 11 ny isan'ny maty tamin'ny voalohany, fa araka ny nampitain'ny CNN tamin'ny sabotsy manaraka io dia 36 izany sady niampy maratra 71. ||| The initial death toll was reported as 11, but by the following Saturday, CNN had reported it as 36, with an additional 71 injured.
Nolazaina moa fa noho ny orana nisesy no nampalemy ny fanorenan'ilay minaret ka nahatonga ny fihotsahana. ||| The collapse was reported to have occurred due to recent heavy rains which weakened the structure of the minaret.
Nifampizara ny fitantarana tao an-toerana sy ny fiaraha-miory tamin'ny mponin'i Meknès ny mpamaham-bolongana. ||| Bloggers are sharing local stories and condolences with the people of Meknès.
Manoratra i MontanaRon, izay nampianatra teny anglisy tao amin'ity tanàna ity: ||| MontanaRon, who taught English in the city, writes:
Noadinoiko ny naneho fiarah-miory tamin'ireo namana Maraokana noho ity voina nahafatesana olona maro ity tamin'ny nihotsahan'ny Mosken'i Bab Berdieyinne. ||| I forgot to offer my condolences to all of my Moroccan friends for the devastating loss of life in the collapse of the Bab Berdieyinne Mosque.
Mivavaka aho mba tsy haninona avokoa ireo olom-pantatro, Insha'Allah. ||| I pray that those of you I know are all well, Insha'Allah.
Ho an'ireo izay tsy nahare moa moa dia nisy voina nitranga tany Meknes, izay niasako nandritra ny herintaona. ||| For those who haven't heard, the mosque disaster occurred in Meknes, where I worked for a year.
Tamin'ny fanisana farany moa dia 41 no nindaosin'ny fahafatesana ary maro ny naratra. ||| At last count, 41 people have died and many more have been injured.
Mitodika any amin'ireo izay nharam-boina ny foko. ||| My heart goes out to all of those who have been affected.
Ato ny rohy ahitana sary nopihako tamin'ny tanàna tranain'i Meknes avy tao wadi, tanàna vaovao izay nipetrahako. ||| Here's a link to a photo I took of the old city of Meknes from a position across the wadi, where I lived in the new section of town.
Na dia tsy fantatro aza hoe aiza no misy ny Moske Bab Berdieyinne ao amin'ity sary ity, di amatoky aho fa iray amin'ireo voapika ao izany. ||| Although I don't know where the Bab Berdieyinne Mosque might be in that photo, I'm sure it's one of those pictured.
Ampahafantaro ahy azafady ny misy azy raha misy mahita ao amin'ny sary. ||| If anyone views the shot, let me know if you see it.
Manantitra ny fiaraha-miory sy ny fampiononana amin'ireo izany niharam-boina aho. ||| Again, my condolences to anyone affected by this disaster.
Nampitodika ny mpamaky ho amina sary irain'ny moske, tao amin'ny Twitter, ny minisitry ny raharaham-bahiny Bahrainita (sary etsy ambony), sady nivolana hoe: ||| Bahraini Foreign Minister Khalid Al Khalifa pointed readers in the direction of a photo of the mosque (pictured above) on Twitter, saying:
Ministry ny raharaham-bahiny Bahrainita Khalid Al Khalifa ||| Bahraini Foreign Minister Khalid Al Khalifa
Tsy fitandremana tao an-toerana ve? ||| Local Neglect?
Anisan'ireo mpamaham-bolongam-baovao Maraokana maro ny Morocco Post izay mahita ity minaret mirodana ity ho avy amina tsy fitandremana. ||| Moroccan news blog Morocco Post is one of several bloggers who finds the circumstances surrounding the minaret's collapse neglectful.
Avy amin'ny fanaovam-pampitahana tamin'ny raharahan-tsy fitandremana alika nitranga tany Angletera sy ity voina ity no nanipazan'ny mpamaham-bolongana teny: ||| Drawing a comparison between the accident and a recent case in England of canine neglect, the blogger writes:
Ohatra, nomena sazy mihantona enim-bolana sy nodidiana handoa onitra £2 500 noho ny fandikan-dalàna nataony tamin'ny herintaona ny manamboninahitra polisy iray tay Angletera tamin'ny Alatsinainy 22 Febroary 2010 teo. ||| For instance, on Monday 22 February 2010, a police officer in England was given a six-month conditional discharge and ordered to pay £2,500 costs for a criminal offence that he committed last year.
Hita ho tompon'antoka tamin'ny fahafatesana Jay-Jay 18 volana sy Jet fito volana, izay tao aorian'ny fiara nandritra ny hafanam-be tamin'ny volana jona ny taona lasa teo ny Ôfisien'ny polisy Mark Johnson... ||| PC Mark Johnson was found guilty of the death of 18-month-old Jay-Jay and seven Jet, who were in the back of a police vehicle during a heat wave in June last year...
... |||...
...Ampielaro kely ary ny fakanareo antsaina ny zavamisy ka ampifandraiso ireo voina roa ireo: olombelona 41 no maty rehefa nihotsaka teo amboniny ny minaret ary tsy misy ny tompon'andraikitra satria nambara fa ny orana no antony, nefa nisy alika roa matin'ny setroka dia polisy iray no nentina teny amin'ny fitsarana. |||...So broaden your imagination and juxtapose the two disasters: 41 human beings died after a mosque minaret collapse on them and no one is to assume responsibility as the rain was the cause, whereas 2 dogs died of heatstroke and the police officer in charge was brought to justice.
Koa izao ny fanontaniako: Iza no alika ary iza no olombelona? ||| Now the question is: who are the dogs and who are the human beings?
Mizotra ny fiainana ||| Life Goes On
Nanambara ny Morocco Time fa maromaro ny fitondram-panjakana vahiny no nandefa ny fiaraha-miory tamin'ny vahoaka Maraokana. ||| Morocco Time reports that a number of foreign governments have offered their condolences to the people of Morocco.
Ny toerana nijoroan'ny minaret taloha (Saripikan'i The Moroccan Dispatches) ||| The site where the minaret once stood (Photo by The Moroccan Dispatches)
Ary nizara ny sary nisian'ny voina ny The Moroccan Dispatches, vahiny iray monina any Meknès, ka manazava fa: ||| And The Moroccan Dispatches, a foreigner living in Meknès, shares photographs of the accident site, explaining that:
Mitohy toy ny mahazatra ny fiainana eo amin'ny manodidina, saingy nitsaha-nitampim-bava sy niady hevitra tamin'ny fihotsahana ny maro tamin'ny Maraokana. ||| Life continues as normal in the neighborhood, but many Moroccans stop to gawk and discuss the collapse.
Afovoany Atsinanana: Veloma mandrakizay ry Saramago ||| Middle East: Goodbye Saramago
Misaona sy mitomany ny fahafatesan'ilay mpanoratra Portiogey Jose Saramago ireo mpitoraka blaogy any Moyen-Orient - ilay hany tokana miteny Portioge nahazo loka Nobel ho an'ny Literatiora, izay manana ny fomba ny ara-pivavahana sy ny ara-politika azy manokana tsy takatry ny maro. ||| Bloggers across the Middle East mourned the death of Portuguese writer Jose Saramago - the only Portuguese language Nobel Prize Winner in Literature, who has his own religious and political controversial views.
Taitra tamin'ny fahalasanany daholo ny olona rehetra tany amin'ny tontolo miteny Portioge (Lusosphere) ary tsy ambaka an'izany ny tontolo arabo. ||| People in the Lusosphere and all over the world reacted to his death, and the Arab world is no exception.
Yazan Ashqar no namoaka ity sarin'i Saramago ity tao amin'ny blaoginy ary nanoratra iray amin'ireo fanamarihana malazany hoe: Raisko ho toy ny jamba isika. ||| Yazan Ashqar published this photo of Saramago in his blog and wrote one of his most famous quotes under it: I think we are blind.
Jamba mahiratra. ||| Blind but seeing.
Vahoaka jamba afaka mahita, saingy tsy mahita. ||| Blind people who can see, but do not see.
||| 
Ilay Ejiptiana mpitoraka blaogy, Badawiaa, dia nanoratra ao amin'ny blaoginy momba ny fanaovam-beloma farany an'i Saramago amin'ity fiainana ity: ||| Egyptian blogger, Badawiaa, wrote in her blog about Saramago bidding farewell to life:
Tao anatin'ny kabariny nandritry ny fahazoany ny loka Nobel, niresaka momba ny fahazazany sy ny fahatsiarovany fodimandrin'ny raibeny i Saramago: "Nankeo an-jarizainan'ny tranony izy. ||| In his speech on the occasion of winning the Nobel prize, Saramago spoke about his childhood and remembered his grandfather's death: "He went to the garden of his house.
Nisy hazo maromaro sy kirihitra teo, aviavy sy hazon'oliva. ||| There were some trees and bushes there, fig and olive trees.
Noteteziny tsirairay ireo hazo, fihininy sy tolorany veloma tsirairay. ||| He went to the trees one after the other, hugged and bid each one of them goodbye.
Fantany fa tsy ho afaka ny hahita azy ireo intsony izy. ||| He knew that he won't be able to get back to them again.
Raha toe-javatra toy izany no tsy hamela dindo ao anaty fanahinao mandritry nandrom-piainanao, dia efa olona fo vato ianao izany." ||| If such scene doesn't leave a wound in your soul for the rest of your life, then you are a senseless man".
Ilay Libaney mpitoraka blaogy Jihad Bazzi dia nanontany tena ny amin'ny toerana mety hisy an'i Saramago amin'izao fotoana any amin'ny fianan-tsy hita misy azy any: ||| Lebanese blogger Jihad Bazzi wonders what Saramago might be doing now in his afterlife:
Lasa ilay mpanoratra... ||| The writer has passed away...
Ankoatry ny maha-mpanoratra azy dia manana ny fironany ara-politika azy manokana koa i Saramago. ||| Besides being a writer, Saramago has his own political stance as well.
Izany no nahatonga an'i Yassin El Suwayheh, Siriana iray mpitoraka blaogy, monina any Espana, hanoratra momba ny fironana ara-politika manokan'i Saramago ao amin'ny blaoginy Spanish waves on Levant shores: ||| And this made Yassin El Suwayheh, a Syrian blogger living in Spain, write about Saramago's political stance in his blog Spanish waves on Levant shores:
Maty ny lehilahy iray, izay azo fantarina fara-faharatsiny amin'ireo loka lehibe azony tamin'ny literatiora sy ny tononkalo, ary isan'ireny ny loka Nobel ho an'ny literatiora. ||| A man has died, who can at least be identified with his major awards in literature and poetry, and Noble prize for literature was one of those prizes.
Mpamaky iray tsy mitonona anarana no nametraka fanamarihana ao amin'ny lahatsoratr'i Yassin. ||| An anonymous reader commented on Yassin's post.
Nifantoka tamina fehezanteny iray ilay mpamaky, "Maty ny lehilahy iray, izay azo fantarina fara-faharatsiny amin'ireo loka lehibe azony tamin'ny literatiora sy ny tononkalo" sady nanoratra fa izay atao sy soratan'ireny olo-malaza ireny no hanamarihana an-dry zareo fa tsy izay loka azony akory: ||| The reader objected to the phrase, "A man has died, who can at least be identified with his major awards in literature and poetry" writing that it's what such personalities do and say that identifies them and not the prizes and awards they win:
Sombin-javatra ihany eo amin'ny fiainan'ny olo-maventy toy ireny ny loka. ||| Awards are just a marginal part in such great people's lives.
Sahala amin'ny hoe hany làlana azon'izao tontolo izao hialana ny henatra manoloana azy ireny ihany iny ka omena azy ireo ny loka toy izany mba hahazoana anaina amin'izay zavatra voatery tsy maintsy hataon'izy ireo. ||| It's like the world's only way to not feel guilty towards them and give them such awards to feel comfortable doing what they are obliged to do.
Sahala amin'ny hoe miandry fankatoavana toy izany ery ireny olo-malaza ireny. ||| It is as if those great men are really waiting for such recognition.
Etsy ankilany, Ahmed Shawky dia nanahy fa ny fijoroana ara-politikan'i Saramago, dia mety hitarika ny olona handray ny fijeriny ho toy ny mpanoratra mpamorona. ||| On the other hand, Ahmed Shawky was worried that Saramago's political stances, might make people overlook his side as a creative writer.
Veloma ho an'ny rain'ny literationa Portioge. ||| Goodbye to the father of Portuguese literature.
Fantatro fa tsy maintsy hiresaka momba ny fironana ara-politika nanananao ry zareo ato ho ato, ary mandritra izany resaka izany dia ho adinon-dry zareo ny ny foto-kevidehibe tokana sy manangana avy aminao§. ||| I know they will keep talking in the coming days about your respectful political stances, and during these talks they will forget your creative and unique masterpieces.
Veloma ry Jose Saramago. ||| Goodbye Jose Saramego.
Maro amin'ireo avara-pianarana Arabo no mahalala momba an'i Jose Saramago, na nandre ny aminy. ||| Many Arab intellectuals know about, and have read for, Jose Saramago.
Indrisy anefa fa maro no tokony hisaotra amin'ny fahafatesany tamin'ny nitarihany azy ireny ho mpanoratra tahaka azy koa. ||| Unfortunately many others should be thankful to his death for introducing them to writer like him.
Ahmed El Mueini dia nanoratra ao anatin'ny blaoginy momba ny Blindness, tantara noforonin'i Saramago, sy ny fomba nahazoany azy ity ho isan'ny tahirim-bokiny nefa tsy mba nanana fotoana namakiana azy velively: ||| Ahmed El Mueini wrote in his blog about Saramago's novel Blindness, and how he has had it in his bookshelf but never had the chance to read it:
Nanjary nalaza be i Saramago noho ilay tantara nosoratany, "Blindness ", izay natonta tamin'ny 1995, ary nadikan'i "Muhammad Habib" ho amin'ny teny Arabo tato aoriana kely, ary avy eo natontan'i "Dar El Mada" avy eo. ||| Saramago became very well known for his novel, "Blindness ", which was published in 1995, and was later on translated into Arabic by "Muhammad Habib", and was then published by "Dar El Mada".
Nalaza ihany koa izy tamin'ilay bokiny, "The Gospel According to Jesus Christ ", izay isan'ny antony nialany an'i Portugal sy nandaniany ny andro sisa niainany tany amin'ny Nosy Canary. ||| He was also well known for his book, "The Gospel According to Jesus Christ ", which was the reason behind his departure from Portugal to spend the rest of his life in the Canary Islands.
Blindness" nosoratany eo amin'ny tahirin-bokiko ka antenaiko fa hisy fotoana mba hamakiako azy atsy ho atsy. ||| Blindness" on my bookshelf and wish to have the chance to read it soon.
Avy eo i Omani Wadhha AlBusaidi nanao fanamarihana tamin'ny lahatsoratr'i Ahmed El Mueini: ||| Omani Wadhha AlBusaidi then commented on Ahmed El Mueini's post:
Hotahian'Andriamanitra anie ny fanahiny. ||| God bless his soul.
Mpitondra fanamarihana hafa indray no namaly ka nilaza famalahelo ny tsy hahita intsony ny asa soratr'i Saramago izy, eny fa na dia tsy miombon-kevitra amin'ny fomba fijeriny ny ara-pivavahana aza izy: ||| Another commenter replied saying that he will sure miss Saramago's writings, although he doesn't agree with his religious views:
Ny azo antoka dia tsy hahita intsony ireo asa soratra goavany aho ary ilay somba fanorany mahasarika. ||| For sure I'll miss his great novels and attractive writing style.
Ary farany, Laila, nanoro hevitra an'i Ahmed mba tsy hamela mandalo fotsiny ny fotoana ahafahany mamaky ireo tantara voasoratr'i Saramago: ||| And finally, Laila, advised Ahmed not to miss the chance of reading Saramago's novel:
Ny toro-hevitro aminao ry Ahmed, dia aza avela handalo fotsiny ny vintana mety hahafahanao mamaky ny "Blindness ". ||| My advice to you Ahmed, is not to miss the chance of reading "Blindness ".
Tena tantara milaza ny zava-misy io izay manome lanja ny fampiasana ny masonao. ||| It's a very realistic novel that will make you feel the value of your eyes.
Hatramin'ny anio dia matahotra foana ny mety ho fahaverezan'ny fahitako tampoka aho. ||| Until today I still have the fear of loosing my sight all of a sudden.
Afrika atsimo: Fiadiana ny amboara manerantany, zato andro sisa ||| South Africa: 2010 Soccer World Cup – 100 Days and counting...
Tompokolahy sy tompokovavy, indreto isika ireto! ||| Ladies and gentlemen it's here!
Manomboka ny fanisana ary miampita amin'ny isa azo marihina isika, 100 andro tokoa manko sisa. ||| The countdown is on and we are about to cross the psychological number of 100 days left to go.
Ny fiadiana ny ho tompon'ny amboara manerantany amin'ny lalao baolina fandaka karakarain'ny FIFA tokoa manko izao hetsika ara-panatanjahantena be mpiandry indrindra tsy noho ny fiezineziny ihany fa io fa any amin'ny kaontinanta maroloko indrindra manerantany no hanatontosana azy – Afrika! ||| FIFA Soccer World Cup has become the most awaited sports event in recent history not just because of its magnitude but because it comes to the world's most colourful continent – Africa!
Raha mbola misalasala amin'izay hahavitan'i Afrika Atsimo ity fifaninanana ity ny haino aman-jery tandrefana ka manabanty matetika ny kaontinanta, dia miomana hanapariaka araka izay tratra ny andron'ny 2 Marsa andro fahazato indrindra mialoha ny hetsika goavana. ||| While the Western media still doubts South Africa's capability to hold the tournament and always throwing jibes at the continent, the South African authorities are ready to make a buzz of this as 2nd March counts exactly 100 days to the start of this magnanimous event.
Inona ny tokony ataon'i Afrika Atsimo handresy lahatra izao tontolo izao fa efa vonona tanteraka izy? ||| What should South Africa do to convince the world that it is ready?
: |||:
Manontany ny tenako aho hoe inona koa no tokony ataon'i Afrika Atsimo handresy lahatra izao tontolo izao fa tsy vitan'ny hoe vonona izy, fa mahavita mampiantrano, ary ho tsara fampiantranoana ny Amboara Manerantany? ||| I have had to ask myself, what else will South Africa do to convince the world that it is not only ready, but capable of hosting and hosting well, the World Cup?
Ary hoy izy nanohy: ||| He continues:
Tsy misy ifandraisany amin'ny fahavononan'ny ekipa isan-karazany kosa aloha ny fanisana, izay manentana antsika kokoa hiatrika ity lalaom-panatanjahantena miavaka manerantany ity. ||| The countdown, therefore, has nothing to do with the readiness of the teams, rather it tends to sensitise us to the greatest single sport spectacle on earth.

The fields were boggy and saturated so the English FA contracted Richard Hayden, from the Sports Turf Research Institute to work on improving their condition.
