Rosia: Ny Fiainan'ny Silamo Ankehitriny Ao Mosko - Ny Zava-misy ||| Russia: Moscow's Modern Muslim Experience - In Context
Ny fitomboan'ny mponina silamo ao Mosko dia maneho ny lalana izoran'ny foko sy finoana Rosiana eo anivon'ny tantara sy zava-nisy izay nanova ny fijerin'ny Rosiana sy ny fandraisany ny vahiny, izay namolavola ny fomba teo amin'ny fiarahamoniny sy ny politikan'ny governemantany ankehitriny momba azy ireny. ||| Moscow's growing Muslim population exemplifies the modern experience of Russia's ethnic and religious minorities amid the backdrop of historical events that have molded the Russian perception of outsiders and thus influence modern societal and governmental policies towards them.
Natsangana tamin'ny taonjato faha-9, Novgorod dia mampiantrano iray amin'ireo toerana masina indrindra ao amin'ny firenena - toerana iray atao hoe "1000 taonan'i Rosia ". ||| Founded in the 9th century, Novgorod is home to one of the country's most sacred sites - a monument entitled, "1,000 Years of Russia".
Nandritra ny Ady Lehibe faharoa dia nilatsaka teo an-tànan'i miaramilan'i Hitler ny tanàna ka nisy ny tetika handrava ilay sarivongana sy hitondra izany hiverina ho any Alemàna, talohan'ny nahazoan'ny tafika Sovietika an'i Novgorod indray tamin'ny 1944. ||| During WWII, the city fell to Hitler's armies and plans were made to dissemble the monument and haul it back to Germany, before the Soviet Army triumphantly retook Novgorod in 1944.
Sarivongan'ny taonarivo ao Novgorod. ||| Millennium of Russia Monument in Novgorod.
Sary: Wikimedia Commons (CC BY-SA 3.0). ||| Photo: Wikimedia Commons (CC BY-SA 3.0).
Taonjato maro talohan'ny Alemàna Nazi dia nitoeran'ny tafika Mongola efa ho nandritra ny 200 taona i Rosia, hatramin'ny nandavan'i Ivan III ('Ilay Lehibe') an'i Khan Ahmed tamin'ny 1476. ||| Centuries before Nazi Germany, Mongol armies occupied Russia for over 200 years, until Ivan III ("The Great") denied Khan Ahmed his tribute in 1476.
Nidika izany fa tamin'ny niatrika fivoarana lehibe ara-kolontsaina sy ara-tsiansa (Renaissance) tsy mbola nisy toy izany i Eoropa Andrefana, dia nitolona tamin'ny hery famoretana avy any ivelany i Rosia. ||| This meant that while Western Europe was experiencing the unprecedented cultural and scientific growth of the Renaissance, Russia was beholden to stifling foreign oppression.
Ilay mpampiasa LJ, crazypinguin, tao amin'ny fanehoan-kevitra izay nataony tamina lahatsoratra izay tsy mikasika ity lohahevitra ity, dia nanoratra momba ny tsy fitovian'ny tahan'ny olona amin'ity taona 2012 - ny Fiangonana Kristianina: ny Mpivavaka Kristianina mitaha amin'ny Fiangonana Silamo sy ny Mpivavaka Silamo ao Mosko: ||| LJ user crazypinguin, in a comment to a post that has nothing to do with the subject matter of this text, wrote about the disparity in the 2012 ratios - Christian Churches: Practicing Christians to that of Mosques: Practicing Muslims in Moscow:
Tamin'ny faran'ny taona 2010 teo dia niisa 837 ny fiangonana niasa ho an'ny Eglizy Ortodoksa Rosiana - Patriarka ao Moskoa. ||| By the end of the year 2010 in Moscow there were 837 churches in the service of the Russian Orthodox Church-Moscow Patriarchy.
Eo amin'ny 271 amin'ireo fiangonana ireo ihany anefa no misy lamesa tanterahina. ||| However, only in 271 of these church were services conducted.
Ao Mosko tamin'ny 01 Janoary 2012, dia nisy olona 11.629.116, ka tamin'ireo, 91,65 isanjato dia Rosiana (toy ny tamin'ny 2002). ||| In Moscow as of Jan. 1, 2012, there were 11,629,116 people, and of these, 91.65 percent are Russian (as of 2002, though).
Midika izany fa miisa 10,5 tapitrisa ny Rosiana. ||| That means there are 10.5 million Russians.
Amin'ireo, 2 tapitrisa monja (raha mino ny filazan'ny pravmir.com ianao (tranonkala Kristianina Ortodoksa)) dia Kristiana Ortodoksa Rosiana - izay midika fa farafahakeliny indray mandeha isan-taona ary zareo no mandeha any am-piangonana. ||| Of these, only 2 million (if you believe pravmir.com (an Orthodox Christian online portal)) are Russian Orthodox Christians - meaning they go to church at least once a year.
Raha ny zava-misy anefa dia 1 - 1,5 isan-jaton'ny mponina ihany no tena mpandray anjara amin'ny fiainam-piangonana. dia misy mpivavaka 2.500 isaky ny fiangonana. ||| In reality, however, only about 1-1.5 percent of the general population are active church members and for each church there are 2,500 parishioners.
Raha atao ny fanoharana, dia misy fiangonana silamo enina ao Mosko. ||| By comparison, there are six mosques in Moscow.
Ny isan'ny silamo dia eo amin'ny 10 isan-jato eo, raha heverina izany dia manisy lanja kokoa ny fiainam-piaingonana izy ireo. ||| The number of Muslims is about 10 percent, considering that they take a more active role in church life.
Midika izany fa an-tapitrisa no anisàna ny silamo ao Mosko. ||| This means there are a million Muslims in Moscow.
Fiangonana silamo enina. ||| Six mosques.
mpivavaka 150.000 (isaky ny fiangonana). ||| 150,000 parishioners (per mosque).
Na dia ny 1 isan-jato (amin'ny mponina silamo ao Mosko) fotsiny aza no mamonjy lamesa tsy miova, dia mbola mijanona ho 15.000 isaky ny fiangonana silamo ihany izany. ||| Even if only 1 percent (of the Muslim population of Moscow) attend services regularly, the figure remains at 15,000 people per mosque.
Ny Moske Goavana ao Mosko eo an-dalam-panamboarana tamin'ny 2009. ||| Moscow Cathedral Mosque under reconstruction in 2009.
Sary avy amin'i Macs24 (CC BY-SA 3.0). ||| Photo by Macs24 (CC BY-SA 3.0).
Ny blaogin'ireo olona avy ao Azia Afovoany dia nanoratra mikasika ny toe-javatra sarotra atrehin'ny mponina Silamo ao Mosko, manainga mavesatra ireo mpamaky mba hitondra am-bavaka ireo avy any amin'ny faritra misy azy ireo izay nifindra monina an-tanàn-dehibe hitady fivoarana ara-toekarena: ||| Central Asian Peoples Blog elaborated on the hardships Moscow's Muslim population faces, as it urged readers to pray for those from their region who had emigrated to the city in search of economic opportunities:
Mba mivavaha ho an'ireo avy ao Azia Afovoany izay mandao ny fianakaviany sy ny firenena niaviany handeha hiasa any Mosko. ||| Please pray for the many Central Asians who leave their families and their home countries while they go to work in Moscow.
Raha ny mahazatra dia tsy voaray an-tanan-droa izy ireo any. ||| They are not usually welcomed there.
Maro amin'izy ireo no enjehina sy avakavahana. ||| Many of them are harassed and discriminated against.
Na dia miasa amin'ny tany milaza azy ho kristianina aza izy ireo, dia mahàlana vao maheno sy mahita ny Vaovao Mahafaly. ||| Even though they are working in a land that proclaims Christianity, they very seldom hear or see the Good News.
Toy ny oram-panàla mameno ny làlana sy ny sisin-dalan'i Mosko, voakiky vantany vao mikasika ny tany. ||| As the snow fills the streets and sidewalks of Moscow it is usually scraped off as soon as it hits the ground.
Isaky ny maraina dia tairin'ny feom-by mikasoka amin'ny lalana ny vahoaka. ||| Each morning people are awoken by the sounds of metal against the asphalt sidewalks.
Io feo io dia ataon'ny mpanadio lalana, izay ny ankabeazany dia avy any Azia Afovoany. ||| This noise is created by a band of street cleaners, most of whom are Central Asians.
Ny ankamaroan'ireo lehilahy ireo dia nandao ny tokantranony tany Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan sy firenena hafa any Azia Afovoany. ||| Most of these men have left their homes in Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, and some other CA countries.
Mankany Mosko izy ireo mba hitady vola halefa ho an'ireo havany any an-tanindrazany. ||| They are in Moscow to make money in order to send back to their families.
Miasa roa ambin'ny folo ora na mihoatra izany isan'andro izy ireo, fito andro isaky ny herinandro. ||| These men work twelve or more hours a day, seven days a week.
Ny hany fisaorana mba azon'izy ireo ho tamibin'ny asa mafiny dia karama kely sy ny antsojain'ny manam-pahefana any an-toerana nohon'ny lokon'ny hodiny. ||| The only thanks they receive for their hard work is a small paycheck and harassment by the local authorities because of their skin color.
Raha miasa any Mosko izy ireo dia maro no mahatsiaro ho irery, malahelo ny fianakaviany sy mitady tanjona amin'ny fiainana. ||| As they work in Moscow many of them are lonely, missing their families and looking for purpose in life.
Mpiasa avy any Azia Afovoany eny an-dalamben'i Mosko. ||| A Central Asian migrant worker walks down the street in Moscow.
Sary nalain'i Veronica Khokhlova, nahazoana alalana. ||| Photo by Veronica Khokhlova, used with permission.
Ny bilaogiko dia misy tantara mampihomehy maneho ny tsy fitiavana vahiny hita taratra amin'ny kolontsaina fahiny sy mifandrirondrirotry ny Rosiana: ||| My blog included a joke which provides insight into how xenophobia fits into the ancient and complex Russian culture:
"Nisy vahiny roa teo amin'ny Kianja Mena tao Mosko nijery ny Kremlin, talanjona. ||| "Two foreigners once stood in Red Square in Moscow looking up at the Kremlin and they were in awe.
Te ho Rosiana izy ireo sy ho izay zavatra rehetra maha-Rosiana ny Rosiana, ka nanontany zokiolona iray izay tokony ho ataony mba hahatonga azy ireo ho tena Rosiana. ||| They wanted to be Russian and to be everything Russians are so they asked an elderly Russian man how they could in fact become Russian.
Namaly ilay lehilahy ka naniraka azy ireo hianika ny tilikambo iray ao Kremlin sy hikasika ny kintana mena eo amin'ny tampony ka hiova ho lehilahy Rosiana eo noho eo. ||| The man told them to climb up and touch the red star on top of one of the Kremlin's turrets and he said they would then be transformed instantly into two Russian men.
Dia nianika tokoa ary ireto lehilahy ka nikitika ilay kintana mena ny voalohany ka niova Rosiana teo noho eo. ||| So the men climbed up the turret and the first man touched the star and he was transformed instantly.
Afaka nanoratra tononkalom-pitiavana toa an'i Pushkin sy hira toa an'i Tchaikovsky izy, afaka nandihy sy niady ary nahatsiaro tena lalina toy ny Rosiana rehetra. ||| He could write love poetry like Pushkin and symphonies like Tchaikovsky, he could dance and fight and feel as deeply as any Russian could.
Fotoana vitsy taorian'izay dia nanontany ilay faharoa raha afaka hiakatra sy hikitika ilay kintana koa ka hivadika ho Rosiana. ||| A moment later, the second man asked the first if he could have a hand up so he too could touch the star and become Russian.
Avy dia nodakan'ilay voalohany tany amin'ny vavany izy ka nilazany hoe "Mialà teo ilay vahiny tsy misy ilàna azy ity!" ||| The first man then kicked him in the teeth and said, 'Get the hell out of here, you foreign trash!
Islam ao amin'ny Europe Blog dia namoaka sombin-dahatsoratra tamin'ny lahatsoratry ny Interfax ny Febroary 2012 teo, mitondra ny lohateny hoe: "Mosko: Manampahefana Ambony Ao amin'ny Ministeran'ny Atitany Ahiana ho Naka Vola tamin'ny Vondrom-piarahamonina Silamo", izay maneho ny loza avy amin'ny fanjakana atrehan'ny vitsy an'isa ao Mosko, fanampin'izay efa loza ao amin'ny fiarahamonina: ||| Islam in Europe Blog provided excerpts from a Feb. 2012 Interfax article entitled, "Moscow: High-Ranking Interior Ministry Officials Suspected of Extortion from Muslim Community," in an effort to illustrate the governmental hazards Moscow minorities face in addition to societal ones:
Ireo manampahefan'ny Sampandraharahan'ny Filaminana Federaly dia nandefa porofo tamin'ny Mpitsara mpampanoa lalàna, naneho fa naka vola be tamina Fikambanana Silamo iray ny mpiasa maro tao amin'ny Sampana Fototry ny Ministeran'ny Atitany ho Fisorohana ny 'Extremisme', hoy ny tatitry ny gazety mpiseho isan'andro, Kommersant. ||| Federal Security Service officials have submitted to the Prosecutor General's Office materials stating that several high-ranking officials from the Interior Ministry's Main Department for the Prevention of Extremism extorted a large amount of money from a Moscow Muslim community, Kommersant daily reports.
"Ireo manampahefana ao amin'ny Sampandraharahan'ny Filaminana Federaly dia nahazo vaovao nilaza fa hoe nisy trangana fakana vola be niseho tao an-tsenan'ny Lefovortsky ao Mosko talohan'ny fialantsasatry ny faran'ny taona. ||| "The Federal Security Service officers obtained information that a major extortion incident had occurred in the Moscow Lefortovsky market before the New year holidays.
Raha araka izany vaovao izany dia nisy andiana polisy nandeha tany an-tsena nilaza fa hanao fisafoana ary nampitsahatra ny raharahan-tsena sy nangataka 1 tapitrisa robla tamin'ny mpivarotra ho alalana hanohizana indray ny rahaharam-barotra", raha ny voasoratry ny Kommersant. ||| According to that information, a group of police officers went to the market under the pretext of an inspection, suspended the market's operation and demanded 1 million rubles from traders for permission to resume work," Kommersant writes.
Raha ny filazan'ny Kommersant dia nanambara ny polisy fa tonga nanamarina tatitra nilaza fa nisy toerana nipetrahana "extremiste" tsy ara-dalàna izay mody natao ho toeram-pivavahana tao an-tsena, toerana fandehanan'ny mpandraharaha Silamo sy mpiasa Tajik avy amin'ny toerana fiasana ankalamanjana eo akaiky eo. ||| According to Kommersant, the police said they were checking reports stating that there was an illegal extremist center disguised as a prayer room at the market, which was visited by Muslim traders and Tajik workers from nearby construction sites.
olona iray mpampiasa LJ, denisapozhnikov dia niezaka nanohitra ny fitsikeran'ny Tandrefana ny tsy fifandeferana ara-pinoana samihafa ao Rosia, tamin'ny fitanisàna ohatranà fiarahamonina am-pilaminana maro sy manamafy fa Etazonia dia hahazo tombony kokoa amin'ny fandinihana ny politikany manokana momba ny fahalalahana sivily: ||| LJ user denisapozhnikov attempted to counter Western criticism of religious intolerance in Russia by citing several examples of peaceful coexistence and asserting that the United States would benefit from introspection of its own policies regarding civil liberties:
Nisy iraka Amerikana momba ny fahalalahan'ny fivavahana nangataka ny Trano Fotsy "hijery manokana" ny mikasika ny olan'ny fahalalahan'ny fivavahana ao Rosia. ||| A United States commission on freedom of religion asked the White House to pay "special attention" to issues of religious freedoms in Russia.
Heverina ho marina fa voahitsaka ny zon'ny Silamo ao Chechnya, izay ahitàna ny fiangonana Silamo lehibe indrindra any Eraopa, na ao Mosko, izay nanomezana ampahan-tany valo hananganana fiangonana Silamo raha tamin'iny taona lasa iny fotsiny, na any Ivanovo (izay niavian'ny mpanoratra ny blaogy), izay nanome toerana ho an'ny zanaka am-pielezana mba hampisehoany ny kolontsainany mandritra ireo hetsika monisipaly rehetra, tafiditra anatin'izany ny kolontsaina mifandray mivantana amin'ny fivavahana; voasakana ny fivavahana Hindoa fa misy vondrona Hindoa any amin'ireo tanàna lehibe rehetra ary mankalaza ny fetiny ampahibemaso izy ireo mankalaza an'i Krishna; na ny finonana Jiosy, anasàna ny Rabi Lehibe ao Rosia foana amin'ny fivoriana an-tampony. ||| It's probably true that Islamic rights are violated in Chechnya, where there is the largest mosque in Europe, or in Moscow, where only last year eight new plots were allotted for construction of mosques, or in (the blogger's native town of Ivanovo), where during all municipal events special squares are given to diasporas to present their traditions, including those that are religious in nature; maybe Hindus are repressed, but there are Hindu communities in all big cities and they carry out traditional festivities in public areas celebrating Krishna; or Judaism, when the Chief Rabbi of Russia is often invited to high-level summits.
Na mety ho ny toe-javatra mifanohitra amin'izay, ny hoe ny zon'ny Kristianina no voahitsaka?! ||| Or maybe it's the other way around, that the rights of Christians are violated?!
Mety tsy any Rosia no misy ireny olana ireny, fa any Etazonia, izay mamindra ny olana tsy ho ao aminy? ||| Maybe these problems aren't in Russia, but in the US, which points blame away from itself?
Ary angamba mitombo ny isan'ny fiangonana Silamo any Etazonia, saingy aoka tsy hohadinontsika fa isanandro koa (ireo tranobe ireo) dia mahazo fandrahonana horavana. ||| And maybe in the US the number of mosques is growing, but let's not forget that every now and then (these buildings) are threatened to be blown up.
Koa, ry namana, aza mino ny fanpielezan-kevitr'ireo Tandrefana. ||| So do not believe, friends, this Western propaganda.
Farany, ny bilaogy Rosiana Yuri Mamchur dia nanome fanantenana ny mpamaky ary nitondra porofo mampiseho ny fifankahazoana maharitra eo amin'ny kolontsaina samihafa tanaty lahatsoratra nivoaka ny Novambra 2011 mitondra ny lohateny hoe: "170.000 no nankalaza ny fialan-tsasatra Silamo Kurban Bayram teny amin'ny lalan'i Mosko": ||| Finally, Russia Blog's Yuri Mamchur gave readers hope and provided evidence of long-term multicultural understanding in a Nov. 2011 post entitled, "170,000 Celebrate Muslim Holiday Kurban Bayram in Moscow Streets":
Androany dia Silamo nihoatra ny 170.000 no nankalaza ny fetibe Silamo fankalazana ny Kurban Bayram. ||| Today, more than 170,000 Muslims celebrated the important Muslim holiday Kurban Bayram.
Ireo nasionalista Rosiana dia naminaviana fandripahana foko, fipoahana ataon'ny mpampihorohoro, fifandonan'ny saranga. ||| Russian nationalists were predicting an ethnic mayhem, terrorist explosions, and racial clashes.
Tamim-pifaliana sy tamim-pilaminana tanteraka anefa no nizoran'ny fankalazana. ||| However, the celebrations were peaceful and joyful.
Tamina fiangonana silamo iray tao Mosko olona 80.000 no tonga nanatrika ny fankalazana! ||| In one of the Moscow's mosques along the festivities were attended by 80,000 people!
Na dia efa niomana hiatrika toe-javatra manahirana aza ny mpitandro ny filaminana tao Mosko, dia gaga nanatrika ny fizotra nilamin'ny hetsika. ||| Even though the Moscow police was prepared for extraordinary situations, the officers were impressed with the smooth flow of events.
Io fankalazana nahomby sy nizotra tam-pilaminana io, na dia teo aza ny fihenjanana nasionalista nampisavoritaka tao anatin'ny fiarahamonina Rosiana, dia fanehoana manan-danja fa afaka miara-miaina ireo Silamo tony fihetsika sy ny Kristianina ao Rosia, tahaka ny nataony izay 500 taona lasa izay. ||| The successful and peaceful celebration, amid troubling nationalistic tensions in the Russian society, is an important statement that Russia's peaceful Muslims and Christian can coexist, just like they have for the past 500 years.
Libanona: Ny fanomezana fahazoan-dalana ny mpitsoa-ponenana Palestiniana hiasa ||| Lebanon: Giving Palestinian Refugees the Right to Work
toby Nahr el Bared, Libanona (avy amin'ny mpampiasa Flickr nimzilvio) ||| Nahr el Bared camp, Lebanon (by Flickr user nimzilvio)
Fonenan'ny mpialokaloka Palestiniana maherin'ny 400.000 i Libanona, nitsoaka na nandositra tamin'ny taona 1948 ny sasany amin'izy ireo tamin'ny fotoana nananganana ny fanjakan'i Israely, ary ny sasany kosa nitsoaka nandritra na taorian'ny adin'ny taona 1967. ||| Lebanon is home to over 400,000 Palestinian refugees, some of whom were expelled or fled in 1948 at the time of the creation of the state of Israel, and others who fled during and after the 1967 war.
Tsy nahazo nanana trano ireo mpitsoa-ponenana, tsy tafiditra hahazo fikarakarana ara-pahasalamana, ary nila alalana manokana raha hiala amin'ny tobin'ny mpitsoa-ponenana, fandraràna izay nokianin'ireo vondrona toy ny Amnesty International. ||| These refugees are not allowed to own property, cannot access the health care system, and need a special permit to leave their refugee camps, restrictions which have been criticized by groups such as Amnesty International.
nisy ny lalàna vaovao nolanian'ny parlemanta tamin'ny 17 Aogositra mamela ny mpitsoa-ponenana Palestiniana hahazo miasa amin'ny maha-vahiny azy (mbola voasakana ihany izy ireo amin'ny 'asa mivelo-tena' maro, anisan'izany ny sehatry ny lalàna sy ny ara-pahasalamana). ||| Until recently, they were also barred from working in a number of professions, however, new legislation passed by parliament on August 17 grants Palestinian refugees the same employment rights as other foreigners (they will still be barred from 'self-employed' professions, including law and medicine).
Sady nahazo tehaka no nahazo kiana ny lalàna, izay hanankery raha vao vitan'ny Filoha Michel Suleiman sonia. ||| The legislation, which will take effect once President Michel Suleiman endorses it, has been met with both applause and dissent.
Raha mahita azy ity ho toy ny dingana mankany amin'ny fanatsarana maharitra kokoa ireo fiainan'ireo mpitsoa-ponenana ny sasany toy ny Firenena Mikambana, ny hafa kosa mahita azy ho fampanarahan-dalàna ireo mpitsoa-ponenana ao Libanona, ary noho izany, dia dingana iray ho amin'ny fifehezana ny Zo hiverina any amin'ny taniny izy ity. ||| While some, such as the UN, see it as a step toward bettering the lives of a long-term refugee population, others see it as normalization of the refugee population into Lebanon, and thus a step away toward securing the Right of Return.
Manazava i Roqayah Chamseddine, manoratra ao amin'ny Mondoweiss,ny antony, araka ny heviny, mahatonga ny fanapahan-kevitra ho fihetsika tsara raisina, nefa tsy mbola ampy: ||| Roqayah Chamseddine, writing for Mondoweiss, explains why, for her, the decision is a welcome move, but not nearly enough:
Laviko mihitsy ny eritreritra hiantso ireo tobin'ny mpitsoa-ponena hoe" trano baoritra" nefa tsy maintsy hampiasa teny tsotra aho; ahodinkodin' ireo Isiraeliana, ireo Amerikana ary ireo Arabo, ny sain' ireo Palestiniana. ||| I cringe at the thought of calling the refugee camps "slums" but I must use candid rhetoric; The Palestinians are being subjugated – by the Israeli's, the Americans and the Arabs.
Milaza ny mpitoraka bilaogy Oussama Hayek fa "tsy misy antony hankalazana ny zon'ireo Palestiniana" satria: ||| Blogger Oussama Hayek says that there is "no reason to celebrate Palestinian rights" because:
Misy zavatra tsy mety avy any amin'ny fotony mihitsy ny lalàna izay nolanian'ny Parlemanta androany, izay manome ireo Palestiniana ny zo hiasa any Libanona. ||| There is something fundamentally flawed with the law that Parliament passed today, granting Palestinians the right to work in Lebanon.
Mamofona fanavakavahana lalandava amin'ny fijerena ny zom-pirenen'ny tsirairay manokana izany. ||| It stinks of continuing discrimination against one particular nationality.
Ary tena hetsika tsy mety mihitsy izy ity noho ny antony roa: ||| It is also absolutely the wrong move for two reasons:
Manohy misakana ireo Palestiniana amin'ireo asa izay mila ny fidirana ho mpikambana amin'ny sendika izany, rafi-pitantanana efa lany andro izay tokony ho foanana tsy ampiharina intsony amin'ny olona rehetra. ||| It continues to bar Palestinians from jobs that require membership in a syndicate, a medieval guild-like system that should be abolished for everyone.
Manohy manakana ireo Palestiniana amin'ny fananany trano. ||| It continues to bar Palestinians from owning property.
Mamarana toy izao ny mpitoraka bilaogy: ||| The blogger concludes:
Marina fa zatra mandika ny lalàna Libaney ireo vondrona Palestiniana, ary mbola tokony hanaiky ny tsy hanana fitaovam-piadiana intsony izy ireo. ||| It is true that Palestinian groups routinely violate Lebanese laws, and have yet to accept to disarm.
Fa karazana fanasaziana iraisana araka ny andrasan'ny tsirairay avy amin'i Saddam na i Staline kosa ny fitazonana ireo vahoaka iray manontolo miisa 400.000 ho takalon'aina noho ireo hetsik'ireo jiolahim-boto anjatony vitsivitsy. ||| But holding an entire population of 400,000 hostage for the actions of a few thousand thugs is the sort of collective punishment one would expect from Saddam or Stalin.
Toetra tsy azo ekena izany avy amin'ny karazana demokrasia izay ironan'i Libanona. ||| This is not acceptable behaviour by the sort of democracy Lebanon aspires to be.
Amin'ny lafiny iray amin'ny vola madinika, Mihevitra i Marillionlb ao amin'ny For a better Lebanon fa tsy andraikitr'i Libanona ireo mpitsoa-ponenana ireo: ||| On the other side of the coin, Marillionlb of For a better Lebanon thinks that the refugees are not Lebanon's responsibility:
Eny, manana zo hanana fiainana tsara ny olombelona tsirairay, manana ny zony fototra ho arovana, fahazoan-dalana hiditra amin'ny fikarakarana ara-pahasalamana fototra, hianatra, trano hisitrihan'ny lohany, afaka hiasa ary ho isan'ny "singa mpanamboatra" eo amin'ny fiaraha-monina..sns. ||| Yes every single human being has the right to a decent life, to have his basic rights protected, access to basic medical care, schooling, a roof over his head, to live with dignity, to be able to work and be a "constructive" part of society..etc.
Naneho ny heviny ny mpanakiana iray eo amin'ny bilaogy fa manaiky izany koa: ||| A commenter on the blog expresses agreement:
Misaotra anao amin'ity lahatsoratra ity. ||| thank you for this post.
100% marina ny anao. ||| You are 100% correct.
Raha ny fomba fijery Palestiniana, toy ny aseho ao amin'ny Palestine Free Voice, tsy dia tena fanovana loatra akory ireo fanovana ireo: ||| From the Palestinian perspective, as expressed on Palestine Free Voice, the changes are hardly changes at all:
Indrisy fa tsy manome ireo zo tena misy dikany ho an'ny Palestiniana sivily akory i Libanona, na mba nampivoatra tsara akory ireo fahazoany asa. ||| Unfortunately Lebanon did not grant its Palestinian refugees meaningful civil rights on 8/17/10 or even significantly improve their work prospects.
Nanala ireo hetran'ny fahazoan-dalana miasa fotsiny no nataony (izay tsy olana goavana mihitsy hatramin'izay) ary nanome alalana ny hananganana ny Social Security Fund manokana izy (fa tsy ny Lebanese National Security Fund araka ny tatitra diso tamin'ny haino aman-jery sasany maro.) ||| What it did do was cancel the work permit fee (which was never a big problem) and allow for the setting up of a private Social Security Fund (not the Lebanese National Security Fund as misreported in much of the media).
Farany, mamehy ireo fomba fijerin'ny Palesitiniana ny hoaviny ny mpampiasa Twitter iRevolt amin'ny fanazavany ny antony mahatonga ny zo mitovy — tsy asiana zom-pirenena — ho tena zava-dehibe ho an'ireo olona maro: ||| Lastly, Twitter user iRevolt sums up one popular Palestinian perspective by explaining why equal rights–without citizenship–are important to so many people:
Raha mahazo ny zo sivily, sosialy sy ara-toe-karena ireo Palestiniana, nefa tsy omena ny zom-pirenana Libaney, dia miantoka ny filàn'izy ireo ny hiverina any amin'ny taniny izany, mitsipaka ireo firarian-tsoan'i Etazonia-Isiraeliana ho an'ny Palestiniana ny hampidirana azy ireo amin'ny tontolo Arabo - ary hamela ny mombamomba azy ireo amin'ny fomba rehetra - ary hamela ireo Palestiniana hampivoatra ireo satany raha monina mipetraka any ivelan'ny tanindrazany izy. ||| If the Palestinians are mandated civil, social and economic rights without being given Lebanese citizenship then it will work towards safeguarding the necessity of returning home, refuting US-Israeli wishes for the Palestinians to integrate into other parts of the Arab world - thus leaving behind their identities in some for or fashion - and allowing Palestinians to improve their status while living outside of their homeland.
Sary avy amin'i mpampiasa Flickr nimzilvio nahazo alalana avy amin'i Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.0 Generic license. ||| Photo by Flickr user nimzilvio made available by a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 2.0 Generic license.
Malaizia: Rava ny fonja manan-tantara ||| Malaysia: Historic jail demolished
Na dia teo aza ny fanoherana nataon'ireo vahoaka, mpanakanto, ary mpahay tantara dia mbola nanapa-kevitra ny handrava ilay fonja Pudu izay efa nahatratra 115 taona, nanamarika ny tantaran'i Kuala Lumpur, ihany ny fanjakàna Malaiziana. ||| Despite the protest of concerned citizens, artists, and historians, the Malaysian government has decided to demolish the 115 year old Pudu Jail, a historical landmark in Kuala Lumpur.
Tamin'ny herinandro lasa teo, noravàna ny rindrina atsinanan'ny fonja Pudu mba hanatanterahana tetik'asa fanitarana làlana. ||| Last week, the eastern wall of the Pudu Prison complex was destroyed to make way for a road widening project.
Hisy toeram-pivarotana lehibe iray hivelatra eo amin'io faritra io ato ho ato. ||| A commercial center will soon be developed in the area.
Diso fanantenana I Badan Warisan izay teratany Malésie ny tamin'ny nandavan'ny fanjakana ny fanangonan-tsonia nataony mba hanekena ny fonja ho toy ny lova manan-tantara. ||| Badan Warisan Malaysia is disappointed that the government has rejected the petition to recognize the prison as a heritage building
Tsara ho fantatra ireo fepetra tokony hananan'ny trano lehibe na toerana iray mba handraisan'ny fanjakana azy ho anisan'ny lova. ||| It would be useful to know what criteria a building or site needs to possess before our government will consider it a heritage building.
Tsy azo lavina fa ampahany amin'ny porofo mivaingana eo amin'ny tantara'ny sazy mihatra ary ampahany amin'ny rafitry ny fitsaràna ny fonja. ||| Surely jails are a part of the tangible evidence of our penal history which is part of our justice system.
Amiko dia tsy tokony hoadinoina koa fa nandritra ny tantarany 100 taona mahery, tsy fonja nanagadràna ireo olo-meloka ihany izy. ||| I think that we should also not forget that in its over 100-year history, it was not only a prison where convicts were incarcerated.
Tao ihany koa, no nogadraina ireo miaramila avy amina firenena maro izay niady ho an'ny fiarovana ny tanintsika, nandritra ny fanjanahan'ireo Japoney. ||| It was also where, during the Japanese occupation, service officers from many different nations who had fought to defend our shores were also imprisoned.
Anisan'ny zavatra iray tsy mampirehareha antsika eo amin'ny tantaran'ny firenentsika ary ve izany? ||| Is this a part of our nation's history which we are also not proud of?
Na dia mety efa tara loatra aza ny hamonjena ny fonja Pudu, dia manantena I Badan Warisan fa ny fahatsiarovan-tena naterak'izany dia hanamafy ny finiavan'ny vahoaka ho tonga saina eo amin'ny mahasaro-bidy ny lova ary mba hiadian'izy ireo hatrany ho an'ny fiarovana, ny fitandrovana ary ny fitahirizana izany. ||| While it may be too late to save Pudu Jail, Badan Warisan hopes that the awareness raised by this will strengthen the public's resolve to be conscious of how fragile our heritage is and to speak up for its protection, conservation and preservation.
Nanoratra momba ny lanjan'ny fonja eo amin'ny tantara ny mirage.studio7 ||| mirage.studio.7 writes about the historical value of the prison
Efa mahatratra 100 taona mahery ny fonja Pudu, naorin'ny firenena Britanika miaraka amin'ny mpiasa madinika avy any India, nampiasain'ny firenena Japoney ho toerana fampijaliana ireo teratany Sinoa ary nampiasain'ny fanjakàna ankehitriny koa ho fanantonana ireo olo-meloka miisa 1000 hatramin'ny taona sivifolo. ||| Pudu Jail is more than 100 years old, built by the British with cheap labor from India, used by the Japanese as a prison camp to butcher the Chinese and by the present government for hanging 1000 criminals till the late 90's.
Tiako ny hahita ny fonja ho toerana fisarihana mpizaha tany eny na dia ny vavahadiny fotsiny aza. ||| I would love to see the prison retained as a tourist attraction or at least the gate.
Dia mbola mamerina manoratra sy mamotsy ny tantara indray ny fanjakàna ankehitriny. ||| Then again, the current policy is to rewrite and whitewash history
Tsy mino I Sarah Kushairi hoe mbola mila toeram-pivarotana lehibe hafa io tanàna io ||| Sarah Kushairi does not believe that the city needs another shopping complex
Somary tezitra kely aho raha nanapa-kevitra ny handrava ilay fonja Pudu manan-tantara ny fanjakàna (mba hanitarana ny tany) ho toerana iray izay hisian'ireo hotely sy trano tsara tarehy vaovao. ||| I'm a bit upset when the government decided to tear down the historical Pudu Prison (so that the land can be developed) into a place that houses those new swanky hotels, apartments.
Blah blah blah. ||| Blah blah blah.
Ohatran'ny hoe mbola tsy ampy ireo lalan-kely fivarotana sy trano ao Malaizia. ||| Like Malaysia doesn't have enough shopping malls and apartments already.
Tezitra mafy ihany koa i From A to Zi satria tsy eo intsony ilay rindrina misy hoso-doko (iray amin'ireo sary hoso-doko lava indrindra maneran-tany) izay nandravaka ny fonja ||| From A to Zi is also infuriated that the mural wall (one of the longest murals in the world) which adorned the prison is now gone
Mino aho fa tsy izaho irery no tezitra mafy manoloana ny toe-javatra rehetra miseho. ||| I'm sure I am not alone in being absolutely infuriated about the whole situation.
Nitoeran'ireo olo-meloka efa tena nalaza ratsy tany Malaizia io fonja io. ||| The gaol housed some of Malaysia's most notorious criminals.
Koa maro noho izany ireo tantara niseho tao no very – ary tsy mieritreritra aho fa tsy afaka hifampitaha amin'ny haren'ny tantarany ny toeram-pivarotana lehibe, raha ny resaka famolavolàna na asa no jerena. ||| So, so much local history, and stories lost - and I don't think a shopping complex, in terms of design or function, would do its rich history any justice at all.
(Ireo soratra eny amin'ny rindrin'ny efitry ny fonja, ny sary sikotra, ny fanendahana ny loko eny amin'ny rindrina... Nahoana re isika no manimba tantara e?) ||| (Writings on the prison cell walls, carvings, peeling of the wall paint... why are we destroying stories)?
Tsy mila lalan-kely fivarotana hafa mihitsy i Kuala Lumpur. ||| Kuala Lumpur is not, not, not, in need of another shopping mall.
Mahafinaritra loatra ary tsy manam-paharoa tokoa ny tantara sy kolontsaintsika, ahoana no tsy ahitanareo izany? ||| Our local history and culture is so beautiful and very much unique, why can't you see that?
Azontsika aseho sy amidy amin'izao tontolo izao izany. ||| We can showcase it, market it to the world.
Tongasoa eto amin'ny taon-jato faha 21 eto amin'ny Kyala Lumpur, taona voalohany amin'ny fahasimban'ny kolontsaintsika. ||| Welcome to 21st Century Kuala Lumpur, our prime age of cultural deterioration.
Fanabeazana ara-kolontsaina no tena ilaintsika fa tsy ireo magazay mivarotra ny lamaody avy any ivelany. ||| We are desperately in need of cultural education, not imported fashion chain stores.
BJ Thoughts dia mahatsiaro ny ireo sary hoso-doko ||| BJ Thoughts remembers the mural
Toerana fanta-daza tao KL ity – Efa zatra nahita ilay sary hoso-doko teo amin'ny rindrina aho rehefa mitaingina fiara fitaterana, ka mitohana ny fifamoivoizana amin'ny lalako miverina any an-tranon'ny renibeko, taona maro lasa izay ||| It is an iconic landmark in KL – I used to see the mural on the wall as I sit in the bus, stuck in the traffic jam on my way back to my grandma's house many years ago
Eo an-dalam-pahasimbàna noho ny fampandrosoana, ilay fonja maharikoriko antsoina hoe Pudu, tsy dia mahagaga loatra anefa izany. ||| The infamous Pudu Jail is being torn down for development, no big surprise there.
Izany hoe raha afaka mitsiriritra toby miaramila mbola miasa ireo adalam-bola sasany hanaovany fampandrosoana ara-barotra, tsy misy tsara mihoatra ny fonja efa rava eo afovoan'i KL ||| I mean if some greedy nuts can eye on a strategic active military base for commercial development, what more of an abandoned prison smack down in the middle of KL
Nikarakara hetsika "fandevenana" nandraisan'ny olona maro anjara ireo mpanakanto, ny andro mialohan'ny fandravàna. ||| A mass funeral was organized by artists on the eve of the demolition.
Nanoratra blaogy mikasika izany i Arteri. ||| Arteri blogs about it.
Fa tsy dia nanohana izany kosa i pagarmerah ||| But pagarmerah is not quite supportive
Na dia manohatra ny fanjakàna sy ny fikambanana mandràva zavatra mba hanorenana toeram-pivarotana mijoalajoala aza aho nefa ahitàna magazay isaky ny kion-dàlana eny ary mbola tsy manan-kialofana ny vahoaka, dia tsy handrehitra jiro aho hanehoana ny fahadisoam-panantenako satria tsy neken'ny fanjakàna ho anisan'ny lovan'ny firenena ny fonja Pudu. ||| while i am against the state and corporations demolishing anything to build a freaking mall when there are malls on every corner of the city in spite the fact that people are still homeless, i dont think i would want to light a candle in disappointment because the state didnt declare pudu jail as a national heritage.
Azo jerena ao amin'ny tranonkalan'i Michael Yip sy Rabiatul Adawiyah ny sarin'ny fonja Pudu. ||| Photos of Pudu Jail are available in the websites of Michael Yip and Rabiatul Adawiyah.
Mamoaka horonan-tsary mampiseho ny fandravàna an'i Pudu ny Fat Bidin Media. ||| Fat Bidin Media uploads a video on the demolition of Pudu.
Bangladesh: Shawpno Rath - Sekoly Iray Ho An'ireo Ankizy Avy Eny Ambany Tanàna ||| Bangladesh: Shawpno Rath - A School For Slum Children
Tao an-drenivohitr'i Bangladesh, Dhaka, rehefa mandao ny tokantranony isa-maraina handeha hamonjy sekoly ny andian'ankizy iray, dia misy andian'ankizy iray hafa kosa mivoaka ho eny an-dalambe hiasa hitady izay hivelomana. ||| In the capital of Bangladesh, Dhaka, when a group of children leave their homes every morning to go to school, another group of children come out onto the streets, to work for a livelihood.
Ny arabe no sehatra iray manome azy ireo fahafahana mahazo izay tokony hivelomany. ||| The streets to them represent an opportunity to earn a living.
Ny sasany amin'ireny ankizy ireny dia manangona fako, ny sasany mivarotra karazan-javatra samihafa - dite sy sigara ankoatry ny zavatra hafa. ||| Some of these children collect garbage, others sell various items - tea and cigarettes included among them.
Ho an'ireny ankizy ireny, zavatra tsy takatra ny sekoly - zavatra mitoetra ho nofinofy fotsiny ho azy ireo, satria raha ny toerana niavian-dry zareo, misy hantsana lalim-be eo anelanelan'ny nofiny sy ny zava-misy henjana iainany andavanandro. ||| For these children, school is something unattainable - something that they can only dream about, because where they come from, there is a huge gap between their dreams and the harsh reality of their day to day lives.
Na izany aza, nisy andian-jatovo iray nandray andraikitra mba hanatanteraka farafaharatsiny ny nofin'ny sasantsasany amin'ireny ankizy ireny. ||| However, a group of youth have taken it upon themselves to fulfill the dreams of at least some of these children.
Namorona sekoly ho an'ireo sahirana sy tsy manan-katao avy eny amin'ny ambany tanàna ireny ry zareo. ||| They have started a school for the disadvantaged children from the slums.
Nomena anarana sahaza azy ilay sekoly ka natao hoe "Shawpno Rath" (Kalesin'ny Nofy). ||| The school is aptly named "Shawpno Rath" (Chariot of Dreams).
Toy izao no nanombohan'ny dian-dry zareo ireo: ||| This is how their journey began:
Raha teny an-dàlana hamonjy ny toeram-piasany ny tovovavy iray dia nahita ankizy vitsivitsy nikaroka zavatra tao anaty fanariam-pako. ||| While on her way to office, a young women regularly noticed some children searching for something in the garbage heap.
Toa tsapan'ity tovovavy ity hoe mitady izay mba nofinofiny angamba ry zareo ireo. ||| The young woman felt that perhaps they were searching for a dream.
Naniry hanao zavatra ho an'ireto ankizy izy, niresaka tamin'ireo namany sy mpiara-miasa aminy momba izay mba azon'izy ireo atao. ||| Wanting to do something for these children, she discussed with her friends and colleagues as to what they could do.
Tany am-boalohany, tapaka ny hevitra fa ho indray mandeha isan-kerinandro ihany, hanome sakafo an'ireto ankizy ry zareo sady hikarakara fialamboly ankalamanjana eo amin'ny manodidina ihany. ||| At first, it was decided that once a week, they would provide these children with a meal and then take them for a fun outing somewhere nearby.
Tsy tany amin'ny biraoko akory fa teny an-jaridaina no nanomboka ny fifanakalozan-dresaka mikasika ity fiaraha-mientana ity - tao amin'ny Chandrima Udyan (zaridaina): ||| Not in any office but the discussions about this venture started in a park - the Chandrima Udyan (park):
Ho an'io fifanakalozan-dresaka io dia nofinidinay ny Chandrima Udyan, satria io no toeram-pitadiavana ho an'ny maro amin'ireo ankizy ireo. ||| And for this discussion we selected the Chandrima Udyan, since this was the workplace for many of these children.
Ny maro amin'izy ireo dia ao anatin'ny sehatra fivarotana voninkazo, sôkôlà, voanjo, dite, sigara, sns., ho an'ireo mpifankatia sy ireo olona tonga mitsidika ilay zaridaina. ||| All of them were engaged in selling flowers, chocolates, peanuts, tea, cigarettes etc., to young couples and other members of the public who visited the park.
Nahazo akony tsara tamin'ilay hetsika nataonay izahay. ||| We got a good response to our initiative.
Mitombo isanandro isanandro ny isan'ny ankizy. ||| Day by day the number of children kept increasing.
Isaky ny Sabotsy, entina eny ny boky hamakiana tantara ho azy ireo. ||| Every Saturday, books were brought to read stories to them.
Faly ery ny ankizy ary efa zatra mamadibadika ny boky, fa tsy afaka mamaky. ||| The children were excited and used to flip through the books, unable to read.
Mba ho afaka mamaky teny dia ilain-dry zareo ny fanabeazana, ary amin'izy ireo ny fanabeazana dia midika hoe miditra an-tsekoly, saingy ho an'ireo ankizy ireo, ny sekoly dia mbola dia lavitr'ezaka hafa indray noho izay efa nizorany. ||| To be able to read they would need education and for education they would need schooling but for these children, school was a journey down a path different from their own.
Noho izany, tsy maintsy nionona tamin'ny famadibadihana nitety pejy anaty boky fotsiny ry zareo, mikitika ny sary sy ny voan-teny. ||| So, they had to content themselves with merely flipping through the pages, touching the pictures and words.
Teo ampahitàna ny fahalinan'ireto zaza amin'ny zavatra misoratra dia nanapa-kevitra nanangana sekoly ho azy ireo ilay andian-jatovo. ||| Seeing the enthusiasm among these kids for the written word, the youth group decided to start a school for these children.
Tapaka fa hatao hoe - Shawpno Rath (Kalesin'ny Nofy) ny anaran'ny sekoly ||| A name was decided for the school - Shawpno Rath (Chariot of Dreams)
Lakilasy eny am-poto-kazo ||| A school under a tree
Mba hahafahana manomboka lakilasy amin'ny ara-dalàna, dia mila zavatra maro ny tsirairay - trano fianarana, lakilasy, boky, kahie, mpampianatra, fàfana mainty, famafàna fàfana ary mpianatra. ||| In order to start a formal school, one needs many things - a school building, classrooms, books, notebooks, teachers, blackboards, dusters and students.
Na izany aza, ho an'ity sekoly ity, tsy voavory ireo fepetra rehetra ireo. ||| However, for this school, all these conditions could not be fulfilled.
Kanefa, isaky ny Sabotsy, misy foana ny fampianarana eo ambanin'ny hazo iray ao an-jaridaina. ||| Nevertheless, every Saturday, classes were held under a tree in the park.
Ilaozan'ireo ankizy ny asany ary tonga mba hanatrika ny fampianarana ry zareo, na dia midika fahabangan'ny fivelomana aza izany ho azy ireo. ||| Children left their work and came to attend the classes, though it meant loss of earnings for them.
Tena ankafizin-dry zareo fatratra ireny lakilasy ireny. ||| They enjoyed these classes thoroughly.
Tsikelikely, nanomboka nitombo ny isan'ireo mpianatra. ||| Gradually, the number of students began to increase.
Ary tsy ela, tonga ny filàna tsy maintsy hitady efitrano fianarana. ||| And soon, there emerged the need to find a classroom.
Nahazo adiresy vaovao ny sekoly ||| The school gets a new address
Niala tao Chandrima Udyan (zaridaina) ny sekoly ary nifindra ao amin'ny adiresy 10 Mirpur Road, izay ahitàna efitrano iray nofaina mba hamapandehanana ny sekoly. ||| The school was moved out of Chandrima Udyan (park) and housed in 10 Mirpur Road, where a room was taken on rent for running the school.
Eto dia misokatra andro dimy isan-kerinandro ny sekoly ary ireo mpianatra dia nanomboka nanaraka ny fampianarana amin'ny ora feno. ||| Here, the school was open five days a week and students started attending classes regularly.
Ankizy 30 no nanombohan'ny lakilasy, ary mpampianatra 2. ||| The school started with 30 students and 2 teachers.
Satria marobe ireo ankizy avy amin'ny fianakaviana sahirana no tonga mba hanaraka ny fampianarana, avy eo amin'ny tanàna ambany manodidina eo ihany, dia mitohy mitombo hatrany ny isan'ny mpianatra. ||| As more children from disadvantaged families, from nearby slums joined the classes, the number of students continued to increase.
Shawpno Rath - foibe hanabeazana ny olon-dehibe ihany koa ||| Shawpno Rath - an adult education center too
Eo am-pahitàna ny zanany mamonjy sekoly, ny sasany tamin'ireo ray aman-dreny koa dia nanomboka naniry ny mba hahazo fahafahana mahazo fampianarana ara-dalàna. ||| Seeing their children attending school, some of the parents too began to wish that they could avail the opportunity for getting some formal education.
Noho izany dia nanitatra ny asany mba hahatafiditra hatramin'ny fampianarana olon-dehibe koa ny Shawpno Rath. ||| So now Shawpno Rath has extended its work to include adult education as well.
Amin'izao fotoana, olon-dehibe 20 no mpianatra ao amin'ilay sekoly - ireo izay tsy mba nanana fahafahana nandeha an-tskoly tamin'ny andron'ny fahazazàny. ||| At present, the school has 20 adult students - those who did not get the opportunity in their childhood to go to school.
Ny vinan'ny Shawpno Rath ||| The Shawpno Rath vision
Ao amin'ny Pejiny Facebook, ny Shawpno Rath dia miresaka momba ny vina sy ny tanjony: ||| On their Facebook Page, Shawpno Rath has said about it's vision and objective:
Ny "Shawpno Rath" dia fikambanana tsy natao hitady tombony natsangana tamin'ny 2010 miaraka amin'ny fomba fijery hoe hampiroborobo ny resa-panabezana sy ny fahasalaman'ireo ankizy sahirana eto amin'ny firenenay. ||| "Shawpno Rath" is a non-profit organization was founded in 2010 with a view to improve the educational and health conditions of the underprivileged children in our country.
Ny ankamaroantsika dia mihevitra fa zo efa azy ireo filàna fototra eo amin'ny fiainana: sakafo, rano, fialofana, fahasalamana, fanabeazana ary ankohonana. ||| Most of us take for granted the basic necessities of life: food, water, shelter, health, education and family.
Saingy misy ankizy an-tapitrisa izay tsy mba manana an'ireny filàna fototra ireny, izay tsy mba manana fanantenana ny amin'ny hoavy. ||| But there are millions of children in our country who do not have these essential necessities, who do not have any hope for the future.
Ny tanjonay dia ny hanampy hanomezana ireny filàna ireny ho an'ireo ankizy mahantra manerana ny firenena ary hifantoka amin'ny fampandrosoana faobe hikatsahana ny hampihenàna ny fàkan'ny fahantrana. ||| our goal is to help provide these necessities for impoverished children throughout the country and focus on integral development that seeks to reduce the root causes of poverty.
Ny vinan'ny Shawpno Rath dia i Bangladesh afaka amin'ny fahantrana. ||| The vision of Shawpno Rath is a poverty - free Bangladesh.
Niaraka tamin'io vina io no nentin-dry zareo nanomboka ny diany, ary fantany tsara fa mbola lavitr'ezaka ny làlana hodiavin-dry zareo. ||| They have started their journey with this vision, knowing fully well that they have a long way to go.
Mila ny fanohananao ny Global Voices ||| Global Voices needs your support
Ry Mpamaky Global Voices Hajaina, ||| Dear Global Voices Reader,
Te-hiangavy anareo izahay hanohana ny asanay ara-bola amin'ity taona 2010 ity. ||| We'd like to ask you to support our work for 2010 with a financial contribution.
Raha nanaraka ny asan'ny vohikala Global Voices, Global Voices Advocacy ary ny Rising Voices ianao, na ireo vohikalam-pandikan-teny 17 mavitrika amin'izao fotoana izao, dia hahamarika ny ezaka lehibe tsy mampino sy ny karazam-mpomba fijery samihafa ezahin'ny olo-tsotra mampita vaovao tantaraina. ||| If you've been following the activity on the Global Voices, Global Voices Advocacy and Rising Voices sites, or on any of our 17 active translation sites, you'll have experienced the incredible energy and array of viewpoints that citizen media can bring to the coverage of global stories.
Avy amin'ny vazantany efatra manerna izao tontolo izao ny vondrona mpanoratra sy mpandika teny 350 izay tsy mitsaha-mitombo, ary mitantara zavatra azo itokisana ny fisiany amina toerana iray ho ren'izao tontolo izao. ||| Our diverse and growing community of 350 writers and translators come from all over the world, and provide trusted perspectives on local stories for global audiences.
Manokatra varavarankely ho an'ny tontolo hafa izy ireo, manampy ny mpamaky hahalala bebe kokoa ny fiaraha-monina tsy dia mahazatra loatra sy ny tantarany. ||| They offer a window into other worlds, helping readers gain a deeper understanding of unfamiliar communities and stories.
Tao-miavaka tokoa ny 2009 ho anay. ||| 2009 has been a great year for us.
Namoaka tetikasam-pihavaozana vaovao izahay izay mipaka hatrany amin'ny farafetran'ny fitaovan-tseraseran'olo-tsotra, tahaka ny fandraisana an-tanana ny fikarohana fifanakalozana fandikanteny navoakanay; ny sehatra fiarovana ny fahalalaham-pitenenana an-tserasera navoakanay, Threatened Voices (Feo Voarahona) ; ary ny RuNet Echo, tetikasana tontolom-bolongana Rosiana navoakanay. ||| We've launched innovative new projects that explore the boundaries of citizen media, such as our Translation Exchange research initiative ; our online freedom of expression advocacy platform, Threatened Voices ; and RuNet Echo, our Russian blogosphere project.
Vao nampiditra tetikasa vaovao iarahana miasa amin'ny hafa ihany koa izahay, toy ny Transparency and Technology Network (Teknolojia sy ny fangaraharana), sy ny fifaninanana fahalalaham-pitenenana an-tserasera antsoina hoe Breaking Borders (Mamaky Sisintany), izay iarahana amin'ny Google. ||| We've just embarked on a new collaborative research project, the Transparency and Technology Network, and a new online freedom of expression award called Breaking Borders, in collaboration with Google.
Amin'ity taona ity ihany koa izahay dia ampiketrehana amin'ny fampitomboana ny loharanom-bola mahasolo, manaika ny fahaizana manokana iarahan'ny ao amin'ny vondrona misy anay manampy ny fikambanana lehibe tahaka ny UNFPA sy ny IDRC mba hitondra ny fomba fijerin'olo-tsotra amin'ny asa ataon'izy ireo. ||| This year we've also worked on developing alternative sources of revenue, leveraging the collective expertise of our community to help organizations like UNFPA and IDRC to bring a citizen perspective to their offerings.
Ireo mpikambana ao amin'ny fiaraha-monina Global Voices nandritra ny vovonana natao tanyBudapest tamin'ny 2008. saripikan'i mentalacrobatics. ||| Global Voices community members at the 2008 Summit in Budapest. Image by mentalacrobatics.
Aty amin'ny fiafaran'ny faha-5 taona nijoroana izao, dia mampientanentana tokoa ny mamaky lahatsoratra avy amin'ny mpanorina sy ny mpandray anjara milaza ny anjara toeran'ity fiaraha-monina ity ho azy ireo. ||| At the end of five years of existence, it's also been exhilarating to read posts from our founders and contributors expressing what being part of our community means to them.
"Ny Global Voices dia. ||| "Global Voices is.

ny toerana alehako rehefa te-hahita hazavana ery amin'ny faran'ny tonelina aho, ilay antony tsy hanariana fanantenana raha mihalevona ny tontolon'olombelona rehefa manaraka ny onjam-piainany," hoy ilay mpandray anjara miresaka an'i Madagasikara Lova Rakotomalala, izay nandany fotoana maro tamin'ity taona ity hanoratra momba ny savorovoro iainan'ny tanindrazany. ||| my go-to place when I want to find the light at the end of the tunnel, the reason to not despair when mankind sputters as it moves along its tumultuous journey," writes our Madagascar contributor Lova Rakotomala, who spent much of this year writing about the turmoil in his home country.

Maraoka: Maneho Hevitra Momba ny Fanafihana tao Marrakech ireo Mpitoraka Bilaogy ||| Morocco: Bloggers React to Marrakech Attack
Tratry ny fipoahana baomba i Marrakech, tanàna sangan'ny fizahantany ao Maraoka tamin'ny Talata teo, izay nandrava trano fisakafoanana iray tao anatin'ny ora fisakafoanana indrindra, ny Argana, manamorona ny Kianja Jamaa Lefna. ||| Morocco's tourist hub of Marrakech was hit on Thursday by a bomb blast that ripped through a popular restaurant at lunchtime, the Argana, overlooking Jamaa Lefna Square.
Araka ny fanambaràna ofisialy dia nahafatesana olona 16 ilay fipoahana ka maro tamin'ireo no vahiny. ||| The blast, according to officials killed 16 people most of whom were foreigners.
Nitranga indrindra ity fanafihana ity raha toa ka miatrika onjam-pihetsiketsehana am-pilaminana hangatahana fiovàna ara-demaokratika ny firenena. ||| The attack occurred as the country witnesses a wave of peaceful demonstrations calling for democratic change.
Maro no maneho ny tahony ny hisian'ny fihemorana taorian'ilay fanafihana. ||| Many have expressed fear of a downturn following the attack.
Ny sasany nampitandrina ny ho voka-dratsy henjana noho ny fomba hatao ho fampandriana fahalemana izay mety hanohina ny fahalalahan'ny olom-pirenena tsirairay ao anatin'izao vanim-potoana izay iomanan'ny firenena hiroso aminà andiam-panovàna izao. ||| Some have warned from the harmful effects of a security approach that would encroach on civil liberties at the very moment the country is poised to begin a series of reforms.
Nandritra ny fitsidihany ny toerana nitrangan'ilay fipoahana, nampanantena ny mpanjakan'i Maraoka, Mohammed VI, fa tsy ho voaelingelina amin'izao ny dingana ho amin'ny fanovàna. ||| In a visit to the site of the bombing, the King of Morocco, Mohammed VI, promised that the reform process would not be curtailed.
Ireo mpitoraka bilaogy sy mpiondana aterineto no haingana indrindra tamin'ny fandefasana fijoroana vavolombelona teo noho eo. ||| Bloggers and netizens have been quick to react sending instant eyewitness accounts.
Mitohy hatrany ireo fanambaràna firaisankina sy fanamelohana ilay fanafihana mahery setra any anaty bilaogy sy tambajotra any. ||| Statements of solidarity and condemnation of the violent attack are still pouring in on blogs and social networks.
Ity ny fantina amin'ireo izay hita nivoka hatreto. ||| Here is a roundup of what has been posted so far.
Tao amin'ny Twitter, teo ambanin'ny tenifototra "Marrakech" sy "Argana" no nanarahana ireo vaovao avy any Marrakech. ||| On Twitter, news from Marrakech have been followed under the hashtags "Marrakech" and "Argana."
Fotoana fohy taorian'ny fipoahana dia nifampizaràna ity saripika ity, avy any an-toerana, nalefan'i Mehdi El Baroudi iray amin'ireo voalohany indrindra nandefa bitsika ny vaovao: ||| Shortly after the blast this pictures was shared from the scene by Mehdi El Baroudi one of the first to tweet the news:
Maherin'ny in-12.000 no nisy nijery ity sary ity. ||| This photo was viewed more than 12,000 times.
Analitikis, mpandefa bitsika koa dia nizara ity lahatsary ity, nalaina fotoana vitsy taorian'ny fipoahana, ahitàna ireo tra-doza navoaka avy tao anatin'ilay trano fisakafoanana ary novonjen'ireo mpandalo, mandritra izany no tonga teo amin'ilay toerana ny voalohany tamin'ireo fiara mpamonjy voina (Mahitsy toraka be ny sary sasantsasany. ||| Tweeter Analitikis, also shared this video, taken moments after the explosion, showing victims being pulled out of the restaurant and rescued by passersby as the first ambulances arrived to the scene (Some pictures are graphic in nature.
Tsy dia ilaina horakorahana loatra): ||| Viewer discretion is advised):
Tanatin'ny fotoana fohy nanaraka ilay fipoahana, i Ismail Erahhali dia nandefa bitsika hoe: ||| In the few moments following the blast, Ismail Erahhali tweeted:
Fiombonan-tsaina amin'ireo tra-doza noho iny herisetra tsy am-piheverana iny. ||| A thought for the victims of this hideous crime.
Miara-ory amin'ny fianakavian'ireo namoy ny ainy. ||| Condolences to the families of the victims.

Rolande Johnson mandefa bitsika hoe: ||| Rolande Johnson tweets:
Ketraka noho ny fanapoahanabaomba tao Marrakech. ||| Gutted about the bombing in Marrakech.
Fotoana betsaka no laninay tany amin'ny kianjan'i Djemaa el-Fna raha 2 volana monja izay no tany an-toerana izahay. ||| We spent loads of time in Djemaa el-Fna square when we where there only 2 months ago.

Tsy tena tsapanao ny hirifiry sy ny ahiahy ateraky ny asa fampihorohoroana raha tsy efa tonga mitsidika ny firenenao izy ||| You do not get to feel real pain and anxiety because of an attack until it is visited upon your own country.
Jennifer Leo, mpanoratra, izay nitsidika an'i Marrakech nandritra ny fotoana nisian'ilay fanafihana dia mandefa bitsika hoe: ||| Writer Jennifer Leo who was visiting Marrakech at the time of the attack tweets:

Ny zava-manahirana dia raha mpanao vy very ny ainy tokoa iny, tahaka izay nilazan'ireo mpampahalala vaovao vahiny azy, dia efa tsy velona intsony ilay ranamana ary tsy ho fantatsika mandrakizay ny antony nanaovany azy iny. ||| The annoying thing is if it was a suicide bomber as the foreign press have started saying then this person is now no longer alive and we will never be able to find out what his reasoning for it was.

Ny manampahefana dia manilika ny hoe olona mpanao vy very ny ainy iny ary milaza fa fipoahana nobaikoana avy lavitra no nisy. ||| Authorities have since rejected the possibility of a suicide bomber and say that the blast was triggered by a remote control device.
Reda Chraïbi, Maraokana mpitoraka bilaogy, dia miteny fa ny Maraokana dia tsy ho kivin'izay fipoahana tao Marrakech ary mandrisika ny hitakiana ireo fanovàna, izay lazainy, fa hany fiarovana tokana amin'ny asa fampihorohoroana. ||| Moroccan blogger Reda Chraïbi says Moroccans won't be deterred by the Marrakech attack and urges for reforms which, he says, are the only safeguard against terrorism.
Manoratra izy: ||| He writes:

Ny mifanohitra amin'izany aza, iny fihetsika iny dia azo antoka fa avy amin'ireo tsy maniry ny hahatongavan'ny fahalalahana sy ny demaokrasia eto Maraoka. ||| To the contrary: this act certainly comes from those who do not want the advent of freedom and democracy in Morocco.
Tsy misy toetra tsara aseho araka izany –manomboka eto– afa-tsy ny firosoana hatrany mankany amin'ny fametrahana fiarahamonina isian'ny fitoviana, malalaka sy madio. ||| There is therefore no better attitude to adopt –now more than ever– than to engage more towards an equitable society, free and fair.
Mandritra izay fotoana izay, hiverina ho any amin'ny kianjan'i Jemaa Lefna isika, bebe kokoa noho ny fahiny, hiaina ny fahafinaretany sy hiatrika ireo kaondrana mitapy, satria tsy nihorohoro isika. ||| In the meantime, we will return to Jemaa Lefna Square, more than ever, enjoying its pleasures and taunting the villains, since we are not terrorized.
Moldavia: Tsy Nahazo Fanohanana Betsaka Avy Amin'ny Mpiserasera Ny Hetsim-panoherana ny Governemanta ||| Moldova: Anti-Government Protests Receive Little Endorsement From Netizens
Tao anatin'izay roa herinandro lasa izay, nidina an-dalambe ny Moldaviana mba hanao hetsim-panoherana. ||| For the past two weeks Moldovans have been out in the streets, protesting.
Nitaky ny fametram-pialan'ny governemanta sy ny fanafoanana ny fifidianana kasaina atao alohan'ny fotoana ny mpikarakara ny hetsika-sy ireo mpanao politika marobe nanatevin-daharana ny Vaomiera Mpiaro ny Lalam-panorenana sy ny Demokrasia. ||| The organizers of the rallies - several politicians who have joined the Committee to Defend the Constitution and Democracy - are demanding the resignation of the government and early elections.
Nanomboka ny hetsika tamin'ny fotoana nanambaran'ny manam-pahefana ny fikarakarana fitsapan-kevimbahoaka any amin'ny tapaky ny lohataona any, mikasika ny fanovana ny lalampanorenana izany mba ahafahan'ny antenimiera maro an'isa mifidy ny filohan'ny Moldavia. ||| The rallies were triggered by the announced decision of the authorities to hold a referendum in mid-spring on amending the constitution in an attempt to make it possible to elect the Moldovan president by a simple parliamentary majority.
Mbola tsy nanana filoha ny firenena hatramin'ny taona 2009. ||| The country has not had a president since 2009.
Maro ireo fanandramana teo aloha notontosain'ny antenimiera fa tsy nahomby, ka fifidianana in-droa vao haingana sy fitsapan-kevi-bahoaka tsy nahomby no vokatr'izany. ||| Several previous attempts by the parliament to elect a leader have failed, resulting twice in early elections and an unsuccessful referendum.
Hetsi-panoherana maro no nambara fa atao isaky ny herinandro manomboka amin'ny volana ambony ary hotohanan'ny antoko Komonista an'ny fitondrana teo aloha izany, na dia teo aza ny tsy fifaliana faobe teo amin'ny fiaraha-monina manoloana ny antokon'ny fitondrana sy ny tsy fahaizany mifidy izay ho filoham-pirenena, kely dia kely ny fanohanana azon'ny mpanohitra ny governemanta ankehitriny avy amin'ny vondrona an-tserasera ao Moldavia. ||| While more protests have been announced to take place every weekend in the coming months and to be supported by the former ruling Communist party, and despite the overall dissatisfaction within the society with the ruling alliance and its inability to elect the head of state, the current anti-government protests have received very little endorsement from Moldova's online community.
Tsy dia nanao fanentanana firy ny vondrona tao amin'ny Facebook ' Down with the oligarchs' government! (Miala ny governemantan'ny fanjakan'olombitsy! ||| The Facebook group ' Down with the oligarchs' government!
,' noforonin'ireo mpikarakara ny hetsika, ka tsy nahatratra na dia mpanohana 300 akory aza, ary maro ireo olona nanoratra teo amin'ny pejy nangataka mba tsy asaina amin'ny hetsim-panoherana. |||,' created by the protest organizers, hasn't managed to reach even 300 supporters, and several people have written on the wall with the request not to be invited to the protests.
Andro voalohany tamin'ny hetsim-panoherana tao Chisinau, Moldovia -22 Janoary 2012. ||| The first day of the protests in Chisinau, Moldova - January 22, 2012.
Sary avy amina mpitoraka bolongany Eugen Luchianiuc, nahazoana alalana. ||| Photo by blogger Eugen Luchianiuc, used with permission.
Tamin'ny fanehoan-kevitra nalefa tao amin'ny Sary Facebook navoakan'i Eugen Luchianiuc mikasika ny hetsika voalohany, mpisera Mircea Scinteianu nanoratra hoe: ||| In a comment posted to Eugen Luchianiuc's Facebook photo of the first protests, user Mircea Scinteianu writes:

Arahabaina ny naka azy. ||| Congratulations to the author.
Ny hetsika kosa na dia izany aza, tsy dia mahaliana mihitsy. ||| The event, however, is not worth a second of attention.
Azo vakiana ao amina fanehoan-kevitra hafa ny antso mitovy ny tsy fanomezana lanja ireo mpikarakara. ||| The same appeal to ignore the organizers can be read in other online comments.
Fanehoan-kevitra mikasika izay niseho tamin'ny hetsika natao tamin'ny Alahady 29 Janoary teo, mpisera Lupan nanoratra hoe: ||| While commenting on a news story about the protests held on Sunday, January 29, user Lupan posts:
Niompana tamin'ireo mpikarakara ny hetsika, ny Antoko Komonista sy ny Antokom-bahoaka Demokraty Kristiana ny fanehoan-keviny; hoy izy araka ny filazany: ||| His arguments refer to the organizers of the protests, the Communist Party and the Christian Democratic People's Party; according to him:
Tsy misy dikany aminay mihitsy izy ireo, andeha haseho an-dry zareo izany amin'ny alalan'ny tsy fanehoan-kevitra sy ny tsy firaharahiana azy ireo intsony. ||| They do not mean anything to us, let's demonstrate this to them by not commenting and by not paying attention to them anymore.
Toa mitombina tsara ihany ny antony mahatonga ireo mpiserasera tsy hiditra amin'ny hetsika atao amin'izao fotoana izao, ary tsy misy ifandraisany amin'ny fitsapana hafanana ahitana maripàna mangatsiaka 20° C ambanin'ny aotra ny hevitr'izy ireo tamin'io andro io tao an-drenivohitr'i Moldavia. ||| Netizens seem to have their well-grounded reasons to stay aside from the ongoing protests, and their arguments have nothing to do with the yellow-code alert of cold temperature of up to -20°C these days in Moldova's capital.
Mpisera janaad.arc naneho hevitra an-tserasera: ||| User janaad.arc comments online:
Eny, tamin'ny taona 2005, natoky an'i Rosca (lehiben'ny Antokom-bahoaka Demokraty Kristianina, iray amin'ireo mpikarakara voalohany ny hetsim-panoherana) izaho sy ny fianakaviako rehetra, nifidy azy izahay tamin'ny fifidianana, nihevitra izahay fa olo-mahitsy izy ary manam-pikasana hanao zavatra ho an'ity firenena kely ity, saingy raha nahita azy namorona vondrona miaraka amin'i Voronin (filoha Komonista teo aloha) izahay, dia tsy natoky ity olona ity intsony, nanjary faty politika izy ary mpamitaka ny firenena sy ny tanindrazana... ||| Yes, in 2005 my entire family and I believed in Rosca (the leader of the Christian Democratic People's Party, one of the main organizers of the protests), we voted for him at the elections, we thought he was honest and wanted to do something for this little country, but when I saw him create a coalition with Voronin (the former Communist president), I lost all my faith in this person, he became a political corpse, traitor of the nation and the country...
Ho an'ilay mpamahana bolongana Radu Marian ihany koa, ilay lehilahy ambadiky ny hetsika no toa mahatonga ny fisalasalana. ||| For blogger Radu Marian, too, the man behind the protests seems to be the reason for distrust.
