Myanmar: Lisitry ny voatazona sy taratasy avy amin'ny mpiasa ao amin'ny zenerasiona 88 ||| Myanmar: List of Detainees and Letter From A 88 Generation Worker
Nahazo lisitra misy ny anarana sy ny fikambanana nihavian'ireo mpitokatena sy sivily mihoatra ny 300 izay nosamborin'ny fitondrana miaramila eto Myanmar ny mpibilaogy Niknayman. ||| Blogger Niknayman has a list of names and affiliations of over 300 monks and civilians who have been arrested by the Myanmar Military Regime.
Maro amin'ireo nosamborina ireo no avy amin'ny Mandatehezam-pirenena ho amin'ny demokrasia, antoko tarihin-dramatoa Aung San Suu Kyi (izay efa nahazo ny loka Nobel ho amin'ny fandriampahalemana saingy giazan'ny fitondrana jadona tsy hivoaka ny tranony).Ny gazety manerana an'I Azia no mametraka fa 1500 ny isan'ireo voatazona. ||| Many are from the National League of Democracy, the party led by Aung San Suu Kyi. Newspapers across Asia are putting the number of detained people at 1500.
Ny Feo demokratikan'I Birmania kosa mitatitra fa mihoatra ny 2000 ny isan'izany nosamboriana izany. ||| Democratic Voice of Burma, a Norwegian organization reports that the number of arrested is much higher at over 2000.
Tsahotsahoana ho anjatony kosa ny isan'ny maty, saingy tsy mety milaza ny isa ofisialy kosa ny fitondrana jadona ao Myanmar. ||| Death toll is rumoured to be in the hundreds, though the Myanmar Junta refuses to confirm the official number.
Vaovao iray hafa indray ny nandikan'ny Feo Demokratikan'I Birmania ny fanambarana avy amin'I Ko Sein Lin, mpiasa anisan'ny Zenerasiona 8888. ||| Democratic Voice of Burma is quoting this announcement from Ko Sein Lin, a 1988 Generation worker.
Nisy fihetsiketseham-panoherana ny fitondrana jadona tahaka ity ihany koa manko tany Myanmar tamin'ny taona 1988 ary mpianatra indray ny ankamaroan'ny mpitarika tamin'izany fotoana izany. ||| In 1988, there was a similar protest against the Myanmar Junta, led mostly by the students.
Potiky ny fitondrana jadona (ihany koa) izany hetsika izany ka 3000 ny isan'ny maty ary maro hafa koa no nampijaliana. ||| These protests were brutally crushed by the Junta and over 3000 people were thought to have been killed and many more tortured.
Manaika ny mpiasa hafa hiditra amin'ny fanoherana ny jadona i Ko Sein Lin: ||| Ko Sein Lin urges the rest of the workers to join in the protest against the Myanmar Junta:
Ny olom-pirenena ihany no tokony ho ray aman-drenin'ny firenena. ||| Only the citizens of Myanmar should be the Mother and the Father of the country.
(Miezaka ny mametraka ny tafika ho ray aman-drenin'ny firenena amin'ny fanasana ati-doha ny vahoaka manko ny fitondrana jadona.)Nandritra ny "hetsika mendri-piderana nataon'ny Sangha (mpitokatena) tamim-pilaminana ho fihaikana ny jadona": ||| (The Myanmar Junta has repeatedly tried to brainwash the citizens by trying to elevate the army's status as that of being the parents of the country). During the "Sangha's heroic act of peaceful defiance against the Junta":
Tokony hianatra ny tantara nampalaza sy nampamirapiratra an'I Myanmar ny vahoakan'I Myanmar ary hivonona ho tahaka ny tongotra miaramamindra sy soroka miaramilanja hiady na dia handriaka aza ny ra. ||| 1) Many monks, students and civilians have been ruthlessly killed, beaten and tortured by the evil Junta, in a bid to crackdown on the protests.
(ohabolana Birmana no noezahina nadika araka izay mety eto). ||| We workers from the 1988 generation vehemently oppose these acts of violence.
Miangavy ny mpiasa rehetra izahay hampitsahatra ny asany ka hiditra ho amin'ny fanoherana ny fitondrana tsy mataho-tody. ||| We would like to request that all workers cease work and to join in the protest against the evil Junta.
Mpiasa avy amin'ny Zenerasiona 88. |||Workers from the 88 Generation
Libya: "Ny fahafahana no zavatra tokana irinay ||| Libya: "The only thing we want is our freedom" (Audio)
Ity lahatsoratra ity dia fanadihadiana manokana mikasika ny Fihetsiketsaham-bahoaka tao Lybia taona 2011. ||| This post is part of our special coverage Libya Uprising 2011.
Ny Alahady 27 febroary, andro hafa indray nisiana rà mandriaka tao Libya, toy ny fihetsiketseham-panoherana an'i Kolonely Muammar Al Gaddafi efapolo taona nitondràna dia mitohy izany tamin'ny andro faha iraika ambinifolo ||| Sunday, February 27 brought another day of bloodshed in Libya, as an uprising against Colonel Muammar Al Gaddafi's 40-year rule continued into the 11th day.
Nilaza ny tatitry ny mpanao gazety eran-tany fa miha-malefaka isan'ora ny herin'i Gaddafi ao Libia, nefa dia mbola mahafehy tsara ihany ireo fitaovam-piadiana maromaro sy miaramila tsy tambo isaina ary mpikarama an'ady avy any ivelany izy. ||| International media reports say Gaddafi's grip on power in Libya is weakening by the hour, but the dictator still controls a massive amount of weaponry and an untold number of soldiers and foreign mercenaries.
Zavatra hafa ihany koa no nolazain'ny zanany lahy, Seif al-Islam. ||| Gaddafi's son, Seif al-Islam, paints a different picture.
Nilaza izy fa tsy misy lanjany loatra ny revolisiona, ary ireo mpanohana mahatoky ny fanjakana dia mahafehy tsara ny firenena. ||| He says the revolution is minor, and that troops loyal to the regime are regaining control of the country.
Mihevitra ny (fianakaviana) Gaddafi fa eto Libia no ho velona sy ho faty. ||| The Gaddafi's insist they plan to live-and-die in Libya.
Raha mbola manjavozavo ny ho avy, indreto misy fijoroana vavolombelona avy amin'ny Libiana, izay manohy ny fiainany an-davanandro manoloana ny herisetran'ny polisy sy miaramila izay efa nahafaty olona an-jatony. ||| While the future is still unclear, below are testimonies from Libyans, who continue their lives in the face of police and military violence that has already claimed the lives of hundreds.
Feon'ny tany: ||| Voices from the ground
Feb17Voices (Ny feon'ny 17 febroary) dia fandraisan-kevitra an-tserasera an' ireo antso avy amin'ny Libiana ary mandika an-tsoratra, mamadika ny teny, sy mizara azy ireo amin'ny alalan'ny tranonkala. ||| Feb17Voices is an online initiative to record phone calls from Libyans and transcribe, translate, and share them on the web.
Ireo olona voakasiky ny tetikasa dia tompon'andraikitra tamin'ny Feon'ny 25 janoary, tetikasa mitovy habe amin'ny fihetsiketsehana tao Egypta. ||| The people behind the project are also responsible for Jan25Voices, a similar project at the height of Egypt's recent protests.
Nanazava ny mpiantso iray fa mikatona ny ankamaroan'ny magazay ao Tripoli, renivohitr'i Libia. ||| One caller explains that most stores are closed in Tripoli, Libya's capital.
Re laza ny zava mitranga ao Tripoli. ||| The situation in Tripoli is very, very tumultuous.
Amin'ireo magazay 100, dia angamba folo fotsiny no mivoha. ||| Out of 100 stores, maybe four are opened.
Na ireo magazay mivoha aza dia sady matahotra ihany. ||| Even the stores open are not at ease.
Raha misy fidirana folo, dia iray ihany no mivoha. ||| If there are 10 entrances, maybe one is open.
Ity misy horonantsary tao Tripoli nampidirin'ny Ali Tweel, izay mampiseho ireo olona miandry mofo dipaina ao amin'ny lalana Jraba ao Tripoli. ||| Here is a video from Tripoli uploaded by Ali Tweel, that shows people waiting for bread in Tripoli's Jraba Street.
Nitatitra ny Al Jazeera fa maro ireo Libiana izay tsy hita popoka, matetika alaina ankeriny manoloana ny tranony. ||| Al Jazeera reported that many Libyans have been going missing, often kidnapped in front of their houses.
Vehivavy iray tao Tripoli no nilaza fa miezaka manavotra ny fianakaviany izy. ||| A female caller from Tripoli speaks about trying to protect her family.
Ity sombiny amin'ny fandikana nataon'i Alive tao Libia: ||| Here is part of the transcript provided by Alive In Libya:
Matahotra izahay, matahotra izahay satria fantatrareo fa vehivavy izahay, manana zanaka vavy aho. ||| We are afraid, we are afraid because you know we are women, I have daughters here.
Antsy no mba fitaovam-piadina ao trano. ||| Every house is armed only by knives.
Tsy manana na inona na inona izahay, fa manana an'Andriamanitra. ||| We have nothing else, but we have God.
Matoky an'Andriamanitra izahay, eto anilanay izy. ||| We believe in God, God's here with us.
Tsy matahotra ny ho faty izahay. ||| We are not afraid of death.
Ity vehivavy ao Tripoli ity dia miteny momba ny eritreritra sy ny antony manosika ireo mpanao fihetsiketsehana: "OK, vonoy izahay. ||| This woman in Tripoli speaks about the thoughts and motivations of the protesters: "OK, kill us.
(Ho faty) izahay na ho afaka. ||| We do or we'll be free.
Ny fahafahana no zavatra tokana tadiavinay." ||| The only thing we want is our freedom".
Ao amin'ny Facebook -n'ireo tanora mpanao fihetsiketsehana Libiana, ity misy fanazavana momba ny antso amin'ireo Libiana mipetraka any UK sy ny rahalahiny izay monina ao Libia. ||| From the Libyan Youth Movement's page on Facebook, here are some notes regarding a phone call between a Libyan living in the UK and his brother who remains in Libya.
Ny isan'ny maty voamarina tao Benghazi irery dia 800 farafahakeliny, raha eo amin'ny sehatra nasionaly dia 2000 mahery, raha mijery ireo isa ireo dia maro koa ireo olona tsy hita, ary ireo miaramila izay tsy nety hiady ka nodorana ary mbola maro koa ireo tsy hita, koa dia mety ho avo roa heny no isan'ny maty. ||| The confirmed minimum death toll in Benghazi is 800+ alone and national is 2,000 + considering those figures there are many unaccounted for missing, and the solders who refused to fight were cremated and many are also unaccounted for, so the death toll could easily be double.
Nisy famonoan'olona tao Zawiya sy toerana sasany ao atsinanana. ||| there has been massacres in Zawiya and other cities in the west.
Iray tamin'ireo mpifanolo-bodirindrina aminay no very nandritra ny telo andro ary hita indray tao amin'ny trano mangatsiakan'ny hopitaly. ||| One of our neighbours have been missing for 3 days then found in a fridge of the hospital who was unaccounted for.
Alive any Libia dia nandika resaka nifanaovana tamin'ny mpanadihady avy amin'ny radio ao Benghazi, izay manohitra ny radio ofisialin'ny fitondrana fa milamina tsara ao Libia. ||| Also on Alive in Libya is a translated conversation with a radio reporter from Benghazi, who disagrees with the government's official line that all is well in Libya.
Teboka iray tiko omena fanazavana momba ny fanazavan'i Sayf al Islam raha niteny izy fa tsy misy revolisiona tao Libia ary mandeha tsara ny zavatra rehetra ankoatra ny tanana izay eo am-pelatanan'ny mpampihorohoro. ||| Another point I would like to make on Sayf al Islam's comment when he said that there is no revolution in Libya and everything is fine except a few cities in the hand of terrorists.
Tsy mpampihorohoro izy ireo Atoa Ghaddafi, olona manana ny maha izy azy sy olona afaka ireo, ka nanda ireo mpiara miasa nirahinao izy ireo satria ianao dia mpiara miasa. ||| These are not terrorists Mr Ghaddafi, these are honourable and free people, and they have stood up to the collaborators you sent because you yourself are a collaborator.
Raha olona marina ianao dia tsy nanao izay efa nataonao. ||| If you were an honourable man you would not have done what you have.
Tao Zawiya, tanàna miorina 30 maily ao antsinanan'i Tripoli (fiarovana mafy ho an'i Gaddafi) ny media eran-tany dia nitatitra fa voafehin'ny mpanohitra ny raharaha. ||| In Zawiya, a town 30 miles west of Tripoli (Gaddafi's main stronghold) international media reported the opposition have taken control.
Tao amin'ny Twitter, ity sombiny tamin'ireo hafatra nipoitra tamin'ny Alahady. ||| On Twitter, here are a few of the messages that appeared on Sunday.
Nilaza ny any Zawiya fa entina mitifitra ny mponina sy ny tilikambon'ny moske ny tafondro fitifirana fiaramanidina. ||| Zawiya locals say anti aircraft guns used against people & shooting from minaret.
Mihofahofa eo amin'ny Lalambe ny sainan'ny mpioko, lasa kosa ny sarin'i Gaddafi ||| Rebel flag flying over main Sq, Gaddafi picture gone
Miaraka amin'ny fiara mifono vy simba. ||| With a tank which has defected.
Ireo vahoaka maro be mihiaka hoe miala! miala ny amin'ny fanjakana - Zawiya ||| Large crowd shouting down down with the regime - Zawiya
Ejypta: Fandresen'ny Sivily Manoloana ny Tribonaly Miaramila ||| Egypt: Victories of Civilians Against Military Trials
Nitsahatra kely tamin'izay nataony an-tserasera sy eny an-kianja ny mpikatroka - hanairana ny fisian'ny sivily hotsaraina eny amin'ny tribonaly miaramila, taorian'ny revolisiona Ejipsiana. ||| Activists are pulling all the stops online - and on the ground - to draw attention to civilians put on trial in military courts, following the Egyptian revolution.
Taorian'ny fisamborana ireo vondrona mpanao fihetsiketsehana tao amin'ny kianja Tahrir ny alin'ny 9 Martsa, vondrona mpitolona, mpanao gazety, ary mpisolovava no niray hina amin'ny fandraisana andraikitra mba hanampy ireo sivily noenjehina eny anivon'ny tribonaly miaramila. ||| Following the group arrest of protesters on the night of the March 9 protest in Tahrir, a group of activists, journalists, and lawyers took upon themselves the task of reaching out to help all civilians prosecuted by military courts.
Nilaza mazava tsara izy ireo fa tokony hotsaraina eny amin'ny tribonaly sivily izy ireo. ||| They have declared it clearly that civilians should be tried in civilian courts.
Tao amin'ny bilaoginy, nampahafantatra ny tenany tahaka izao manaraka izao ry zareo: ||| In their blog they introduce themselves as follows:
Vondrona mpitolona miaina ny andavanandron'ny revolisiona izahay ary nahafantatra tsara ny tena" Ejypta" izay tao amin'ny kianja Tahrir. ||| We are a group of activists who lived everyday of the revolution and experienced the true" Egypt" that was there in Tahrir square.
Manameloka tanteraka ny fandikan-dalàna ataon'ny tafika amin'ireo sivily izahay izay mody milaza fa" Miaro ny firenena amin'ireo jiolahim-boto". ||| We strongly condemn the violations the army commits towards civilians under the pretense of" Protecting the country from thugs".
Mangataka ny fampiatoana ny tribonaly miaramila atao amin'ny sivily izahay, ary ny fanomezana fitsarana marina eny anivon'ny fitsarana ady tsotra tena izy ho an'ireo voampanga/nomelohina. ||| We demand an end to all military trials of civilians, and granting those who had been charged/sentenced a fair re trial in front of their natural civilian court.
Raha nanomboka ny fandraisana andraikitra voalohany, dia vitsy no nifantoka tamin'ity raharaha ity sy ny tohana azony, zava-dehibe ho an'ny olona mahafantatra ny fandikan-dalàna atao any amin'ny fonja miaramila. ||| When the initiative first started, very minimal support and attention were given to it, and it was important for people to know about the violations committed in military prisons.
Miasa mafy ny vondrona" Tsy Fitsarana ady miaramila "amin'ny fikarakarana valandresaka, ka nifandray tamin'ny vahoaka, ary nametraka bilaogy ahafahan'ireo gadra sy ny ray aman-dreniny manao fijoroana vavolombelona sy milaza ny zava-niainany mba hampahafantatra izao tontolo izao ny tsy rariny niaretan'izy ireo. ||| The group of No Military trials worked hard on arranging conferences, contacting people, and established a blog on which prisoners as well as their parents can provide their testimonies and expose their experience to let the world know the injustice they have been subjected to.
Efa maherin'ny dimy volana izay, mbola mitolona ampirehetam-po sy ankerim-po hatrany ny vondrona "NoMilTrials" mba haka antoka fa notsaraina tamim-pahamarinana ny Ejyptiana ary tsy voakasikasika ny zo maha olombelona azy ireo. ||| It has been over five months and the "NoMilTrials" groups are still fighting enthusiastically and courageously to ensure Egyptians are tried fairly and with all their human rights intact.
Tao anatin'izay andro vitsy lasa izay, nanomboka nandray ny valin-kasasarany ny vondrona "NoMilTrials". ||| Over the past few days, "NoMilTrials" group started reaping the fruits of their hard work.
Gadra sasantsasany no noafahana, ao anatin'izany ireo nampidirana am-ponja tamin'ny fifandonana teo anoloan'ny Minisiteran'ny Atitany ny 28 sy 29 Jiona: ||| A number of detainees have been released as well as all those who were detained during the 28th and 29th of June clashes in front of the Ministry of Interior:
Salma Abdel Gelil, iray amin'ireo mpitolona "NoMilTrials" nilaza fa: ||| Salma Abdel Gelil, one of the "NoMilTrials" activists says:
Nilaza tamin'ny manampahefana tao ny Mpampanoa lalàna Miaramila hoe: tsy mitombina ity raharaha ity satria tsy misy porofo na antonta-taratasy naterina. ||| The Military Prosecutor told the officers: this case is flawed as there were no evidence or file reports provided.
Na dia izany aza, nandray sazy mihantona enim-bolana izy ireo araka ny "baiko" nomena ||| Nevertheless, they received suspended sentences of six months as per the given "orders"
Na dia fandrosoana ngeza be amin'ny fomban'ny fitsarana aza izany, sivily marobe no mbola ao amin'ny fonjan'ny miaramila ka tsy tonga nanatrika ny andro voalohan'ny revolisiona tahaka an'i Amr El Beheiry: ||| Albeit this is a huge leap in the way for justice, yet lots of civilians are inside military prisons and have been away since the early days of the revolution like Amr El Beheiry:
Mona Seif izay nifandrirotra teo amin'ny asany sy ny fanampiana ireo fianakaviana sy ny gadra akaiky azy ireo nilaza hoe: ||| Mona Seif who has been torn between her work and helping out the families and their imprisoned dependents says:
Toa hita fa nisy vokany ny fanerena natao amin'ny SCAF, resaka marobe momba ny fanajanonana ny tribonaly miaramila saingy tsy misy resaka ny momba ireo an-jatony efa nogadraina. ||| The pressure on SCAF seems 2 be paying off,lots of talk abt stopping use of military trials but no talk abt the thousands already in prison.
Nandritra izany, e-fihetsiketsehana manohitra ny fitsarana ady miaramila no nokarakaraina tao amin'ny Facebook androany alina tamin'ny 10 (ora ao Kairo). ||| Meanwhile, an e-protest against military trials is being organised on Facebook tonight at 10pm (Cairo time).
Mifandray amin'ny mpiserasera ireo mpitolona mba haneho hevitra amin'ny pejin'ny Facebook efatra mandritra ny ora iray ka mba haneho ny fandàvany ny fitsarana ady miaramila ho an'ny sivily. ||| Activists are reaching out to internet users to comment on four Facebook pages during for one hour to voice their rejection to military trials for civilians.
Namporisika ireo mpisiokantserasera ihany koa izy ireo mba hi-tweet ny fandàvany amin'ny alalan'ny fampiasana teny fototra NoMilTrial. ||| They are also urging Twitter users to tweet their objections under the hashtag NoMilTrial
Tamberina 2009 Azia Atsimo ||| South Asia: Looking Back At 2009
Nivalona hatreo ny taona 2009 ary izao no fotoana hitodihana izay nitranga tany Azia atsimo. ||| The year 2009 is ending and its time to retrospect how the year has been for the South Asian region.
Ao anatin'ny tamberina misy fizarana roa no ijerentsika ireo fotoan-dehibe nanamarika io taona io ho an'ny firenena atsimon'i Azia amin'ny alalan'ny mason'olo-tsotra tia mampita vaovao. ||| In a two-part review we will look back at some of the major events which took place this year in the South Asian countries seen through the eyes of the citizen journalists.
Isaorana manokana ireo mpanoratry ny Global Voices ho an'i Azia atsimo noho ny fahiratantsain'izy ireo sy ny asa mafy notontosainy nandritra ny taona. ||| Special thanks to the South Asia authors of Global Voices for their insight and hard work all around the year.
Mafy ny taona ho an'i Azia atsimo satria tratran'ny fitotonganana ankapobeny ihany koa ny mponina any. ||| The year was tough for South Asia as the global recession affected people of this region too.
Fiaviana mpiasa mifindra monina maro ho an'ireo firenena an'i (Azia) Afovoany antsinanana sy faritra hafa manerantany io faritra iray io. ||| The populous region is a source of many migrant workers in the middle east and other places in the world.
Hitanay fa maro ireo mpiasa nifindra monina no niverina an-tanindrazana noho ny fahaverezan'ny asa sy ny fihenan'ny tolotra azo nohararaotina. ||| We saw many migrant workers returning to their homeland as they lost their jobs and saw opportunities diminishing.
Adihevitra lehibe ihany koa ny resaka angovo fa maro ny firenena no tsy maintsy nizatra fahatapahan-jiro sy delestazy. ||| Energy was a major concern as some countries had to cope with power shortage and rolling blackouts.
