Nahoana no hamaham-bolongana ho an'i Afrika ||| "Why I blog about Africa"
Andro vitsivitsy lasa izay dia nitagy ny mpamaham-bolongana namany i Théophile Kouamouo, mpamaham-bolongana mipetraka any Abidjan (Côte d'Ivoire), hilazalaza ny eritreriny tsirairay avy amin'ny antony hamahanam-bolongana momba an'i Afrika: ||| A few days ago, Théophile Kouamouo, a blogger based in Abidjan (Côte d'Ivoire), started a meme asking bloggers to reflect on why blog about Africa:
Hamaham-bolongana ho an'ny mieli-patrana sy ny tontolo midadasika, tafasaraka amin'ny mpiara-belona amintsika any amin'ny kaontinanta? ||| Do we blog for the diaspora and for the world at large, cut off from our contemporary on the continent?
Hamaham-bolongana ho an'i Afrika tahaka izay hamahanam-bolongana ho an'i Eoropa na i Azia? ||| Is blogging about Africa done in the same way as blogging about Europe or Asia?
Moa ve ny tontolom-bolongana mitodika amin'i Afrika manan-javatra manokana atolotra ny fiaraha-mientan'izao tontolo izao endrika 2.0? ||| Does the African-oriented blogosphere have something specific to offer to the world version 2.0?
Taorian'ny nitagiany mpamaham-bolongana Afrikana vitsivitsy dia natolotry Téophile ihany ny valinteiny tamin'ny fanontaniany: ||| After tagging a few fellow African bloggers, Téophile offered his own answer to the question:
Mamaham-bolongana ho an'i Afrika amim-pifaliana aho satria inoako fa avy amin'ny feo maningatsingana sy mifangaro avy amintsika no iavian'ny tsirim-panantenana afrikana vaovao indray izay ho avy mihitsy tahaka ny nofin'i Martin Luther King izay tanteraka 40 taona taty aoriana. ||| I blog about Africa with joy because I believe that it is from our individual and mixed voices that the African renaissance will sprout, which will come as surely as Martin Luther King's dream became a reality forty years later.
Mamaky amim-pahasambarana ny bolongana mitodika any Afrika aho satria ireny no manome ahy sary tsy mankaleo sy tsy manana fijery ratsy loatra ny kaontinanta syny mponina ao aminy. ||| I read African-oriented blogs with joy because they give me a less monolithic and less doomed image of the continent and its inhabitants.
Indreto ary misy nofantenana avy amin'ireo mpamaham-bolongana miteny frantsay nandray anjara tamin'ity tagy ity. ||| Amongst the many Francophone bloggers that participated in the meme and gave some thinking to Téophile's question, here is a selection of their answers.
Hilaire Kouakou, avy any Côte d'Ivoire koa: ||| Hilaire Kouakou, also from Côte d'Ivoire:
... satria tsy afaka esorina tsy ho anisan'izao tontolo izao i Afrika. |||... because Africa cannot escape from the world.
Ary porofon'ny fisian'ny aina, ny fisiany, ny lalantsainy koa ny mamaham-bolongana ho an'i Afrika. ||| Thus blogging about Africa, it's the proof that this continent has a life, that it exists, that it has its ways.
Claudus: ||| Claudus:
Mitady Afrika hajaina eto amin'izao tontolo izao satria mendrika sy matoky tena ho an'ny anabavy sy rahalahintsika madinika ary ny zanatsika aho. ||| For our little sisters, our little brothers and our children I would like an Africa respected in the world, proud and self-confident.
Ramata Sore avy any Burkina Faso, no miresaka tao amin'ny l'Atelier des Médias tao amin'ny Radio France Internationale: ||| Ramata Sore from Burkina Faso, commenting on l'Atelier des Médias of Radio France Internationale:
Satria anisan'izao tontolo izao i Afrika, ||| Because Africa is part of the world,
Africa 2.0: ||| Africa 2.0:
* Fiezahako hikosoka ny sary ratsy miraikitra amin'ny kaontinanta ||| * Try to rub out the bad image stuck on this continent with my contribution
Maintikely avy eto Madagasikara no manangona ny lisitr'ireo fijery mahazatra an'i Afrika mialoha ny hitondrany ny fijery hafa izay ananany: ||| Maintikely from Madagascar collects a list of common stereotypes about Africa before describing how different she can be from them:
...Afrika tsy hoe ny loko mainty ihany, tsy hoe SIDA no mitovy dika aminy, na ady an-trano isaky ny mivily. |||...Africa is not just the black colour, it's not just a synonym of AIDS, or of civil war at every turn.
Tsy tsi-fahampiankanina na fahantrana na fahoriana na fahafantesan-jaza. ||| It is not malnutrition, or poverty, or misery, or children mortality.
Tsy kolikoly, na piraty, fihazana (tsy ara-dalàna?), na ady fahefana, na trosa, na safaris, na pyramida, na tontolo fanalan'andro, na Sahara, na Mugabe sy ny tariny, na liona sy elefanta, sns...Afrika koa ilay nihavian'ny olombelona rehetra, ilay akanin'ny sivilizasiona rehetra, ilay tsikin'ny mponina ao aminy, ilay fampiantranoany vahiny sy fahaizany mandray vahiny, ilay firahalahiana, ny mponiny, ny mieli-patrana avy aminy, ilay fanantenana amin'ny andro tsara kokoa, ilay dihy soukous, ilay fahasamihafan'ny mponina ao aminy, ilay fahasamihafan'ny endri-taniny, ilay firaisan-kinan'ny fianakaviana sy ilay soatoavin'ny fianakaviana hajainy, i Maghreb, ilay firoky mampiavaka loatra ny Afrikana iray izay mahatonga anao ho manina ny tanindrazanao, kouakou, ny loko marevaka, ny kolontsany samihafa... ||| It is not corruption, pirates, poaching, power struggles, debts, safaris, pyramides, exotic landscapes, the Sahara, Mugabe and company, or lions and elephants, etc... Africa is also the cradle of humanity, the cradle of all civilisation, the smile of her population, the hospitality and welcoming sense, the friendship, its population, its diaspora, the hope for a better day, the soukous, the diversity of her inhabitants, the diversity of landscapes, the family spirit and family values, the Maghreb, the characteristic accent of an African that makes you nostalgic for your country, kouakou, bright colours, her diverse culture...
Ary dia resahiny farany moa ny nahatonga azy hamaham-bolongana ho an'i Afrika: ||| And finally she answers the question of why she blogs about Africa:
satria Afrikana aho, ary mirehereha amin'izany. ||| because I'm African, and proud to be.
Vehivavy Afrikana tsy dia mahalala loatra an'i Afrika saingy tia azy ary maniry indrindra mba ho fijery vaovao no ijerena ny kaontinanta, fijery izay mamaky ny endrika mahazatra ijerena azy, fijery mihoatra ny hevitry ny mpizahatany, tsy mijanona amin'ny maharary an'i Afrika fa hijery koa ny lafiny iray amin'ny meday. ||| An African woman who doesn't know Africa well but who loves her and who wishes for a new look on the continent, a look that would trascend the clichés associated with it, a look beyond touristic opinions, and beyond her troubles to see also the other side of the coin.
(saritanin'i Afrika notagen'ny mpandray anjaran'ny Barcamp Africa tamin'ny volana Septambra, saripikan'i Maneno Flickr photostream) ||| (Map of Africa tagged by participants of Barcamp Africa last October, from the Maneno Flickr photostream)
Sri Lanka: Miatrika Fitobahan'ambim-bava Avy Amin'ny Fambolena ||| Sri Lanka: Tackling Agricultural Surpluses
Miatrika karazana fanamby vaovao ny governemanta ao Sri-Lanka, miatrika ny fitobahan'ny ambim-bava amin'ny vary. ||| The Sri Lankan Government is facing a new kind of challenge, tackling surplus production of rice.
Ny Minisitry ny Fampandrosoana ara-toekarena ao Sri Lanka, Basil Rajapaksa, dia nanolo-kevitra ny hanondrànana ireo ambim-bava amin'ny vary sy legioma ao aminy. ||| The Economic Development Minister of Sri Lanka Basil Rajapaksa has suggested to export the surplus of rice and vegetables in the country.
Nisy ihany koa ireo soso-kevitra hoe atakalo solika ny vary. ||| There has also been suggestions that oil should be purchased bartered with rice.
Saingy inona anefa no tena zava-misy eny an-kianja? ||| But what is the reality on the ground?
Faly amin'ny fivangongoan'ny ambim-bava ve ny tantsaha? ||| Are farmers happy with the surplus productions?
Kely dia kely ny vaovao mikasika ny fijalian'ireo tantsaha mba hita anaty gazety. ||| There is very little information on the plight of the farmer in the Press.
Rajaratarala, bilaogera sady tantsaha, mamaritra ilay fanondranana ny vary ho fanompàna ireo tantsaha mpamoka-bary ao Sri Lanka. ||| Rajaratarala, blogger and a farmer, terms the export of rice an insult to the paddy farmers of Sri Lanka.
Hoy ilay bilaogera manao fanamarihana: ||| The blogger comments:
Fotoana vitsy lasa izay dia voalaza, androany 18 Aprily 2012, fa ny Sekreteran'ny Ministeran'ny Fambolena, KA Sakalasooriya, dia nanambara ny fananganana faritra efatra mitodika amin'ny fanondrànana. ||| It was reported a short while ago today, April 18th 2012, that the Secretary to the Ministry of Agriculture, KA Sakalasooriya, has announced the creation of four zones for export.
Mbola lasa lavidavitra kokoa aza ny fanambarana fa hoe amin'ny taom-pamokarana manaraka, Yala, ny akotry dia mety hosandaina Rs40/kg. ||| It was further announced that in the next Yala season this paddy would be purchased at Rs40/kg.
Nahoana moa io fanambaràna io no manafintohina? ||| Why is this announcement insulting?
Tsy azony an-tsaina na kely akory aza ny mikasika izay fambolena vary, ny mikasika vokatra azo sy ny fitombon'izany amin'ny karazan-tany fambolena samihafa any, sy ireo karazana vary akotry samihafa. ||| He has no clue about rice farming, about yields on different soil and growing conditions, and on different varieties of paddy.
Namboly karazana akotry 6 aho, ary ny tenako manokana dia nitety varavarana rehefa nivarotra, karazam-bary 14 no azo tamin'io. ||| I have planted 6 varieties of paddy, and I have personally sold door to door, 14 varieties of rice arising from this paddy.
Rs 40/kg izany tsy ho ampy velively hanentsenana ireo zara raha nahita vokatra ||| Rs 40/kg is not enough to compensate for the lower yields.
Toa tena tsapako marina fa raha mamokatra akotry ho aminà kalitao ilaina amin'ny fanondrànana amin'io sanda io ireo tantsaha, dia mbola ry Miller (mpanangom-bokatra) ihany no hahazo tombony, satria izy no mamatsy ny tsena, ary ny ataon'ny governemanta amin'ny fanatanterahana ity fampanantenana ity dia fanaovana ny tolobidy ho an'ireo Millers (mpitoto koba) izay nanome kely ho an'ny Governemanta mba hividianana io akotry io amin'izay sanda izay ||| I really suspect that if farmers produce paddy at this price for the quality that is required for export, it is the Miller who will make the profit again, as he has the market sown up, and all the Government is doing by making this promise is doing the bidding of the Millers who have given the Govt. an undertaking to buy this paddy at this price.
Tanimbary ao Sri Lanka. ||| Paddy fields in Sri Lanka.
Sary tao amin'ny Flickr an'i Nishan.sl. ||| Image from Flickr by Nishan.sl.
Nampiasàna ny Creative commons license BY-NC-ND ||| Used under a creative commons license BY-NC-ND
Ao anaty lahatsoratra iray hafa mitondra fanazavana ilay bilaogera momba ny fijalian'ireo mpamoka-bary ao Sri Lanka, izay tsy mahazo ny sanda sahaza ny vokatr'izy ireo: ||| The blogger sheds a light into the plights of the rice farmers in Sri Lanka, who are not obtaining a fair price for their produce, in another post:
Tsy misy tombony mihitsy ny famokarana vary akotry aminà tany latsaky ny 5 hektara izay manome ny 70 % amin'ny tany voavoly ankehitriny. ||| There is no profit in growing paddy on an acreage that is less than 5 acres which comprise, 70% of the paddy land grown today.
Noho izany TADIDIO fa ny vary izay hanintsika dia vokarin'ireo olona feno fandavan-tena!!! ||| So REMEMBER the rice we eat is grown by people making a sacrifice!!!
Tsy iandrasana na inona na inona, tsy ampy akory aza mba handoavana karama isan'andro mitentina Rs200. ||| For no gain, not even enough to pay for a daily wage of Rs200.
Ka inona noho izany no ho entin'ny hoavy? ||| So what does the future hold?
Miezaka ny mamnoritsoritra ny fomba ifehezan'ireo mpitoto koba ny tsena sy fakàny tombontsoa amin'ilay fandraharahana i Rajaratarala ao anaty lahatsoratra iray hafa. ||| Rajaratarala depicts in another post how the millers control the market and take the cream out of the business.
Manolotra hevitra ilay biloagera: ||| The blogger suggests:
Mba handaniana ireo fatra mihoatra amin'ny vokatra akotry ao Sri Lanka araka izany, ny Governemanta dia tsy maintsy mividy sy mitahiry vatsy ampy mandritra ny 6 volana raha kely indrindra anaty sompitra manerana ny firenena, ary koa manana tetikady hananganana fitotoam-bary goavana mba hahazoana vary fanondrana tsara kalitao, izay ilàna rafitra manokana fanaraha-maso ny kalitao hifaninana amin'ny fenitra iraisam-pirenena, izay ananan'io fitotoam-bary io ihany koa. ||| In order therefore for the excess paddy in Sri Lanka to be absorbed, the Govt. must purchase and store at least 6 months supply in large silos around the country and also have a plan to build a large mill for export quality rice, that requires special standards of quality control to compete with international standards, which this mill also has.
Hahazo vola misimisy kokoa amin'ny fivarotana eo amin'ny tsena anatiny ny tompon'io fitotoam-bary io, ary metimety kokoa ho azy raha ny marina ny tsenan'ny fanondrànana! ||| This mill owner makes more money selling to the local market, the export market to him is actually more competitive!
Farany ilay bilaogera dia manazava ny fomba hiatrehana io ambim-bava ara-toekarena io ary miteny fa tsy mandà ny fanondrànana izy akory: ||| Lastly the blogger explains how to tackle the economic surplus and says that he is not against export:
Tsy maintsy manana politika hitantanana, hanentanana sy hanampiana ny sehatra tsirairay ny governemanta. ||| must have a policy on how each segment is treated, incentivized and compensated.
Ny fanisahana ny mpamaritra vidin-javatra avy amin-dry Mpitoto koba, ny mpamongady sy ny mpanelanelana amin'ireo mpamboly, izany izao no adisanina tsy ahitam-baliny mbola itoloman'ireo mpahay toer-karena eran-tany, mahatonga ny asa fambolena ho vadin-tsena sy ilàna hery manetsika izay ho tombony ho an'ireo tantsaha fotsiny ihany rehefa misy tsy fahampiana manangasanga eny am-paratazana. Pourquoi cette annonce est insultant? ||| The transfer of the pricing determinant from the Miller, the wholesaler and intermediary to the grower, is what economists the whole world over are even now grappling with without answers, leaving agriculture to Market supply and demand dynamic that is only in the farmers' favor when shortages are in the horizon.
Però: Fotoam-Panombohan'ny Fihodinana Faharoa Amin'ny Fifidianana ||| Peru: Second Electoral Round Kicks Off
Ireo mpifaninana: Ollanta Humala sy Keiko Fujimori. ||| Candidates Ollanta Humala and Keiko Fujimori.
Sary: TVCultura (CC BY-NC-SA 2.0) ary ny Kongresin'ny Repoblika (CC BY 2.0) ||| Photos: TVCultura (CC BY-NC-SA 2.0) and Congress of the Republic (CC BY 2.0)
Herinandro vitsy talohan'ny fihodinana faharoa amin'ny fifidiannaa ao Però, isafidianana amin'ireo mpifaninana, dia ry Gana Perú, Ollanta Humala Tasso sy ny zanaka vavin'ny filoha taloha Alberto Fujimori, Keiko Sofía Fujimori (ho an'ny Fuerza 2011), ny fitombon'ny fisamahan'ny fiarahamonina Peroviana, sy ny anjara toeran'ireo mpifidy no tena mivandravandra kokoa na any anaty gazety samihafa na any anaty tambajotra sosialy. ||| A few weeks before the second round of elections in Peru, the choice between the candidate of Gana Perú, Ollanta Humala Tasso and the daughter of the ex-president Alberto Fujimori, Keiko Sofía Fujimori (for Fuerza 2011), the growing polarisation in Peruvian society, and ultimately from the electorate, is as notable in the press as it is on social networks.
Ny vaovao tena manaitra tato ho ato dia ny fandroahana mpanao gazety roa tao amin'ny fantsona mpampahalala vaovao Canal N, fananan'ny vodron'orinasa "El Comercio", nambara ho tsy nanaraka ny toro-làlana amin'ny fandefasana tatitra manome tombon-dahiny an'i Keiko Fujimori. ||| The most striking news these days is the recent dismissal of two journalists from the local news channel Canal N, property of the "El Comercio" group of companies, supposedly for not complying to instructions to display coverage in favour of Keiko Fujimori.
Niteraka fahasorenana teo anivon'ny vondrom-piarahamonin'ireo mpanao gazety ilay fihetsika, eny fa na teo amin'ny mpiara-miasa amin'ireo voaroaka aza. ||| This action has generated feelings of disgust within the journalistic community as well as with the colleagues of those fired.
Raúl Tola, mpanao gazety mpiara-miasa tamin'i Patricia Montero sy José Jara, dia manontany ao amin'ny matoan-dahatsoratra fanaony isanandro ao amin'ny La República: ||| Raúl Tola, journalist and colleague of Patricia Montero and José Jara, questions in his daily column in the periodical La República:
Ahoana no tokony handikàntsika, dia isika izay mbola manohy miasa ao amin'ny Canal N na ny América Television, iny fandroahana iny? ||| How should we who still work at Canal N or América Television interpret this dismissal?
Manomboka izao, isak'izay hamoaka tantara ve izany isika dia tokony hametraka anatin'ny làlan-jotrantsika ny hoe misaina izay" soa ho an'ny firenena" ny tompony, amin'ny teny hafa dia hoe, ny fampielezan-kevitra ho an'ny Fuerza 2011? ||| From now on, every time we release a story should we do it taking into account that the owners consider "the good of the country", in other words, the campaign of Fuerza 2011?
Angamba tsy anjarantsika ny mampahalala zavatra tsy manome lanja tahaka izany, fa ny fahatsapantenantsika irery ihany, amin'ireo hevitra fototra iorenan'ny asa aman-draharaha, ho an'ny mpamaky sy mpijery, nefa dia lasa ho an'ny tombontsoan'ny tena manokana?... -Dia inona no hiheveran'ny olona ny mpampahalala vaovao manafina sy milalao ny Lalànan'ny fahalalaham-pitenenana araka izay mahametimety azy fotsiny noho ny fifandraisana ananany...? ||| Perhaps it isn't our duty to inform without considerations of this nature, responding only to our consciences, to the fundamental principles of our profession, to the readers and viewers, but for subordinates interests?... What would the people think of a media that hides and plays with the freedom of expression Act in short term dalliances...?
Keiko Fujimori ao anatin'ny fivorian'ny Kaongresy. ||| Keiko Fujimori in a session in Congress.
Sary: Kaongresin'ny Repoblikan'i Pero (CC BY 2.0) ||| Photo: Congress of the Republic of Peru (CC BY 2.0)
Manontany toy izany koa ireo mpitoraka bilaogy sy mpampiasa ny tambajotra sosialy. ||| Bloggers and users of social networks are asking the same thing.
Ohatra, i Gustavo Faverón nanoratra tao amin'ny bilaoginy Puente Aéreo (Aerial View): ||| For example, Gustavo Faverón posts on his blog Puente Aéreo (Aerial View):
ireo izay niomana hifidy an'i Keiko Fujimori dia maneho (matetika amin'ny fomba kidaladala) ny tahotr'izy ireo ny mety hisian'ny famoretana raha i Humala no mitondra, izay mety hanao kenda roroka ny fahalalahan'ny asa fanaovana gazety.... ||| those who are prepared to vote for Keiko Fujimori display (most delusionally) their fear of a repressive dictatorship under Humala, that suffocates the freedom of the press....
(...) Ary ho fiomanana ho amin'ny andro izay mety hitrangan'ny zavatra eritreretina hataon'i Humala momba ny fahalalahana miteny, dia mamaky gazety sy manaraka ny fahitalavitry ny El Comercio ry zareo, izay tato anatin'ny roa andro izao, dia nanomboka nanao fandroahana sy fanendrena hafahafa: fandroahana ireo mpanao gazety izay mandà ny hanoratra fiandaniana amin'i Keiko Fujimori ary hanaratsy an'i Humala; ary ny fanendrena mpanao gazety iray hafa izay nifandray tamin'ny tàna-maloton'ny fitondrana Fujimori teo aloha... ||| ... And that there will come a day when the things that Humala will do with freedom of speech, they read the papers and watch the television stations from El Comercio, mediums from which for a couple of days now, have begun firing and making strange appointments: dismissals of journalists who refuse to write in favour of Keiko Fujimori and unfavourably of Humala; and the appointment of other journalists who were connected to the Black hand of the previous Fujimori regime...
César Lievand manamarika ao amin'ny Twitter: ||| César Lievand comments on Twitter:
Frospigliosi tuesta ny nataon'ny GRUPO EL COMERCIO dia tsy inona fa fanohintohinana ny fahalalahana amin'ny fanaovana gazety sy fitenenana. ||| Frospigliosi tuesta what el GRUPO EL COMERCIO has done has been an attack on freedom of the press and of expression.
Silvio Rendón mizara ny fomba fijeriny ao amin'ny pejy Facebook-ny bilaoginy Gran Combo Club: ||| Silvio Rendón shares his opinion on the Facebook page of his blog Gran Combo Club:
Cipriani (the Cardinal) no mpitari-pivavahana, El Comercio no ilay mpitaingin-tsoavaly, ny CONFIEP (fikambanan'ny mpandraharaha ara-barotra) no tilikambo, Fujimori (Alberto) no mpanjakalahy, ary i Keiko mpanjakavavy. ||| Cipriani (the Cardinal) is the bishop, El Comercio is the knight, the CONFIEP (guild of commerce) is the tower, Fujimori (Alberto) is the king, and Keiko the queen.
Ary misy fanirakiraka tsy tambo ho isaina ao. ||| And there are countless pawns.
Jack Sánchez manamafy: ||| Jack Sánchez affirms:
Betsaka ankehitriny ny antony tokony hifidianana an'i Ollanta Humala. ||| Now there is a greater reason to vote for Ollanta Humala.
Ny fiantombohan'ity lahatsoratra ity dia milaza ny fisamahan'ny fiarahamonina, izay tsikaritra koa eny anivon'ireo tambajotra sosialy: anatin'ity bitsika maneso sy mandranitra nalefan'i Paul Nassi ity, be ny mampisalasala ny olona amin'ny antoka azo omena ireo mihetsika ho fanohanana ny fahalalahan'ny asa fanaovana gazety, toy ny fanehoana izay fetezany amin'ny resaka ara-moraly fotsiny: ||| The beginning of this article mentions the polarisation of society, which patents itself on social networks: in this sarcastic tweet from Paul Nassi, one doubts the credibility of these and other protests in favour of the freedom of the press, just as it does with the question of moral appropriateness in itself:
Raha toa ny El Comercio manohana an'i Fujimori, dia nivaro-tena taminy izany. ||| If El Comercio supports Fujimori, it has sold itself out.
Fa raha ny La Republica no manohana an'i Humala, dia noho ny fahalalahana miteny. ||| But if La Republica supports Humala, it's for freedom of speech.
Aza mampihomehy ho'aho... ||| Don't mess around...
Ollanta Humala. ||| Ollanta Humala.
dikasary tamin'ny Enlace Nacional, TVCultura (CC BY-NC-SA 2.0) ||| Captura de pantalla de Enlace Nacional, TVCultura (CC BY-NC-SA 2.0)
Sokro, avy ao amin'ny bilaogy Cero Contenido (Tsy Misy Atiny) dia miresaka momba ireo mpanao gazety ao an-toerana izay nilaza ampahibemaso fa mpanohitra an'i Humala: ||| Sokro, from the blog Cero Contenido (No Content) speaks of certain local journalists who openly consider themselves anti-Humala:
"...resy lahatra ry zareo fa miresaka ny "cholos" (metisy) mihinana sushi dia tsy misy hafa amin'ny fisondrotana ara-toekarena, ary ireo fotsy hoditra izay mijery ny "Toerana ho an'ny fahefana ery an-damosina ery" ("Al fondo hay sitio", andiam-pandaharana be mpanaraka tokoa ao amin'ny fahitalavitra ao an-toerana) sy ny fihinanana akoho Hikary (trano fihinanana be mpankafy, malaza amin'ny akoho natono) dia zavatra mitovy amin'ny fandresena'ny fanavakavahana ara-piaviana sy hoe mahantra ny mahantra satria mitapy sy kamo ry zareo... ||| "...they are convinced that "cholos" (people of mixed race) eating sushi is the same as economic growth and whites seeing "Positions of power in the background" ("Al fondo hay sitio", a popular shows from local TV) and eating Hikary chicken(popular roasted chicken restaurants) is the same as overcoming racism and that the poor are poor because they are stupid and lazy...
Luchín mijery mialoha sahady: ||| Luchín anticipates:
Bayly (Jaime Bayly, mpanolotra fandaharana amin'ny fahitalavitra, izay nanambara ny fanohanany an'i Fujimori) dia hiverina ho ao amin'ilay fahitalavitra ho fampiharana ny tetika famotehana ny "OH" (Ollanta Humala) Mitandrema tsara ka saino tsara izay rehetra hitranga sy ho vokatr'izay. ||| Bayly (Jaime Bayly, TV presenter, who has declared his support for Fujimori) will return to TV as a part of the plan demolition "OH" (Ollanta Humala) Be very careful and mindful of all that comes as a result of this
Alexis Palomino miteny hoe: ||| Alexis Palomino says:
Ny ampahany lehibe indrindra amin'ireo haren'ny olon'ny Bayly (fianakaviana) Bayly dia saika avy amin'ny harena ankibon'ny tany avokoa. ||| The greater part of the riches of the Bayly peeps (family) Bayly are derived from mining utilities.
Zavatra iray nampanantenain'i Ollanta fa hanaovana fanadihadiana... ||| The ones that Ollanta promises to investigate...
Tsy dia mijery ny tena fototr'olana loatra ireo mpitoraka bilaogy mikasika ireo fifanoheran-kevitra sy fanontaniana, ohatra i Mario Ceroni dia manoratra ao amin'ny bilaoginy hoe: ||| Bloggers are not dispassionate about these controversies and questions, for example Mario Ceroni posts on his blog:
Leo be mandray mailaka sy hafatra ho fanohanana na fankahalana an'itsy na iroa mpifaninana iroa aho. ||| I'm fed up of receiving emails and messages against one or the other candidate.
Ny ratsy indrindra dia tsy dia misy tohan-kevitra matanjaka mba aroson-dry zareo fa dia mifototra fotsiny amin'izay fampielezan-kevitra azo lavina mora foana izy ireny. ||| The worst is that none of their arguments are solid but only based on propaganda that can easily be reasonably refuted.
Fara faharatsiny mba hafatra manome tombondahiny ny mpirotsaka tohanany no alefan-dry zareo, manolotra sy mifikitra amin'izay teniny. ||| They should send messages in favour of their candidates instead, propose and stick to their word.
Araka ny fitsapankevitra natao momba ny fifidianana navoaka tamin'ny Alahady 24 Aprily dia elanelana kely monja no manasaraka an'i Humala sy Fujimori, 42% sy 36% avy. ||| In accordance with the surveys of popular vote published on Sunday April 24 a slight difference is revealed between Humala and Fujimori, at 42% and 36% respectively.
Ireo mpampiasa Tweeter, Bryan Gutiérrez sy Maria Gracia Pérez dia mandika ny tsy hafaliana mahazo ny ankamaroan'ireo Peroviana amin'ny fitondrana fanamarihana hoe: ||| Tweeter users Bryan Gutiérrez and Maria Gracia Pérez interpret the disenchantment that takes the forefront in most Peruvians by commenting:
Ollanta sa Keiko, raha tokony ho ny mendrika no hofidiana, dia hifidy izay azoazo kokoa amin'ireto ratsy saina roa ireto isika ||| Ollanta or Keiko, instead of electing the best, we choose the lesser of two evils

Shina: Fotoana ho an'ny adihevitra vaovao momba ny fitsabahana amin'ny fiainana manokan'ny olona ||| China: Time for a new conversation about privacy invasion
Raha araka ny Privacy International, i Shina no ery amin'ny tendrony amin'ireny fiarahamonina manao ny fitsikilovana ho tandra vadin-koditra ireny, arahan'i Malezia, Rosia, UK ary Taiwan, Thailand sy Etazonia. ||| According to Privacy International, the list of endemic surveillance societies is topped by China, followed by Malaysia, Russia, Singapore, the UK and Taiwan, Thailand and the United States.
Ao anaty lahatsoratra iray ao amin'ny bilaoginy Phoenix, amin'ny maha-olona manam-pahatsiarovana ny fahazazany tsy mba nananany fotoana ho azy manokana mihitsy azy, ilay poeta, Rui Shen, sady mpampianatra ao amin'ny United States Naval Academy dia manontany hoe: amin'ny fiainantsika amin'izao fotoana toa voatsikilo isa-minitra izao, tsy fotoana ve izao hiresahana momba ny fitsabahana amin'ny fiainana manokana izay manoatra lavitra noho ny sehatra fiarovana seranam-piaramanidina? ||| In a post on her Phoenix blog, as someone with memories of a childhood severely lacking in privacy, poet and United States Naval Academy professor Rui Shen asks: with nearly every minute of our lives now under some form of surveillance, isn't it time for a discussion on privacy intrusion that goes far beyond airport security theater?
Teo ampijerena vaovao aho tamin'io andro io. ||| I was watching the news the other day.
Tatitra iray nandeha tao no nilaza fa any amin'ireo fivarotana lehibe any Amerika dia nametrahana camera video handraketana ny mpanjifa tsirairay avy, ny anton'io fanarahamaso io, tsy hoe hisamborana ny mpangalatra eny ambony fitoeran'entana, fa ho an'ny fikarohana manodidina ny fitondrantenan'ny mpividy. ||| A report came on which said that in all major shops in America now, video cameras are set up to capture every single customer, the purpose of this surveillance being not to catch shoplifters, but for research into purchasing behavior.
Nanazava ny amin'ireo zavatra hita eo amin'ny fàfana ny mpitantana toeram-pivarotana iray: "Jereo ity mpanjifa ity, mijanona manoloana ity fitoeran'entana ity mandritra ny folo minitra izy, mazava ho azy fa mila fanampiana izy. ||| The manager of one store explained what is seen on screen: "See this customer, he's been standing in front of this rack for ten minutes, clearly he needs some assistance.
Manampy anay handafo bebe kokoa ny camera video. Handefa olona eny aho izao dieny izao." ||| The video camera helps us increase our sales, I'll send someone over now".
Nanontany ny mpanadihady, "Nefa koa ampiasaina amin-javatra hafa ireny video ireny, sa tsy izany?" ||| The reporter asked, "but these video cameras do also serve other purposes, right"?
Nihomehy ilay mpitantana: "Ny amin'izany, mbola resaka hafa indray" ||| The manager laughed: "Well, that's another question".
Nanaraka ilay vaovao ny resadresaka nifanaovan'olona vitsivitsy. ||| Following the news was a debate between a few people.
Na iray aza tamin'izy ireo tsy nisy nankasitraka ny fisian'ny camera video eny rehetra eny, ary efa an-taonany maro no nahatsapany toy izany; kanefa dia mitohy mitombo hatrany ny isan'ny camera video, raha tokony hoe hihena. ||| None of them liked that video cameras are so pervasive, and have felt this way for many years; yet the number of video cameras continues to grow, instead of going down.
Tsy manana fiainana manokana intsony isika; rehefa isika ilay manao firaisana ao an-trano iny, mbola afaka mahita antsika ireo zanabolana any an-habakabaka any. ||| We have no privacy; when we make love at home, space satellites can see us.
Tsy misy hafa amin'ny fony andro faran'ny Kaominisma hoe tsy mahazo manao firaisana ara-nofo ao an-tranonao ianao rehefa mbola tsy manambady vita mariazy, na hoe tsy afaka hiteny manohitra ny Antoko ao an-trano satria manan-tsofina ny rindrina ary mety hisy olona hitoroka antsika any amin'ny komity ifotony eo amin'ny fokontany noho isika nanao firaisana ara-nofo nefa tsy nahazo alalana na noho isika manohitra ny revolisiona. ||| It's like the past days of Communism when we couldn't have sex in our homes if we weren't married, nor could we be anti-Party at home, because the walls had ears and someone would report us to the local neighborhood association committee for having sex without a license or for being counterrevolutionaries.
Miainga amin'ny Huang Shuai ka hatramin'ny fotoan'andron'ny fitorotorohana tsy amin'antony tamin'ny taona 1970, dia ny karazana fanarahamaso faobe ankehitriny, izay tokony hampiahiahy antsika amin'izao fotoana. ||| From Huang Shuai to a climate of exposure in the 1970s, and the kind of exposure we should actually be worried about today:
Tsy misy antony tokony hitorohana na iza na iza intsony amin'izao fotoanan'ny fanarahamaso tsy ankiato izao. ||| There isn't much need to expose anyone in this age of nonstop surveillance.
Miaraka amin'ireo maso mangatsiakany, mibanjina antsika tsy mitsahatra ireo camera video, izay rehetra fihetsika ataontsika. ||| With their cold eyes, cameras stare constantly at us, watching our every move.
Baikoan'ireo teknolojia vaovao, miditra amina vanim-potoana iray izay mampiboridana amin'ny fotoana rehetra isika. ||| Guided by new technologies, we are entering a new era in which every moment is laid bare.
Tsy noho ny tahotra avy amin'ireny fotoana lehibe ireny, fa na dia amin'ity anio ity aza dia tsy sahy mandeha ao amin'ny Facebook aho ary tsy mihevitra mihitsy ny hanao izany. ||| Out of fear of these great times, even to this day I don't dare go on Facebook and have no plans to do so.
Vao avy namaky mihitsy aho izao mikasika ny fomba fivarotan'ny Facebook ny tahiriny amin'ireo orinasa vaventy mpanao dokambarotra, na tsy manana zava-miafina eo amin'ny fiainako aza aho, tsy laniko ny hoe ny mombamomba ahy no vidiana na amidy. ||| Having just read an article on how Facebook sells its data to advertising companies, while I have no secrets in my life, I do nonetheless feel uneasy about having information about me being bought and sold.
Io no antony tsy mba ametrahako fanamarihana ao amin'ny Sina na Sohu, tsy mba ananako ireny fitorahana bilaogy kiritika ireny sy tsy dia itsidihako tranonkala maro loatra. ||| It's for this reason that I don't leave comments on Sina or Sohu, why I don't keep a microblog, and why I don't visit many websites.
Raha ny marina, fantatro fa ny fanaovako izany dia familiako ny tenako tsy hijery ny zava-misy, satria efa mameno tanàna ny camera video. ||| In fact, I know that in doing so I'm in a way deceiving myself, because video cameras are already so ubiquitous.
Tsy ela akory izay ny fampahalalam-baovao Amerikana no niresaka momba ny fiarovana ny seranam-piaramanidina. ||| American media have recently been discussing issues of airport security.
Maro ny olona no tsy miombon-kevitra amin'ireo fepetra fiarovana ny seranam-piaramanidina izay mampiseho ny toe-batan'ny olona, izay raisin'izy ireo ho toy ny fitsikilovana tanteraka ny maha-izy azy manokana. ||| Some people disagree with airport security measures that display people's bodies, feeling those to be an invasion of their privacy.
Rehefa nijery ilay resadresaka tamin'ny vaovao, dia manontany tena aho hoe: olona tsy milamina ve sa mitapy ireny olona ireny? Raha afaka miditra amin'ny aterineto avy any an-tranonao ianao, na raha efa nividy zavatra tamin'ny alalan'ny tranonkala, dia efa niparitaka sahady izay ny mombamomba anao rehetra. ||| Watching the debate on the news, though, I wonder: are these people confused or just stupid?

Misaotra ireo mpitolona, handray an-tanana ny herisetra mianjady amin'ny vehivavy teratany nandritra ny 36 taona ny fitsarana iraisam-pirenena manaraka akaiky ny famonoana olona miseho tao Goatemalà, niharan'izany herisetra izany izy ireo satria vehivavy ary satria koa vazimba teratany. ||| Thanks to activists the international courts following the genocide proceedings against Guatemala will be taking into account the violence indigenous women faced for more than 36 years where they were victims because they were women and because they were indigenous.
Horonantsary fanadihadiana sy lahatsary marobe misy fijoroana vavolombelona no mitantara ny zava-niainany mampalahelo, tantara milaza ny fanavakavaham-bolokoditra iaretan'ireo niharam-boina ao amin'ny fiarahamonina misy azy sy ny tahotry ny fanafihana, ka maro ireo tsy sahy niloa-bava nandritra ny taom-polo. ||| A documentary and several video testimonials tell their harrowing stories, stories that due to the discrimination the victims faced in their communities and the fear of retribution many kept silent for decades.

Nilaza izy fa efa nialana ny sazy famonoana ho faty sy ny fanagadrana fianakaviana tsy mampilaza amin'ny manam-pahefana ny fisian'ny fiarahan'ny lahy sy ny lahy na vavy sy ny vavy. ||| He claims to have dropped the death penalty and jailing of family members who fail to report homosexuals to the authorities.

Brezila: Ho esorina ny Fokonolona Quilombo ao Bahia ||| Brazil: Quilombo Community in Bahia About to Be Evicted
Iray amin'ny fokonolona taranak'andevo ela indrindra ao Brezila ny Quilombo Rio dos Macacos, ahitana fianakaviana manodidina ny 50, izay nomena andro tsy maintsy ialana: 4 Marsa 2012. ||| One of the oldest slave descendent communities in Brazil, Quilombo Rio dos Macacos, where around 50 families live, has a date for eviction: March 4, 2012.
Ny fitakiana ny tany dia avy amin'ny tafika an-dranomasina breziliana, izay mikasa hanitatra toerana ho an'ny manamboninahitra ao aminy ao amin'io zara-tany io, izay anelanelan'i Salvador sy Simões Filho, fanjakan'i Bahia... ||| The claim for the land comes from the Navy of Brazil, that intends to broaden a condo for its officers in that territory, in the border area between Salvador and Simões Filho, state of Bahia...
Taranaka Afrikana, izay nangalarina tany amin'ny tany niaviany nandritra ny fanjanahantany mba atao andevo any Brezila, dia izao andalam-pahaverezan'ny tranony indray ankehitriny ny Quilombolas, na dia eo aza ny zony amin'ny tany voasoratra ao amin'ny Lalampanorenana. ||| Descendants of original peoples from Africa who, during colonialism, were taken from their land to become slaves in Brazil, the Quilombolas now see themselves under threat of losing their homes again, despite their right to the land they inhabit enshrined in the constitution.
Ity fanadihadiana fohy dia ahitana ny toe-draharaha atrehin'ny Quilombolas: matahotra ny handao ny tranony, tsy afa-mivezivezy malalaka ary manahy ny amin'ny ainy, ny fianakaviany ary ny tranony. ||| This short documentary shows the situation the Quilombolas are facing: afraid to leave their houses, unable to move freely and fearing for their well-being, their families and their homes.

Brezila: Rafi-Panarenana misy lesoka any Amerika ||| Brazil: The Deficient Prison Systems of the Americas
Ny zava-nitranga tany amin'ny fonja maro tany Amerika Latina niteraka fahafatesana voafonja an-jatony no nahatonga ny olona hijery ny fiaimpiainana sy ny fahamaroan'ny olona be loatra hita any amin'ny tobim-panarenana maro, ka ieritreretana raha voina efa andrasana hitranga izy ireny. ||| Recent events in Latin American prisons that cost the life of hundreds of inmates have people looking into the living situation and overcrowding faced in many penitentiary centers, and analyzing if they are tragedies waiting to happen.
Tokony mba ho voaantoka ny fepetra kely indrindra, izay mety tsy hitranga any akory indraindray, azon'ireny olona tsy hahazo mivezivezy ireny ho sazin'ny heloka nataony, araka izay asehon'ny fampafantarana ny fiainana any am-ponja breziliana, ary manolotra ihany koa ny vahaolana vitsivitsy azo ampiharina rehefa miatrika toe-javatra manahirana. ||| People who are being deprived of their liberty as punishment for their crimes should be guaranteed minimum living conditions, and sometimes these aren't met, as shown in the documentary of life in Brazilian prisons, which also provides possible solutions for this difficult situation.
Manandratra ny resadresaka amin'ny Amerikana ny mpitoraka bilaogy Jordaniana ||| Jordanian Bloggers Promote Dialogue With U.S.
Manohy mandinika ny "Ground Zero Mosque" sy ny loza nitranga mikasika ny fandoroana ny korany tany Etazonia ny mpitoraka bilaogy jordaniana amin'ny alalan'ny fangatahana resadresaka amin'ny Etazonia. ||| Jordanian bloggers continued to contemplate the "Ground Zero Mosque" and Quran burning incidents in the United States by calling for greater dialogue with the US.

Nanoratra toy izao i Natasha: ||| Natasha wrote:
Indrisy anefa, tsy tantara izany ho an'ny haino aman-jerin'i Etazonia. ||| Sadly, for the US media this was a non-story.
Iza no hiraharaha izay firenena kely sy milamina sahala amin'i Jordania? ||| Who cared about a small, stable country like Jordan?
Iza no hiraharaha izay tanora Silamo sarotiny manome voninkazo nefa ny hafa manao hetsika mahery setra? ||| Who cared about a handful of young Muslims delivering flowers when there were others demonstrating violently?

Indrisy, ny herisetra no nosafidian'ny haino aman-jerin'ny Etazonia. ||| Sadly, the US media chose violence.
Iza moa no afaka hifaninana amin'ny fahafatesana sy ny rà? ||| Who can compete with death and blood?

Raha adika tsotsotra dia hoe, tsy azony an-tsaina mihitsy ny hoe ahoana no mahatonga ny olona iray mino an'Andriamanitra ho ao amin'ny antenimieran-doholona...Raha ny hevitry ny laika, tsy mety sady ho siantifika no hino an'Andriamanitra ianao. ||| In another word, he can't imagine that someone who believes in God could be in the senate...According to seculars you can't be a scientist and believe in God.
Hoy i Ali mamarana hoe ny fomba tsara indrindra hiverenena dia tsy amin'ny alalan'ny haino aman-jery Amerikana, fa amin'ny alalan'ny hetsika maro miaraka amin'ny mponina Amerikana mba hanazavana amin'izy ireo ny tena fomba fihevitry ny Silamo sy ny fihetsika ataon'ny ankamaroan'ny Silamo. ||| Ali concludes that the best way forward is not through U.S. media, but through direct interaction with U.S. citizens to explain to them the rationality of Islam and the moderation of most Muslims.
Niditra ho ao anatin'ny vondrona Facebook antsoina hoe Feon'ny Arabo miteny amin'ny fon'ny Amerikana (Arab Voices Speak to American Hearts) izy. ||| He joined a group on Facebook called Arab Voices Speak to American Hearts.
Amin'ny alalan'ity vondrona ity no nanazavany ny fomba fijeriny mikasika ny Silamo sy i Jordania tamin'ny Amerikana tsirairay izay liana mafy mihitsy amin'izay ho valiny. ||| Through this group, he has explained his viewpoint on Islam and Jordan to American individuals who are curious for answers.
Ho an' i Ali, ny tanjona amin'ity fanazarana ity dia tsy ny hanome safidy ho an'ny sarin'ny haino aman-jery Amerikana. ||| For Ali, the purpose of this exercise is not to provide an alternative to U.S. media depictions.
Eo andanin'izany, fomba iray hanoherana avy hatrany ny sary ratsin'ny Arabo sy ny Silamo izy ity. ||| Instead, it is a way to directly oppose negative images of Arabs and Muslims.
Raha toa koa ianao ka mba mihevitra ny hanova an'izao tontolo izao.Ireto misy fomba tena mety izay azo anaovana an'izany. ||| If you ever thought of changing the world. Well here is a very reasonable way to do so.
Ny ataonao fotsiny dia miresaka amina Amerikana iray ary amin'ny fombanao, dia manodina ny sainy amin'ny zavatra lazain'ny vaovao ary avy eo dia resy lahatra ianao fa mba efa toe-tsaina iray aloha izay no voaovanao farafahakeliny ary hahazo hery ianao mba hanova ny sain'ny hafa, dia toy izany hatrany. ||| All you gotta do is talk with a American and in your way turn his/her thoughts away from what the media are telling them and then you will be convinced that at least you changed one mind and you'll be more encouraged to change another and another.
Iran: Nifarana tany amonja ny diam-panoherana nataona mpitondra fivavahana ||| Iran: Cleric's Protest Walk Ends in Jail
Mpitondra fivavahana Iraniana antsoina hoe Ali Reza Jahanshahi no nosamborina tapabolana lasa izay, rehefa nanomboka ny diam-panoherana 960 kilometatra (590 maily) avy any an-tanna atsimon'i Iran Sirjan ho any Teheran. ||| An Iranian cleric named Ali Reza Jahanshahi was arrested about two weeks ago, shortly after beginning a 960 kilometer (590 miles) protest walk from the southern Iranian city, Sirjan to Tehran.
Notoherin'ilay mpitondra fivavahana manko ny kolikolim-pakana tany tao Sirjan ary nitarainany ny fitondrana mahefa ho tsy miraika loatra amin'ity raharaha ity. ||| The cleric was protesting corrupt land appropriation in Sirjan, and complained the government was not doing enough to stop it.
Nosamborina i Jahnashahi raha vao nahavita 30 kilometatra akaikin'ny tanànan'i Abadeh. ||| Jahnashahi was arrested after walking about 30 kilometers near the city Abadeh.
Maro tamin'ny mpamaham-bolongana mpitahiry ny fahazarana Iraniana sy mpanohana ny repobilika Isilamika no nanambara ny fanohanany ity diam-panoherana ity, ary niantso ny mpitondra mahefa hamotsotra azy. ||| Several conservative Iranian and pro-Islamic Republic bloggers have declared their support for his protest, and have called on authorities to release him.
Maro tamin'ireo mpianatra Isilamika sy mpitondra fivavahana tokoa no nanao fihetsiketsehana ho fanafahana azy. ||| Many other Islamic students and clerics have also demonstrated for his freedom.
Maro tamin'ireo mpikambana sy mpamaham-bolongana ireo no mpikambana ao amin'ny Fikambanan'ny Mpianatra Mitady ny Rariny, vondrona Isilamika sy mpitandro ny fahazarana izay mitsikera ny mpitondra Iraniana ho tsy mihetsika loatra hiady amin'ny kolikoly. ||| Many of these bloggers and students are members of the Association of Justice Seekers' Students, a conservative and Islamist group that has criticized the Iranian authorities for their lack of action against corruption.
Namoaka ny sarin'ilay mpitondra fivavahana maromaro ny mpamaham-bolongana Mostazafin (midika hoe 'voateritery' amin'ny teny Perisiana), izay nanaraka akaiky ny vaovao momba ity fanoheran'i Jahnashahi ity, ary nolazainy fa gazetin'ny mpianatra miisa 18 no namoaka fanambarana hanohanana ny diam-panoherana revolisionera ataony. ||| Blogger Mostazafin (means 'oppressed' in Persian), who has followed the news of Jahnashahi protest closely, has published several photos of the cleric, and says that 18 university student magazines published a declaration to defend his revolutionary protest walk.
Naka ny sombin'ny filazana nataony izy: ||| He quotes from the declaration:
« Vavolombelon'ny fakan'ny Kapitalista sy manampahefana amin'ny tsy rariny sy tsy ara-dalana ny ankamaroan'ny tanin'ny vahoaka Iraniana izahay eto Sirjan... (Tena) olona mandika ny lalànana'ny Repobilika Silamo sy ny Isilamo ireo » ||| "In Sirjan we witnessed how power circles and capitalists illegally took control of many properties that belong to the Iranian people... People who acted against Islamic Republic law and Islam".
Hoy ny filazan'i Mostazifin momba ny hetsiky Jahnashahi: ||| Mostazifin says of Jahnashahi's campaign:
« Efa roa taona izay izy no nanaitra ny mpitondra Iraniana amin'ny haben'ny kolikoly ifanakalozana saingy tsy noraharahiana... Inona moa no mitranga raha singa hita manerana an'Iran manontolo hay izao any Sirjan izao?» ||| "For two years he tried to attract the Iranian authorities' attention to enormous financial corruption, but nobody paid any attention... What happened in Sirjan is just an example of what is going on across Iran".
Markazinews moa nanoratra fa mpitandro ny filaminana miisa 6 no nisambotra an'i Jahanshahi nanery azy hiditra anaty fiara raha mbola tao amin'ny Môsikea izy. ||| Markazinews writes that six security agents arrested Jahanshahi while he was in a mosque and forced him into a car.
Araka ny tatitra dia nosamborina izy satria mandika ny fitsipika mifehy ny mpitondra fivavahana. ||| Reportedly, he was arrested because his actions are against the statute of clerics.
Markazinews ny sombim-panambaran'ny Mpianatra mitady ny Rariny, mampahatsiahy ny tenin'ny Ayatollah Khomeini, mpitarika ny Repobilika isilamikan'i Iran teo aloha, fa tsy mahazo manadino ny mahantra sy ny vahoaka tsy mikiraro ny mpitondra fivavahana... Nohazavazavain'izy ireo fa tsy ho andeferany ny kitoatoa ataon'ny mpitondra fanjakana, ary hotontosainy ny adidy revolisionera ataony. ||| Markazinews has quoted from a statement of the Justice Seekers' Students, that recalls that the late Ayatollah Khomeini, the former Leader of Islamic Republic of Iran, said clerics should not forget the poor and barefooted people... The statement says they will not tolerate the authorities' shortcomings, and will strive to accomplish their revolutionary duties.
Bignaehstiz indray namoaka badge (mari-pamantarana) hanohanany ilay mpitondra fivavahana ary mivaky toy izao "Ho fanoherana ny kolikoly ao Sirjan, dia miaraka amin'i Jahanshahi izahay." ||| Bignaehstiz has published a badge to support the cleric that reads, "In the fight against the corrupt of Sirjan, we are with Jahanshahi".
Nampian'ny mpamaham-bolongana moa fa misy mpianatra sy mpitondra fivavahana manohana azy ka hiara-dalana aminy eny atsefatsefan-dalana eny hanoherana ny kolikoly. ||| The blogger adds that some students and clerics supported his action and walked with him part of the way to protest against corruption.
Kashmar injao mitsikera ny Fitsarana Manokan'ny Mpitondra Fivavahana izay namoaka ny didim-pitsarana hisamborana sy hamonjana an'i Jahanshahi, ka manontany hoe nahoana moa tsy ny mpitondra fivavahana manao kolikoly no enjehiny. ||| Kashmar criticized the Special Cleric Court that ordered the arrest and detention of Jahanshahi, and asks why they do not act against the corrupt clerics instead.
Namoaka mari-pamantarana moa ny Muslim Bloggers Association (fikambanan'ny mpamaham-bolongana Silamo) izay milaza fa ny mpitondra fivavahana mpanao tsolotra no tokony samborina fa tsy ny mpitondra fivavahana avy any Sirjani. ||| The Muslim Bloggers Association also published a badge that says corrupt clerics should be arrested instead of the protesting cleric from Sirjani.
Global Voices Podcast 4: Misandratra Isika Miaraka ||| Global Voices Podcast 4: Together We Rise
Miarahaba an'izao tontolo izao! ||| Hello world!
Amin'ity andiany ity dia handre ireo mpamaham-bolongana Grika avy ao amin'ny fikambanana Rising Voices ianareo, ny fomba fanatsaran'ny olotsotra tia mampita vaovao Goatemalteka ny talentany hiatrehana ny fifidianana ary izay kasaina hotontosaina mandritra ny Vovonan'ny Mpamaham-Bolongana Arabo hotontosaina ny 3-6 oktobra 2011 any Tonizia ary anisan'ny mpikarakara ny Global Voices. ||| In this edition you'll hear from blind Greek bloggers of our Rising Voices community, how Guatemalan citizen journalists are honing their skills for elections, and a preview of what's planned for the Arab Bloggers Summit co-hosted by Global Voices on October 3-6, 2011 in Tunisia.

Kara Andrade avy ao amin'ny Vozz no nitafatafa tamin'ny Tonianay ao amin'ny faritra Amerika Latina Silvia Viñas ny momba ny fanangonam-baovao mandritra ny fifidianana Goatemalteka sy ny fampitetezana fandaharam-panofanana mba hampivelarana ny tambajotran'ny olotsotra mirotsaka an-tsehatra. ||| Kara Andrade of Vozz spoke to our Latin America regional editor Silvia Viñas about covering the Guatemalan elections and turning a training scheme into a wider network for citizen engagement.

Rosia: Mampifandray Mpiray Tanàna, Mamonjy Aina ||| Russia: Connecting Neighbors, Saving Lives
Tamin'ny lohataonan'ny taona 2010, rehefa nanenika an'i Rosia ny doro tanety, ka nanakenda sy nanempotra tanàna, dia nifandamina tao amin'ny aterineto ireo mafàna fo. ||| In the summer of 2010, when peat fires spread across Russia, choking and suffocating villages, Internet activists got organized.
Rehefa hita fa ela sy nitsitaitaika ny valintenin'ny governemanta Rosiana, dia nihetsika avy hatrany ireo bilaogera tamin'ny famoahana nyt tranonkala Russian-Fires, izay nanome fahafahana, indrindra ireo mpampiasa aterineto any amin'ireo tanàna kely, mba hampita ny vaovao any amin'izay toerana mbola mirehitra ary hampahafantatra hoe inona avy ireo fitaovana tokony ho ilaina. ||| While the Russian government response was slow and piecemeal, bloggers responded by quickly launching the site Russian-Fires, which allowed Internet users in small towns to relay information about where fires were still burning and what supplies were needed.
Lasa be mpitsidika be ilay tranokala, ary efa nisy fotoana aza nahatratra 10,000 ny mpitsidika tao anatin'ny andro iray. ||| The site was immensely popular, at one point experiencing upto 17,000 unique visitors a day.
Ka rehefa nifarana ny krizy, ireo bilaogera tao ambadik'ilay tetikasa - Anastasia Severina, Alexey Sidorenko, Lev Zvyagintsev, Valery Ilyichev, ary Gregory Aslomov - dia nanamarika fa mbola naresaka be tao amin'ilay tranonkala. ||| When the crisis was over, the bloggers behind the project - Anastasia Severina, Alexey Sidorenko, Lev Zvyagintsev, Valery Ilyichev, and Gregory Asmolov - noticed that the website was still buzzing with activity.
Mbola mitohy mandefa hafatra momba raharaha sy filàna hafa ao an-tanànan-dry zareo ireo mpampiasa aterineto. ||| Users continued to send messages about other problems and needs in their towns.
"Hitan'ny olona fa fomba iray tena nahomby tokoa io mba handefasana fanampiana amin'ny toerana sy fotoana rehetra ilàna azy," hoy i Severina. ||| "People saw that it was an effective platform for sending help when and where it was needed," says Severina.
Tranonkala "Virtual Alarm" misy ny sari-tany fanairana momban'ireo fanampiana sy ny filàna, ary fanentana ireo mponina mba hihetsika. ||| Website "Virtual Alarm" maps alerts for help and need, and then coordinates locals to respond.
Fampifandraisana ny olona amin'ny fomba vaovao ||| Connecting people in new ways
Voasinton'ny fahombiazan'ilay tranonkala Russian-Fires, namorona tranonkala iray ireo bilaogera izay nomeny anarana hoe Rynda.org (Virtual Alarm) – ary ankehitriny dia ahitàna sarintany telo ao anatiny: ny "General Map" na ny "Sarintany amin'ny ankapobeny", ny "Fire Map" na ny "Sarintany misy Afo", ary ny "Blood Donation" na ny "Toerana Fanomezan-drà". ||| Inspired by the success of Russian-Fires, the bloggers developed a new site - Rynda.org (Virtual Alarm) – which currently consists of three maps: a "General Map", a "Fire Map", and a "Blood Donation" map.
Ny toerana misy ireo mponina nandefa fangatahana dia miloko mena, raha miloko maitso kosa ny an'ireo manome fanampiana. ||| The locations of people who have sent requests are indicated in red, while offers to help are in green.
Nilaza i Severina fa niezaka izy ireo nanao ilay tranonkala ho faran'izay tsotra indrindra, mba hahazoan'ireo olona, "tsy mahay mampiasa solosaina miditra ao amin'ilay pejy ka hahita bokotra kely anankiroa manao hoe: 'I need help' (Mila fanampiana aho) na 'I want to help' (Te hanolotra fanampiana aho). ||| Severina says they have tried to make the site as simple as possible, so that people, "who have no idea how to operate a computer can go to the page and see two buttons: 'I need help' or 'I want to help.'"
Ny ekipan'ilay tranonkala ao Moscow dia tsy tena mitatitra na mandray mivantana ireo entana. ||| The site team in Moscow does not physically transport or receive goods.
Fa kosa mba ho solon'izany dia mampifandray ireo mponina izay samy mipetraka aminà tanàna iray ny Virtual Alarm, miaraka amin'ireo manana nt tadiavin-dry zareo. ||| Instead, Virtual Alarm connects people who live in the same city, with those who have what they need.
"Andeha atao hoe mila fitaovana ny renim-pianakaviana iray, toy ny akanjo ho an'ireo zanany. ||| "Let's say a mother needs supplies, like clothing for her children.
Tsy misy dikany izany raha avy any amin'ny ONG ao Moscow no alefa mankany Vladivostok," hoy ihany ny fanazavan'i Severina. ||| It makes no sense to send clothes from an NGO in Moscow to Vladivostok," Severina explains.
Mba tsy hanaovana izany, dia efa voamarika ao amin'ny sarintany ny fanairana ho an'ny fanampiana na filàna vonjy, ary amin'ny alalan'ny mailaka no handefasana ireo fangatahana vaovao any amin'ny olona izay nanolo-tena fa vonona ny hanampy. ||| Instead, alerts for help or need are marked on a map, and people registered as willing to help are notified of new requests via email.
Rehefa afaka roa herinandro teo ho eo, dia narahan'izy ireo maso akaiky ny fizotran'ireo fanairana tena miavaka mba hahazoana antoka fa misy olona mamaly tokoa ny antso filàna vonjy. ||| After about two weeks, they follow up on any outstanding alerts to make sure someone has responded to the call for help.
Sarintanin'ny mpanome rà ||| Mapping blood donors
Ny sarintany vaovao ao amin'ny Virtual Alarm dia misy sary ho an'ny fanomezan-drà sy ny toerana fitahirizana rà manerana an'i Rosia. ||| The newest map on Virtual Alarm charts blood donation and blood banks throughout Russia.
Manoro ny misy ireo foibe fanomezan-drà ilay sarintany, ary mampifandray ireo izay mila fanomezan-drà sy ireo mpanome rà mitovy sokajy any amin'ny manodidina azy ihany koa. ||| The map marks donation centers, and also connects those who need blood donations with donors of the same blood type nearby.
Afaka maneho hevitra momba izay traikefa hitany tamin'ny nanomezany rà ireo mpampiasa ilay tranonkala ka nisoratra anarana ara-dalàna, izay antenain'i Severina fa hanampy amin'ny fanehoana amin'ny olona ny mahamora sy maha-zavatra ilaina ny fanomezan-drà na dia indray mandeha monja isan-taona aza. ||| Registered users can also leave comments about their experience donating blood, which Severina hopes will help show people how easy and necessary it is to donate blood at least once a year.
Sary iray avy amin'ny tranonkalan'ny Minisiteran'ny fahasalamana Rosiana izay mamporisika ireo olom-pirenena hanome rà. ||| An image from Russian ministry of health site encouraging citizens to donate blood.
Raha ny salan'isa tamin'ny taona 2010 no asian-teny, dia hita fa olona 13 amin'ny 1000 fotsiny no manome rà ao Rosia isan-taona, raha oharina amin'ny any Eoropa sy Etazonia izay manana taham-pahavitrihana avo telo sy avo efatra eny. ||| According to 2010 statistics, only 13 out of every 1,000 people in Russia donate blood every year, in comparison with rates 3-4 times as high in Europe and the United States.
Nilaza ny Ministry ny Fahasalamana sy ny Fiahiana ara-tsosialy fa tokony hahatratra farafahakeliny 25 amin'ny olona 1000 ny taha mba hahafahan'ireo hopitaly sy klinika mihodina araka ny tokony ho izy. ||| The Russian Ministry of Health and Social Development say they need to reach a rate of at least 25 out of 1,000 people in order for hospitals and clinics to function adequately.
Nandefa laharana antso an-tarobia ary tranonkala antsoina hoe "I'm a donor na Mpanome aho" (Yadonor.ru) ny Ministera ho fampahafantarana ny vahoaka ary mba hanamoràna ny fanomezan-drà. ||| The ministry has recently launched a hotline number and website called "I'm a donor" (Yadonor.ru) to inform the public and make blood donation easier.
Ato anatin'ny fotoana fohy, dia manantena i Rynda fa hiara-hiombon'antoka aminà orinasa ao an-toerana mba hanolorana fanomezana kely ho an'ireo mpampiasa izay nisoratra anarana ara-dalàna - ohatra hoe fanomezana fihenam-bidy na tapakila hijerena sarimihetsika - Toy ny hoe misaotra anao nanao asa an-tsitrapo. ||| In the near future, Rynda hopes to partner with local businesses in order to offer registered users small rewards – like discounts or movies tickets – as a thank you for volunteering.
Raha ny amin'izay hampiasàna ny sarintany amin'ny ho avy, dia hoy i Severina hoe," raha toa ka, Andriamanitra anie hiaro, ka mety hisy zavatra hitranga, ary hisy krizy vaovao indray, dia hanangana sarintany iray vaovao indray isika ka hampifandray indray ny vahoaka. ||| As far as the future uses of the map, Severina says, "If, God forbid, something should happen, and some new crisis should arise, we would make a new map and connect people".
Jordania: Fifandonana nanaraka ny fifidianana tao amin'ny Anjerimanontolo ||| Jordan: Clashes Follow University Elections
Ny 21 Desambra 2010 teo dia nampanao fifidianana ny ho governemantan'ny mpianatra ao aminy ny Anjerimanontolon'i Jordania. ||| The University of Jordan held university elections for its student government on Dec 21, 2010.
Noho ny fisian'ny tatitra momba ny herisetra sy tsy fetezan-javatra nandritra ny fifidianana, namoaka fanambaràna haingana ny Anjerimanontolo manohitra ny filazana fa hoe nisy korontana. ||| Following reports of violence and election irregularities, the University promptly issued statements denying the clashes.
Herinandro roa latsaka taty aoriana, mbola nisy korontana hafa indray nitranga. ||| Less than two weeks later, further clashes broke out.
Hoy i Hamzeh Lattouf nandefa tweet: ||| Hamzeh Lattouf tweeted:
Nezahan'ireo mpiambina ny Anjerimanontolo nofehezina tamin'ny alalan'ny fantson-drano ihany ny korontana tao amin'ny Anjerimanontolon'i Jordania. ||| University guards tried to contain the clashes at the University of Jordan with water hoses.
Avy eo i Lattouf nandefa andiana tweets mangataka an'i Walid Maani, Minisitry ny Fampianarana Ambony, mba hitondra fanavaozana hisorohana ny herisetra: ||| Lattouf then launched a series of tweets asking Walid Maani, the Minister of Higher Education, to launch reforms to curb violence:
YE mba diniho. ||| YE make a study.
karazan'olona toy inona moa no manao korontana toy izao, ireo tsy dia manam-bintana loatra ve sa ny hafa, atombohy amin'ny fanekena azy ireo any amin'ny Anjerimanontolo samihafa any ||| what type of people r making such troubles, those with less luck or whatever,start accepting them in diff Univ
Avy eo i Lattouf dia nandefa video tamin'ny alalan'ny twitter manasongadina ny fifampitoraham-bato ifanaovan'ny mpianatra, ary olona iray nentina tamin'ny filanjana marary: ||| Lattouf then tweeted videos featuring students pelting rocks at each other, and of a person being removed on a stretcher:
dikasarin'ny fàfana avy amin'ny video tao amin'ny YouTube nampakarin'i Farislord ||| Screenshot from YouTube video posted by Farislord
Fifandonana teo amin'ny al-Saltiya sy al-Hamayda tao amin'ny Anjerimanontolon'i Jordania. ||| Clashes between al-Saltiya and al-Hamayda at the University of Jordan
Koa satria nisy nanely tamin'ny tweet ilay video, ireo Jordaniana tahaka an-dry Nada Abandah dia nanampy ny fahaketrahan-dry zareo: ||| As the videos were retweeted, Jordanians such as Nada Abandah added their dismay:
Mpianatry ny Anjerimanontolo ve sa karazan'andian-jiolahy ||| University students or some sort of a gang
Mohammed Yousef nanampy ny fanamelohany, sady nanao ho teny fototra ny Maani: ||| Mohammed Yousef added his condemnation, also tagging Maani:
izao no fitotongan'ireo anjerimanontolo ao Jordan ||| this is what Jordan universities stepped down to
Mba afaka miteny zavatra iray monja ve aho alohan'ny hidirantsika amin'ny taona 2011? ||| Can i just say one thing before we enter 2011?
MISAOTRA AN'ANDRIAMANITRA FA TSY NIANATRA TAMINA ANJERIMANONTOLO TAO JORDANIA AHO NA IRAY AZA! ||| THANK GOD I DIDN'T STUDY IN ANY JORDAN UNIVERSITY!
Ao amina firenena iray mirehareha amin'ny fahalavorarian'ny fampianarany, mety ho ilaina mihitsy ny fandraisan'andraikitra avy amin'ny governemanta mba hisorohana ny fifandonana hafa indray. ||| In a country proud of its educational achievements, a governmental response to prevent further clashes seems likely.
Masoarabo: Henakisoa Halal ||| Arabeyes: Halal Pork?
Ny tena dikan'ny teny hoe masoarabo eto moa dia hoe "fomba fijery arabo". Ny Silamo, tahaka ny Jodaisma dia mandrara ny mpikambana ao aminy tsy hihinana henakisoa. ||| Islam, like Judaism, bans its adherents from consuming pork.
Saingy inona moa no hitranga raha misy tsahotsaho fa misy fanomezandalana ara-pivavahana na 'Halal' hita eny an-tsena? ||| But what happens when rumours about 'Halal' or religiously sanctioned pork appear in the market?
Ity misy adihevitra nataona mpamaham-bolongana sy mpandray anjara hafa avy any Bahrain hijerentsika azy. ||| Here's what some bloggers and participants in an online forum from Bahrain have to say.
Sary avy amin'i SubZero Blu e Naneho ny heviny momba io entana amidy io tamina mpamaky iray i Mark, izay mpamaham-bolongana Libaney mipetraka any Kuwait: ato. ||| Lebanese blogger Mark, who lives in Kuwait, comments on the product with a one-liner: Yeah, I don't think so.
Hoy ny mpamaky iray: Bahrain Online, fanaovana karajia amin'ny teny arabo avy any Bahrain ny resaka. ||| The issue was also brought up on Bahrain Online, an Arabic-language forum, from Bahrain.
"Hitanao eny an-tsena. ||| "Available in the markets.
Henakisoa Halal novonoina araka ny fomba (lalàna) Silamo (Shariah)," hoy ny filazana izay mipetaka eo amin'ny sary eo ambony. ||| Halal pork and slaughtered according to Islamic Shariah (law)," said the announcement which tagged the picture above.
Nisarakevitra teo anelanelan'ireo nino fa tena nisy tokoa ilay karazan'entana amidy sy ireo nihazakazaka nanazava ny antony ny mpamaky. ||| Readers were torn between those who believed the product was really available in the local markets and those who quickly came up with a 'logical' explanation.
Mivandravandra be fa misy soratra Halal ny famantarana. ||| It is obvious that the word Halal is on a sticker.
Midika izany fa mety naka iny marika iny ilay olona dia nametaka azy teo amin'ny entana ary dia nakany sary na namboarina io. ||| This means that someone may have had this sticker and stuck it on the product and took a picture or it could have been fabricated.
Mazava be satria mamehy izay voasoratra amin'ny teny anglisy ny teny hoe Halal. ||| This is obvious because the word Halal is covering what is written in English.
Na ahoana na ahoana dia tsy nahita zavatra hafa tsaratsara kokoa hapetaka ilay olona nametaka io sary io. ||| Whatever the case, the person who published this picture has nothing better to do.

Ho fampitahana dia mitaraina ny mpamaky iray hafa: ||| In comparison, another reader laments:
Aondrana any amin'ny helodranon'i Arabia ny entana amidy sahala amin'itony, ary tafiditra amin'izany i Bahrain. ||| Such products are exported to some countries in the Arabian Gulf, including Bahrain.
Tsy misy fanavazavana. ||| There is no monitoring.

Egypt: Nosaronan'ny Salafista Ny Sarivongana Zazavavindrano Ao Alexandria ||| Egypt: Salafis Cover Up Alexandria Mermaid Statue
Nosaronan'ny Salafista ny sarivongana zazavavindrano iray tao Alexandria, Ejipta, izay nahatonga tsikera sy filazana fahadalana avy amin'ny mpisera. ||| Salafis have covered up a mermaid statue in Alexandria, Egypt, drawing ridicule and criticism from netizens.
Notaterin'ny mpisiokantsera fa nosaronan'ny Antoko Salafista Al Noor, izay nanao fivoriana teo akaiky teo, ilay sarivongana. ||| Tweeps report that the statue was covered up by the Al Noor Salafi party, which was holding a gathering nearby.

Hivory teo akaikin'ny sarivongan'ny zazavavindrano ny Salafista. Naleo nosaronana ilay zazavavindrano nandritra ny fivoriana ||| Salafis had a meeting close to a mermaid statue in Alexandria.. Ended up covering the poor mermaid during the gathering
