Nepal: Azo tapahina ho mariky ny fanoherana ve ny Aterineto ||| Nepal: Can Internet Be Shut Down To Mark Protest?
Nikorontana ireo mpiserasera nepaley, raha nahita fa nanapaka ny fidirana amin'ny aterineto ny "Fikambanana Nepaley Mpanome Tolotra Aterineto" ny alahady 10 aprily 2011 nanomboka tamin'ny 1 ora hatramin'ny 2 ora atoandro mba ho fanehoana ny tsy fankasitrahany ny fepetra ara-pitsarana noraisin'ny governemanta manoloana ny" fanodinkodinana tsy ara-dalàna ny antso VOIP" (ireo antso an-taroby mampiasa Aterineto). ||| Nepali Internet users were caught in disarray as the Internet Service Provider's Association of Nepal shut down its internet service last Sunday 10 April, 2011 from 1pm to 2pm, as a mark of protest against the government's crackdown on 'illegal VOIP call bypass'.
Tao anatin'ny fanambarana dia niampanga ny Manam-pahefana Nepaley misahana ny Fifandraisan-davitra ny ISPAN noho ny fanajanonany sy ny fanendrikendrehana tsy ara-drariny ireo Mpanome tolotra Aterineto ho nanampy ny mpandraharaha "mpanodinkodina tsy ara-dalàna ny antso an-taroby". ||| In a statement ISPAN condemned the Nepal Telecommunications Authority's act of arresting and making false allegations against the Internet Service Providers of aiding illegal call bypass operators.
Fepetra famaizana ||| Crackdown
Ny volana lasa teo, nandray karazana fepetra ny NTA mba hisorohana ireo raharaha marobe momba ny "fanodikondinana tsy ara-dalàna ny antso" izay mampiasa ny feo amin'ny Aterineto, na VOIP (Voice over Internet Protocol), ary manampy ireo mpampiasa izany mba hialàna amin'ny vidiny lafo mahazatra apetraky ny orinasa fifandraisandavitra manana fahazoan-dalana. Sary noforonin'i Jamarier tao amin'i Flickr (CC BY-SA 2.0). ||| In recent months, the NTA has cracked down on several illegal call bypass rackets, which use VOIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) via Internet, giving users the opportunity to avoid the heavy fees for such calls charged by licensed voice operators.
Nitsikera ny fahatapahan'ny aterineto ny tontolon'ny bilaogy, ary mihevitra fa fanitsahana ny Lalampanorenana vonjimaika izany, izay mifanohitra amin'izao sakana amin'ny fifandraisana izao. ||| The Nepali blogosphere is criticizing the shutting down of Internet and they feel that this is a breach of the Interim Constitution, which is against such obstruction of communication.
Tsy taitra tamin'ny fihetsiketsehan'ireo mpanome tolotra Aterineto i Nepali: ||| Nepali is not impressed with the strike of the ISPs:
Misy antony ara-drariny matoa misy ny fihetsiketseham-panoherana, azoko izany. ||| There are legitimate reasons to protest, I get it.
Fa iza anefa no mety hanao fihetsiketsehana hanohitra izay mety ho lazaina fa zava diso nataon'ny polisy raha toa ka misy iray amin'izy ireo tratra ambodiomby? ||| But who protests against an alleged police wrongdoing when one of your own gets caught commiting a crime?
Ireo mpanome tolotra anay, eny tokoa. ||| Our ISPs, of course.
Mbola ireo mampiasa ny Aterineto, izaho sy ianao hatrany foana anefa no mizaka ny voka-dratsiny. ||| And the people that again bear the brunt are us – you and I.
Nanao fanamarihana ilay bilaogera: ||| The blogger points out:
Zo fototra ho an'ny olom-pirenena nepaley izay voalaza ao amin'ny Lalampanorenana (vonjimaika) ny zo hiditra amin'ny Aterineto. ||| The right to Internet Service is a fundamental (interim) Constitutional right of a Nepali citizen.
Manosihosy ny zo ananako amin'ny fomba tsy azo ekena, nanapa-kevitra hamono ny "routeurs" (fitaovam-pahazoana serasera amin'ny Aterineto) mandritra ny adiny iray amin'izao antoandro izao ao Nepal ireo ireo mpanome tolotra Aterineto, izay tena nanohina ahy mafy dia mafy. ||| Unacceptably violating my rights, the ISPs decided to turn their routers off for an hour this afternoon in Nepal causing me mass anger.
Manontany tena i Pradeep Kumar Singh hoe nankaiza ny etika amin'izao fahatapahan'ny Aterineto izao: ||| Pradeep Kumar Singh asks how ethical is the Internet outage:
Mikasika ny ATERINETO ity, ahoana ny ahazoan'izy ireo zo hanapaka ny fidiran'ny olona amin'io tambazotram-pifandraisana io? ||| This is INTERNET, How come you have right to stop people access to this network?
Afaka mamboraka na mahavita zavatra marobe ny Aterineto. ||| Internet can break or make things.
Heverin'ny ankamaroan'ny Nepaley ho toy ny rendrarendra na fialam-boly ny Aterineto, saingy tsy midika izany fa tsy miraharaha izany izy. ||| Internet may be luxury or even leisure stuff for most of the Nepalis but that doesn't mean that it's not taken seriously anymore.
Minoa ahy, mpiserasera marobe no mihevitra fa filàna fototra amin'izao vanim-potoana ianantsika izao ny Aterineto, ary raha miteny izany aho dia matoky fa "filàna fototra" izay heverina fa toy ny efa ananana izy io. ||| Trust me a lot of users consider this a basic need now and by saying that I mean it, "a basic need" in fact taken for granted.
Na izany na tsy izany, andry iankinan'ny fampahalalam-baovao ny Aterineto. ||| After all, Internet is pivotal and crucial for Information these days.
XNepali mankasitraka ny fitakian'ireo mpanome tolotra aterineto, ary nilaza ny heviny tamintsika: ||| XNepali acknowledges the demand of the ISPs, but opines:
Ny hetahetan'ny ISPAN izay mitaky tontolo azo antoka sy lavitry ny tahotra amin'izay mety hetsika tsy ara-drariny ataon'ny polisy dia heveriko fa mari-pototra kokoa. ||| ISPAN demands of safe environment free from fear of unwarranted police action seems a valid demand.
Fa nahoana ireo mpiserasera tsy manana ahiahy no voasazy amin'ny ataon'ny governemanta? ||| But, why are the unsuspecting customers punished for the government action?
Yam Gurung nitsikera ny lahatsoratra ao amin'ny bilaogy My Sansar (népaley): ||| Yam Gurung comments on a post in blog My Sansar:
Tsy faly aho fa nofaranan'ny CIB (Credit Information Bureau) ny antso izay nolazaina fa "nahodikodina" ary nisambotra ireo mpiasan'ny Mpanome tolotra Aterineto. ||| I am not happy the CIB shutting down so called call bypass and arresting ISP peoples.
Mipetraka ao Hong Kong izahay nandritra ny 15 taona. ||| We live in Hong Kong for 15 years.
Tsy afaka mandefa antso mazava sy mora vidy amin'ny fianakavianay ao Nepal izahay raha tsy averina amin'ny laoniny ny antso izay nolazaina fa nisy nanodikodina tsy ara-dalàna ao Nepal. ||| We can make quality and economy calls to our families in Nepal only when so called illegal call bypass is active in Nepal.
Hatramin'ny nanajanonan'ny CIB ireo mpamatsy aterineto sy ny fikendrena ireo Ivo-toeram-pifandraisana VOIP, dia nanjary lafo vidy ho an'ny olona mpila ravinahitra Nepaley (ireo antso mankany Nepal). ||| Since CIB started arresting ISP and raiding VOIP centres calling Nepal have become tremendously expensive for Nepalese living abroad.
Mangataka an'ny NTA sy ny CIB aho mba handefitra amin'ireo mpandraharaha tsy ara-dalàna amin'ny antso VOIP mba hiasa aloha mandra-pidinan'ny vidin'ny antson'ny Nepal Telecom sy hanatsarany ny tambazotrany mba hampandeha tsara mandrakariva ny fifandrasaina. ||| I request NTA and CIB to let illegal VOIP operate until Nepal Telecom reduce its rates and expand its network capacity so that call gets connected each time.
Iangaviko ianao tompoko, ampio izahay mba ho afaka hifanerasera, na dia eo aza ny halaviran-tany, amin'ireo fianakavianay mipetraka any izay tsy misy fomba ahafahana hifaneraserana mihintsy. ||| Please help us to get connected with our families living in remote places where there is no other communication.
Natsahatry ny ISPAN ny fihetsiketseham-panoherany rehefa nanaiky ny hanadihady ny olana mikasika ny antso VOIP amin'ny Aterineto ny Manampahefana Nepaley misahana ny Fifandraisan-davitra. ||| ISPAN has called off their protest program after the Nepal Telecommunications Authority had committed to investigate about the VOIP issue.
Andro iadiana amin'ny SIDA manerantany: Ireo mitondra ny tsimok'aretina ||| World AIDS Day: Blogging Positively
Ity taona ity no manamarika ny faha-20 taona ny Andro manerantany iadiana amin'ny SIDA izay tanterahina isaky ny voalohany volana Desambra. ||| World AIDS Day, which takes place every year on December 1.
Na dia tsapan'ny olona anarivoarivony amin'ny ankapobeny isan'andro aza ny fiantraikan'ny VIH sy ny SIDA dia ity kosa ny andro manokana hamphafantarana bebe kokoa ny amin'ity aretina ity. ||| Though the impact of HIV and AIDS is felt by millions of people globally every day, this particular day can help bring much-needed attention to the disease.
Ny lohahevitra raisin'ny andro iadiana amin'ny SIDA amin'ity taona ity dia mifantoka amin'ny "Mitarika – Mankahery – Manafaka," izay mampivoitra ny paikam-pahaiza-mitarika ahafahana manohitra ny aretina. ||| The theme for this year's World AIDS Day is "Lead – Empower – Deliver," highlighting the political leadership required to truly combat the disease.
Na dia tsy nihetsika firy intsony aza ny isanjaton'ny olon-dehibe mitondra ny Tsimok'aretina VIH hatramin'ny taona 2000, dia mbola misy hatramin'ny 33 000 000 nomitondra izany amin'izao fotoana izao ary manakaiky ny 7 500 isan'andro no tratrany koa isan'andro. ||| While the global percentage of adults living with HIV has leveled off since 2000, 33 million people are still living with the virus and there are nearly 7,500 new infections each day.
Niakatra tokoa ny tahan'ny fifindran'ny VIH any amin'ny firenena maro tahaka an'i Shina, Indonezia, Kenya, Mozambika, Rosia, ary Vietnam. ||| Rates of new HIV infections are also rising in many countries, such as China, Indonesia, Kenya, Mozambique, Russia, and Vietnam.
Manana ny antontan'isany koa ny SIDA — 2 000 000 ny olona matin'io aretina io tamin'ny herintaona. ||| AIDS is also taking its toll — 2 million people died of the disease last year.
nanehoizany antontan'isa izany ny bolongana manerantany, mizara ny tantaran'ireo mitondra ny VIH/SIDA, sy ny fiantraikan'ny aretina amin'ny fiainany andavanandro, sy ny henatra azo amin'ny fitondrana ny aretina. ||| Blogs from around the world are putting faces to these statistics, sharing stories of caring for those with HIV/AIDS, how the disease impacts people's daily lives, and the stigma that accompanies the disease.
Izany atontan'isa izany dia mampiseho amintsika ny zavatra efa tontosa tamin'ny fiadiana ity aretina ity sy ny habetsaky ny asa mbola miandry. ||| These first-hand accounts show both the progress that has been made in fighting this disease, and how much work still needs to be done.
Ao amin'ny Poz For Life i Russell 20 taona no mamaham-bolongana avy any Aostralia amin'ny fitondrany ny tsimok'aretina VIH mba hampirisihany ny hafa hanao fizahana sao mitondra aretina azo avy amin'ny firaisana ka hanaovana ny firaisana voaaro. ||| In Poz For Life 20-year-old Russell blogs from Australia about being HIV positive in hopes that it will encourage others to get tested for sexually transmitted infections and to play it safe.
Tamin'ny lahatsorany voalohany no nahatsiarovany ny nizahana azy raha mitondra ny VIH izy sy ny fitaintainana tao aminy nandritra ny fiandrasana ny valiny. ||| In his first post he recalls being tested for HIV and the awful waiting period before receiving the results.
izao no nataony rehefa fantany fa nitondra ny tsimok'aretina VIH izy: ||| Here is how he found out he was HIV positive:
Tonga tao amin'ny tobim-pahasalamana aho tokony ho tamin'ny 10:30 maraina teo ho eo ary nivantana avy hatrany, tahaka ny hoe niandry ahy ry zareo vonona handray ny fanahiko ary hanipy azy any amin'ny tantara fahaefatra. ||| "I got there (the doctor's office) around 10:30am and went straight in, it was like they where waiting for me ready to take my soul and toss it out the 4th story.
Niditra tao amin'ny biraony aho ary nipetraka, reko avy eo ny hoe" Russell malahelo aho milaza aminao fa miabo ny valin'ny fitsapana ny fisian'ny VIH". ||| I went into his office and I sat down, then I hear 'Russell am sorry to say but the test for HIV is positive.
Tsy nahahetsika nandritra ny segondra vitsivitsy aho ary naneho fahagagana. ||| ' I froze for a few seconds and just looked amazed.
Naharitra 30 segondra izany fotoam-panginako noheveriko ho maharitra dia maharitra izany. ||| What felt like a lifetime of silence was around 30 seconds.
Niteny aho hoe" Noheveriko fa mety hiverina amin'izany izy io". ||| I said 'I was thinking it might come back that way.
Tsy nampino ahy hoe izany no teniko, ny teny voalohany nivoaka ny molotro dia hoe noheveriko fa mety hiverina amin'izany izy io. ||| ' I can't believe that I said that, really the first words out of my mouth was I thought it might come back that way".
Ao amin'ny bolongan'ny fikambanam-pampandrosoana AZUR mitondra ny anarana hoe AIDS Rights Congo, izay tetikasan'ny Rising Voices iray, no miaro ny zon'ny olona mitondra ny tsimok'aretina VIH. ||| The AZUR Development organization's blog AIDS Rights Congo, a Rising Voices project, advocates for the rights of HIV-positive people.
Asehon'ny takelaka maro ao aminy ary ny fanavakavahana sy ny henatra atrehin'ireo mitondra ny tsimok'aretina any Congo. ||| Their posts show the discrimination and stigma faced by those living with the virus in Congo.
Misy lahatsoratra iray ao miresaka momba ny fiainan'i "Bernadette," ramatoakely iray mpivarotra akanjo ao an-tsenan'i Tié-Tié any Pointe-Noire. ||| One post talks about the life of "Bernadette," a young woman who is a clothing vendor at the Tié-Tié market in Pointe-Noire.
Niova ny fiainany rehefa nolazain'ny namany (sipany?) tao an-tsena fa mitondra VIH i Bernadette. ||| Her life changes when her friend at the market divulges Bernadette's HIV positive status.
Nandao ny latabany avy hatrany ny manodidina azy tao an-tsena; ary nanaitra ny tompon'andraikitry ny fandaminana ny tsena, izay mahalala tsara fa sarotra izany mahazo latabatra ao an-tsena izany nefa mahita iretolatabatra foana ireto manodidina azy. ||| "At the market, her neighbors immediately desert their tables; which even attract the attention of those responsible for managing the market, who, conscious of the fact that having a table at the market is a difficult thing, are surprised to find empty tables around her.
Nanaitra ny rehetra izany, ary na ny lavitra aza dia maheno ny fosafosan'ny manodidina fa mitondra ny tsimok'aretina VIH izy. ||| The situation has put everyone on alert, and those passing from far away can hear the neighbor's gossip on the fact that she is a woman infected with HIV.
Na izany aza tsy misy soritra ivelany mihitsy ahalalana fa marary i Bernadette, tsy hita eny amin'ny endriny izany. ||| However there are no outward signs that Bernadette is sick, one cannot read it on her face.
Mbola tsy lasa lavitra ny faharariana ary tsy mbola nandray fanafody ARV (Antiretroviral) akory izy. ||| The illness is not at an advanced stage and she is not on ARV (Antiretroviral) treatment.
Ramatoakely tahaka ny hafa tsotra fotsiny izy.Fa rehefa nandinika izy, ary tena nahatohina azy ny toe-javatra dia naleony najanony ny varotra keliny. ||| She is simply a normal young woman. In a setback, traumatized by the situation, she stops her little shop".
Juan Carlos, 29 taona avy any Ekoatera,no mamaham-bolongana ny amin'ny atrehin'izay mitondra ny VIH. ||| Juan Carlos, a 29-year-old from Ecuador, blogs about coping with being HIV positive.
Ao amin'ny lahatsorany iray no iresahany any amin'ny mahazava-dehibe ny fandanjalanjana sy ny vokatsoa azo aminn'y firesahana aman'olona izay sedraina. ||| In one post he talks about the importance of balance and the benefits of talking to someone about what you're going through.
"Maro amin'ny mitondra ny VIH no mitady fanampiana amin'ny mpahay toetsaina (psikôlôgy) mandritra ny fiainany. ||| "Many HIV positive people seek help from psychologists throughout their lives.
Izaho manokana aloha, raha misy ny mihaino na mamaky ity... dia heveriko fa tsara ny miresaka amin'ny psikôlôgy indraindray mba hampihiratra kokoa ny andro maizi-kitroka sy ahafahana mizaka ny fitondrana ny tsimok'aretina sy ny olana hafa mianjady." ||| Personally, if anyone listens or reads this... I think it's always good to talk with a psychologist from time to time, it makes the darkest days become lighter and helps us to better carry on our lives with this virus and our other problems".
Pinoy Poz, izay mipetraka any Quezon any Philippines, no mamaham-bolongana ny amin'ny fitondrana ny VIH sy ny fahasarotan'ny ilazana fa mitondra izany izy. ||| Pinoy Poz, who lives in Quezon City in the Philippines, blogs about living with HIV and the difficulties of disclosing his HIV status.
Nolazainy ary fa nitia olona nitovy fanahana aminy izy fony 21 taona, fa "niverina nidiot" sivy taona tay aoriana rehefa hitany fa mitondra ny tsimok'aretina izy. ||| He came out about being gay at the age of 21, but nine years later went "back in the closet" after finding out he was HIV positive.
Ao amin' ity lahatsoratra ity no ilazany fa tsy tsy ratsy araka izay atahorany tsy akory ny filazana fa mitondra ny tsimok'aretina VIH izy, nefa mbola tena sarotra izany. ||| In this post he talks about how telling people he's HIV positive hasn't been as bad as he feared, but it's still hard.
Amin'ny fo madio no ilazako fa tena mifarirotra aho milaza amin'ny efa nifaneraserako hafa. ||| "Honestly, I've been too chicken to tell some of my other contacts myself.
Ary rehefa miteny aho hoe nifanerasera ny tiako lazaina dia hoe... fifaneraserana ara-pananahana. ||| And when I say contacts, I mean... okay, sexual contacts.
Dia nataoko ny zavatra tena tsara. ||| So I did the next best thing.
Nilazako mangingina (SMS?) avokoa, nisy tamin'ny alalan'ny namana ary nisy nanafenana anarana, izay efa nifanerasera tamiko hatramin'ny nihoatra ny herintaona ananako fomba ifandraisana hanoro hevitra azy hanao fizahana VIH ao aminy tsirairay avy. ||| I backtracked through my sexual contacts up to more than a year ago, and had a friend contact them anonymously, to advise them to get tested for HIV.
Miova araka ny mpandefa ny valinteny, raha miafina ny laharana dia valiany fa efa nanao fizahana ry zareo, valiany amim-pahatezerana raha heveriny fa olona adala aminy no mandefa ny somisika, na amin'ny ankapobeny, heverina fa voarainy fotsiny ny hafatra satria tsy mamaly izy ireo. ||| The reactions varied from asking who the sender was, replying to the anonymous number that they'd just gotten tested, sending foul messages to their alleged stalker, or most commonly, assuming that they did get the message, not replying.
Izaho kosa mahatsapa ao anatiko ao fa izay no fomba mety hampitandremana azy ireo azoko natao. ||| But I felt that was as decent a warning as I could manage".
Maro ny mitovitovy amin'ireo lahatsoratra maro ireo manerantany. ||| There are anecdotes similar to these posts from all over the world.
Mampivoitra ny feon'ireo sahy miseho fa mitondra ny tsimok'aretina VIH sy ny feon'ireo mpikarakara, ary ireo olo-tsotra te-hampahafantatra ny VIH/SIDA ity Saritany Google anoritan'ny Global Voices ny toerana misy ireo mpamaham-bolongana mitondra ny tsimok'aretina VIH ity. ||| This Global Voices Google map of HIV-positive bloggers highlights more voices of openly HIV-positive bloggers and caretakers, and other citizen media related to HIV/AIDS.
koa tsidiho ary vakio ny tantaran'izy ireny. ||| So take a look and read their amazing stories.

Meksika: Hetsika Rodobe Am-bisikilety Nifandona Tamin'ny Governemanta Tao an-toerana ||| Mexico: Bike Ride Protest Clashes With Local Government
Ny 28 Aprily 2012, andiany iray mpitaingina bisikilety, ka tao anatin'izy ireny dia nahitàna fikambanana sivily iray antsoina hoe Bicitekas, no nikarakara rodobe iray izay niainga teo amin'ilay 'Anjelin'ny Fahaleovantena' mampiavaka ny fon'ny tanànan'i Mexico, nitodi-doha nankany amin'ilay antsoina hoe 'Supervía Poniente ' (Làla-migodanan'i Poniente) ho fanoherana ny fanamboarana ito farany. ||| On April 28, 2012, a group of cyclists, among them a civic organisation named Bicitekas, organised a bike ride which would depart from the emblematic 'Angel of Independence' in the heart of Mexico City, heading towards the so-called 'Supervía Poniente ' (Poniente Super-road) in protest at the construction of the latter.
Teny an-tenantenan-dàlana teny dia mpitaingina bisikilety enina no nosamborin'ny polisy teny an-toerana, araka ny voalazan'i Mónica Tapia A. ||| At some point along the way, local police detained a group of six cyclists, according to Mónica Tapia A.

Ny 'Supervía Poniente' dia tetikasa iray an'ny governemanta avy amin'ny elatra havia tarihan'i Marcelo Ebrard, filohan'ny Governemantan'ny Distrika Federaly. ||| The 'Supervía Poniente' is a project led by the left-wing government of Marcelo Ebrard, leader of the Federal District Government.
Ny tanjona amin'ilay làlana dia ny hampitohy ny ilany atsimon'ny tanàna amin'ny faritra fifaneraseran'ny eraky ny firenena any andrefan'ny tanàna, ao amin'ny distrika iray fantatra amin'ny hoe Santa Fé. ||| The road aim is to link the south of the city with the area of transnational corporations located to the west of the city in a district known as Santa Fé.

Nahita ny fihazakazaky ny fitomboan'ireo mponina mifamoivoy ao aminy i Santa Fé, ary noho io antony io indrindra indrindra no mahatonga azy ho lalan-tsarotra ho an'ireo izay mpiasa mamily fiara mamonjy fiasàna isan'andro ao vokatry ny vesatry ny fifamoivoizana. ||| Santa Fé has witnessed a rapid growth in its floating population, and it is for this reason that it has become a real ordeal for those who work there to drive to work everyday due to high levels of traffic.
Nokendrena ho vahaolana amin'io olana io ny 'Supervía Poniente', saingy niteraka fanakianana avy amin'ireo mafàna fo izay milaza fa hisy fiantraikany goavana eo amin'ny tontolo iainana ireo asa atao ao. ||| The 'Supervía Poniente' aims to be a solution to this problem, but it has attracted criticism from activists who argue that the works will have a serious environmental impact.
Ilay rodobe am-bisikilety natao ny Sabotsy 28 Aprily teo dia iray ihany amin'ireo hetsi-panoherana natao hanoherana ny asa fanamboarana ilay làlana. ||| The bike ride which took place on Saturday, April 28, was just one of the protests against the construction of the road which have been carried out.

Global Voices Podcast: Mahatsiaro Ireo Androntsika Tany An-tsekoly ||| Global Voices Podcast: Remembering Our School Days
Arahabaina ny Tontolo! ||| Hello World!
Tongasoa ato amin'ny podcast an'ny Global Voices. ||| Welcome to the Global Voices podcast.
Ato anatin'ity famoahana ity isika dia handeha ho any an-tsekoly. ||| In this edition we're going to school.
Miainga amin'ny fanabeazana henjana be any amin'ny Reniranon'i Niger, hatrany amin'ny fihainoana ny marina avy amin'ireo namana tanora indrindra, ary ny fisaintsainana ny sasany amin'ireo fotoana mamy sy tsy hay hadinoina indrindra tamin'ny fotoana nandratoan'ireo mpandray anjara ato amin'ny Global Voices fanabeazana. ||| From extreme teaching on the Niger River, to hearing truths from our younger friends, and thinking back to some of the fondest or most memorable educational moments of Global Voices contributors.
Araka izany, toy inona izany andro tany an-tsekoly ho an'ny olona eto amin'ny Global Voices? ||| So, what were school days like for Global Voices people?
Fahatsiarovana mivaivay ||| An explosive memory
Paula Goes avy any Brezila dia mpamoaka lahatsoratra aminà tenim-pirenena maro ato aminay. ||| Paula Goes from Brazil is our multilingual editor.
Ity ny iray amin'ireo fahatsiarovany mahatsikaiky indrindra tany an-tsekoly fiofanana ho mpanao gazety, izay nandrosoana "glow in the dark" salady ovy misy maionezy tao anaty fety nitafiana ny endrik'ireo mahery fo, niteraka fihazakazahana sy fanaovana tongotra an-katoka nataon'ireo mpianatra nankany amin'ny toeram-pitsaboana, ka nampivalaketraky ny hehy ireo mpitsabo sy ny mpandalo. ||| Here is one of her funnier memories from journalism school, where a "glow in the dark" potato-mayonnaise salad served at a superhero costume party caused a frenetic rush of students to the hospital, to the great amusement of doctors and passersby.
Mbola velon'aina sy ripaky ny hehy tamin'ilay tantara ny tsirairay, taona maro taty aoriana. ||| Everyone survived to laugh at the story years later.
Mampianatra aterineto eny ambony sambokely ||| Teaching the internet from a boat
Ao anatin'ity andiany ity isika dia mahita fitantarana mahazendana mikasika ny fampianarana, ny sambokely ary ny renirano. ||| In this episode we also have an amazing tale of teaching, boats and the river.
Eddie Avila, talen'ny Rising Voices miresaka amin'i Boukary Konaté ao Mali mikasika ny Tetikasa Vohitr'i Segouizay nitondra ny aterineto ho amin'ireo vohitra manamorona ny Reniranon'i Niger tamin'ny alalan'ny sambokely. ||| Eddie Avila, director of Rising Voices talks with Boukary Konaté in Mali about the Segou Villages Project that brought Internet to villages along the Niger River by boat.
Ato raha hamaky betsaka mikasika ny dia izay nitondràna ny aterineto ho an'ireo mponina 800 tao am-bohitra ary hahita ireo saipika nalain'i Boukary nozaraina ao amin'ny Flickr. ||| Read more about the journey that brought internet to 800 villagers and see Boukary's photos shared on Flickr.
Mpampianatra iray tsaroana lalandava ||| An unforgettable teacher
Ireo fahatsiarovana ny andro fahiny tany an-tsekoly dia mety hifamatotra akaiky aminà namana na fahavalo saingy koa mety hifandray aminà toerana na fampianaran'ny mpampianatra. ||| Memories of school days may be closely linked to friends or enemies but they may also be related to places and of course teachers.
Ny sasany miteny fa samy tavela ao an-dohanao daholo na ny mpampianatra ratsy indrindra, na ny mpampianatra mendrika indrindra, taona maro aty aorian'ny nandaozanao ny sekoly. ||| Some say that it is both the best and the worst teachers that stay in your mind years after you have left school.
Veroniki Krikoni ao Gresy dia mizara fanomezam-boninahitra fotoana iray, toerana ary mpampianatra iray. ||| Veroniki Krikoni in Greece shares a beautiful tribute to a time, place and a teacher.
Kianja filalaovana politika ||| Playground politics
Irony fotoana nianarana nandritra ny fahazazantsika dia manampy koa amin'ny fanefena ny isika ankehitriny. ||| These times of learning in our childhood can help to make us who we are today.
i Cyrus Farivar dia mpanao gazety, mpamokatra sady mpanoratra. ||| Cyrus Farivar is a journalist, producer and author.
Izy dia mamariparitra ny tosiky ny vanim-potoana iray izay teny ankianja fakàn-drivotra izay isan'ny tena nametraka azy tanaty zava-tsarotra tsy mbola niainany mihitsy tany an-tsekoly.....taorian'ny nanaikerany ny namany iray ||| He describes an impulsive moment in the playground that landed him in the most trouble he's ever experienced in school... after biting his friend.
Nahatsiaro ihany koa ny fotoana niainany teny an-tokotanin-tsekoly, i Juliana Rincón Parra avy ao Kolombia no manoritsoritra ny fomba niatrehany ny politikan'ny faritra feno vanja milevin'ny maha-lahy na vavy, mba hilalaovany ny lalao tsotran'ny "trano" miaraka amin'ireo namany. (Avy amin'ny mpandika: tena mba tsy haiko ity lalao lazaina eto ity) ||| Also recalling a formative moment on the playground, Juliana Rincón Parra from Colombia describes how she was forced to negotiate a minefield of gender politics in order to play a simple game of "house" with her friends.
Ny fomba nahaizan'i Ethan nitendry haingana be ||| How Ethan learned to type so fast
Amin'ny fotoana iray ny sekoly dia toerana ahatakaranao ny ho lalan-kizoranao any aoriana, eo amin'ny fiainana. ||| School can be a time where you realise where you may want to go later in life.
Saingy tsy mora mandrakariva anefa ny fandehanana any. ||| But getting there is not always easy.
Zazalahy kely iray antsoina hoe Ethan Zuckerman, izay nitombo mba ho lasa mpiara-manorina ny Global Voices, no mitantara ny ady natrehany tamin'ny fanoratana amin'ny tanana tany amin'ny kilasy faha-4 izay efa saiky nahavery fanantenana azy... mandra-pianany nitendry. ||| A boy named Ethan Zuckerman, who grew up to be the co-founder of Global Voices, tells how his struggles with handwriting in the 4th grade almost caused him to lose hope... until he learned to type.
Haingana be! ||| Fast!
Mijoro miatrika filam-baniny ||| Standing up to bullies
Ny fandalovana fotoan-tsarotra tany an-tsekoly miaraka amin'ireo mpanabe dia mety hitarika aminà vahaolana am-pahendrena toy ny nanaporofoan'ny tantaran'i Ethan azy. ||| Having a hard time at school with teachers can lead to smart solutions as Ethan's story proves.
Saingy indrisy, ny sasany amintsika dia nitombo tanaty tontolo zara raha nisy namana saingy maro fahavalo. ||| Unfortunately, some of us grew up surrounded with few friends and more enemies.
Ny filam-baniny any an-tsekoly dia olana iraisam-pirenena ary tsy mora ny fahitana vahaolana tena izy amin'io. ||| Bullying at school is an international problem and finding the right answer is not easy.
Ny olona iray nizaka ny tàna-maherin'ny filam-baniny dia i Vuk. ||| One person who has suffered at the hand of bullies is Vuk.
Bilaogera vao 12 taona monja ary zanak'i Danica Radisic ao Serbia. ||| He's a 12-year old blogger and son of Danica Radisic in Serbia.
Miara-manazava ny zava-mitranga izy ireo ary izany atao hoe sekoly izany ao anatin'io karazana tsindry io. ||| Together they explained what happened and what school is like under this type of pressure.
Raha miatrika filam-baniny ianao, aza mihevitra ny hamakivaky izany samirery ary mitadiava olona azo ifampiresahana, hoy izy. ||| If you're facing a bully, don't go through it alone and find someone you can talk to, he says.
Mianatra any ivelany ||| Studying abroad
Francois-Xavier Ada-Affana dia sady mpanoratra no mpandika teny ary milazalaza ny momba azy ao anatin'ny bilaoginy ho toy ny "Kamerone iray manjakely nikaroka ny làlany teo anatin'ny tontolo. ||| Francois-Xavier Ada-Affana is a writer and translator and describes himself on his blog as "a nice Cameroonian finding his way in the world".
Tantarainy amintsika ny fomba nahatonga ny fianarana ny fifandraisana iraisam-pirenena tany Cypre, Gresy ho nanampy azy handranitra ny fomba fijeriny ny tantara sy ny fanabeazana, hanokatra ny saina amam-panahiny ho aminà kolontsaina sy vahoaka vaovao. ||| He tells us how studying international relations in Cyprus, Greece has helped shape his views on history and education, opening his mind to new cultures and people.
Ny dia lavitr'ezaka hamonjena sekoly ||| The long walk to school
Ny tantarantsika farany dia fitetezana iray. ||| For our final story we have a journey.
fitetezana miverina any amin'ny lasa, ary ny làlana 3 kiloametatra nodiavin'i Victor Kaonga isan'andro rehefa hamonjy sekoly tao Malawi fony izy vao zazalahikley 8 taona, mazàna no anaty orana ary ravin'akondro no atao solon'ny elo. ||| A trip into the past, and the 3 kilometre path that Victor Kaonga walked to school each day in Malawi as an 8-year old boy, often in rain with banana leaves as umbrellas.
Ankehitriny, i Victor dia mpanao gazty aminà fampielezampeo. ||| Today, Victor is a broadcast journalist.
Eny am-pamiliana fiara mandeha amin'ny làlana nahazatra azy fahiny nankany an-tsekoliny, dia hoy izy, "Tsy miova ny elanelana, fa fotsiny sahala amin'ny hoe fohifohy kokoa izy ankehitriny." ||| Driving past the place where he used to go to school, he says, "The distance remains the same, it's only that now it appears much shorter".
Isaorana ianao nihaino ||| Thanks for listening
Izay aloha no masaka azonay naroso tamin'ity famoahana ity. ||| That's all we have for this edition.
Ny sekoly sy ny tantaran'ny fabeazana dia fampahatsiahivana ireo zavatra itoviantsika, tsy ijerena izay misy antsika eto amin'izao tontolo izao. ||| School and educational stories are a reminder of the things that make us so similar no matter where we are in the world.
Ny zavatra mampiray antsika rehetra dia irony taona maro tsy nananantsika rehetra traikefa. ||| The thing that brings us together are those years when we were all inexperienced.
Ankehitriny isika dia afaka manao jery todika sy manontany tena amin'izay niafarantsika aty aoriana ||| Now we can look back and wonder at what we have become.
Fisaorana mitafotafo ho an'ireo mpandray anjara rehetra izay nitondra antsika tany amin'ny fiainan-dry zareo fahiny tany, ka hatramin'ireo nifampizara ny endriky ny fanabeazana amin'izao fotoana. ||| Huge thanks to all of our contributors who took us back in their lives as well as those who shared a picture of education today.
Heveriko fa mba naharay lesona daholo isika rehetra! ||| I think we all learned something!
