Tsy haiko intsony ny lojikan'ny FIF RT Nosoloina an'i Sabri Lamouchi eo amin'ny fitarihana ny Elefanta (ekipam-pirenena Ivoariana) i Zahoui ||| I can't follow the logic of the FIF RT Zahoui has been replaced by Sabri Lamouchi as the head of the Elephants.
Amin'izao fotoana anoratana izao, mbola mitohy ny fitenanam-po nateraky ny fanambarana ofisialin'ny FIF, samy tafintohina avokoa ny fanehoan-kevitra hita ataon'ny tsirairay avy. ||| At the time of writing, reactions follow reactions and on the official page of the FIF announcing this change, the indignant comments continue.
Korea Atsimo: Adihevitra Ny Amin'ny Fiverenan'ireo Boky Momba Ny Mpanjaka ||| South Korea: Controversies on the Return of Korean Royal Books
Uigwe dia andianà boky momba ny mpanjaka izay norobain'ny tafika Frantsay nandritra ny fanafihana ny Nosy Koreana Kanghwa, ny taona 1866. ||| Uigwe (의궤 in Korean) is a collection of Korean Royal books that was looted by French troops during the French invasion of Korea's Kanghwa Island in 1866.
Tafaverina an-tanindrazana ihany, 145 taona aty aoriana, ny volana May 2011 ||| It finally returned home after 145 years on May 2011.
Nankalaza izany fiverenana izany ny governemanta Koreana Tatsimo tamin'ny fomba nentin-drazana makotrokotroka ny 11 Jona, ary nisafidy ny hampiranty izany ao amin'ny Mozea Nasionalin'ny Tantara, izay nanomboka ny 19 Jolay ka hatramin'ny 18 Septambra. ||| The South Korean government celebrated the return with a large-scale traditional ceremony on June 11 and decided to exhibit it at the National Museum of History from July 19 to September 18.
Kanefa, mitoetra ny adihevitra izay heverina fa ny fiverenan'ilay boky dia misy ifandraisany lalina amin'ny tantara maoderina misavoritak'i Korea. ||| However, controversies remain as the return of the Korean Royal books is deeply connected with Korea's troubled modern history.
Tontosa ihany ny famerenana ireo boky momba ny mpanjaka taorian'ny nifampiraharaha tamin'ny governemanta Frantsy an-taonany maro, notsenain'ny maro tamin-kafaliana lehibe izany fiverenana izany. ||| As the return of the royal books was achieved after long years of tedious negotiation with the French government, this return has been warmly welcomed by many.
Ny namelona karazana adihevitra dia ilay famerenana arahana fepetra, endrika 'fampanofàna' ny harem-pirenena fa tsy famerenana tanteraka. ||| What ignited the various controversies was the fact that the return was conditional, a de facto 'rent' of the treasure rather than a permanent return.
Takiana ny hanavaozan'ny governemanta Koreana ilay fifanekena nataony tamin'ny fitondram-panjakana Frantsay, momba ny fitazonana ireo asa tànan'ny tao Korea Atsimo, isaky ny dimy taona. ||| The Korean government is required to renew the agreement it made with the French government, regarding keeping the artefacts in South Korea, every five years.
Fa ny ankamaroan'ireo Koreana dia mbola faly amin'ilay vaovao. ||| But most Koreans are still thrilled at the news.
Ilay bilaogera JooYoo, izay nandray anjara tamin'ny lanonana fitsenana, ny 11 Jona, dia maneho hevitra hoe tahaka ny inona ny hasafononoky ny hafalian'ny vahoaka noho ny fiverenan'ilay harem-pirenena. ||| Bloggger JooYoo who participated in the welcoming ceremony on June 11, expresses how people are overwhelmed with joy over the return of the national treasure:
Na dia narahana fepetra aza ny fiverenan'ilay bokin'ny mpanjaka, eo ambanin'ny teny hoe "fanofàna", izay mitaky fanavaozana hatrany an'ilay fifanekena, fa ny zava-dehibe indrindra dia tafaverintsika eto ireo. ||| Although the royal book return was a conditional return, under the title of "rent", which requires a continuous renewal of the agreement, the most important thing is that we finally got them back here.
Harena sarobidy ny Uigwe noho ny hatsaran'ny harena sy ny lanjany ara-tantara, amin'ny fahatakàrana ny fomban-drazana Koreana. ||| Uigwe is highly regarded treasure for its beauty and its historical value in understanding Korean tradition.
Ny Bilaogera Cookiedesiger maneho io fomba fijery io: ||| Blogger Cookiedesiger reflects this view:
Sarobidy ireo lova nentin-drazana. ||| Traditionally inherited things are precious.
Ny fanahin'ny firenena no ao anatin'izy ireny. ||| The spirit of nation runs through them.
Na dia ny silan-koho kely indrindra aza dia mitahiry fanahy. ||| Even the smallest nail contains the spirit.
Rehareham-pirenena sy fietrena ||| National pride and humiliation mingled
Ny fanapahan-kevitra hanofa ilay harena sarobidy dia niainga tamin'ny fandinihan'ny lalàna anatiny Frantsy. ||| The decision to rent the treasure was based on consideration of French domestic law.
Ary eo amin'ny tontolon'ny diplaomasia iraisam-pirenena, dia adika izany ho faneken'ny governemanta Frantsay hanome alàlana ny famerenana. ||| And in the diplomatic world, it is interpreted as the French government practically allowing the return.
Nefa tsy afaka hanome fahafaham-po ny Koreana izany fanazavana izany. ||| But that explanation could not satisfy Koreans.
Ilay bilaogera Binbini dia mitsikera io fifanekena io ho tsy ara-drariny ary fohy fijery.: ||| Blogger Binbini argues this negotiation was unfair and short-sighted:
Diniho izay nambaran'ny Lehiben'ny Fitantanan-draharaha sy ny Minisitry ny Raharaham-Bahiny ary ny Varotra: Ny marina dia "fampanofàna maharitra" izy ity raha mbola manohy ny fanavaozana ny fifanekena isika' sy ny hoe 'Inona no mety hataon-dry zareo momba azy io? ||| Look at what the Head of Administration and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade said: 'It is actually "a permanent rent" as long as we continue to renew the agreement' and 'What would they do about it?
Raha vao tonga aty Korea Atsimo ilay harena, tsy afaka hanaisotra azy io eto amintsika intsony izy. ||| Once the treasure arrived in South Korea, they couldn't possibly take this away from us.
' Adinon'izy ireo fa norobaina nandritra ny fananiham-bohitra ny Frantsay izy io. ||| ' They've forgotten that it was looted during the French invasion.
Ny Tahirim-bakoka Nasionalin'ny Tantara hita ao Seola, Korea Atsimo, Sarin'i RadioHat mpampiasa Flickr. ||| The National Museum of History located in Seoul, South Korea. Image by Flickr user RadioHat.
(CC BY-NC-ND 2.0) ||| (CC BY-NC-ND 2.0)
Izany tsy fitovian-kevitra izany dia fifangaroana ambony ambany ary hafahafa eo amin'ny rehareham-pirenena sy ny fietrena. ||| That disagreement is intertwined with the paradoxical combination of national pride and humiliation.
Ohatra, ilay bilaogera, A Small World in the World (Tontolo kely iray ao anatin'ny Tontolo) no maneho ny hatezerany manoloana ny fihetsiky ny governemanta Frantsay sy ny fanampahan-keviny hamela ilay famerenana 'voafetra': ||| For example, blogger A Small World in the World expresses his resentment toward the attitude of the French government and its decision to allow the 'limited' return:
Raha tsorina, nahatsiaro feno fankasitrahana ny governemanta Frantsay aho noho ny fikajiana tsara ny harem-pirenentsika nandritra izay fotoana ela izay. ||| Frankly speaking, I felt grateful to the French government for well preserving our national treasure for many years.
(Kanefa) voalohany indrindra dia harem-pirenentsika ny Uigwe. ||| (However) Uigwe is our national treasure in the first place.
Nangalarina izy io ary notazonina tany amin'ny tranombokin'ny firenen-kafa nandritra ny taona maro. ||| It has been stolen and kept in a foreign country's library for many years.
(Vokatr'izany) avy amin'ny fomba fijerin'ny Koreana azy, ny fahazoana mamerina azy avy any Frantsa zavatra tena mendrika hataontsika. ||| (Thus) From the Korean perspective, getting it back from France is to retrieve what we rightly deserve to have.
Ary mbola manohy ilay bilaogera: ||| Then the blogger continues:
Ary koa, ny governemanta Frantsay dia nilaza lainga tanteraka tamintsika taloha mikasika ny famerenana ireo boky momba ny mpanjaka. ||| Moreover, the French government told an outright lie to us in the past regarding the return of royal books.
Fony isika sahirana nisafidy izay homena ny fifanarahana fametrahana fiarandalamby haingam-pandeha eto Korea Atsimo tamin'i Frantsa, Japana ary Alemana, ny Filoha Frantsay dia nanome toky tsara fa hamerina ireo boky momba ny mpanjaka. ||| When we were torn between choosing France, Japan and Germany in giving a contract to build high-speed rail here in South Korea, the French president made a strong promise to return the royal text.
Izany fanomezan-toky izany no antony iray nahatonga antsika nisafidy ny TGV Frantsay teo anoloan'ny an'ny firenena hafa. ||| This promise was one of the deciding reasons that we adopted French TGV before those of other countries.
Tamin'izany fotoana izany, ny olona sasany nanolotra fa ny teknolojian'ny lalàmbian'i Japana no safidy tsara ho an'ny hoavy, nefa mbola nisafidy ny TGV Frantsay ihany isika, midika izany fa vendrana isika, nanao ny hamerenana ireo boky momba ny mpanjaka fotsiny. ||| At that time, some people suggested that Japanese rail technology is a better choice for the future, but we still chose French TGV, just because we so badly wanted to retrieve our royal text.
Kanefa na dia tsy nilaza izany tamin'ny fomba mazava aza ilay bilaogera, tsy sarotra ny manakatra eny antseantsefan'izay nosoratany eny fa ny lahatsorany dia mizara ny fomba fijerin'ny Koreana ny vanimpotoanan'ny fanjanahatany. ||| Although the blogger did not articulate it explicitly, it was not hard to read between the lines that his post reflects Koreans' view on the colonial era.
Ny lohatenin'ilay lahatsorany dia hoe "Fiverenan'ny bokin'ny mpanjaka: Tezitra tamin'ny fibodoana fohy nataon'i Japana isika, Nahoana isika no hampiseho fihetsika feno hatsaram-panahy manoloana ny fibodoana nataon"ny Frantsay? ||| His post title read ' Royal Text Return: While Resenting Japanese Occupation, Why are We Reacting so Generously toward French Invasion?
ary mariho fa ilay bilaogera dia nisafidy ny teny hoe "lainga tanteraka" tao amin'ny fehezanteny voalohany. ||| ' and note that the blogger chose the words "outright lie" in the first sentence.
Nampiasa teny mampihetsi-po izymikasika 'fifanarahana' iray, izay ny vola sy ny tombontsoa ihany no anton-dresaka ary ny kajikajy tsy ampiheverana no hany fiteny nampiasain'ny andaniny sy ny ankilany. ||| He used such an emotive word about a 'negotiation' situation where costs and benefits only matter and cold calculations are the only language two sides use.
Kanefa na dia izany aza, tsy fahatsinjovana lavitra ny fanerentsika ny vahoaka Koreana hanaiky ilay famerenana voafetra ny harem-pirenena. ||| Nonetheless, pushing the Korean public to accept the limited return of the treasure seems myopic.
Tsy maka ny hevitry ny besinimaro sy ny fihetsem-po manoloana ny tantara ratsiny, ary ny fomba fiatraikan'izany fihetsem-pon-dry zareo izany amin'ny fiarahamonina Koreana ankehitrio. ||| That does not encompass public views and feelings toward their tragic history and how their views affect current Korean society.
Soudan: Inona no azo tsoahina tamin'ny fifidianana? ||| Sudan: What do we make out of Sudan's elections?
Nifarana tamin'ny 15 aprily lasa teo ny fifidianana tany Soudan, kanefa, na dia mifarana aza izany dia mbola resabe ny fangaraharana sy maha azo antoka azy eo amin'ireo mpanao politika sy ireo mpanara-maso iraisam-pirenena ary ireo olom-pirenena tsotra ao anatiny sy ivelan'i Soudan. Andeha hojerena ny hevitry ny iraisam-pirenena mikasika iny fifidianana iny sy ny maha azo antoka azy. ||| Let's start by looking at the opinion of the international community on the election and its credibility.
Ao amin'ny lahatsoratra nivoaka tao amin'ny Afriquejet mitondra ny lohateny hoe "Vondrona Afrikana, miandrandra filaminana mandritra ny fifidianana any Soudan ny IGAD ||| In an article written in Afriquejet titled African Union, IGAD praise Sudan security for peaceful polls:
Raha jerena ny tantara politika vao haingana, fanamby maro noho ny halehiben'ny firenena, ny lafiny fandriam-pahalemana ary ny fisintonan'ny tady politika talohan'ny fifidianana, dia marika manan-tantara eo amin'ny tantaran'i Soudan iny fifidianana iny. ||| Considering its recent political history, the numerous challenges relating to the size of the country, the security situation and the political tensions prevailing ahead of the elections the election was a monumental milestone in the history of Sudan.
Ao amin'ity lahatsoratra ity, ilay mpanara-maso avy amin'ny Vondrona Afrikana Kunle Adeyemi manameloka ireo milaza fa tsy nalalaka sy tsy nanaja zo ny rafitra napetraka: ||| In the article, AU observer Kunle Adeyemi dismisses protesters who argue that the process was not free and fair:
Manaiky izahay fa tsy tonga lafatra ny fifidianana. ||| We agree that the elections were not perfect.
Na izany aza, tsy tokony hiandry zavatra tsara avy amin'ny olona tsy nandray anjara koa anefa. ||| However, you do not expect somebody who did not take part to say anything positive.
Vato fototra ho an'ny fifidianana ho avy iny fifidianana iny. ||| The election was a building block for future elections.
Any amin'ny faritra, toy izao no voalazan'ny lahatsoratra nivoaka tao amin'ny Sudan Tribune mitondra ny lohateny hoe "Fikambanana Afrikana sy Arabo manantena hitarika ny fifidianana any Soudan": ||| Regionally, in an article written in the Sudan Tribune titled African and Arabs organisations praise the conduct of Sudanese elections.
Milaza ny fanambarana avy amin'ny Ligy Arabo: ||| The statement by the Arab League says:
"Tsy afaka milaza izahay fa manaraka ny fenitra iraisam-pirenena ny fifidianana natao tany Soudan, kanefa tsy manambany izay efa vita izahay, izay tena manan-danja", hoy ny fanambaran'i Salh Halima, lehiben'ny ligy arabo any Karthoum. ||| We cannot say that the Sudanese elections have met international standards, but that does not reduce what has happened, which is an important transition," said Salah Halima the head of AL mission in Khartoum today
Etsy an-kilany, ny fanambaran'ny Vondrona Afrikana dia milaza fa iny fifidianana iny no "zava-bita lehibe ho an'ny vahoaka soudanais" ||| On the other side the AU statement notes that the elections were a great achievement for the Sudanese people"
Ny zava-nitranga tany Soudan dia tena manan-tantara sady zava-bita goavana ho an'ny vahoaka soudanais", hoy Kunle Adeyemi, mpitondra tenin'ny mpanara-maso avy amin'ny Vondrona Afrikana any Soudan, tarihan'ny filohan'i Ghana teo aloha John Kufuor. ||| What happened in Sudan was a historical event and a great achievement for Sudanese people," said Kunle Adeyemi, who is spokesperson of the AU observer mission in Sudan chaired by John Kufuor the former President of Ghana.
"Raha jerena amin'ny hoe firenena tsy nahitana fifidianana nisy mpandray anjara betsaka tahaka ity tany Soudan efa taranaka iray izao... ny filazana fa nalalaka sady azo antoka, araka ny efa fantantsika dia tsy tokony hisaina ny mifanohitra amin'izany isika", hoy izy nanampy. ||| "Looking into the fact this is a country that had not had a multi-party election for almost a generation... to say they are free and fair, to the best of our knowledge we have no reason to think the contrary," he added.
"Tsy nahita hosoka izahay... hitanay fa mangarahara ny fifidianana," Adeyemi nanamafy. ||| "We have not found evidence of fraud... we saw a vote that was very transparent," Adeyemi affirmed.
Mitantara ny hevitra samy hafa sy ny dikan'iny fifidianana mana-tantara iny ny tontolon'ny bilaogy. ||| In the blogosphere there are a variety of opinions and perspectives about the credibility and the meaning of this historical event.
Lahatsoratra mitondra ny lohateny hoe Ruth Messinger: Fifidianana tsy nahomby tany Soudan: Ahoana izany? ||| A post titled Ruth Messinger: Failed Elections in Sudan: Now What?
ao amin'ny bilaogy All Over the World no miombon-kevitra fa ny politikan'i Obama momba ny karaoty sy ny tsora-kazo hampiharina amin'i Soudan dia mbola mila tsora-kazo fanampiny: ||| at Blog All Over the World argues that Obama's carrot and stick policy towards Sudan needs some sticks:
Diso fanantenana tamin'ny fitondrana ny fifidianana ny fitantanan'i Obama. ||| The Obama administration has expressed disappointment in the way these elections were conducted.
kanefa tsy ampy ny fanambarana tany amin'ny haino aman-jery. ||| But press releases are not enough.
Ny politikan'ny karaoty sy ny tsora-kazo dia tmbiny vokatry ny ezaka nataon'i Soudan ho amin'ny fandriam-pahalemana ary mamela ireo izay te handrava sy manembatsembana izany fandriampahalemana izany hahazo tsora-kazo fanampiny. ||| President Obama's "carrots and sticks" policy of rewarding the Sudanese government for progress towards peace and holding it accountable for undermining peace now requires some sticks.
Maika isika izao hijery, raha tarafina ny fifidianana farany tany Soudan, hoe amin'ny fomba ahoana no hanatanterahan'ny Maison Blanche ny politika napetrany. ||| And we are eager to see, in light of Sudan's recent elections, how the White House intends to implement its own stated policy.
Ao amin'ny bilaogy Making Sense of Sudan, Abd al-Wahab Abdalla no mamehy fa ratsy ny fifidianana. ||| At Making Sense of Sudan, Abd al-Wahab Abdalla concludes that the election was ugly.
Hoy izy manazava: ||| He explains:
Fanodikodinam-bato, halatra sy hosoka, nisy izany. ||| Rigging, fraud and corruption, there were.
Mpifidy tsy nahazo nifidy, fisoratana anarana amin'ny ora farany sy famoriana mpifidy tamin'ny alalan'ny taratasy fanamarinam-ponenana maimaika izay mifanaraka na tsia amin'ny anarana voasoratra ao amin'ny lisim-pifidianana, azo antoka fa voamarin'ireo mpanara-maso avokoa izany rehetra izany. ||| Voters excluded from the poll, last-minute registration and a roundup of voters with hastily-issued residence certificates which may or may not have matched the names on the voters' roll, all will surely be documented by the observers.
Zava-nisy tsy misy dikany taorian'ny fifidianana tamin'ny herinandro lasa teo tany Soudan. ||| These had no material consequence for the outcome of last week's election in Sudan.
Ny valim-pifidianana ratsy endrika dia efa voafaritry ny manan-katao izay nitondra ny politika tany Soudan nandritra ny 40 taona izao. ||| The ugly result of the election was determined long ago by the material forces that have driven Sudanese political life for the best part of forty years.
Ny fikambanana politika naorina avy amin'ny famokarana dia efa nopotehina tanteraka tamin'ny fikomiana volana may ary nasolo azy dia niatrika fanakambanana hetsika politika maromaro ny soudanais izay tsy nankaiza fa niodina teo amin'ny olom-panjakana sy ny fitaovam-panjakana ary ny tombotsoany ihany. ||| Political organization founded in the means of production was decisively crushed by the May Revolution and instead Sudanese have witnessed the coalescence of political activities around nothing more than proximity to the state and its instruments of power and rent.
Ireo sisa tamin'ny fikomiana, ny ankavia mitondra ny hevitra hoe "Soudan Vaovao" miaraka amin'ny SPLM, sy ny ankavanana mitondra ny hevitra Fizakan-tenan'ny Silamo, naorina satria sady nilaina no naharesy lahatra, dia efa resy hatramin'ny ela teo amin'ny tontolo politika. ||| The only revolutionary alternatives, from the left in the form of the banners of the "New Sudan" raised by the SPLM, and from the right with the Islamists' slogans of self-reliance, adopted from necessity rather than conviction, have long since succumbed to the lure of the politics of the bazaar.
Hoy ihany izy manohy ny famakafakany: ||| He continues with his analysis:
Mizara roa mazava tsara ny mpifidy. ||| Our voters fall into two main categories.
Ao amin'ny sokajy A no ahitana ireo izay voatery na noho ny fitadiavana tombotsoa dia nanaraka ny filaharan'ny tsy maty manota. ||| Category A is those who have, of necessity or opportunism, joined the loyalty parade.
Hita ao anatin'izany ny mpifidy avy any ambanivohitra izay mila fitantanana tsaratsara hahazoany tombotsoa. ||| This includes almost all rural voters whose services and livelihoods require government beneficence.
Ao anatin'izany koa ireo mitaky fahazoan-dalana vao mahazo mivarotra. ||| It includes anyone who may need a licence to trade.
Ireo no nifidy ny NPC, ary arakaraky ny tsy hitiavana ilay mpirotsaka hofidiana no hisian'ny vintana hahalany azy, satria izay solombavam-bahoaka tsy tiana indrindra no manjary lasa tanana ankavanan'ny filoha sy ny saribakoliny. ||| These voters will vote NCP, and the uglier the candidate, the more likely they will vote him in, because the ugliest representative is likely to be the one seated closest to the president and his minions.
Kayode Oladele ao amin'ny Sahara Reporters no mamakafaka ny fifidianana ary mijery ny fomba fanaovana izany fifidianana izany tany Soudan izay azon'ny firenena hafa halaina tahaka koa: ||| Kayode Oladele of Sahara Reporters reflects on the elections and identifies some values in the Sudanese electoral system that other countries can emulate:
Misy zava-baovao sy tsara azon'ny firenena hafa hampiharina ny fifidianana tany Soudan. ||| There is one innovative and good side to the Sudan elections which other countries can emulate.
Nisy ny fanakambanana ny fifidianana olon-tokana sy ny solon-tena mifanaraka aminy . ||| They had a combination of the First Past The Post system and a Proportional Representation system.
Ao amin'ny solon-tena mifanaraka aminy no nahitana ny Lisitry ny Vehivavy sy ny Lisitry ny Antoko. ||| Under the PR system they had the Women List and the Party List.
Nampirisika ny ankamaroan'ny vehivavy hifidy izany. ||| This encouraged a lot of women to turn out during polling.
Hamaranana azy, Maggie milaza ny fahataran'ny famoahana ny vok-pifidianana: ||| Finally, Maggie discusses the delay in announcing official election results:
Ho an'ny maro any Atsimo, tsy mahagaga ny fanambarana ny vokatry ny fifidianana nataon'ny NEC (Komitin'ny fifidianana), raha jerena ireo zava-tsarotra niainana tamin'ny fanangonana ny vato sy ny fanisana azy avy any amin'iroe birao fandatsaham-bato any an-toerana - izay ny sasany tsy misy lalana. ||| To many in the South, the NEC's announcement today came as no surprise, given the significant difficulties in collecting ballot papers and results from local polling stations—some of which are not accessible by road.
(Any amin'ireny toerana ireny dia manampy amin'ny alalan'ny helikoptera ny Firenena Mikambana). ||| (In these locations, the United Nations is helping collect elections materials by helicopter).
Ny famoahana ny vokatra amin'ny tabilao koa dia mananosarotra noho ny antony mitovy amin'ny teo aloha ihany izay nahasarotra ny fizotran'ny fifidianana: ny lanjan'ny vato sy ny tsy fahampian'ny vaovao avy any an-toerana. ||| The tabulation of results is complicated for some of the same reasons that the polling process was complex; the number of ballots and the lack of resources at the local level.
Ankehitriny, tompon'andraikitra iray avy amin'ny Komity Ambonin'ny Fifidianana any Soudan Atsimo no nanambara tamin'ny Enough fa ny NEC dia tokony ho nanaraka ny hevitry ny vaomiera mitantana ny fifidianana noho ny zava-misy any Atsimo, izay mahalala tsara ny fahasarotana ara-pitaterana sy ny fahasarotana teknika izay nisy vokany teo amin'ny fifidianana tsany Atsimo, raha ampitahaina amin'ny any amin'ny foibe any Karthoum. ||| Today, an official at the South Sudan Elections High Committee told Enough that the NEC should have listened to the state-level elections committee in the South, who have a better understanding of the logistical constraints and technical challenges that have affected the electoral process in the South than the national body in Khartoum
. |||.
Israely: Mpampiasa Aterineto Manohitra Mafy Ny Mety Ho Fanafihana Atao Amin'i Iran ||| Israel: Netizens Strongly Object to the Prospect of a Strike on Iran
(Rohy amin'ny teny Anglisy sy Hebreo) Tatitra avy amin'ny fampahalalam-baovao Israeliana maro tato ho ato no niresaka ny mety hisian'ny fanafihana hataon'ny Israeliana amin'ireo foto-drafitrasa nokleary any Iran. ||| Several Israeli media reports in recent days have discussed the possibility of an imminent Israeli strike on Iran's nuclear facilities.
Ireo tatitra dia nilaza fa ny masoivoho miandraikitra ny filaminana, ny IDF, Mossad sy Shin Bet dia samy manohitra ny fampiasan-kery amin'i Iran avokoa, raha toa kosa ny Praiminisitra Benjamin Netanyahu, ny Minisitry ny Fiarovana Ehud Barak ary ny Minisitry ny Raharaham-bahiny Avigdor Lieberman dia samy manosika ny kabinetra hanaiky ny fanafihana an'i Iran. ||| The reports stated that Israel's security establishment, the IDF, Mossad and Shin Bet object to attacking Iran, while Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defense Minister Ehud Barak and Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman are pushing the cabinet to agree to strike Iran.
Raha zohiana ireo tatitra ireo, sambany izao ny vahoaka Israeliana no nanomboka niresaka tamin'ny fomba matotra ity olana goavana ity. ||| Following these reports, the Israeli public, for the first time, started seriously debating this important issue.
Araka ny soratan'i Larry Dafner ao amin'ny +972 Magazine: ||| As Larry Dafner wrote on +972 Magazine:
Farany, tonga amin'izao ihany. ||| Finally, it's happened.
Taorian'ny taona maro nandrenesana sy niresahana izatsy sy izaroa momba ny loza mitatao ateraky ny nokleary ao Iran, dia mandre sy miresaka ny loza mitatao amin'ny fiezahana hisoroka itsy loza voalohany aminà fiaramanidina mpanjera baomba ity firenena ity. ||| After years of hearing and talking about nothing but the potential danger of a nuclear Iran, this country is hearing and talking about the potential danger of trying to pre-empt that first danger with fighter bombers.
Ny rentsika, tsy hoe fotsiny mikasika ny "loza mitatao Iraniana," fa koa mikasika ny "loza mitatao Israeliana". ||| We're hearing not just about "the Iranian threat," but about "the Israeli threat," too.
Ary taorian'ny taona maro nahenoana ny mpanjaka hasbara miresaka momba an'i Hitler sy ny 1938 ary ny Holocaust, ny vahoaka Israeliana dia mihaino, ankolaka, ireo olona izay inoan-dry zareo kokoa miohatra amin'ireo mpanao politika – ireo matihanina, ireo manao ny raharaha miaramila ho anton-draharahany sy ireo mpitsikilo – ary ny feo ren-dry zareo avy amin'ireny bandy be mokony ireny dia feo mafy, hentitra manao hoe "TSIA" ||| And after years of listening to the hasbara king talk about Hitler and 1938 and Holocaust déjà vu, the Israeli public is hearing, indirectly, from the people they trust more than they trust the politicians – the professionals, the career warriors and spies – and the word they're hearing from those tough guys is a very loud, urgent "NO".
Ny setrin'ireny tatitra ireny sy ny mety hisian'ny fanafihana ireo foto-drafitrasa nokleary ao Iran dia miiba avokoa eny anivon'ireo Israeliana mpiondana aterineto. ||| The response to these reports and the possibility of attacking Iran's nuclear facilities was unanimously negative among Israeli netizens.
Ny sasany aza nanomboka hetsika eo amin'ny Facebook hanaovana hetsi-panoherana eo anoloan'ny Ministeran'ny Fiarovana Israeliana ao Tel Aviv ny 6 Novambra hanoherana ny fanafihana an'i Iran. ||| Some have even started a Facebook event for a protest in front of the Israeli Ministry of Defense in Tel Aviv on November 6 against a strike on Iran.
Maro ireo mpampiasa aterineto no nahita ny fanafihana an'i Iran ho toy ny tetika fanarian-dia noho ireo onjam-panoherana tato ho ato mikasika ny rariny ara-tsosialy anoherana ny politika ara-toekarenan'ny governemantan'ingahy Netanyahu. ||| Many netizens saw a possible attack on Iran as a diversion tactic from the recent wave of social justice protests against the economic policies of the Netanyahu government.
Efa tofoka sahady amin'ny horohoro Iraniana. ||| Enough already with the Iranian threat.
Raha misy balafomanga nokleary mitontona eto, fanombohan-tselatra no ho hitantsika dia mifarana ny zavatra rehetra. ||| If a nuclear missile lands here, we'll see the beginning of a flash and everything will be over.
Tsy handre fanaintaina akory. ||| It won't even hurt.
Ny trosa mitambesatra (trosa babena noho ny politika ara-toekarena ao Israely), etsy ankilany, ho tsapanao foana. ||| An overdraft (living in debt due to Israel's economic policies), on the other hand, you feel all the time.
Raha tsy mahita harapaka intsony, hàno ny ady ifanaovana amin'i Iran ||| If there's no bread, eat a war with Iran
Raha izany, nahoana no resahan'ny rehetra ny momba an'i Iran ankehitriny? ||| So why is everyone talking about Iran now?
Raha ny fahitana azy, Ehud Barak dia niara-niasa akaiky tamin'ireo iraka momba ny raharaha miaramila mba handresy lahatra azy ireny fa hoe hihetsika isika. ||| Apparently, Ehud Barak has worked closely with all the military affairs correspondents to convince them we're about to strike.
Nahoana? ||| Why?
Satria tian-dry zareo hahena ny tetibolam-pandaniana ho an'ny fiarovana ||| Because they wanted to cut the defense budget.
Ny sasany nalahelo ny amin'izay lazain-dry zareo ho hagaigena sy tsy fahatsiarovantenan'ny mpitantana ao Israely ||| Others lamented what they perceived to be the stupidity and recklessness of Israel's leadership.
Olona kaondrana, atsaharo io! ||| Crazy people, stop this!
Ity dia tsy misy hafa amin'ny hoe: "Oay! ||| This is basically something like: "oh no!
Tena ny hamely ahy no tetehan'ilay tsy ampy fandinihana ity! ||| This bully wants to beat me up!
Noho izany dia ny famelezako azy no hataoko tonga aloha, ary dia hahita izy ka hitomany sy hiverina hody!" ||| So it's better I beat him up first, and this will show him and he'll cry and go home" !
Mba handavoana ny manampahefana Palestiniana, tsindrio ny 1. ||| For causing the collapse of the Palestinian Authority, press 1.

Ho an'ny Gog sy Magog (faran'izao tontolo izao) tsindrio ny 0 na miandrasa. ||| For Gog and Magog (end of the world) press 0 or wait.
Hitako fa ho avy any Gaza ny fanafihana antsika, ary ny toe-draharaha ao Ejipta sy Siria ka nitenenako irery ny amin'izay tokony ho nolazain'izay milaza azy ho praiminisitra salama saina amin'ny tenany ihany: aleo isika hanokatra vava-ady hafa. ||| I saw we were being attacked from Gaza, the situation in Egypt and Syria and told myself what every sane Prime Minister would tell himself: let's open another front.
Tsy hoe mangalatra aminao ny zo hiaina am-pahamendrehana sy anaty fivelarana fotsiny ity governemanta ity, fa ankehitriny ny zo hiaina mihitsy no angalariny aminao. ||| Not only does this government rob you for the right to live in dignity and prosperity, now it will also rob you for the right to live.
Ny sasany, mazava loatra, dia zatra ny manao sangy ratsy. ||| Some, of course, used to opportunity to crack jokes.

Lahatsary: Mifampizara Ny Fiainany Ny Reny Manerantany ||| Video: Mothers Around the World Share Their Different Experiences
Hita ao amin'ny fampirantiana an'aterineton'ny Mozea iraisampirenena Momba ny vehivavy avokoa ny momba ny reny rehetra. ||| In the International Museum of Women, the current online exhibit is all about mothers.
Nampahafantatra ireo karaza-pijery momba ny reny tamin'ny alalan'ny fanadihadiana an-dahatsary natao tamin'ny vehivavy avy ao Nizeria, Kenia, Afganistana, Etazonia, Kolombia, Hongria, Shina ary Norvezy ny MAMA: Ny Fiainan'ny reny manerana ny glaoby. ||| MAMA: Motherhood around the Globe explores the different aspects of motherhood through video interviews to women in Nigeria, Kenya, Afghanistan, USA, Colombia, Hungary, China and Norway.
Lusina avy ao Kenya, iray tamin'ireo nanaovana fanadihadiana tamin'ny IMOW ||| Lusina from Kenya is one of the interviewed mothers for IMOW
Mama to Be (Ho reny atsy ho atsy) no zoro miresaka ny fanantenana rehetra momba ny maha-reny sy ny fitondrana vohoka, ary ahitana ihany koa ny fomba fandraisana sy fiatrehan'ireo vehivavy isan-karazany ireo lohahevitra ireo, ary ny sasany amin'ireo aza mbola tsy tafala amin'ny fahatanorana nefa miandry andro. ||| Mama to Be is the section on the expectations around motherhood and pregnancy, and how the different women, some not even out of their teens reacted and faced their impending motherhood.
Firy amin'ireo vehivavy manerantany ankehitriny no afaka manapa-kevitra eo amin'ny fiainany, toy ny hoe rahoviana vao hanorina tokantrano, ary amin'ny fomba manao ahoana? ||| How many women in the world actually have an opportunity to decide if, how, and when to create a family?
Inona ny antony mahatonga ny vehivavy ankehitriny hisafidy – na tsia – hiditra eo amin'ny sehatry ny fiterahana? ||| What are the reasons that women today are choosing – or refusing to choose – motherhood?
Tao amin'ny Healthy Mama, Healthy Bab y (Renim-pianakaviana Salama, Zaza Salama), natao hanehoana mazava tsara ny fomba fiterahana sy ny fahasalamana avy amin'ny kolontsaina samihafa ananan'ireo renim-pianakaviana ny tantara nozarain'izy ireo mikasika ny traikefa niainany tamin'ny fiterahany. ||| In Healthy Mama, Healthy Baby, the stories these women share on their birthing experiences serve to illustrate how different cultures view birthing and health.
Vehivavy an'arivony manerantany isan'andro no miteraka. ||| Every day, thousands of women worldwide give birth to new human life.
Ka maro amin'izy ireo no nisosa tsara tao anatin'ny fifaliana sy fahombiazana ny fiterahana, ary an-jatony kosa ireo maty teo am-piterahana. ||| While many of these women will have happy and successful deliveries, hundreds will die in childbirth.
Ahoana ny fiantrakain'ny jeografia, fidiram-bola, sy ny taona eo amin'ny tahan'ny fiterahana lavitry ny loza? ||| How do things like geography, income, and age affect your chances of a safe delivery?
Inona no efa natao nampihenana ny tahan'ny fahafatesana am-piterahana, ary ahoana ny fomba andraisanao anjara amin'izany? ||| What is being done to improve upon the world's maternal mortality rate, and how can you get involved?
Ao amin'ny Featured Voices section, nandefa ny tantarany manokana ny mpihaino ary tantara 6 tamin'izany no nofinidin'ny mpitsara iraisam-pirenena hahazo ny Loka avy amin'ny Safidim-bahoaka. ||| In the Featured Voices section, stories were submitted by the audience and six stories were selected by an international jury for the Community Choice Awards.
Iray amin'izany ohatra ity sombi-tantara milaza ny toe-java-tsarotra iainana ao amin'ny toera-piterahana iray ao Kolombia, notontosain'i Caballero ho an'ny Gusano Films. ||| One of them is this excerpt of the hard situation in the Colombian hospital maternity wards by Jorge Caballero for Gusano Films.
Tao amin'ny Birth Journal Maternity Excerpt (Sombim-baovao momba ny fiterahana), renim-pianakaviana manan-janaka 6 no tonga nanao fizahana ara-pahasalamana sy hiteraka ny zanany faha-fito. ||| In Birth Journal Maternity Excerpt, a mother of six arrives to a checkup and then to deliver a baby.
Nandritra ny fizahana ara-pahasalamana natao azy no nanomboka ny tantarany noho ny fanontanian'ny mpitsabo azy, niova ny fihetsik'ilay mpitsabo manoloana ilay renim-pianakaviana, ka niafara tamin'ny fanomezany soso-kevitra azy hanao famatorana ny fantson-taova-pananahana mba tsy hiterahany intsony. ||| During the checkup, her story comes out through the questions asked by the doctor, and his attitude towards her changes, ending up with a suggestion for a tubal ligation and a curt farewell.
Nandritra ny fiterahany, irery tao anaty kalesy (chariot) ilay renim-pianakaviana, tsy mba nisy fotoana namindrana azy hoentina hampiterahana ao amin'ny efi-trano natokana amin'ny fiterahana, fa niteraka tao amin'ny fandrian'ny hopitaly izy. ||| During delivery, there isn't even time to move the lone woman to the gurney and into the maternity room, she gives birth on her hospital bed.
Mifantoka manodidina ny vehivavy sy ny tantarany manokana kosa ny resadresaka ifanatrehan-tava tao amin'ny Meet the Mamas (Fantaro Ireo Reny), ohatra tamin'izany, ny fampitahana ny toe-javatra isan-karazany misy eo amin'ny tanora reny ao Liberia, miaina amin'ny fari-piainana mafaitra, sy ny tanora reny ao Etazonia, izay afaka mandroso sy manohy ny fianarana noho ny fanohanana ara-tsosialy. ||| One-on-one interviews in Meet the Mamas focus the conversations around the woman and her personal story, for example, it helps contrast the different situations between a teen mother in Liberia, living what she calls in Critical Condition, and a teen mother in the United States, who through family support is able to move on ahead and continue her studies.
Ny hampafantatra amin'ny olona marobe mikasika ny toe-pianana sy ny fahasalaman'ny vehivavy no tanjon'ny fampiratiana ao amin'ny Mozea Iraisam-pirenena momba ny Vehivavy, ao amin'ny Get Involved page (pejy raiso ny andraikitrao), mandrisika ny mpamaky izy ireo mba handray anjara hanatsarana ny antontanisa sy hifanentana bebe kokoa momba ity lohahevitra mafonja ity. ||| This exhibit in the International Museum of Women aims to get more people informed on the state of Women's Maternal Health, on their Get Involved page they suggest different ways in which readers can participate in improving the statistics and raise awareness themselves on these important issues.

Androany (01/11) dia nanambara i Qatar ha hanao fifidianana izay ho mpikambana ao amin'ny parlemantany amin'ny tapany faharoan'ny taona 2013. ||| Qatar today announced it will hold parliamentary elections in the second half of 2013.
Ny Emir ao Qatar, Shaikh Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani, no nanao ny fanambaràna ary noraisin'ny vahoaka tsara tokoa, izay manantena fa ny fanohanan'i Qatar ny revolisiona Arabo dia hanefy ampitso vaovao ho an'ireo Qataris. ||| The announcement was made by the Qatari Emir Shaikh Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani and welcomed by netizens, who hope that Qatar's support for the Arab revolutions is shaping a new tomorrow for Qataris.

Nohatsarain'ny Fampahalalam-Baovao Iraniana Ny Kabary Nataon'i Asghar Farhadi Nahazo Oscar ||| Iranian News Agency "Improves" Oscar Speech by Asghar Farhadi

Amin'izao fotoana izao, Iraniana marobe manerana izao tontolo izao no mijery antsika ary hitako eto fa tena faly tokoa izy ireo. ||| At this time, many Iranians all over the world are watching us and I imagine them to be very happy.

Costa Rica: Sehatra Maro Mitsipaka Ny Vinan'ny Governemanta Momba Ny Hetra ||| Costa Rica: Numerous Sectors Oppose Government Tax Plan
(Ny rohy rehetra dia amin'ny teny Espaniola afa tsy amin'ny filazana manokana) ||| (All links lead to Spanish language pages except when otherwise noted)
Amin'izao fotoana izao, ny laharam-pahamehana ho an'ny governemanta ao Costa Rica dia ny hametraka vina momba ny hetra antsoina hoe "Solidaridad Tributaria" (Hetra faobe) (jereo ny tenifototra "planfiscal"), ary dia, vitan'izy ireo hatramin'ny fanajanona ny lahadiniky ny Antenimiera (kaongresy) mpanao lalàna, mba hahafahana miresaka an'io. ||| At the moment, the priority for the Costa Rican government is to pass a tax plan named "Solidaridad Tributaria" (Tax Solidarity) (See hashtag "planfiscal"), and as a result, it has gone so far as to leave the agenda for the Legislative Assembly (Congress) blank, so that only this subject can be discussed.
Na dia izany aza, sehatra maro ao amin'ny fiarahamonina, antoko politika ary mpandrahara maro no nanao fanambarana ny amin'ny fanoherany mafy io fanovana eo amin'ny lafiny ara-ketra io, izay noelanelanin'ny hetsika tsy manaraka ny lalampanorenana napetrak'i Luis Fishman, mpikambana ao amin'ny antoko mpanohitra. ||| However, different sectors of society, political parties and businessmen have declared their strong opposition to this fiscal reform, which was halted by an action of unconstitutionality imposed by Luis Fishman, a member of the opposition.
Io antso io dia mifotora amin'ny "vía rápida" (làlana-haingana), araka izay iantsoan'ny kaongresy azy, tsy mamela ny mpikambana hahay hijery tsara ilay vina. ||| This appeal is founded on the fact that the "vía rápida" (fast-track), as it is called by Congress, does not allow members to have a good enough look at the plan.
Ilay làlana haingana dia nampiasaina ho vina laharam-pahamehana ary manena ny fotoana hiresahana ny mikasika ny fifidianana lalàna iray. ||| The fast-track is used for priority projects and it reduces the margin of time for discussion about voting on a law.
Ireo mponina dia nampakatra ny feon'izy ho fanoherana ny drafitra ara-ketra, ary ny 13 Desambra, maherin'ny olona roa arivo no nanao diabe ho any amin'ny Antenimiera mpanao lalàna mba hangataka ny fanajanonana ilay vina. ||| Ciitzens also raised their voices against the tax package, and on December 13, more than two thousand people marched to the Legislative Assembly to demand it to put an end to the plan.
Ny teboka izay nahatonga fifandroritana indrindra dia ny fanovàna ny hetra ara-barotra izay 13%, izay mihatra amin'ireo entana jifain'ny mpanjifa, ny tataon-ketra 14%, izay mahakasika ireo sehatra tsy niharan'ny fanovàna mihitsy hatreto. ||| The point that generated most disagreement was the proposed change of the 13% sales tax, which applies to consumer goods, to a value-added tax of 14%, which would also include the services that have, so far, been exonerated from any changes.
Fanakianana ilay vina ara-ketra nandritra ilay hetsi-panoherana nataon'ireo mponina tsy faly ao Costa Rica ny 11 Novambra 2011. ||| Criticism of the Fiscal Plan during the protests by indignant Costa Ricans 11 November 2011.
Sary: Luis Diego Molina. ||| Photo: Luis Diego Molina.
Ilay bilaogera El Chamuko dia nanoratra momba ilay hetsika fanoherana ilay vina El Infierno en Costa Rica (Ny Helo ao Costa Rica): ||| Blogger El Chamuko wrote about the movement against the plan in El Infierno en Costa Rica (The Inferno in Costa Rica):
Chamuko dia mahita mazava fa any amin'ny farany, ny sehatra ara-panjakana dia hiaraka ao anaty hetsika iray miady amin'ny famelezan'ny "el pacto PALI" (the PALI pact) ("el pacto PALI" dia anaram-petaka ampiasain'ny vohikala tambajotra sosialy mba hilazana ilay fifanarahana nataon'ny antokon'ny mpitondra Partido Liberación Nacional (National Liberation Party) ary ny Partido Acción Ciudadana (Civil Action Party), ilay hery politika faharoa ao amin'ny firenena, izay tonga hatrany amin'ny Vina Ara-ketra hita tao amin'ilay fanadihadiana). ||| Chamuko clearly sees that in the end the public sectors will manage to come together in a single movement against the blow dealt by "el pacto PALI" (the PALI pact) ("el pacto PALI" is a nickname used by social networking sites to refer to the pact carried out by the ruling Partido Liberación Nacional (National Liberation Party) and the Partido Acción Ciudadana (Civil Action Party), the second political force in the country, which culminated in the Fiscal Plan found in the study).
Chamuko dia mino fa ny governemanta dia tokony hanangona ny hetra misy ary hanafoana tanteraka ny 70%-n'ny fandosirana hetra, ary io tsy hikatona ny "cafès" sy ny toeram-pivarotana karatra firaran-tsoa, asa mafimafy kokoa no ilaina mba hisamborana ireo ngezalahy mpandositra hetra. ||| Chamuko strongly believes that the government must collect up the existing taxes and completely eliminate 70% of tax evasion, and this won't close the cafes and the gift-card shops, more severe actions are necessary to catch the big tax evaders.
Ireo sendika izay nanao ilay antso hanao hetsi-panoherana dia nampitandrina fa tsy maintsy hitohy izany hatramin'ny taona ho avy, tsy ijerena izay faneken'ny mpikambana ao amin'ny antoko, na tsia, ilay vina. ||| The syndicates that called for protests warned that it would continue until next year, regardless of whether party members approve the plan.
Ao amin'ny vohikala n'ilay fikambanana ho an'ireo Mpampianatry ny Ambaratonga Faharoa, sendikà lehibe iray no manamafy fa: ||| On the webpage for the Association for Teachers of Secondary Education, an important syndicate, affirms that:
Raha toa ilay vina ka ekena alohan'ny 24 Desambra, dia tsy afaka ny hiraviravy tànana isika; mbola hitohy ny taona 2012 ilay hetsi-panoherana, na dia hilaza aza ny Efitra Fahaefatra fa tsy ahitàna zavatra tsy araka ny lalampanorenana izany. ||| If the project is approved before December 24, we will not fold our arms; the protest action will continue in 2012, even if the Fourth Chamber declares that it does not contain unconstitutional faults.
Tamin'io andro io ihany, ny Filankevitry ny Anjerimanontolo ao amin'ny Anjerimanontolon'i Costa Rica dia namoaka fanambarana iray nilaza fa "tsy ho an'ny firenena" ilay vina dia ary nangataka tamin'ny governemanta hiady amin'ny fandosirana hetra (tsindrio eto raha hijery ilay fanambaràna amin'ny endriny.pdf). ||| On the same day as the protest, the University Council of the University of Costa Rica issued a statement which expressed that the plan "is inconvenient for the country" and it appealed to the government to combat tax evasion (click here to see the statement as a.pdf).
Tany aloha, ireo vondron'ny fandraharahàna koa dia nitsipaka ilay tetikasa. ||| Previously, business groups were also opposed to the plan.
Manohitra izany hevitra izany, ny tanjon'ny governemanta hampanaiky izany tetikasa izany alohan'ny faran'ity taona ity dia nihasarotra be. ||| Against this background, the government's aim of approving this project before the end of the year has been greatly complicated.
Costa Rica dia hamaràna ny taona 2011 amin'ny tsy fahombiazana ara-ketra ao Amerika Latina, amin'ny fametrahana ny governemanta eo anelanelanà vato sy toerana sarotra amin'io resaka io. ||| Costa Rica will close out 2011 with the largest fiscal deficit in Latin America, putting the government firmly between a rock and a hard place on this issue.
Tonga saina ny amin'ny filàna vahaolana haingana amin'ilay olana, David Solís, mponina iray, izay nanao fanambaràna tamin'ny alalan'ny lahatsoratra fanbehoan-kevitra iray nivoaka tao amin'ny Amauta, gazetiboky iray anaty aterineto: ||| Aware of the urgent need to find solutions to this dilemma, David Solís, a citizen, commented via an opinion article published in the digital magazine Amauta:
Ny sehatra ara-panjakana dia vonona ny handoa hetra raha toa ka ara-drariny izany, izay tsy maintsy ilàna ny hampitsahatra izany vina ara-ketra izany ary hamoronana fifanarahana ara-sosialy manàja ireo fianakaviana miasa, ka amin'izany ny fanjakana dia mandray hetra bebe kokoa ho an'ny tetikasa iray mandrava ny hetra mijotso teo aloha ary ny tolo-dalàna PLN-PAC. ||| The public sectors are willing to pay taxes as long as they are fair, which would imply a need to end this fiscal plan and generate a real respectful social agreement for working families, where the State receives more tax for a project that breaks the current regressive taxes and the proposals of the PLN-PAC.
Liberia: Miparitaka Ilay Volavolan-dalàna "Vonoy Ny Pelaka" ||| Liberia: "Kill the Gays" Bill Spreading
Nampahafantatra volavolan-dalàna iray izay mametraka ny fifanambadian'olona ho azo ampiharana ny sazy fanamelohana ho faty ny Vadin'ny Filoham-pirenena Liberiana Teo aloha Jewel Howard Taylor. ||| Former Liberian first lady Jewel Howard Taylor has introduced a bill making homosexuality liable to a death sentence.
i Jewel Howard Taylor dia loholona no sady Vady nisarahan'ilay filoha teo aloha Charles Taylor. ||| Jewel is a senator and former president Charles Taylor's ex-wife.
Namerina nametraka volavolan-dalàna iray tahaka izay ary manohitra ny fifanambadian'olona mitovy, niteraka resabe, ihany koa i Oganda vao haingana izay. ||| Uganda re-tabled a similar controversial anti-gay bill recently.
Fihoàrana ny lalàna ny fifanambadian'olona mitovy any aminà firenena Afrikana 38 ary mety hitondra amin'ny fanamelohana ho faty izany any Maoritania, Sodàna, ary any Nizeria Avaratra. ||| Homosexuality is outlawed in 38 African countries and it can be punishable by death in Mauritania, Sudan, and northern Nigeria.
Manoratra momba io volavolan-dalàna manohitra ny fifanambadian'olona mitovy any Liberia io, miteny i Melanie hoe: ||| Writing about Liberia's anti-gay bill, Melanie says:
Aseho matetika ao amin'ny bilaogiko, ny tahotra amin'ny hiparitahan'ny volavolan-dalànan'i David Bahati hoe "Kill the Gays", midika hoe "Vonoy ireo Pelaka", efa eo anoloan'ny Parlemanta Ogande amin'izao fotoana, mety hiparitaka tsara any amin'ireo faritra hafa ao Afrika, satria arahan'ny fanandràtana fatratra ny anganongano mikasika ny fanoherana ny pelaka. ||| Expressed many times on my blog, is the fear that David Bahati's Kill the Gays Bill, currently before the Ugandan Parliament, could well spread to other parts of Africa, as it is accompanied by the promotion of much anti-gay rhetoric and myth.
Toa miparitaka tokoa izany hevitra "Kill the Gays" izany, na dia narahana tsikera tsara manerana izao tontolo izao aza izany. ||| It seems that the Kill the Gays idea is indeed spreading, even though it has met with great criticism around the world.
Tanatin'ireo resadresaka tamin'ny taona lasa, niteny tamin'i Warren Throckmorton sy ny tenako i David Bahati fa naneho fahalinana tamin'ity volavolan-dalàna Manohitra ny Fifanambadian'olona Mitovy natolony ity ireo firenena Afrikana hafa, izay fantatsika amin'ny hoe Volavolan-dalàna Kill the Gays. ||| In conversations last year, David Bahati told Warren Throckmorton and me that other African nations had expressed interest in his Anti-Homosexuality Bill, which we have come to know as The Kill the Gays Bill.
Sarintany mampiseho ireo fanasaziana mikendry ireo pelaka lahy sy vavy any Afrika. ||| A map showing penalties targeting gays and lesbians in Africa.
Loharanon'ny sary: ||| Image source: 
Manoratra ||| Warren writes:
Tsy misy daty navoaka mikasika ny adihevitra na ny fifidianana. ||| No date has been set for debate or vote.
Samy mila mandàny io volavolan-dalàna io avokoa ny antenimiera roa tonta vao mandefa izany any amin'ny Filoha ho soniavina na holavina. ||| Both Houses of the legislature would need to pass the bill to send to the President for signature or veto.
Nanoratra momba ity volavolan-dalàna ity sy volavolan-dalàna fanampiny tany amin'ny Antenimieran-dry zareo ireo aho tamin'ny herinandro lasa. ||| I wrote about this bill and a companion bill in their House last week.
Araka ny fara-tampon'ny fahafahako mamaritra azy, manomboka amin'ny 10 taona an-tranomaizina ka hatramin'ny fanamelohana ho faty ny sazy azo avy amin'ny Heloka Sokajy Voalohany any Liberia. ||| As far as I can determine, in Liberia penalties for a First Degree Felony can range from 10 years in prison to death.
Fohy io fanitsiana io ary tsy misy famaritana. ||| The amendment is short and without definitions.
ny amin'ny antony mampikombona ny vavan'ilay nahazo Loka Nobel sady filohan'i Liberia Ellen Johnson Sirleaf: ||| the Nobel prize winner and president of Liberia Ellen Johnson Sirleaf remains silent:
Raha meloka izy, ny asa ratsy tahaka izany dia mendrika sazy 10 taona an-tranomaizina ka hatramin'ny fanamelohana ho faty. ||| If convicted, such a crime would warrant punishment ranging from 10 years in jail to death.
Ary nikombona ny vavan'i Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, ilay nahazo ny Loka Nobel tamin'ity raharaha ity. ||| And Nobel prize winner Ellen Johnson Sirleaf has remained silent on the issue.
Mihamafana izany raharaha izany noho ny famoretan'ny Etazonia sy ny Angletera izay mihevitra ny zon'ireo pelaka ho toy ny zon'olombelona nandritra ny taona lasa. ||| The issue continues to heat up owing to the pressure of the U.S. and the U.K. to consider gay rights as human rights over the past year.
Tokony hanapaka ny fanampiana any Liberia ve i Etazonia? ||| Should the U.S. cut back aid to Liberia?
: |||:
Manome fanampiana kely an'i Liberia i Etazonia. ||| The U.S. gives quite a bit of aid to Liberia.
Ny fanontaniana mipetraka dia ny hoe hametraka ny volantsika any amin'ny toerana misy ireo vava tokony ho fahanana ary hanapaka marina ny fanampiana noho ity raharaha ity ve isika, na dia mihen-danja aza ny dindo Amerikana ao amin'ny kaontinanta manoloana ny fampiasam-bola be ataon'ny Sinoa. ||| The question is whether we will put our money where are mouths are and actually cut back assistance because of this issue, even as American influence on the continent wanes in the face of massive Chinese investment.
Hiaraka tsara amin'ny fifidianana Amerikana ve ny toerany tahaka izao? ||| Would such a stance fly well with the American electorate?
Mety hisy ny fanohanana mifamahofaho ny fifanambadiana pelaka, nefa azoko antoka fa ny ankamaroan'ireo Amerikana salama saina dia mety handray ny fahafatesana noho ny "sodomie" ho fanitsakitsahana tanteraka ny zon'olombelona... ||| There may be mixed support for gay marriage, but I'm pretty sure that a healthy majority of Americans would recognize death-for-sodomy as a massive human rights violation...

Mihevitra ny Sebaspace fa tsy mandeha am-pahatsorana ilay vadin'ny ny filoham-pirenena teo aloha: ||| Sebaspace thinks the former first lady is not genuine:
Toa nahazo lesona iray na roa avy amin'ny fomba tsy nampahomby ny karazana fampielezan-kevitra tahaka izany tany amin'ireo faritra hafa aty Afrika i Ramatoa Jewel Taylor. ||| Jewel Taylor has learned one or two things about how campaigns of this sort have come a-cropper in other parts of Africa.
Araka izany, miezaka ny manatsaratsara endriky izy amin'ny alàlan'ny fanafenany ny fihetseham-pony manohitra ny pelaka anaty resaka ilazàny fa hoe miezaka ny hisoroka ny "fifanambadian'ny pelaka" izy. ||| So, she is covering her flank by disguising her anti-gay sentiments in language that suggests that she is trying to prevent "gay marriage".
Mampitandrina i Boima J. V. Boima: ||| Boima J. V. Boima cautions:
Nefa io lalàna io, raha lany, mety hisy fiantraikany ara-toekarena ho an'i Liberia rehefa ampifandraisin'ireo hery tandrefana, anisan'izany Etazonia sy Angletera, ny zon'ny pelaka sy ny fanampiana avy any ivelany ho an'ireo firenena any amin'ny tany an-dalampandrosoana, anisan'ireny i Liberia. ||| But the law, if passed, could have economic implications for Liberia since western powers including the US and UK are tying gay rights to foreign aid to third world countries, including Liberia.
Nipoitra io volavolan-dalàna io taorian'ireo antso miverimberin'ny Sekretera Jeneralin'ny Firenena Mikambana Ban ki-moon sy ireo hery Tandrefana izay mangataka ireo mpitondra fanjakana Afrikana mba hanaiky ho ara-dalàna ny fifanambadian'olona mitovy na ho tapahina ny fanampiana ho an'ny fampandrosoana avy any ivelany. ||| The draft bill surfaced following repeated calls by UN Secretary General Ban ki-moon and western powers urging African leaders to legalize same sex marriage or risk being deprived of foreign assistance for development.
Afaka manao sonia fanangonana sonia ao anaty aterineto ireo mafana fo miaro ny zon'ny pelaka mba hanoherana ny volavolan-dalàna "Kill the Gays" any Liberia: ||| Gay rights activists and sympathizers can sign a petition to protest Liberia's "Kill the Gays" bill:
lasibatra: Ny Loholona Liberiana Jewel Haward Taylor ||| Target: Liberian Senator Jewel Haward Taylor
Tanjona: Hangataka ny Loholona Taylor mba tsy hanohana ity lalàna ity, izay hamela ireo mpitsara hanasazy ireo hetsika pelaka amin'ny fanamelohana ho faty any Liberia. ||| Goal: To urge Senator Taylor not to push this bill, which would allow judges to punish homosexual acts with the death penalty in Liberia.
Any amin'ny firenena Afrikana Andrefan' i Liberia, miady ho an'ny fanekena araky ny lalàna azy ireo ny mpifankatia LGBT. ||| In the west African country of Liberia, LGBT couples have been struggling to gain legal recognition.
Nefa ny Loholona Taylor, izay vao tsy ela izay no nanolotra volavolan-dalàna hanamelohana ho faty ireo pelaka, dia mety ho sakana lehibe iray mankany amin'ny fitoviana. ||| But Senator Taylor, who recently introduced a bill that would make homosexual acts punishable by death, could serve as a huge roadblock to equality.
Tokony hampiato ny fisoloany vava ny fampandaniana io volavolan-dalàna io ny Loholona Taylor, izay mety hanaisotra ny ain'ireo Liberiana LGBT sasany. ||| Senator Taylor must stop advocating for the passage of a bill that would essentially take the lives of some LGBT Liberians.
Maro ireo mpitondra fanjakàna Afrikana no milaza fa tsy voajanahary sy tsy Afrikana ny fitiavana olona mitovy amin'ny tena. ||| Many African leaders claim that homosexuality is un-natural and un-African.
I Afrika atsimo no miavaka amin'izany miaraka aminà lalam-panorenana, izay manome fiarovana tanteraka ny zon'ireo pelaka erak'izao tontolo izao. ||| South African is an exception with a constitution, which provides the most comprehensive protection of gay rights in the world.
Gaza sy Sderot: Mila fiaingana vaovao isika rehefa vita ny ady ||| Gaza and Sderot: "The day after the war we need a new beginning"
Kilometatra vitsy monja ny mampisaraka ny tanànan'i Gaza sy ny tanàna Isiraeliana ao Sderot. ||| Gaza City and the Israeli city of Sderot are separated by just a few kilometres.
Herintaona izay, na dia sahirana tanteraka aza ny mponin'i Gaza noho ny fahirano Isiraeliana, ary voatifitry ny balatafondro matetika avy any an-tehezantanin'i Gaza aza i Sderot, dia nisy lehilahy roa avy amin'ny andaniny sy ny ankilany tsirairay avy nanomboka namahana bolongana iray. ||| A year ago, even while the people of Gaza were living in severe conditions under Israeli blockade, and Sderot was an ongoing target for rocket attacks coming out of the Gaza Strip, a blog was started by two men, one in each place.
Hatramin'izany fotoana izany no nifampizaran'ny roa tonta izay niainany andavanandro sy ny fomba fijeriny mamndritra ny toe-draharaha ka tafiditra amin'izany ny tamin'ny herinandro lasa. ||| Since then they have been documenting their experiences and giving us their perspective on events, including those of the last week.
Life must go in Gaza and Sderot dia bolongana iraisan'i "Peace Man" (Lehilahin'ny Fandriampahalemana) avy any Gaza sy "Hope Man" (Lehilahin'ny Fanantenana) avy any Sderot. ||| Life must go in Gaza and Sderot is joint blog written by "Peace Man" in Gaza and "Hope Man" in Sderot.
Nampifandraisin'i Danny Gal, Miasa amina Fikambanana tsy miankina iray misahana ny fiantraikan'ny ady ao Azia Andrefana, izy mirahalahy ireto ka nanomboka namaham-bolongana hatramin'ny Janoary 2008: ||| The two men were introduced by Danny Gal, who works for an NGO dedicated to addressing the effects of the Middle East conflict, and they have been blogging since January 2008:
Mpinamana 2 no manoratra amin'ity bolongana ity. ||| This blog is written by 2 friends.
... Mitohy ny herisetra eo amin'Isiraely sy Gaza izay nihanahery vaika hatramin'ny Oktobra 2000. |||... There is ongoing violence between Israel and Gaza which has intensified greatly since October 2000.
Maro ny maty sy maratra. ||| Many have been killed and many have been injured.
Mitongilana avokoa ny tati-baovao ataon'ny haino aman-jerin'ny andaniny sy ny ankilany. ||| The media coverage on both sides has been extremely biased.
Ny Bolonganay kosa dia soratan'olona roa tena misy sy mifampiserasera avy amin'ny roa tonta. ||| Our Blog is written by 2 real people living and communicating on both sides of the border.
Tamin'ny lahatsoratra farany no nilazan'i Peace Man: ||| In his most recent post, Peace Man says:
Mihoatra ny 300 ny maty ary 200 no tsy hita popoka ary 160 eo ho eo ny maratra mafy nandritra ny roa andro nitifirana ny tehezan-tanin'i Gaza. ||| Since the operation started in Gaza Strip, more than 300 people killed in two days and two hundred missing and about 160 were in critical condition.
Noravan'Isiraely avokoa ny paositry ny polisy sy ny tranom-panjakana rehetra. ||| Israel destroyed all the police station and all the Government centers.
Polisy sy sivily ary zaza no maty nandritra ity fanafihana ity. ||| police and civilians and children who (were) killed in this operation.
Sarotra ny mitantara izay mitranga eto Gaza, voina mampihoron-koditra, fa tsy manaaka na sivily na miaramila na zaza ny voromby mpiady. ||| It is hard to describe what is going on in Gaza, a terrible disaster, where the aircraft do not distinguish between civilians and military and children.
Miangavy ny vondrona iraisam-pirenena aho hampitsahatra izay mitranga eto Gaza amin'izao fotoana izao ary manantena aho fa hiverina indray ny fampitsaharana ny fifampitifirana ka haifika lavitra any ny herisetra ||| I am asking the international community to stop what is going on in Gaza I hope to return to ceasefire and move away from violence
Nampiseho ny fomba fijeriny i Hope Man: ||| Hope Man gives us his perspective:
Maro ny olona nandao an'i Sderot ary tombanako fa latsaky ny 50%n'ny mponina ao aminy sisa no mijanona. ||| Many people have left Sderot and I estimate less than 50% of the people remain.
Vitsy ny olona mieziezy eny an-dalambe ary tsy ahitana zaza mihitsy. ||| Very few people are walking in the streets and no children are seen anywhere.
Fahadisoana lehibe ny ady, na izany aza dia tsy isalasalana fa maro amin'ny olona eto Isiraely no manohana ny ady. ||| The war was a great mistake, however it is no wonder that so many people in Israel support it.
Zavamisy mampihoron-koditra ny fanjerana baomba isan'andro nandritra ny valo taona teto Sderot. ||| The ongoing reality of rockets falling in Sderot and other places for 8 years is a terrible reality.
Maro tamin'ny olona eto amin'ny faritra misy anay nandritra ny taona vitsivitsy izay lasa nifindra monina tanteraka. ||| Many people of our region have left it for good over the years.
Tsy mety sady sady maneho tsy fahamatorana ny fitaizana zaza amina toe-draharaha tahaka izany. ||| Bringing up children in such a reality seems almost abusive and certainly irresponsible.
Raha milaza izany aho, dia mieritreritra manokana fa fahadisoana azo nidifiana ity toe-javatra ity. ||| With that said, I personally think it is a terrible mistake that could have been avoided.
Nitsahatra tanteraka ny fifampitifirana nandritra ny 5 volana. ||| For 5 months there was an almost complete cease fire.
Samy nandany ny androny hiomana amin'ity ady ity tamin'ny fanangonana fitaovam-piadiana sy fanomanana tetikady ny roa tonta raha tokony ho nahay nanararaotra hanao fifanarahana maharitra. ||| Instead of taking advantage of this long period of quiet to reach a long term agreement, both sides spent their time preparing for this war by planning and arming.
Tsy nisy fiezahana matotra hifampiresaka. ||| No serious efforts were made to start a dialog.
Nitohy ny fahiranaon'Isiraely sy ny fanangonana fitaovam-piadiana nataon'ny Hamas. ||| The siege by Isreal continued and the smuggling of arms by the Hamas continued.
Fampitsaharana fifampitifirana no natao hiomanana amin'ny dingana mahatsiravina manaraka izay iainantsika amin'izao fotoana izao. ||| It was a cease fire but only to prepare for the next terrible round which we are experiencing this very moment.
Kivy tanteraka aho amin'izao fotoana izao. ||| I am very pessimistic at the moment.
Ny ahiako dia ho avy ny fanafihana avy ety an-tanety ka hampitombo bebe kokoa ny hifirify. ||| My fear is that a ground attack is coming and that much more pain is still ahead.
Angamba hisy ihany ny fifanarahana. ||| Eventually some kind of agreement will be achieved.
Manantena aho mba ho avy faingana izany, sangy manahy aho fa tsy izany no hitranga. ||| I hope it will happen soon, I fear it will not.
Mifampiresaka isan'andro izaho sy Hope Man. ||| Hope Man and I talk every day.
Mifampahery mandrakariva ary samy miahy amin'ny fiainan'ny andaniny avy. ||| We support each other and worry for each others well being.
Manana fifandraisna amin'ny hafa any Gaza aho izay mifampizara sy mifampihaino ny manjo anay tsirairay avy. ||| I am in contact with others in Gaza and share my situation while hearing of theirs.
Samy matahotra sy samy mangirifiry ny any amin'ny andaniny sy ny aty amin'ny ankilany ||| Much fear and pain on both sides.
Mifanapatapak'ahitra mandrakariva amin'ny namana azy Gaza no ataoko sy ny hafa. ||| What me and others are doing is continuing the dialog with friends in Gaza.
Miezaka izahay hampivelatra sy hampiroborobo izao fifampiresahana izao eo amin'ny andaniny syny ankilany. ||| We are working to widen and deepen this dialog with more people on both sides.
Rehefa tapitra ny ady dia hitady lalana izahay hiaraha-miasa sy handravona ny toe-draharaha. ||| The day after the war we want to start finding ways to work together and create a normality.
Kilometatra maromaro ihany no manelanelana ary tsy hiova mandrakizay izany elanelana izany. ||| We are only several kilometers apart and that will never change.
Tena zava-dehibe tokoa izany fampivelarana ny fifampiresahana sy manangana fifampitokisana eo amin'ireo manetry tena hifampiresaka izany. ||| It is extremely important to widen our dialog and create trust between those that are willing to talk.
Mifampizara tantara, tahotra ary fanantenana. Mila fiaingana vaovao isika rehefa vita ny ady. ||| To share our stories, fears and hopes.The day after the war we need a new beginning.
Atombohy dieny izao ary ny famafazana ny voam-(panahy maha-olona) sy fifampitokisana izany. ||| Let's start planting seeds of humanity and trust now.
Nanatontosa andian-dahatsary fohy antsoina hoe Gaza Sderot ny televizionan-kolontsaina Germano-Frantsay ARTE nalain'ny ekipa Isiraeliana sy Palestiniana avy amin'ny fiainana andavanandro tao anatin'ny roa volana, ary anarahana olona enina avy any Gaza sy olona enina avy any Sderot. ||| Recently the French-German cultural television station ARTE undertook a project called Gaza Sderot in which short videos were shot by Israeli and Palestinian teams on a daily basis for two months, following six people from Gaza and six from Sderot.
azonao jerena eto ny vokatr'izany. ||| You can see the results here.

Maldiva: Ho Firaisankina amin'i Ejipta ||| Maldives: In Solidarity with Egypt
Ity lahatsoratra ity dia singa iray avy amin'ireo fandrakofanay manokana ny Egypt Protests 2011(Hetsi-panoherana Ejipta 2011.) ||| This post is part of our special coverage of Egypt Protests 2011.
Ny hetsi-panoherana mitranga any Ejipta dia toy ny 'herinaratra' namely ny mponin'ny aterineto tao Maldiva. ||| The ongoing protests in Egypt have 'electrified' netziens in the Maldives.
Ny fitalanjonana nentin'ny zava-misy amin'izao fotoana any Ejipta dia miampita ny sisintany rehetra saingy tao Maldiva dia nànana ny dikany manokana mihitsy satria namelona indray ny fahatsiarovana ny hetsi-panoheran'ireo mpandàla ny demaokrasia vao taona vitsy lasa monja izay mba hamerenana ny demaokrasia ao amin'ity tangoro-nosy mitambatra ho firenena iray ao amin'ny Ranomasimbe Indiana ity. ||| The fascination with the current phenomenon in Egypt transcends all geographical borders but in the Maldives there is a special significance as it brings back flashbacks of pro-democracy protests held only a few years ago to bring democracy to the Indian Ocean island nation.
Manoratra i Yaamyn, mpitoraka bilaogy: ||| Blogger Yaamyn writes:
Sahala amin'ny tratry ny herinaratra avy any Tonizia sy Ejipta aho (ary Yemen, Jordania sy Alzeria). ||| I'm electrified by Tunisia and Egypt (and Yemen, Jordan and Algeria).
Miha matanjaka indray ny finoako, na toa manjombona sy tsy ahitàna mangirana aza ny zavatra rehetra, afaka manova ny lahatra sy mandray an-tànana ny ampitsony ny vahoaka. ||| My faith that no matter how bleak and hopeless things seem, people can change their own plight and chart their own destiny, is once again reaffirmed.
Lany fetr'andro. ||| Expired.
Sary avy amin'ny ||| Image from 
Miantso ny Filohan'i Maldiva, Nasheed, i Hilath mba hitondra teny fankaherezana ho an'ireo Ejiptiana mpanohitra: ||| Hilath urges President Nasheed of Maldives to say some words of encouragement to Egyptian protesters:
Angamba fotoana mety izao ho an'ny Filoha Nasheed "hilazany tenim-pahendrena" ka mba tsy hifamono ireo rahalahy sy anabavintsika ao Ejipta ho tonga amin'ny hoe "ny mahery sisa no mijoro", ho solon'izany, toy ny eto Maldiva, izay tsy maintsy novakian'izy ireny tany anatin'ny tsanganam- "baovao manerantaniny" amin'ny gazetim-pirenen-dry zareo, dia mba handrisika azy ireo koa ho tonga hatramin'ny fanatanterahana izay vitan-dry zareo — afaka manangana tetezamita ampilaminana ho amina demaokrasia tena izy fa tsy sarintsarina demaokrasia nokasain'i Maumoon sy Hosni Mubarak hapetraka efa ho 30 taona izao. ||| Perhaps it is the right time for President Nasheed himself to "put in a good word" so that our brothers and sisters in Egypt will not slaughter each other to the "last man standing", and instead, like the Maldives, whom they must have read about in their "international news" section of their national newspapers, will be encouraged to come to the realization that they too can — can make a peaceful transition to real democracy and not the kind of fake democracy that Maumoon and Hosni Mubarak have been projecting for almost 30 years.
Mila miala avy hatrany i Mubarak ary ampilaminana. ||| Mubarak needs to step down immediately and peacefully.
29 taona efa tena mihoatra noho ny ampy! ||| 29 years is more than enough!
Ity ny faha-30 taona naha teo amin'ny fitondrana ny Filoha Ejiptiana Mubarak ary ireo Maldiviana dia manao fampitahàna ny nitondran'i Mubarak sy ny 30 taonan'ny jadona tao Maldiva izay nifàrana tamin'ny 2008.. ||| This is Egyptian President Mubarak's 30th year in power and Maldivians are drawing parallels between Mubarak's rule and the 30-year-old dictatorship in Maldives that ended in 2008.
Firax mandefa tweets: ||| Firax tweets:
Tsy Vita ny Tsy Hanao Fampitahàna ny Zava-misy Mitranga any Egypt & sy ny Fiafàran'ny Fitondrana Tsy Norefesi-Mandidy 30 Taona teto Maldives ||| One Just Can't Help But Draw the Parallels Between the Events Unfolding in Egypt & the End of the Heavy Handed 30 Year Rule of Maldives
AdduHaanee miteny: ||| AdduHaanee says:
isa majika ny 30. ||| 30 is the magic number.
Amin'io isika no miatrika olan'ny hatanorana. ||| That's when we face mid-life crisis.
Amin'io no misedra ny olany ireo mpanao jadona ||| That's when dictators meet with their crises

Ampy tena ampy, 29 taona efa mihoatra noho ny ampy Egypt ||| Enough is enough, 29 years is more than enough Egypt

Firax manampy: ||| Firax adds:
MUBARAK: Izaho no Rain'ny Demaokrasia, Navelako Hanao Fihetsiketsehana Tsotra izao ry Zareo Mampanembona zavatra ve??? ||| MUBARAK: I'm the Father of Democracy, I Only Let Them Protest Sound Familiar???
MaldivesVotes.com, vohikala iray nampàkatra sary betsaka manentana ho amin'ny demaokrasia tamin'ny hazakazaka hofidiana ho Filoham-pirenena tao Maldiva tamin'ny 2008, dia namorona pejy manokana ho an'i Ejypta. ||| MaldivesVotes.com, a website which posted several images campaigning for democracy in the run up to the presidential election of Maldives in 2008, has created a special page for Egypt.
Namoaka sarin'ireny afisy lehibe ireny izy, sary lafika amin'ny fàfana ary nampiseho sary izay azon'ny rehetra ampiasaina hanehoana firaisankina amin'ireo mpanao hetsi-panoherana any Ejipta. ||| It has posted images of posters, wallpapers, and display pictures that can be used to show solidarity with the protesters in Egypt.
Misy fanantenana any ambadiky ny tariby misy farango. ||| There is hope beyond barbed wires.
